Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MItravelerforbus
Reviews.Content: Whether I stay here for one night or for a week, I enjoy this hotel. The staff is friendly and follows up well on any requests I've had. The rooml layouts are nice. The place is one of the most quiet hotels I've ever stayed at. You do not hear those in rooms around you. I have to say it's a wonderul place to stay. It's also a great location because it's really not far from the theme parks, shopping, or the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand Vacations on International Drive”
Reviews.Author: grammylinda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio with a king size bed overlooking the lagoon. The whole place is immaculately clean and the large thick towels were changed every day. We enjoyed the screened balcony with two chairs and table. There was music and games at the pool and someone playing water volleyball much of the time. The pool was heated and beautiful. We will definitely stay here again. We listened to the timeshare session and toured the other rooms--one and two bedroom suites were beautiful with granite countertops, fullsize stove and fridge. The best thing is that you don't have to be a member to stay there. There is a Publix grocery store very close and a large premium outlet shopping center. Close to Disney, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jules71
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the HGVC Tuscany on International Drive. The property is beautiful, the suite was so nice, and the location is convenient to most things.Stayed in a one bedroom suite with screened in porch and full kitchen. The housekeepers were obsessively clean! Enjoyed walking the path around the lagoon. Nice pools. Service at the poolside bar was very slow for lunch, but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Bryanb82
Reviews.Content: This was the final stop for my Wife and I on our honeymoon in November 2011, and when it comes to saving the best for last, this resort takes the absolute cherry. What an absolutely stunning resort, huge in size and stunning in design. It is built around a body of water, which is about a mile in circumferance. We stayed in the Tomaso building, building 6, we were on the top floor and every evening from our hallway we had a stunning view of the fire work displays from disney. The accomodations themselves were just the lap of luxury, very grand spacious living, kitchen, bathroom and bedroom area's, each mor plush than the last. The resort offers pre payable shuttle services to the major theme parks. No more than 100 yards from the entrance to the Tomaso building you will find an high end outlet mall with amazing purchases to be had at next to nothing prices. The staff in this resort are incredibly friendly and helpful. Every time you pass an employee, be it from gardening service, house keeping or front desk you are greeted with a smile and a friendly hello. It is an accomodation i can't reccommend highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewer099
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton on Arezzo Way and have one word to describe my stay--PERFECT! The place is beautiful, spotless clean and the staff is amazingly accomodating! The pool and pool bar were beautiful. Only downside is that they are short of parking. Otherwise, the place is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “overated and you won,t get in till 4pm”
Reviews.Author: demartino
Reviews.Content: These vacation units are better for 1 weeks stay Booked a one night stay through Hot wire, these are vacation time shares 7 very large blocks,over several acres and unless you stay in block 1 by their main pool area expect to have a very long walk to these Apartments and up and down stairs etc to get to water, I was placed in block 7 overlooking the Shopping mall and I know hot wire is a cheap rate get what ya pay for. and I wanted to leave as soon as I arrived ! food and drinks very expensive but lots of restaurants outside a short walk or car ride. what I found disappointing was that for a one night stay I had to ask several times at the front desk on staying in block one, the other frustrating thing is you won,t get in your room till 4pm which for a family with kiddies is very frustrating, the apartments are 4 star but I would never return here there are much nicer places around the Disney area my advice take your time in choosing a resort wisely.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!”
Reviews.Author: trish274
Reviews.Content: Great location. Factory outlets right beside, 10 minutes from downtown Disney, church nearby. Facilities clean and nice. Didn't receive five stars because of lack of parking and room wasn't ready until 5:45 pm!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious accommodations, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Robert I
Reviews.Content: This is the second Hilton Grand Vacations property we have had the pleasure of visiting and once again it exceeded our expectations. We stayed in a 2 br king suite with whirlpool bath. The rooms are well decorated and very nicely furnished. The kitchen is stocked with everything a family might need for cooking. I did wonder about the lack of dishtowels but paper towels are supplied daily if needed. Our bedroom had the giant whirlpool tub which has more than enough room for two. The second bedroom is actually an efficiency unit with adjoining doors. The grounds and facilities are beautiful and very well maintained. Staff seemed to be everywhere cleaning and polishing. There aren't enough good things to say about the staff. They are probably the friendliest, most accommodating group of people I've ever met at a hotel or resort. From the people at the front desk to the lady polishing the trash can lids, every one says hello with a warm smile. We plan to return to this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Wishing I was still there!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bchdoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after a cruise. It is one of the loveliest hotels I have ever stayed in. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous. Our room, which was a one bedroom suite with jacuzzi. was marvelous. It was very spacious, nicely decorated and had all the amenities one could want on vacation. We stayed in the 3rd building with a lake view on the 5th floor. I would highly recommend the 3rd building as it is centrally located between both pools (a few mins walk) but far enough away to be peaceful. We slept both nights with our balcony door open (nice plus that the balcony is screened in to keep the bugs out) and fell asleep to the sounds of the fountain in the lake. The staff was amazing. Our room was ready for us to check in about 3 hours before normal check in time. I did call the before our scheduled stay to advise them we would probably be in the area sooner than the normal check in time. About 20 mins after we settled into the room we received a call from the front desk asking if our room was up to our standards. It definitely was!!!! I didn't expect there to be any housekeeping services as we were only staying 2 nights-because of this I kept the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. On our 2nd night we had a message on our phone from the housekeeping staff stating that they were unable to service our room due to the sign and to call them if we had any requests. We also a bit later got a phone call from the housekeeping manager asking the same thing. We did call and request some assistance after a bottle of wine was dropped and busted in the kitchen. Someone was up immediately with a vacuum to help us get up the broken glass, and after they left we got a follow up phone call from the front desk asking us if everything had been taken care of. The service is really top notch. We only went to the main clubhouse pool. It was wonderful. I had the most pleasant time lying in a lounger in the sun which a bit of shade from the palm tree above me. I never had a problem finding an open lounger. We weren't expecting any "activities" by the pool and they were a welcome surprise. It was nice to have dj type music playing or a live band to listen to as I was lounging around. They had nice adult and kid oriented activities available. The 1st day we had lunch at the pool bar and grill (food and prices were good, service could be faster/more attentive-but overall a decent experience) and watched a few couples participate in the Newly Wed Game and Battle of the Sexes. The 2nd day while I was lounging around you could tie-dye a t-shirt for a small fee. We never received any marketing phone calls and our stay was nothing but pleasant. I wish I was still there lounging under a palm tree as I write this!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: cjway
Reviews.Content: Wonderful property, clean, lots of amenities. Staff friendly, food was fabulous, even serve Starbucks coffee! Stayed in building 7 overlooking the pond. Would sit on the patio at night watching the fountain and planes flying out of Interantional airport. Will be returning to this property. Public directly across the street and outlet mall connected. Very close to Disney, universal, and sea world. In four visits to Orlando, this has been the best property we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Kicking myself for ten years of Disney resort stays”
Reviews.Author: daynasu
Reviews.Content: This place is EXCELLENT. There is no other way to put it. We were treated like royalty from the second we checked in. The reviews and photos here don't do this place justice. I don't even know what to call it, as it certainly isn't a hotel. It's more like a community within a compound. You could literally check in and NEVER LEAVE for your entire vacation and feel like you got your money's worth. We talked to the woman who let us into the compound on the day we checked in. She gladly gave us hints about which buildings were the best (6 and 7). Here's something VERY important to remember...check in is a negotiation. Know what you want, and stick to your guns. They will break out a map for you and show you what they are offering you. If you don't want it, ask for something different. We had room # 807 in Building #7, and it was the best room in the place. It was on the highest floor, overlooking the lake, but it was quiet. It had a king bed in a separate bedroom, a jacuzzi, huge closet, gorgeous bathroom, screened balcony, full kitchen with utensils/plates/cookware, a dishwasher, dining table, two TV's, sofa bed, and best of all...WASHER AND DRYER. We could not have asked for anything more! There was one night when housekeeping missed us during the day, but they fixed it immediately. They are very accommodating, and if you give them a range of time during which you intended to be out of the room each day, they will try to clean your room then. There are tons of activities. Something is always going on. We had some bad weather while we were there, but whenever there was a schedule change, there would be a voice mail left for all the guests describing the change. If a movie was scheduled for outside at the pool, it would be moved inside. They have a quiet lounge and an active lounge. There is a big, main pool with lots of neat water features. Plenty of shade for those who want to stay out of the sun. There is a smaller, quieter pool on the other side of the compound as well. The lake has a bridge over it so you can walk from one side to the other. There are jogging paths. The lake contains all kinds of wildlife...we saw gigantic fish, tiny fish, HUGE turtles, and lots of adult and baby ducks. The lake has a couple of fountains in the middle that are lit up at night. So beautiful. We rented a car to get around, and it was worth it. We paid about half of what we would have paid for meals inside the park, and we had a wide variety to choose from, as the hotel is located near International Drive. It takes 15-20 minutes to get to any of the parks from the hotel. We never wanted to leave, and we certainly won't be staying in the Disney resorts EVER again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great price”
Reviews.Author: JonandEmily
Reviews.Content: The price we paid was about 140 a night after tax. The room was super spacious and had a wonderful kitchen that we used both nights. Everything is nearby. Highly suggest this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great week in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Karaoke_Mom72
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! We stayed in the King Suite - it has a full kitchen, dining area, pull out couch (which I opened up to check the mattress and it was better than standard), screened in balcony, king size bed, very large jacuzzi tub and large bathroom. Staff were friendly and very helpful. There are BBQ areas so we took advantage of that one night. The pools and hot tub were great - pizza was terrific too. I don't have anything negative to say and I have already reserved a room for September to go back - with the kids this time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - brilliant staff , room Just needs a little updating”
Reviews.Author: Ladyogradie
Reviews.Content: My friend and myself stayed here last week , we loved it and had a fantastic time ! We used the shuttle bus to the theme parks - as we didn't have a car , were reasonably priced and very reliable - the drivers were friendly . The staff were excellent , especially the porters - they always welcomed us back at night and asked us if we needed a lift to our room , Daniel was especially helpful . I really can't fault the service - even by the high American standards . . We had a 2 bed suite , it was huge !! My only gripe is the decor is a little dated - if this was improved I would definitely give 5 stars . The grounds of the hotel are beautiful - the lawns are well kept , there is a lake and swimming pools . The location of the hotel was great for us as it's right next door to a large outlet mall and opposite a supermarket . We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend it to anyone else - we hope to be back in the future !

Reviews.Title: “Tuscany Village - HGVC in Orlando Fl”
Reviews.Author: rosiedreams
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Property! We are thrilled to have stayed here. Very well kept; peaceful surroundings; pleasant staff, particularly the bell staff driving around on golf carts.. We used points for a 2 bdrm suite combination (Master room with king bed and queen sofa bed. Second room was a studio type apartment). Both "rooms" were equipped with coffeemaker/iron and ironboard, individual screened in balcony. The Master was also equipped with washer/dryer and a single complimentary pkg of detergent. Knowing we could do our own laundry limited the amount of clothes we packed. BTW - The room came with a single complementary pkg of detergent. It also included a fully equipped kitchen w/serving dishes and utensils for 4. We were located in building #3 which is midway between both pools and had a beautiful view of the center lake. I'm sure our location enhanced the sense of serenity. Complimentary wifi was a little slow but worked almost 100% of the time. There are 2 pools: the major one has numerous activities occurring on the pool deck, such as music, hair braiding, air tattoos, restaurant/bar, etc. There is a second pool that is smaller and better if you seek a more quiet and restful space for swimming and relaxing. We only had lunch at the pool on one day so with respect to food, it seemed good. Very convenient to major attractions. Just 1.2 miles from I4 leading to all the Disney attractions. 3 miles from Sea World. About 6 miles from Universal Studios. Across the street is a Publix for grocery shopping and a Mailboxes for shipping all your Disney souvenirs.. The property is adjacent to one of the prime outlet malls and has a walking path direct to the outlet. Also, International drive is an intersection away. Having personally traveled to Disney and non-Disney properties (over 90 times in the last 20 years), I must say that we will definitely return here for all future Orlando trips.

Reviews.Title: “No housekeeping services provided”
Reviews.Author: Cammy044
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this property. We stayed there 2 years ago in a one bedroom suite which was very nice. However, we were a little disappointed during a recent stay in a studio room. Our room was cleaned while we waited upon our arrival. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and polite as was all of the staff we met up with throughout our stay. It wasn't until bed time that I noticed some stains on the sheets! These did not look faded and we actually wondered if the sheets had been changed. We requested a feather free room which was provided but the blanket was scratchy and the pillows were flat and hard as rocks! We did not receive any housekeeping services throughout our stay. An informational pamphlet stated that rooms would be cleaned between 9:00 A.M. and 10:00 P.M at night! Why would you want your room cleaned in the evening when you are getting settled in for the night? Anyway it didn't matter because nobody offered to clean it until we called to ask for towels the second night. (The first night we just took some towels and washcloths off the cart in the hallway). Needless to say, I did not want to have the room cleaned at 7:00 P.M on our last night! Just a side note: We received a discount for agreeing to listen to the Hilton Vacation Club Pitch! We would not agree to one of these again! They became very aggressive and rude when we declined their offers. Too bad for them because we were considering signing up next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbellmom256
Reviews.Content: We are HGVC owners on an exchange, so we are used to many of Hilton's vacation resorts. We found this one to be one of the more beautiful of the properties we have stayed on. We had a 2 bedroom suite in the first building near the pool. A perfect spot for our kids to go to the pool/ games room, since the resort buildings are quite extensive. The rooms were very comfortable, including the beds. We all loved the screened balcony. If we had more meals in the room, it would have been used more. The kitchen was well stocked for our use, we were in the parks most days/ dinners. The grounds were lovely - Italian "Tuscan" style garden situated near a large lake filled with large fish, turtles and ducks. There was a bridge that led to the Outlet mall next door that my daughter and I found useful :) We did hit the Publix grocery store for frozen pizza's, breakfast and snack items. Very handy (I also found the prices much less than my California groceries, happy bonus) We loved the pool area. The snack bar was ok, it could have more healthy choices. We had a rental car, and never found a problem getting a parking spot near our room. We were about 15 - 20 minutes away from Disney, and 20 - 30 minutes away from Universal. Excellent stay, would probably go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: 199SeasonedTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks in April. A great place to stay with superb facilities and friendly efficient staff. the position it occupies is ideal - a short drive to the main attractions and a short walk to the outlet mall. This was our second visit but won't be our last!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Katy K
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. We began every morning drinking coffee on the screened in balcony. Every evening when we returned from Universal, we relaxed in the pool which was absolutely beautiful. Even with a lot of people in the main pool it didn't feel crowded. The grounds and the lake were so beautiful, I spent a long time the first day we were there just wandering around taking pictures. We were in a king studio suite that had a locked connecting door to the living area of the suite next door. The only complaint I had about the hotel is that we could hear the next door neighbor through the door late into the night on our last night there.

Reviews.Title: “good experience..TOO EARLY CHECKOUT TIME”
Reviews.Author: rosana n
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel in occasion of a Convention in Orlando. we were pleased with the suite, very clean, good service but MAKE SURE YOU ASK FOR LATE CHECKOUT WHEN YOU CHECK IN!!!! This hotel has the earliest check out we have ever seen...10 AM! When we tried requesting late checkout, they denied it because "we have only a few rooms assigned for that exception"...regardless of the denial, and of us having to leave so early, the maid started banging on our door consistently at 9, 9:15 and 9:40 !!!! Besides that very uncomfortable fact, the rest of the experience at the hotel was very good and we would recommend it, and come back ourselves with the late checkout request before even making the reservations! Rooms are spacious, bathrooms confortables in size, good towels and sheets. The bridge on the central fountain is beautiful at night, the jasmines smell beautiful. The food at the poolside bar was simple but excellent and the lounge very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay at Orlando”
Reviews.Author: DrDougB57
Reviews.Content: The resort is fantastic and a delightful place to stay. Great rooms and friendly staff make it inviting and pleasant. The only area I could recommend for improvement is to learn from Parc Soleil for the poolside restaurant. The food selection is better at Park Soleil as is the service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and a great place to stay (even for a business traveler)!”
Reviews.Author: fernsandflowers
Reviews.Content: The property and rooms are beautifully appointed, they are clean, parking was good and staff very pleasant and helpful! I traveled here on business and I asked for a building closer to the entrance (building 7). There was adequate parking and it was not a long drive through the property to get to the main street. The price I paid was better than the Hilton Garden Inn or Hampton Inn (any hotel comparable to these). If you like a motel style (room door to outside), this hotel feels safe and well light. I personally do not like the big hotel chains (Renaissance or Marriott). I stayed in a 1 br suite and it was nice after a day on the road with clients. Positives: Very clean, great water pressure, towels are soft and plenty, the pools were very nice (recommend the smaller pool which has less children after 5 pm), mattresses were comfortable, tv's new, whirlpool tub was very large and worked well. Grocery store (Publix) right across the street! Walking trail around lake is very nice (I walked each night and felt safe) and there were runners every day. It serves the whole property so there are many people around dinner walking so a runner might want to pick a later time to run. Negatives: In suite coffee maker and coffee was confusing (not sure how many cups to make with the coffee provided-directs were not clear), only one cafe to dine on site -- had to drive to local restaurants for meals, bldg 7 is farthest from the pool and there is no lighting in the closet by the tub. It's just one of my pet peeves, but it makes picking clothes out difficult. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Screens make a difference”
Reviews.Author: Mister_Boffo
Reviews.Content: For anyone who has never been to Florida, let me be the first to warn you: they have bugs -- lots of bugs, all kinds of bugs. The patios here are screened, so when you sit out and enjoy the view of the lakes the only way you will be aware of all the other life forms is an occasional sound as a big one bounces off. There's a shopping mall just outside the fence, too, and the location is only a few minutes from many of the attractions in the Orlando area. It's our first choice when we return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Family oriented”
Reviews.Author: Dwhite5149
Reviews.Content: We chose this one bases on Hilton Vacation staff saying it was quieter than the other clubs in Orlando. Wrong, this place is very noisy dont plan on sleeping in here

Reviews.Title: “Security a major issue”
Reviews.Author: emkiku
Reviews.Content: Check out the review by daveh from November 12, 2011. We stayed with family a week later and had a similar experience, only electronics were stolen. The thieves had access to cloned room keys and had even come to the room two days before they stole the items to case the place. HGVC made every effort to reassure us that they had no liability beyond what was in the $500 Innkeepers Statute. We were traveling with elderly family members and children and they felt very unsafe for the remainder of the trip. After extensive pushing on our part, HGVC reimbursed us the cost of the stay (in HHonors points) and promised a VIP experience for the next trip (as if we would stay there again!). They would not reimburse us for the lost days of park visits and related costs while we went to the police and replaced the items on our own. The thieves were organized and obviously had access to the property, so be very careful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Luxury for a Family Trip Near Disney”
Reviews.Author: LoveTimeshares
Reviews.Content: We traveled to HGVC International Drive during our Canadian March Break, but still found that it was not overcrowded. We were always able to find pool chairs and room at the outdoor restaurant. We stayed in a gorgeous three-bedroom combined unit (King with jacuzzi and ensuite, 2nd bedroom with two beds / TV, full kitchen / living room / balcony, laundry, and then an adjoining studio unit with it's own King / kitchenette / balcony). We were in Building 1, which I highly recommend if you have children and want to be near the pool and children's activity / craft room. Our room was on the 4th floor facing the side of the building (looking towards Building 2), and we were never bothered by any outside noise. We also never heard any noise from other units. We found that it took about 20 - 30 minutes by car to really get to your parking spot at any part of Disney (maybe the traffic was worse because it was a busy season). Tons of restaurants nearby. Gorgeous property - great running / walking trail around the pond. Lots of fish / turtles to see in the pond. Lots of reviewers complain about parking availability, but this was never an issue for us at Building 1 - probably because there are also spots because of the adjoining main activity building. Full activity schedule, including a passport program where kids can get "points" for participating in activities, and then cash in for prizes at the end of the week. Our daughter did crafts, got her hair braided, tried stilt walking at the pool, watched a movie by the pool at night, and otherwise enjoyed herself. I did a Zumba class by the pool (ouch). One of the nicest timeshares we've ever exchanged to, and perfect for families.

Reviews.Title: “Just OKAY”
Reviews.Author: anthony1michigan
Reviews.Content: We were put in building 4 facing the outlet mall parking deck. The parking lot was tight and they lacked security as far as having viedo survellience of the parking lot. We received a nasty gram on our vehicle, which happens to be a large SUV (for a large family) by an irate guest for driving such a vehicle we must be bleep bleep bleep and brain dead! Security did nothing, but try to pacify us by telling us that the people were just jealous! The toilet in the room did not flush right and overflowed 3 times with a horrible sewage smell. The staff were nice and the problem was fixed pretty quickly. The pools are very nice, but the main pool is really crowded. The grounds are well kept and there is a nice walking/jogging path. After staying at Parc Soleil last year, we will not be back to this resort. Parc Soleil is much nice and has an underground parking garage. The rooms were larger and a whole lot nicer. The toilet area was seperate from the bathroom and the showers were huge and had several sprayers. Oh, and we payed less at Parc Soleil than we did at Int. Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Very Good Location, Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: GoKate
Reviews.Content: Just completed second stay and we will be back. The grounds are very inviting and many of the room views are excellent. Keep in mind this is not the Ritz, but they don't charge for it. I did give 5 points based on expectations set by pricing. They delivered. Multiple buildings, two pools, next to a Premium Outlet Mall, across from a large grocery store. This is a wonderful place for families because of the pool activity day and night, basketball court, etc. We’re a “maturing” couple who do not use the pool so avoid the busy side of the resort. The pool area is calmed down later in the evening if you want to enjoy an end of the day cocktail. In the end, it’s the individual staff members who make the difference. Jesse, Donald, Michelle, Troy, etc. were professional and pleasant. Edwin of Engineering and Mason of the bar we met both during our first visit last year. Edwin acts as the mayor of this resort and, as he’s busily walking to check on the next issue, he greets all guests and asks how their stay is going. Mason is quietly cheerful, friendly, and well organized as he takes care of all guests. They are both delightful. This is not to say everything is perfect. Things happen. We did have a large beetle in our room the first stay. It’s Florida. The attention to the matter was not only quick and professional but they also wanted to track down the carcass to make certain they knew exactly what my husband had found so they could assess the situation (i.e. is it a typically outdoor bug that got in or is there a bug problem in the room). One quite unpleasant front desk staff, Sherrie, we chalked up to statistics. It did not seem she was having a bad day, the impression she left is that she moves through life in a cloud of snippiness and low self-esteem disguised as arrogance that she delivers with condensation. We hope you don’t have her to deal with. If you do, they have a number of ways to work it out: a large sidewalk loops around the property for jogging and walking, an ice cream shop, and a bar. Hopefully she’s long gone by the time you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Good for couples”
Reviews.Author: Figaro14
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice now. Because these are all either studio suites or one bedroom suites, some with lockouts where you could, if you had a large group get a two bedroom with two kitchens, they are ideal for couples. There are no units with the option for two separate beds. All the units have one king bed and one sleeper sofa in the living room. They are nicely appointed, with granite counter tops, GE appliances, glass top dining room tables, whirlpool tubs in the bathroom (some units have tubs in the bedroom). A big plus is a stackable washer and dryer off the kitchen. Both times we got units on high floors which overlooked the center court pool area. The screened in porches are nice to sit on when the weather is not too hot. If you do intend to cook, the kitchen is stocked with some basics, like dishes for 4, silverware and very few actual cocking utensils. It’s ok for cooking breakfast, but probably not for dinner. Not certain why these suites condos have decided that absolutely no one wants two separate beds in the bedroom, but this really limits who you can stay here with. So it’s fine for couples but doesn't work as well for friends travelling together. My single biggest complaint is parking. If your are out for the day and get back late at night, all parking spots are taken and you end up parking several buildings away from where you are staying. If you are staying here to visit the theme parks, it’s a pretty good location. Most parks are just 10 - 15 minute drive away. This particular property is now 3 + years old, and it’s starting to show some signs of wear and tear. Our unit had a broken kitchen cabinet in it and the cover on the tub appeared to have been broken and just propped in place. The carpet in the living and bedroom area is also starting to look a bit worn. Since these are vacation condos, not a "hotel," not certain when these things will get taken care of. Our one “negative” experience was with the concierge desk. When we checked in, the front desk encouraged us to use the concierge to help us get theme park tickets. The next day I visited the concierge desk. The woman who greeted me asked, “Are you here on a marketing package?” When I said I was, she no longer wanted to assist me and treated me as if I were some bum who had wandered in off the street. I found this particularly disconcerting.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but could be great...”
Reviews.Author: Business_Traveler_MI
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to this resort. Here are my thoughts... Positives -The units are very nice and well maintained. -The grounds are immaculately maintained. Albeit you pay the price for this with morning weed wacker and leaf blower sounds. -Grills are cleaned frequently and the pool area is in very good shape. -Housekeeping does a decent job but the quality of the work varies by individual. -Pool activities make it feel like a resort and fun for families. Negatives -Signs are posted that you cannot reserve pool chairs and that any items left for more than 30 minutes are subject to removal. However, we have frequently observed guest "reserving" prime chairs early in the morning with towels only to come to the pool by 10am or later for an hour or so. When they leave, they adjust their towels to keep their chairs claimed for a later visit. The hotel needs enforce their own policy and have someone remove used towels and make these chairs available to all owners/guests. -There are no 2 room units with a king bed and a second room with 2 queen beds. The website claims that this is an option you can reserve but guest services confirmed that this configuration does not even exist in their complex. This bit us when we expected three beds and they gave us a unit with only two. Pull out couches don't count as beds. HGVI needs to fix their website. - Grounds employees mostly use gas golf carts to commute and move cargo around the grounds. They slow down and gun it after every speed bump and the carts are loud. They need to get all electric carts. -If you arrive back at your condo late after the parks have closed, expect to park at the front of the complex. Or at least not at your building. They could assign one space per unit right at your building with extra parking located where appropriate. All of the negative items can be solved. I hope the resort management read this review and address these issues. It's a very good destination but could be incredible by accommodating a few of the negative items.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, but probably won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Christina K
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and two young kids) stayed at this hotel last year in building 7. We had a two bedroom that faced the outlet mall. Other than the lack of view, we were very happy with our stay last year. This year we headed back and booked a one bedroom. Wishing to be closer to the pool, we were placed in building one. Thank goodness for white noise machines, because it was LOUD all day until 9 or 10 at night. For most families with young kids, this would have been horrible. We were able to tolerate it by turning the white noise up full blast, but it definitely made for less than relaxing evenings for my husband and me. The room itself...eh. The housekeeping was not done until about 5pm each day and was spotty. Kitchen counters not wiped off, vacuuming not done, some days kitchen linens, some days not. The room seemed to be getting run down and a little dirty. And the roaches. Ew, the roaches. Found one just about every day we were there, usually in the kitchen. Saying they have a shuttle to the major theme parks is kind of a joke. It's expensive and very limited. Read about lots of other people having issues with parking, but we were usually home early enough to avoid any problems. Pool was very crowded, with all of the good sunning spots "saved" with personal belongings by about 7 each morning, despite signs saying this was prohibited. Not that big of a deal, but kind of annoying. Not really the hotel's fault. The pool was very lively with lots of fun things going on all day long. We enjoyed this during the day, not so much into the night. We didn't have much issue with the whole timeshare hassle thing. They called us once at home before our trip and then pushed it when we checked in. Then I wisely unplugged both phones in our room after reading about people getting so many phone calls during their trip. Keeping them unplugged throughout our stay seemed to solve the problem. Ha! We weren't unhappy with our stay, just kind of indifferent. Will likely stay on property somewhere next time. This resort just didn't thrill us the second year in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable, Clean and Congenial”
Reviews.Author: mumsie2u
Reviews.Content: We are HGVC Premier Elites...lots of points. We booked a six night stay for two rooms: a 1 BR and a 2 BR so we could vacation with family. We received a call before we left asking if we had any special wishes. We asked to be in the same building but had no other requests. Check-in was fast and very friendly. We also went over to the Welcome Desk and expected a "push" to attend an update, but instead we met a guy named Conan who immediately understood our wish to just have family time...no push whatsoever. He had good information for us and when we met him in the lobby later in the week, he remembered us. Impressive! Our room was the 1 BR and we found it to be clean and located in Building 4, 3rd floor overlooking the Laguna Pool. This was a great location and we especially enjoyed the screened porch with table and four chairs. Our unit had a fully equipped kitchen, though only had 4 place settings of dishes and stainless (could have used 2 more) and had the usual pots and pans. We suggest that in case you don't get a teflon fry pan you bring or buy some spray PAM. Very necessary! There's a dishwasher and a washer and dryer in the unit. Bedroom also has a large jetted tub. Orlando water is somewhat "smelly" so we bought bottled water and found this to be a good help. The king bed was extremely comfortable with nice, soft linens and pillows. Our son's unit was a 2 BR which is a ! BR with a studio lock-off. It worked very well for 2 adults and 2 kids. The hotel staff was always very friendly and all we met seemed to really enjoy their jobs and being with people. Staff was also very responsive to any needs we had. There is a business center and also a computer to print boarding passes for free. The two pools on property were heated and we always were able to find lounge chairs. There are bars/snack bars at each pool. We tried the pizza at the Laguna pool and it was excellent! There is a Publix grocery store across the street and a very large outlet mall directly behind the property. We tried the Outback Restaurant which is about a half block away as well as the Carrabas Italian Restaurant which is just past the outlet mall. Both were very good. There's a Subway next to the grocery store. Location of this property is really excellent! Easy drives to the Disney properties and SeaWorld. The hotel does have a shuttle to these places but we opted for the convenience of being able to come and go whenever we wanted. Once the $14 parking fee is paid at one Disney property, you can park at any of the others the same day for no additional fee. There are many choices of places to stay in Orlando within the Hilton family but we will always choose this one because of the amenities, convenience, and friendliness of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand Vacations Club/Orlando, FL”
Reviews.Author: fcrockettj
Reviews.Content: 1. AAA rating for facilities and location in Orlando, FL. 2. Short driving distance to major Orlando, FL attractions 3. All guest are stay on members accounts which usually assures no nonsense actions by people staying. 4. Children friendly 5. Close to shopping and all types of eating establishments

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: waynegaudet
Reviews.Content: beautiful scenery,pools were nice to your choice,rooms were nice,cleaned everyday,workers were friendly,walk/jog track was busy which was good,very peaceful.catholic church nearthe malls,which was convience to people,front desk very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Resort,Great Location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Joannacam
Reviews.Content: Booked HGVC with RCI points and what a lovely place it turned out to be. The resort as far as I'm concerned is second to none. The accommodation was superb, the staff are so friendly and nothing was too much trouble a real credit to HIlton. One word of advice, make sure before you get there they have your reservation, as when we checked in I am convinced HGVC did not have our reservation as the guy at the front desk asked if we had already checked in, (this began to make sense, as about a month before we traveled I sent an e-mail to Hilton requesting the room location I would like etc., I got a reply back stating that Hilton central reservations did not have my reservation but they would forward my e-mail directly to the resort to sort out. I didn`t get a response from HGVC so I phoned them about 5 days before our arrival to make sure they actually had our reservation and according to them, they had.) I'm convinced that there were another family with the same surname as why would they ask if we had already checked in. The room we were allocated was in building 7 on the ground floor, I was really disappointed with the room as it was so gloomy due to the position on the side of the building and the shrubbery growing around it seemed to be blocking out the natural light. I contacted the front desk to ask for a room change and explained my reasons for it, but was informed that as the place was full nothing could be done until the next day and was promised a more suitable suite. When we finally got the keys around 1 pm, we were certainly not disappointed, the suite overlooked the lake (building 2 5th floor) absolutely beautiful, spotlessly clean and well appointed. The location is great for all the Disney / Universal / Sea world / Epcot , 15-20 min drive, we could actually see the observation tower at Sea world and the fireworks at Epcot at night from our balcony, about 30 mins from the airport. If I had one gripe about this place, it would be the pool bar / restaurant, not a great selection on offer and quite pricey for what you get, not great quality either. We ate there 2 or 3 three times if coming back late from the parks. However there are some good local restaurants , the Outback steakhouse across the road and if you turn left out of the resort, drive for about 3 or 4 mins you`ll come across firstly The Longhorn, and if you like Italian cuisine then try the Carrabbas Italian grill ( try the Red Snapper if they have it on ) both serving great food with excellent service. Back to the resort, 2 lovely pools, good games room, plenty of activities going on for young and old to enjoy. There is a deli on site which has a breakfast and lunch offerings. All in all, we had a great stay at HGVC and would not hesitate to stay again if visiting central Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect suites for families!”
Reviews.Author: Elof16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at our long weekend, perfect location and with two lovely pool areas. If you have small kids its really good to stay close to the smaller pool, its perfect for children (and adults!). The rooms where big and clean, we loved our stay at Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Booooring........”
Reviews.Author: avchamp
Reviews.Content: The rooms/suites in this place are clean, gorgeous ,spacious and beautifully decorated. The rooms come with full size fridge, microwave and oven. Property has two pools. the main pool is a decent size but with so many kids around you may not exactly get to enjoy your swimming much. There are no bars, restaurants, no music, no light life to excite you about staying in the place. There are no great restaurants within the vicinity of the property either. The place is next to an out door mall so if your aim is shopping then you are in a right place I suppose. This is a great place to get a good night sleep and to venture out on your business and pleasure during the day. You will need a car so don't even contemplate taking a taxi to this place or you will be stuck.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisha Y
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed here countless times and we always have an excellent experience! Great location, close to theme parks, restaurants, and shopping. Wonderful service. Great amenities, especially the pool! Could not ask for a better place to stay! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Karla G
Reviews.Content: The service was fabulous and the grounds were beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL WITH OUTSTANDING POOL!”
Reviews.Author: Sissi N
Reviews.Content: I loved our stay in this hotel. It has an outstanding pool, super friendly staff and the whole hotel is so beautiful designed. Super location right by the Outlets. Beautiful water fountains everywhere with walking trails, awesome Game room. The only reason why I give this 4 stars instead of 5 is, that our suite was a little smaller and had no household equipment like plates, silverware etc

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shef78
Reviews.Content: I'm probably not your 'typical' traveler to this property. I went as a solo traveler on business, rather than what it's primary focus is - families. That said, I enjoyed my stay. Positives: The room was clean, the water pressure and temperature were awesome, the bed was comfortable, and all of the staff I encountered were super friendly! I loved the 1/2 mile jogging path around the lake - I ran every night and felt safe. I also enjoyed having dinner out on the covered balcony - a nice treat. Walked to the outlets. Negatives: biggest negative is parking. There isn't enough spots when the place is at 100% capacity. That said, I only had an issue when I came back after 11 p.m., and then you just park near the lobby and they give you a free shuttle ride to your room. It wasn't a big deal, just mildly annoying. And I'm not sure how often it is at 100% capacity; I just happened to be there during the height of spring break. Nice place - I would return!

Reviews.Title: “March 2012 - Fantastic stay. As usual.”
Reviews.Author: jonasurfer
Reviews.Content: We’ve stayed here quite a few times, and we keep going back because we like it so much. We have tried other accommodations in the same area such as Floridays and Sheraton Vistana Villages and several others. And whilst we had no complaints about them, we think that the Hilton GVS is very much “a cut above”. It’s certainly not a budget option but it’s great quality accommodation in a lovely setting in a fabulous location with extremely helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best getaway”
Reviews.Author: anna b
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best trips I have ever had in florida. Hotel was clean, staff were extremely nice, entertainment was not as I expected thats why I rated it a 4. They acted as if they did not want to be there I was they interacted with the guests more. I read reviews thought it was ok but when we actually got there I was speechless on how amazing it looked. Perfect location, 20 mins to universal, pool excellent, outlet mall, great food overall great and will be back asappppp. P.S. Best part was not bothered about time share.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Travelrossitiy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, everything was top notch, we loved the resort. The distance to the attractions was perfect, nice grocery stir across the street, right next to a huge outlet mall. Only downside was that parking is a little tight,

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: MISnowBird2
Reviews.Content: We had never traveled to Florida before, and heard that some hotels are not the greatest. My husband planned a 20th wedding anniversary celebration, and we were astonished at how beautiful, clean, and comfortable the room was. We had a great view of the pool. The staff was friendly, and the shuttle drivers were extremely helpful when we needed to get to Epcot. Great trip! We hope to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “5 MINS TO DISNEY!!”
Reviews.Author: rachm7
Reviews.Content: Awesome location, only 5 mins to Disney made it great having my 3 year old neice with us! Its also not far to IOA universal or seaworld. Great size rooms, always clean on site. Only one problem we had was parking was a nightmare of an evening! Espeically when everyone was back from fireworks at Disney. Great Pool with a big water fall was fun, and the deli was great for breakfast. We also LOVED the bbq's near the lake, the only thing we didnt like was all the 3 bed (2 bed + connecting room) were facing the car park, this was a bit of a shame because we loved looking over the lake. But being opposite Premium Outlets was pretty hand. We loved it so much we'll be back in September this year! The stuff were very friendly too. Having cocktails at pool bar in evening was lovely aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Josh G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the nba all-star weekend on accident by booking the wrong hotel, but everything was absolutely incredible. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the moment i checked in until we left at the end of the weekend. The rooms were very clean and up to date. I would gladly reccommend this hotel to any of my family or friends looking to stay in the orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleIllinois
Reviews.Content: Very nice property very close to all the action. Roomy comfortable suites with all the amenities. Very nice pool area with an overall upscale look.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Very Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jamann
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing resort that is family friendly. Staff was very pleasant to deal with. Check in was easy. I traveled with my 15 year old daughter and husband. We booked a King Suite. I was a little hesitatant on the comfort of a pull out sofa. Much to my surprise this mattress was the best I have ever seen for a pull out sofa. Room was very nice. King bed was comfortable. Screaned in patio was very relaxing to use. Coming from Buffalo, NY where the snow is flying any opportunity to sit outside and eat breakfast, read or relax is a delight in February. Kitchen has some basic kitchen equipment: blender, a cookie sheet, a few kettles, plates, glasses and utensils. They also had dish detergent and washing machine detergent left in the room. The only negative I found was I was in building 4 facing the parking ramp to the outlet. So the view and car noise wasn't great. Two beautiful pools. The main pool was busy with daily entertainment. There was a bar pool at each of the pools. The second pool was still a good size. Both pools supplied plenty of towels. Scattered around the resort were BBQ area's. The lake in the center has a path around it that is approximate 1/2 mile. Lots of joggers buzzing around in the morning. Several times a day security was seen going around on their segways. Within walking distance was a Publix grocery store, Walgreens (with red box video rentals to use in the room DVD player) McDonalds, Out Back Steak Restaurant and a nice outlet mall. At the entrance of the resort there is a bus stop for the troll and the Lynx bus system. I took the Lynx from the hotel to the other outlet mall on intenrationial drive. It was $2 and took about 40 minutes. You can take the trolly to get to the same location with many more stops along the way. If you do this you can look up the bus schedule on the LYNX website (they run about every 15-20 minutes ) and you take the Oak Ridge link. If you want a taxi it would run $25. This is location on intenrational drive was less busy than the area near Sand Lake Road. Sand Lake Road area has a ton of restaurants and lots of traffic. The only recommendation I would make would be to request a room with lake view. Personally I would request building 2 or 3. These buildings have a lake view on one side and on the back side a view of the parking lot for the resort and another resort on the back side. Building 1 is facing the main pool and can have more noise all day, building 4 & 5 could have rooms that face the out mall parking ramp. Buildings 5-8 back up to the outlet mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great family spot”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: Well worth it. I love the location - especially if you are doing more than Disney as the location is great for shopping, Sea World, and Golf. It is definitely a family place so if you are looking for a quiet pool experience, it is not going to happen. There is a Publix across the street to stock up on what a family would need for a few days whether it is dinner or beer, soda, water and snacks. The staff was great. Very friendly and looking to help. The place was very clean. The guy who sings at the pool on Friday is a treat and helps snap you into vacation mode. Not a big Orlando guy, but if heading back, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews for this property, I had moderately high expectations coming in - and I was not disappointed. Staff at check-in were very friendly, taking time to explain the amenities, what's on site, and on-property benefits (very limited at HGV locations) for Hilton Diamond Members. Ample parking was available in front of our building and there were sufficient luggage carts to haul things around. The building was well maintained and looked in nearly perfect shape. We were extremely impressed with our room - size, amenities (full kitchen, bathroom, washer/dryer, furnished kitchen), layout, complementary WIFI and the balcony. We were on a higher floor wo we had a nice view of the pool area and most of the resort - so we were able to enjoy the entertainment, while having dinner right in our room! The view was somewhat hindered by the mosquito net - but at least mosquitoes were a non-issue! On-site food options are somehwat limited, but this is easy to understand given the amenities provided, and the fact that a Publix store is right accros the street. Moreover, many people are likely out around meal times - this is Orlando after all! We did grab a light snack by the pool on one occasion and food quality and size was above average. There were sufficient chairs, umbrellas, towels and space in/around the pool. Pool and pool area was very clean and well-maintained For the shopping enthusiast, Orlando Premium Outlets are easily accessible via a pedestrian bridge between the property and the Outlets. The hotel will provide (complimentary) laundry detergent, liquid dish soap, dishwasger detergent and additional towels upon request. Housekeeping during our stay was executed perfectly and the staff friendly and accomodating. Lastly, of the HGV locations in the Orlando area, this is usually the most affordable one - hence providing awesome value. This was a great place to end our 10-day trip throughout Florida and won't hesitate to go back next time that we are in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: icecream1pharm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip (in February) to Orlando, on the spur of the moment, and found a room at this place. It is a very large complex. Our room was very nice and clean, and the property was beautiful. it's very close to the Epcot exit off the highway, and right next to a large outlet shopping area. Even though its proximity to these areas would make you think it was loud and noisy, it was not. We enjoyed our stay. The pool area is great, good for kids, lots of room, heated pool with a nice bar. Wish we could have stayed longer. While we didn't have a lot of time to spend near the lake or pool, we were not bothered by mosquitos at all, and I am a mosquito magnet.

Reviews.Title: “Take a mosquito spray”
Reviews.Author: fourstaronly
Reviews.Content: Bitten several times during our first nights sleep. This resort in spot less clean but has neighbouring lakes which could be supplying the mosquitos. We s,toyed ain a studio which was large enough for us. A couple of nice pool areas back door enterajnce to the large premium mall McDonald's across the road good for coffee as well as a Walgreen superstore. Some poor view rooms here but a high floor pool view room is very nice. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “A good place for vacation when in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: EarlDGrt
Reviews.Content: Two couples and two teens shared a suite (2 bedrooms and one pull out sofa in living room). There was ample room and with two full baths we did not "step on each other toes". The hotel had 2 reasonable size pools - but I could imagine that in peak time they would be too small. If you are looking to stay in a nice hotel outside the parks (Disney, Universal or Sea World) this hotel is a good choice. It is centrally located although it does not provide shuttle service to the parks. You need to have a cal but having a Piggly Wiggly across the highway, which makes it a great place if you want to eat some of your meals in the room (the kitchen is stocked for 6 including a dishwasher). The hotel is mid-to-high price for this size / quality accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Business Meeting”
Reviews.Author: sandra p
Reviews.Content: Recently held a business meeting with 15 co-workers and it could not have went any better. Meeting rooms were well set-up, grounds were well kept, rooms were clean, and staff was outstanding. Debra the food and beverage manager was outgoing, engaging, and met and exceeded our every need. Everyone in our group raved about her great attitude/personality and she went above and beyond with breakfast, lunches, snacks, and meals. All staff were helpful, friendly, and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, but Debra was the OUTSTANDING.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tampa77
Reviews.Content: I regretfully stayed only one night and wish I could of stayed a week. I was in a road trip for 7 days then checked in here. It was such a refresher. Large bathtub, space, quality, I even got to wash all my clothes before I left. It is definetly a place I lived to stay again. I stated in building 6 on the forth floor by elevator, you could not here any noise even though we were place there. I definetly want to return.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: ialwaysloveflorida
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Resort ! Great Pools! Immaculate rooms! Hospitable Staff!! I do not have anything bad to say !!!

Reviews.Title: “Used our private information for telemarketing purposes!!”
Reviews.Author: CelticsFan2012
Reviews.Content: We all get annoying and intruding telemarketing calls. Well....if you stay at this property, you will also get intruding telemarketing calls directly on your private room phone during your vacation!!! Hilton feels it is "within their right" (according to the Resort Director - Mr. Abed Ereikat) to pass along the personal information we provided to the front desk reservation personnel/system to its telemarketing department so they can call you in your room, in the middle of the afternoon, intrude on your vacation AND afternoon nap in order to annoy you to attend their timeshare sales breakfast. As a data privacy professional and senior corporate executive, I was shocked that Hilton would undertake such unethical business practices. I thought it was perhaps the actions of a rogue employee to misuse our personal information in this manner that we did not authorize - however, I have been told by the Resort Director that they make these calls everyday, it is part of their standard practices and endorse by Management!!! Unbelievable!!! I have requested a teleconference with their Privacy Officer in the hopes that this inappropriate and unethical business practice will be halted once their Privacy Officer becomes aware of it - at a minimum, they should ask you at check in if you are interested in receiving a call regarding the timeshare sales event. I will update this post with the results of that teleconference once known. In the meantime, I remained very concerned that if this is their corporate endorsed approach to protecting my private information - who knows what else they are doing with my information (e.g. my credit card information???!!!). To clarify - they say they are complying with the Hilton global privacy policy with this business practice - therefore, if you value your privacy and protection of your personal information (e.g. want to avoid identity theft and other similar problems), then I suggest that you don't stay at any Hilton Properties worldwide - at least until their Privacy Officer hopefully cleans up this unethical mess that Hilton Management has created. Rest assured - If they don't address this incident properly and clean up this unethical privacy practice, this post will be the least of their problems (Federal Trade Commission Act complaint, Safe Harbour complaint to U.S Dept of Commerce....just to name a few). The ball is in your court, Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here many times”
Reviews.Author: lillious
Reviews.Content: I was here for 10 days in January and 7 days in February. During my first stay the Internet was non existent in my room. I called for tech support and they sent 2 very nice gentlemen up quickly. Their first comment when they entered and saw my laptop. "Oh, it's a Mac." Found that quite humorous as the issue was not with my equipment but due to the fact that the resort was in the process of an upgrade to a new provider. I had the same housekeeping issue as previous posters. They asked when I wanted my mid-week cleaning and I told them. When I returned at 8pm nothing was done. I called again and they said they would send someone up right away. I took a walk and when I returned the unit was tidy with new linens. When I checked out the first trip I told them I would be returning and to please put me on the 2nd or 5th floor as the tech's told me those were the floors with working Internet. They honored my request and the Internet worked flawlessly. However, same problems with housekeeping. They were a no show 2 days in a row. I spoke with the front desk and was assured things would be taken care of the next day-which they were. I have stayed at this property since their opening week. Pros: I choose this location when I know I want to either do some shopping or when I know I'll want to walk after dark and choose to walk at the outlets so I'm not alone. Pizza shop on site has nice staff and a decent pizza. I expect to pay dearly-it's a resort. But they are friendly and the pizza was tasty. Location is very convenient to the places I like to frequent. The pool is always very pretty even if I don't go in! Onsite Starbucks is nice albeit double the price of the one around the corner. But again, you're paying for the convenience. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom is spacious and washer/dryer was very convenient. Cons Units are starting to show their wear. Tub in second room was coming apart from wall. Outlet by kitchen sink was coming out of the wall. Second unit had lukewarm water, barely hot enough for a shower. Parking has been a nightmare since day one. They overbuilt for the amount of spots they offer. Quite often during peak times you have to park by the main entrance and be shuttled to your unit. Although a nice touch it is a true inconvenience when you are unloading or loading your vehicle. Definitely not fun if you are bringing children. The issue of the timeshare sales. Yes, expect to be called. BUT if you tell them when you check in that you have no interest in their sales pitch and that they are not to call you, they will honor your request. I learned that a long time ago. I tell them I have no time to sit and listen to them nor do I need any more vacation homes. Just be honest with them and they won't bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Devo64
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights on a business trip. Room was well equipped - toaster, microwave, coffee maker, fridge for breakfast items. Large complex with 7 buildings, but easy walk from any building to main reception. Ample parking (at least when I was there). Easy pass-thru from hotel to Premium Outlets for outlet shopping. 2 nice large pools. Excellent value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Just Relax as Frankie says !!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul795
Reviews.Content: did this as an exhange via RCI .Nice place we got the i tolley most days to Uni and walked to the Park .(we Brits walk) good super makert over the road they ID under 90 .Go tro Winter Gardern take the boat around the Lake a very clean and safe area.The Staff are very nice as well Outback Restruant across the Street do some great meals.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: SumBeach_1
Reviews.Content: Amazed by some of the complaints on here. How can you be shocked that you were offered a Time Share, when staying at a Time Share Resort? Have stayed here numerous times, some business some social. Resort is top notch. Rooms are very nice as are both pools. Pool bar is also very nice. Food pricing is what you will get at every Resort around Disney. If you are caught off guard by that you simply did not do your research on the cost of going to Disney. The grounds are very nice in general and the staff is very friendly. We had requested a Pack-n-Play and it was brought to our room within 20 minutes. We requested some additional towles and experienced the same promptness. My only criticism would be two fold. There are limited restraurants on the grounds. Basically a small cafe, a pizza place and a grill at the bar alongside the pool. Second, the WiFi is very, very sketchy. If you are on business (as I was part of the week), it will be painful at times. Had to physically go down to the Business Center to ensure I would not get kicked off the Internet. Overall, this place is very nice and I would highly recommend. I have stayed at 5 different Hiltons in Orlando and I prefer this one over all others minus the Hilton next to the Convention Center (better business Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway location.”
Reviews.Author: sk1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this resort for 3 nights. Its a great location to either stay put, or venture out to see the sights. Units range from larger timeshare units to smaller efficiencies. Right next to the Premium outlets, which you can wander through without getting in your car. We were able to book a hotel room through the usual channels, allowing us to stay near our friends who had a timeshare week.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: DMC4
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend you stay somewhere else while visiting Orlando. Issues we experienced: 1. Requested a quiet room with a view. Manager assisted trainee with room selection for us. Despite our request, he put us in a room next to the outlet mall and the maintenance garage overlooking a busy road and a Publix shopping plaza. 2. At 8:30 a.m., we were awakened by a call from the hotel trying to sell us a timeshare "opportunity" which was not something we had expected or requested. 3. Our room was not cleaned when we returned at 5:30. Called room service and was told the cleaning would be done before 8:00 p.m. No one came until we called mgmt. Apparently, the hotel reserves the right to clean up till 10:00p.m. Unacceptable. Especially since the cleaning crew were able to be at our door, knocking, to clean our room at 9:30 a.m on the morning we were checking out when the hotel checkout time is 10:00a.m. Their inability to properly run housekeeping is disruptive and intrusive. 4. Ordered two salads at the poolside cafe. It took one hour to receive our order despite this being the off season. Cost for our two small salads and two drinks was $50! And the salads were worse than those from a fast food restaurant. 5. The hotel is located right next to the Premium Outlets with a gate pass thru. Convenient for shopping, especially since this outlet area is a popular tourist stop and parking there is almost impossible. But, due to the popularity of this shopping destination, getting in and out of this hotel is an absolute NIGHTMARE! For example, we sat in a miles long line of traffic for an hour Saturday evening trying to get to a nearby restaurant. Same issue Fri and Sunday. Too many tourists for the road the hotel shares with the outlets so, unless you enjoy Christmas season type traffic every day, stay away! 6. The pool area is pretty but the "resort" is basically many crammed in buildings around a circular drive/manmade pond. Don't expect green/lush Floridian type areas..not enough room. Feels like an apartment complex, not a resort. Don't expect poolside food/drink service. You have to go to the poolside restaurant on your own. Resort looks very dated. 7. Only positive comment- Most of the staff are very friendly and will always wave or say hello. 8. Apparently the hotel is pet friendly as we had two dogs in a neighboring room. We would not have stayed at this hotel if we were aware of this policy.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: m5dream
Reviews.Content: Travelers: 40, 38, 8, 6, 5 years old Great location in Orlando. Close to all the parks, including Disney, Sea World, and Universal. You already know about the Premium Outlet and the Publix across the street. The buildings are about 6-7 floors high. I believe there are around 7-8 buildings with a small conference center. The buildings surround a small lake. If you want to be next to the main pool, playground, and basketball court, ask for building 1. There is also a bridge behind building 1 that crosses the lake to get to the shopping area. If you prefer your room to be close to the outlet, ask for the higher number building - I believe 7. Overall, this place is very peaceful, convenient, and affordable. It is very nice to have a full kitchen while staying in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Break”
Reviews.Author: kz23
Reviews.Content: We love this resort! The weather is always sketchy in December, but the hotel makes sure there are plenty of things to do! We had the best poolside server named Jill this year and she made our whole stay AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “For Familes and Couples, Great Place for Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveurcpl
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacations on International Drive is a place of peace and relaxation surrounded by the non-stop pace of Mickey and all his theme park friends! We had a Suite in Building 7 facing the lake and Main Hotel facility. Check in was a breeze and very welcoming, great start. The first night we had to park near reception but the security guard gave us a ride in the golf cart to our Building. Our room was very spacious, with kitchenette and nice sized bathroom (Very Clean). We had a screened porch facing the lake. Take our advice, ask for a higher floor. We were on the 3rd, no way would we have wanted to be on the ground floor!! Clean room with daily service that did a great job every day we were there. The beds are a bit soft, nice 32" TV, well lit. Parking is limited but not a huge issue as everything within the compound is close. The "gated" resort is monitored at the vehilce entrance and card key controlled at the points facing the Outlet Mall. The entire staff is very friendly and helpful always with a smile!!! There is a grocery store across the street with everything you need. The pizza place on the compound is very good (try the Buffalo Chicken Sub). Many good eating establishments close by. Disney Worlds Magic Kingdom not more than 15 minutes away. On site deli and Starbucks worked well in the morning!! We will stay again, as this is an oasis away from the theme park crazy and prepackaged "fun"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property, convenient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: jrdavis05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this property for two nights (Jan. 26 and Jan. 27). We had a late flight into Orlando, and planned to get up early to go to The Magic Kingdom. When we arrived, check in was very easy. The parking is gated, and accessed either through using your room key card, or through the front gate, where security has to grant you access. When we checked in, Phil, the front desk agent was pleasant, and knowledgeable. He explained all of the amenities of the property, confirmed my special requests were taken care of, and directed me to the bellman who got us a shuttle to our building, Building #6 - Highly recommend this building. We had a 1 King Bed Suite. Mini fridge, microwave, sink. More than we truly needed for our short stay. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable. Large flat screen television, Large comfy chair, as well as a small table with two chairs, perfect for a small meal if you choose to eat in the room. There was also a decent sized screened in balcony with a plastic table and two chairs. The balcony on our room looked out onto the lake, as opposed to a room that might look out upon the Outlet Mall or parking lot. The room was very quiet. The only issue that I will bring up is with parking. They have a main parking lot by the main lobby and building. There is also parking that goes around by each of the buildings (1-7), however there is only parking near the individual buildings for about 85% of guests if the property is fully booked, as it was when we stayed. The hotel does offer a shuttle to the main parking lot, however they have 2 different types of shuttles, and it seems to be luck of the draw. One is a 15 passenger van, the other is a 6 passenger golf cart. If it is raining, and they send the golf cart, prepare to be wet. Hector, our shuttle driver was very nice, and did the best job he possibly could to dry the seats on the golf cart shuttle. There is one outlet mall that you can access directly via your keycard and a shortcut through the parking lot. This is a good feature if you get back from theme parks early and want to do a little shopping. The overall area is very nice, completely safe, and fun for couples or family's alike. We did not use any of the amenities (pool, game room...), so I cannot comment on them. If traveling to Orlando again, I would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPAL
Reviews.Content: Selected this as our hotel for a 5 day stay in Orlando in late January based on a good price ($97) for a King bed studio suite at a Hilton Property, and we were not disappointed. This is basically a time-share resort that rents unoccupied units by the night-- after turning down an invitation for a sales pitch the first morning ("we're not interested"), we were not bothered again. Beautifully landscaped and maintained property, comfortable bed, microwave, refrigerator, toaster, coffeemaker, blender and 2 sets of pottery dishes --- adequate for making breakfast in the room. Enjoyed a morning walk around the lakeside path and several hours at the wonderfully large "active" pool near the main lobby. There is a smaller "quiet" pool at the other end of the lake, but this was "off-season" so the main pool was uncrowded and, besides, being lap swimmers we enjoyed the nearly 75 yard length of the main pool. Staff was very friendly across the board - including the maintenance folks. A car is a necessity here for quick access to the amusement parks, shopping and fine dining, although there is a public trolley on International Blvd, a Publix Market and Walgreen's across the avenue, an outlet shopping center next door, and a few chain restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: payne0295
Reviews.Content: This entire property is wonderful! From the moment we arrived, the staff was so helpful and friendly. The area is beautifully manicured. There was always something fun going on around the pool. We were there in the off season so it would really be a great place to come with the entire family during the busy months! The rooms were large and comfortable. We will most certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Great full suite lodging”
Reviews.Author: Mqttraveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on 2 occasions and our experience was great both times. Service in 2012 exceptional. I travel often several times a month and find few places with bell and desk staff as friendly and willing to serve as at HGVC Int drive. Many suites have been updated. Reasonably well equipped kitchen although I have had better cooking utensils at other long stay suite facilities. Great location. Near all the parks, golf, and shopping. Secure safe area. Nice but limited exercise facility. 2 pools easily accessed from your room. You cannot beat staying here in Orlando especially if you are with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: linners13
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights in September and it really was absolutely fantastic! It is at the end of International Drive so it is so quiet. There is a Publix supermarket across the road and it is so handy to have your own little kitchen. The staff could not have been more helpful driving us around in their golf buggies as the complex is quite large. Only downside was a man on reception told us that to get to Universal Studios we had to pay for the private van but in fact you can get to it using the trolleys that drive up and down Universal Drive. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable and there were washer/dryer facilities in the complex. Right next door there is a shopping outlet with restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, lucky surprise!”
Reviews.Author: tvk4
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on my way to a last-minute visit to Universal Studios. I'm a new Hilton Honors member and most of the others in the chain were booked. This was not only available, but one of the least expensive rooms at only $98.00! My husband and I were greatly surprised and delighted with our kitchenette-living room-bedroom that overlooked the lake ( with fountain) and pool. A short walk took us to the huge Premier Outlet Mall. We wanted to add a night so we could enjoy the many activities offered but there were no rooms left. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Experience not the best”
Reviews.Author: Peggy V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five days at the Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on International Drive. We are Hilton members and have always had good experiences at the Hilton. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The grounds were also beautiful and well maintained. It was close to the outlets, supermarket and restaurants. However, our experience left a great deal to be desired. There is a lack of ample parking spaces. Upon returning to the complex one evening, we were forced to park almost a quarter of a mile from our room. On another evening we were awoken in the middle of the night by other guests screaming and fighting on their terrace. On our last day we returned to our room at 5 PM and was surprised that the room had never been cleaned.
