When I spoke to management about these matters she stated that those things (fights) happen in a hotel and I am not at home. As far as house cleaning, they had a busy day and it was only 6 PM. They would now send someone over to clean the room!!! The manager did send a jar of mixed nuts to our room as a nice gesture,but I am highly allergic to peanuts!!!! Although we made the best of it, this experience wasn't what we expected from a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money - Amazing !”
Reviews.Author: Ashok_Gunasekaran
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing deal and it was worth every penny. The best suite rooms i have seen for this price. So clean and comfortable. Lots of amenities and good quality service. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: wedgieBedford
Reviews.Content: Huge suites in 6/7 blocks surrounding a central lake. Next door to Premium outlets for the shoppers and about 2 miles from i4 so all the attractions and Downtown Orlando easy to get to - except in rush hour when it gets like the M25 in London. Gym not up to expectations - far too small - but food good if pricey compared to eating out. Fantastic room, we got senior rate at about $125 plus tax per night, very competitive for this area and this standard. Large TV'S in both lounge and bedroom and jacuzzi for two plus fully fitted kitchen - supermarket opposite. Thoroughly recommended but you will get called every day until you tell them you're not interested in timeshare. One problem with hair dryer, one call and fixed within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED OUR STAY - WANTED TO STAY LONGER!!”
Reviews.Author: bamagrl77
Reviews.Content: I just happened upon this property while performing an internet seach - looking for a nice place in Orlando that was more than just a room with a bed. This exceeded our expectations!! We had a one bedroom and it was more than enough room for out little family. The full kitchen was nice and of course the washer/dryer was awesome to have so I could do laundry while we were hanging out. We only had time to stay for a couple nights but after checking in wished we could have stayed longer. We will stay here again the next time in the Orlando area. The front desk staff was out of this world - they offered us the timeshare tour but once I told them we were on limited time traveling with a 2 year old, they didn't push the issue. The pools were great and the property was beautiful - security was on site and always seemed to be on patrol This property it situated beside one of the outlet malls and you just walk through a gate to the mall - even though the mall is next door, you cannot here all the traffic. Excellent property!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations! Great Location! The Best”
Reviews.Author: Jeepmancrd
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days here and my girlfriend and I were SUPER IMPRESSED. Excellent value for the money. The suites are beautiful, great ammenities, very very clean,well laid out,super location, the staff were top notch! I do not have one complaint about this place. This will be my "go to" place to stay when in orlando !

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but only if you get a deal.”
Reviews.Author: dwctraveler
Reviews.Content: I am just getting ready to leave and thought that I would write my review while things are fresh in my mind. It is a pretty place, but it is not up to par with a fancy hotel. They didn't clean my room one day, there is never any parking close to the buildings at night, small things were always going wrong in the room. Lights, sink, dirty towels and linens. Just small things that would never be an issue at a large resort hotel, versus this type of time share resort. I paid $87 a night, so I figured I could put up with some of the small issues. Had I paid more or been a time share owner, I would not have been too happy. Overall, a good concept that is not executed very well.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Vacation-Definitely 5 Star Worthy!”
Reviews.Author: WITRAVLR
Reviews.Content: I booked on Hotwire without knowing the Hotel Name and I was VERY impressed with this resort! It is by far the nicest looking resort of all the resorts on that end of I-Drive.The staff is amazingly accommodating and very pleasant. We were traveling with another couple and requested rooms close to each other, since they did not have any King Studios close to each other we received a complimentary upgrade to 1-bedroom units that had connecting doors. Not once during our stay did anyone ask us about doing a timeshare presentation. Upon arriving we were greeted by a gentlemen in the lobby while waiting in line to check in, he asked us some generic questions about why we were in the area, what our plans were and if we had been in Orlando previously. I had mentioned in our conversation that we had Bluegreen timeshare and that may have given the hint that we were not interested in a presentation on HGVC Ownership. The resort is gated, you must use a room key to get through the gates or be let in by the gate attendant. The grounds are immaculate, everyday there were dozens of workers planting new plants/flowers and maintenance workers keeping everything in working order and looking fantastic. Security Officers are always around and acknowledge you nicely every time you cross paths. We were in Building 5, closest to Laguna Pool and the Outlet Mall's private gates, couldn't have asked for a better building! The unit we occupied was very spacious as it was a corner unit, bigger than our traveling companion's unit. Very clean, well stocked and not dated in the least. Loved the washer/dryer and the screen balcony. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, we slept great! One downfall, parking is a nightmare! We arrived late on Thursday afternoon and found a parking spot near our building, a little bit of a walk with our luggage though. We returned on Saturday night around 11PM and there was a sign in front of the gate indicating parking was full and to see gate attendant to park and be shuttled to your building, that was not ideal! We had to walk to get the car and drive up to the building to load in our luggage on Sunday morning. I called the front desk to ask about recommendations for transportation services to Universal City Walk and was surprised to find they contract a private SUV for up to 5 people to anywhere in the Orlando area. It arrived at our door in less than 10 minutes and only cost $24 to be dropped curbside at Universal. Plus, the driver gave us his personal cell number to call him whenever we needed him again! We LOVED the pool, it is beautiful and relaxing.The pool water is the perfect temp, it was upper-70's the days we were there.The pool bar offers delicious drinks and has a good lunch menu, try the Citrus Chicken Flatbread...a surprisingly delicious dish! I love how you can charge all drinks and food to your room so you do not have to carry a wallet to the pool and then just have it charged to the credit card on file at the end of the stay. They have so many great things planned for everyday that there really is enough at the resort to occupy you for days if you aren't coming to the area to go to Disney/Universal, like Wine Tastings, Dive-In Movies at the pool, Black Jack Tournaments and Live Entertainment. It's truly a great vacation experience, you will not regret choosing this resort! I would not consider staying anywhere else, it has great location, great staff and is all together an amazing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but beware...”
Reviews.Author: SheriK815
Reviews.Content: My husband & I are HGVC owners with our home resort in Vegas. Went to this timeshare with my adult daughter for some fun and rest. Beautiful grounds. Read many of these reviews before I went. I was concerned when I read about the cockroaches. Well, we requested building 7 as it was the newest building and right across from the outlet mall. Great view of the lake as we got a 1 bedroom suite on the top floor of the building. It was nice but could have used a good rug cleaning. Upon leaving the room for our first venture outside, another guest was complaining to one of the staff that her camera was stolen out of her room. Not good. First two days were fine. On the thrid morning of our stay, I entered the bathroom to see a big black cockroach running under the door to the room my daughter was sleeping in. Went to the front desk and requested another room. So we packed up and moved down to the third floor and he assured me this room would have no problems and no bugs. This was a nice room but could also have used a good cleaning of the rugs and drapes. This was the last night of our stay. My daughter was in the bathroom getting ready for bed after midnight when we encountered our newest cockroach. This one she was able to step on before it disappeared under the door. She tried to call the front desk but only got a busy signal (which happened almost all the time) so she finally called the operator and they asked if they could come up and spray the room (at 12:30 a.m.!!!!). NO. Even though we had a noon checkout, housekeeping came at 10:00 a.m. to clean. Yes this is a nice place. Location is excellent. The pool cafe was wonderful and so was the wait staff. The bell staff (Hector) was very friendly our whole stay. The timeshare desk was rather annoying in the first thing they asked me was where was my husband and when I replied it was just me and my daughter, the desk person said "are you divorced?!!!" Where does he have the right to ask me something like that. I said NO and then thought about it later that he probably wanted me to go to a timeshare presentation. I would not stay at this timeshare again. I would go back to Parc Soleil as it is superior in all aspects other than not within walking distance of much. We stayed there last year and were more than pleased with everything and everyone associated with that timeshare. Oh and after we left the first room because of bug problems, it was given to someone else that same day.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the bar high of what a Hilton property should be !!”
Reviews.Author: Aprilia_Motogp
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying here for 5 days with my father who decided to come with me. He had not been to the Orlando area in quite sometime. I had originally booked a single room efficiency, and discovered it was too small, as I had originally planned to travel alone. Austin at the front desk was kind enough to upgrade us to a 1 bedroom full suite with kitchen, living room and a large bathroom. I couldn't thank her enough, as it made this trip so much better by not being crammed into such a small living space. The property was immaculate. clean, and well taken care of. It is quite a large property built like a large Italian (or Tuscan) Villa. There are 7 buildings (7 floors high) all with balconies, most of which face a man made pond with a bridge cutting through the center. It is pretty easy to walk anywhere and not get lost. Heated swimming pools with waterfalls and jacuzzis are scattered outside of the main building. This place was designed to be over-the- top luxurious. The one bedroom suite had a full kitchen with new appliances, granite couters, dining room table, dishes, coffee maker microwave, and flat screen TV and sofa. A screened in balcony is right outside the living room area. The bathroom contained a large, enclosed stand up shower, full tub with water jets, and double sinks. Beds were comfortable with enogh pillows and blankets. I had a 3 day pass to the Disney parks, and transportation was provided for $9 round trip. This is way cheaper than what a cab would charge. Staff was very friendly and helpful with answers to all questions. The property is also right next door to a large Outlet Mall, with a private gate entrance which you use your room keycard for easy access. All in all this was a great property with spectacular location! Thanks again to Austin!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: luckygirl64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the end of August 2011, we had 2 - 2 bedroom suites and my Aunt & Uncle, cousin, daughter and sisters were so happy. The grounds are spotless, the staff over the top friendly. We had a couple of uncontrolable issues arise and the whole entire staff from the Front Office manager to his front desk staff could not have been more pleasant and more patient with us. Please don't let me forget the amazing bell crew always on hand to give a lift or offer some advice and recommendations about the area. Loved the restaurant staff as well, so helpful and friendly. Enjoyed the entertainment as well as my daughter and I getting matching tattoes poolside. So fun and so very pleasant. Like a breathe of fresh air. Thank you all for making our visit so very memorable and enjoyable. The family wants to make it a yearly trip to your location!! Thank you and keep up the amazing job. I don't want to leave the housekeeping staff out either. Our rooms were so very clean and so was the game room. Highly recommend this location for families and I am a hard sell....trust me! also, shopping center across the street and outlets next door...yippee!!!

Reviews.Title: “a fun family vacation”
Reviews.Author: momofjrr
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed here quite comfortably. The kitchen is spacious, the jacuzzi bathtub,a very nice touch. My kids had a blast in the pool. Delish burgers at the main pool. The minimart/restaurant was convenient. There is an outlet mall to walk to, very good discounts. Timeshare presentations are annoying but not overbearing. The resort is located very close to many of the theme parks. Housekeeping was very responsive to a toilet issue. Overall, a good time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Not to far from Disney”
Reviews.Author: CPECHO
Reviews.Content: Nice accomodations, stayed in studio. Location is next to Premium Outlet Mall resort has walkway to Mall.. Grocery store and strip mall across street. Gated sommunity. They really are pushy about you going to a timeshare presentation eventhough we are already owners. We had just gone to a presentation a month ago in Vegas and they were pesty about going to another one. We came for our vacation, not a presentation!! Parking at night is lousy. We stayed for 7 nights, most nights we did not get a parking space near our building. On some nights a HGCV shuttle van saw us and gave us a ride to our building from the parking space. Did not use pool, weather a little cool. Very large resort. This is 3rd time we've stayed here, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Hobbytraveler88
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Hilton Grand and we were overall very pleased. The room was nice and clean. We stayed in building #2 and it was well kept and quiet. Housekeeping came every day around 10am, and did an excellent job. We never had any trouble finding a parking space, and the parking lot attendant/security people are friendly and helpful. We also only had one person talk to us about attending a timeshare meeting, we politely declined and were not bothered again. The location is great, we went to Seaworld and it only took about five minutes to get there. There is a grocery store, Walgreens, and a Mcdonalds right across from the resort, and of course the outlet mall is right next door. There are many restaurants within a short distance. We definitely would stay here again if we come back down to Orlando, and will recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Major water break & no water for 6 hours!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jane D
Reviews.Content: For a new property I would expect top notch- on the second day they had a water pipe break in building 6- so no water until 6 pm that evening... when I called to ask why we had no water it was oh we had a pipe burst it should be back by 6 pm... no compensation or anything. So we went out without a shower after swimming to fill the rest of the day & get food since we couldn't really cook without water or washing hands. In such a new property this really makes you wonder about the construction quality!! (especially when they are trying to sell us a timeshare!!!) The one bedroom suite was very nice & clean and new. I did find one bug but wasn't able to identify what it was- small & fuzzy looking so definitely NOT a bed bug or anything like that. They wanted to sell us a time share but we were a strong NO & they also wasted a LOT more than 2 hours of our time & we couldn't really leave the presentation area (lot stronger pitch than I expected & makes you feel stupid for saying no). (think the price for your 2 weeks times 26 & the maintenance fee times 26... this makes it REALLY expensive real estate!!! Also had nothing to say about the water break except these things happen... UM excuse me- in a what 6 year old building??? Can you imaging what it will be like 6 years from now???) The staff didn't interact with us at all really, but that was fine with us. The only perk- the Prime outlet mall is just a 2 minutes walk away (don't forget to print your VIP book free coupon from the web before you go!!)

Reviews.Title: “This place has changed!”
Reviews.Author: savi2
Reviews.Content: I last stayed at this place early 2011 and I have been back this time for a week. I rated this place all excellent but not this time! I realised that upon being signed up for a timeshare orientation the room you got would be completely different from the actual one. My boyfriend is a HGVC owner but not at orlando so the sale representative was trying to sell the place here for him last year so we got a really nice new room last year. However since we refused to buy and this time we didn't sign up with the sale representative so the story has changed. The room was worse...old, smaller though we booked the same one bed room suite! The refrigerator's smaller too and cheap looking. The kitchen utensils were incomplete and old. The room wasn't cleaned nicely. Bed was rather hard. The staff was tough too. Upon requesting for a late checkout, they gave us just half an hour! Although we have traded our timeshare from other place to orlando, it didn't seem that they value us at all as one of the HGVC member. My impression from this place went all the way down despite the fact that it's situated in such a perfect location with a mall next by. I wouldn't return again. This is worser than other hilton once you haven't enrolled for an appointment with the sale representative! Parking's still a pain once you got in late. It's just the location that makes this place spectacular but the hygiene and quality of the place drag it down. I suspect that they have certain good new buildings and some lower quality ones depending on the luck!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay near mall”
Reviews.Author: girlstar28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights at the beginning of December. Early check in was smooth and room was ready. Room is clean and large (studio) but decor a little dated. Kitchen well equipped. Great that mall is just outside the gate. There aren't many restaurant options to walk to nearby other than the Outback. When member of our party arrived with rental car late, parking near our building was tough to find as spots filled up. Pool is very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Fabulous! And we are still here!”
Reviews.Author: Marie P
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about this property! This is our 6th day here and everything has been perfect. We are family of 5 adults staying in 7810-7811 two bedroom condo for the Disney marathon event. Our first five days were spent mostly at Disney all day and evening. When we would return at night, our rooms were always spotless. Love the screened in lanais and view of lake from our 8th floor. Management and staff are so accomdately and kind. Examples: we requested an extra non-stick fry pan as we are cooking all breakfasts. Within minutes it arrived.....still with the manufacturer tags on. Need more towels? Shampoo? Body wash? Dish towels? They are there within minutes and are staff is so sweet and courteous. Today we walked all around the property for exercise and every staff member we passed, whether it was a housekeeper and manager, addressed us with 'good afternoon, is there anything you need?" Today we have been at the larger pool and again, everything immaculate. I did a LOT of online research as well as asking friends where they would recommend for this trip. Googling "what is best rated properties in Disney Orland for hotels" is how I found this propertyand reading reviews here is how I decided to choose this. We were even considering renting a $7000 a week home because I am very particular about where I will stay and sleep. For the price we are paying and the amenities we are receiving, I doubt any other place could have made us happier! The Grand Floridian and Contemporary would have been our firt choices but the cost was ridiculous and still not as big as our accomodations. The ONLY advantage would have been being on the Disney property. We have not used the restaurant or pizza area. They have a few nice Weber Genesis grill areas for guests to use. The workout rooms do look small but c'mon, who you really want to work out after walking miles each day? Not us! Relaxing at this amazing pool I'm sitting at right now is my exercise of notice while the rest of the fam. Is in the excellent hot tub for the third time today! Disney is so close to here! We ate at Seasons 52 and Bahama Breeze for nicer dinners....both great! Every imaginable fast restaurant nearby. Seriously the only COMPLAINT we have is the coffee. There's a nice Cuisinart coffee maker in the full size kitchen but the coffee provided is awful! Tried it again for 3rd time....zero coffee flavor. Perhaps they could try different vendor! We are making Starbucks runs. As far as time share pitches: I received two calls 48 and 24 hours before arriving here. They wanted us to book a time to listen. I didn't. When we checked in I asked the receptionist if we were going to be asked this all week. She promptly put us on a NO CALL list. This is day 6 and we have not had a single call nor has anyone ever approached us! Amazing! Thanks Hilton and thank you Abed, the Resort Director!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Javier S
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 5 nights during our recent visit to Orlando. The one bedroom studio is nice, decent size and properly maintained. The location is close to all attractions and attached to Orlando Premium Outlets. The only issue we had is with the safe which got stuck and was promptly fixed. (This seems to occur quite often, management should think about replacing the narrow vertical safe by a standard box-size one). We were offered $130 discount on a 2-day Disney passes for attending a time share presentation. It was worth it, despite the pushing and outright rudeness of the sales guy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Pool Temp is Chilly”
Reviews.Author: Lee051
Reviews.Content: Excellent property, we liked the pool area but the water temp was very cold. That really is the only complaint I have for this hotel. They must've recieved complaints because our second day there it was warmer but no where near what we've experienced at the Omni a few days later. Our kids stayed in the water all day at the Omni but couldn't do that at this Hilton. This hotel has alot of activities, is clean, nice staff and low pressure sales. Pool bar is great and inexpensive. The one bedroom had all the amenities including washer dryer which we didn't use. Nicely located near many restaurants, shopping and Publix. We plan to buy a time share in the next year and will strongly consider the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelkook
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just about perfect for a family stay in Orlando. We had a one bedroom suite in building 5. Parking was always available close by, rooms were clean, comfortable and welcoming and the kitchen well-equipped. We would definitely return to stay again. Both housekeeping and security (for the safe) responded promptly and helpfully when we needed them. The location was great - near the grocery store as well as a two-minute walk to the outlet mall (our building was very close). The main pool was large and there were loads of lounge chairs even though the hotel was full. Overall - two thumbs up for this excellent family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: aasr81
Reviews.Content: We like so much this hotel, this time we had a 1 bedroom suite. The location is awesome,- publix right across the street-,rooms are spacious with laundry and full kitchen, and the grounds are nice. The service and the housekeeping aren't the best, but average.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, almost wonderful, but....”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of things to love about this resort. The staff is over the top helpful. The rooms are up to date, spacious, super clean and upscale. The wii fii is strong and the mattresses are comfy. The location is convenient to everything. The pool is super cool and little kids will love it. Even though the hotel was at capacity and it was a beautiful sunny day, there were plenty of lounge chairs both in the shade and the sun. There are fun activities for the younger ones and hanging around the resort is actually a great alternative to Disney. I truly hate to see my vacation end, because this has been a great place to stay. That being said, there are a few annoyances that would be so easy for management to fix. I feel petty for pointing them out, but in the hopes that management keeps up with their reviews here they are. First, the fitness centers (there are two) are astonishingly inadequate. For 400+ guestrooms, between the two fitness centers there are three treadmills and three ellipticals. I've had much better facilities in Hampton Inns. Secondly, the hotel boasts a "restaurant." The food is reasonably priced but not terribly good. Everything tastes very frozen and preprepared. It sort of feels like someone in the back is heating up the latest finds from Costco. It seems like with a little effort, this would be easy to fix. Find a few good recipes and learn how to make them. Parking is an additional nightmare. Having a resort without enough parking is crazy. The efforts to mitigate the parking situation with golf carts are admirable. However, constantly tipping the valets gets pricey quick and failing to tip feels wrong. It’s not the valet’s fault that parking is impossible. A “no tipping” policy should be enacted until a parking solution is determined and the valet’s pay should be adjusted accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but nothing fantastic”
Reviews.Author: travelfromMN
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in an apartment style place. We have 3 kids and used their 2 bedroom/2 bathroom place. Pros - Rooms are spacious and clean - The kitchen is well equipped - DVD players in room, and there's a blockbuster movie vending machine in grocery store across the street -Location. It is very close to all the attractions and restaurant options Cons -No room service, except pizza -No sound insulation. You can hear EVERYTHING happening next door -Dated, slightly tired rooms - Waited 20 minutes at concierge to buy Disney tickets to be told they didn't have any. -Unless you really plan on buying, don't sign up for time share presentation. About 3 hours of your life you will never get back!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ShaunzieClark
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at this hotel - it is wonderful and the staff is very friendly. The grounds are beautiful. The suite is the perfect size for us - we have two children, 5 years old and 2 years old. The location was excellent for the nearby outlet mall shopping (Black Friday sales). The only negative I have to contribute is that we booked Thanksgiving dinner at the hotel and while the facility was clean and the staff were wonderful, as usual, the dinner was sub-par. There were maybe five dishes to choose from (buffet-style) and it was very disappointing. I believe we paid over $50 for each adult and over $30 for my 5 year old (who ate two bread rolls, as she did not like the food selections). Other than that, I would have given this property five stars.

Reviews.Title: “GIFT for Attending Sales Pitch”
Reviews.Author: 2Poods
Reviews.Content: The main gift we received for attending the sales pitch was a certificate for $100 toward a stay at Hilton. We used it over Thanksgiving and just received a postcard stating that our request is invalid because we didn't stay at THE Hilton, we stayed at Homewood Suites. As for the resort in Orlando (the one on International Dr), it was nice, the room was ok (nothing real fancy, and we had noisy a/c fan) but worth the $50/night we paid. The service there was phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome”
Reviews.Author: ugafan33
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Orlando. The staff was awesome. A little slow to check in as it is mostly a vacation club so lots of sales talk to guests doing tours for free vacations. Other than that this place is awesome 2 outdoor pools one with a huge watefall and always lots of activities going on if you want to partake. Great bar by the pool. The food was good at the cafe. The location is across from a Publix , a McDonlads an Outback and the outlet shopping mall and on international drive. The property is beautiful with lakes and fountains. I wish we had stayed here the entire week vs just overnight. I will definitley choose this hotel the next itme I come to Orlando for Business or vacation

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and should get a Five Star Rating”
Reviews.Author: X11RAJ
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad that I can say about this hotel, the location is superb, the staff are super friendly (and everyone waves to you - I loved it). Super safe with security gates, the rooms are furnished to a very high standard, the food at the pool side and the deli was excellent. One down side I did ask if the main pool was heated and told that it was but it was a bit cold however the jacuzzis were boiling and made up for this. I would definitely return, this is such good value for money - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is amazing, rooms are amazing....BUT”
Reviews.Author: Loveagoodmeal
Reviews.Content: I have to say that when we walked in the door we most likely needed someone to shut our mouths as everywhere you looked it was breath takingly beautiful! The kids (teens and 10 yr old) were so excited and ran to the pool that is to die for. So, here comes the but....when checking in, they started the HEAVY sell to get you to view the property to purchase a time-share. This continued for two more phone calls or until we said STOP calling us. We are Gold Hilton owners already and were only trying to use the investment that we made a couple years ago. We do NOT want to get the hard sell every time we use our vacation club. Their sales pitch even continued at the pool where they ran this recording that sounded like you were calling to buy a timeshare with interruptions every 2 min. or so giving the hard sell again.Through the stereo system at the pool? Come on - all I wanted was to relax and feel the warm sun in peace. I don't appreciate that in the least bit!!! If the hard sell was lightened a little bit, this hotel would have been one of the nicest places we have stayed and we are big travelers. We had a two bedroom and we could not ask for anything in the rooms. Well, good pans would have been nice. They were spacious and beautiful! When we needed anything, they brought it right away. We had a late flight and requested a late check out (2PM) and they said yes with a $75.00 charge. That is not normal for a Hilton to charge gold members for a late checkout but what I was told is that this is not your average Hilton Vacation club. There is no owners club which is disapointing for us as owners. If you are using the room to eat with a family, wash clothes before returning home while running to the parks every day...it is a great place. There are events at the pool, play ground for kids and lots to do with the family. If I was with my husband looking for romance...this is not the place. **Please note that this hotel is NOT right around the corner from Disney. It is a drive on highways to get to the parks. It is not an easy trip and we got lost many times.**

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Orlando so far!”
Reviews.Author: orlando_fan_62
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Sheraton just around the corner but the reso has become increasing tired in the past few years and the villas very dated so we thought we would try the Hilton this time round and were very happy. The room was very clean and well equipped, the resort had catering (my wife said the burger from the clubhouse was the best she has ever eaten, this is holiday food not high cuisine people) and the staff were attentive and extremely helpful. As a location this is ideal, right In the middle of WDW and Universal for those visiting the parks and close the the I4 for travelling to Tampa or Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Visit 12 Times a Year!”
Reviews.Author: SmellyMarj
Reviews.Content: Yes, you could live here! We love the Orlando area and are only a few hours drive away. This location is IDEAL -- it's a true "resort" feeling which allows you to feel free from the hussle-bussle normally associated with the Disney area. However, you are next to the necessities like shopping, grocery, gas, drug store, nail salons, etc. There are also many activities going on if you so wish to participate - along with a wonderful pool/bar/restaurant area that is great for just "hangin' out". And if you have to get in the car - it's not far to Disney, Seaworld, Convention Center, Airport or Universal Studios. You will also find no finer staff than the entire lot at HGVC International Drive! Many of the staff have been there for there since it's opening in about 2004 or 5 -- and they now feel like family when we visit. HIGHLY recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Canary2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 13 nights and enjoyed every day here. The one bedroom apartment was fantastic comfortable bed and all the appliances you needed were available. Storage space was ample and living area was very comfortable. Staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and very knowledgeable about the resort and the services they offer. The 2 pools are great both very different one quieter than the other. Resort is right next to Orlando Premium Outlets a great shopping experience at a lower price than the malls. A great location to all the popular attractions would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Just came back!!!! Location is perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Ahh_C
Reviews.Content: Cons: No magnified mirror. No Q-tip. The walls were thin. We could hear next door neighbor cough. Pros: The location is very good, next to premium outlet and very close to Seaworld, Disney and other major attractions. The room is clean. My bf and I just came back. We stayed for 6 days from Nov 28 to Dec 3. We chose this hotel based on the good reviews. We arrived at the hotel around 11pm to check in. My bf was pissed that he was woken up by the time share people at 9:00 am the next morning. They called to see if we were interested and when my bf said no to them 4 times, they finally hung up. We stayed in the smaller suite because we did not plan to cook. The room was spacious for the 2 of us. Our room located right at the elevator. We could hear people walking by, talking while getting out of the elevator. The staffs are friendly. Every time we drove by the main gate, they would come out and greet us. We will go try a different hotel if we go back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Next door to outlets!”
Reviews.Author: FLcmm
Reviews.Content: We stay here often several times a year. We love the location which is right next to the outlets, there is a private gate access that leads you to it. We usually stay in the "king whirlpool suite with screened balcony." It has a living room with a sofa that folds out and the bedroom is seperate with the jacuzzi. The kitchen has everything you need to cook and dine in the room. The room also has a washer/dryer and dining room table. When they are booked the parking is hard to come by especially at night. There is more parking by the lobby building and they have a shuttle that can drive you to your building. Ask for a lakeview... it makes sitting on the balcony more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location near a mall, shops and convenient forDisney.”
Reviews.Author: Grace2009Galway
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our family stay in this hotel. We were able to use the I trolley for transport all along International Drive. The suite we stayed in was excellent and we had breakfast on the balcony each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Deal, Large Suite, Well Appointed”
Reviews.Author: PanzerEpsilon
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel as a home base for visiting Disney World theme parks. It is approximately 15-20 minute drive to all of the theme parks. For under $200 per night, I got a one bedroom suite that was like moving into a fully furnished apartment with kitchen supplies (dishes, glasses, utensils, etc.). If you have a child with you, this is very helpful. We were also able to enjoy a pizza from their late-night pizza parlor. The room was clean and modern. I enjoyed the bedside iPhone charging station. The only negative was that the parking spots filled up quickly and sometimes I had to park the car far away from the room. The bed was also a little bit firmer than I am used to; however, I never quite find a hotel mattress as comfortable as the one I enjoy at home. Upon a return trip to Orlando, I would gladly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay and wonderful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Cloggy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October for 12 nights in a 1 bed suite and enjoyed every minute. The location is excellent at the south end of International Drive bit no more than 30 minutes from anywhere including Orlando International Airport. I agree with all the previous comments and would add that everything is spotlessly clean and well organised. The small pool is quiet and easy for access. My only warnings would be the price of a glass of wine in a plastic cup at $9 without tax and tip! Also the big pool can be very noisy in the evening but becomes silent at about 10pm. Outback Steakhouse in a 10 minute walk and Publix is very convenient at 5 minutes. I had no problem with wireless and the Outlet Mall next door always has fast food available. We stayed in Building 6 which is need the bridge and the secure gate to the Mall. We would stay here again without any worries.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: edu_cavalcanti
Reviews.Content: This is the place so stay, specially if you travel with your kids, family or friends. Rooms are huge with full kitchen appliances. Bathrooms are great and have a jaccuzzi. The only downside is that there is no Breakfast Buffet, only some sort of deli where you can purchase your breakfast. Had a problem with the Wifi Internet in my room and no one could solve it, despite my several complaints (had to go everyday to the lobby in order to access my emails). Location is also convenient, right next to the Premium Outlets (you can walk right into it) and close to Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Siniard
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights here and this was by far the best place ever for the price we paid. The room was excellent. Pools were great. Grounds were beautiful. Very clean. The mall right next door? What more could you ask for. Grocery store and restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “So Nice Some People Even Live Here”
Reviews.Author: Sortova
Reviews.Content: I have some friends who got tired of the northern US winters and decided to spend a tremendous amount of time in Florida. They literally live at this resort several months out of the year. This review is based on my own experience visiting them. They rent a one bedroom suite. The layout of the hotel has these suites next to one bedroom studios, so when I visited they simple reserved the studio next to their room and an adjoining door turned it into basically a two bedroom apartment. This is pretty much what you could expect from a Hilton resort. The rooms are spacious and clean, the kitchen looks new and my room had a screened-in porch that overlooked a pond. There are several pools and activities, and during my short stay we visited various areas of Disney and it never seemed to be a long ride. There are also a number of cars standing by ready to drive you should you decide to leave your car behind, and the property is next to an outlet mall, a supermarket and a drugstore, so you really don't have to leave if you don't feel the need. While I am partial to Marriott properties, I enjoyed my stay. The staff was very friendly, and while I was here at the end of a business trip, this would probably be a good place for families. I look forward to some day coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton that I ever spent some days - not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo P
Reviews.Content: This Hilton has the most worst rooms that I ever staied, the air conditioned engine seems to be just beside my bed and couldn't sleep good any of days. They moved my rooms twice and the wireless didn't work in many areas of the hotel. The breakfast is very simple and expensive. There were many items broken in the room including the cabinet. Frontdesk people is nice, but very disorganized with the rooms arragements. There is no enough parking slots for the rooms and sometimes you need to park 5 minutes walking to reach your room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent get away resort.”
Reviews.Author: tyldes145
Reviews.Content: The whole resort is ideal for couples or families. The location is fantastic whether you are looking to shop or visit the parks. This central location means your not spend precious time travelling to and from the parks no matter what the time of day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Early riser”
Reviews.Author: 76Chrisw
Reviews.Content: On entering our room 5614 we were impressed with the lay out & equipement provided in the kitchen. Our room was extremely comfortable so long as you do not value a good nights sleep! The washing machine room next door was frequently used around 3am causing us to be wide awake through every spin cycle. When we eventually managed to get to sleep again we were rudely awakened at 7am by grass cutters & lorries arriving at the shopping outlet next door. The moral of this review is to make sure you have a pool/lake side room & definately not a room at the back looking out over the carpark/shopping outlet. We would also strongly recommend you use the room safe provided as our friends in the adjoining room had some monies go missing from their suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “security”
Reviews.Author: dave h
Reviews.Content: though the rooms are very nice and well equiped some how someone was able to enter our room the first full day we were there and steal €375 &£200 cash out of a locked suite case that was still locked on our return no other items went i.e laptop, mobile ,passports . security came we explained what had happened took a statement asked if we wanted to report to the police we said yes nothing happened so went to reception management new nothing of the theft secutity came and said it was down to us to phone police after us getting a bit upset they phoned , sherrif turned up first words to security ,this will be a lot of work . hotel insurance emailed to arrange to phone us, still waiting ,4 days after incident . but the evening it happened phone call for time share . the rooms have safes which in hind sight we should have used. if i was reading this i would think insurance scam but it what happened NOTE when we arrived and unpacked in the locked case was note from charlotte airport security that they had entered the case but we would not have known without them telling us . the cash was not in the case at that time

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: kirstenmc
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. This is our second stay here and if I could live here I would. The grounds are stunning, the hotel complex is beautiful. When we checked in we were asked what the nature of our visit was. When we mentioned it was part of our honeymoon the two girls on reception got very excited. The changed our room allocation to building 3 top floor which overlooked the stunning lake. The room was huge with a very comfy king size bed. The room had a dining table area and tv and dvd player. It also had a kitchenette with coffee maker, microwave and large fridge. The screened balcony was lovely we were able to sit out and enjoy a glass of wine without the bugs annoying us. All the staff were lovely. Lots of staff riding around on segways and golf buggys, I felt so safe. The shopping complex is right next to the hotek complex you access it through a locked gate which you open using your room key. Shortly after we arrived in our room the reception girls sent up a bottle of champagne. It was heaven

Reviews.Title: “Best family hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: twinketoes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just like the photo's on this site. We had a spaceous suite on the 4th floor of Block 4. The kitchen and lounge has a luxury sofa bed, TV, DVD player, free WI-FI, Iron, Ironning board, huge fridge/freezer, coffee machine, small kettle,dishwasher and powder, washing machine and powder, dryer, full cutlery/utensils including scissors, crockery, washing up liquid, scourer, dishcloth & teatowel. In the bathroom, you are provided with toilet rolls, plush towels, soap, body wash, shampoo, conditioner, hairdryer and tissues. The bedroom has a center fan, TV, IPod Alarm clock. The duvet and pillows are filled with feathers. They promptly changed these when I told them about my allergy! I also requested 20 more coat hangers, which they sent up to the room immediately with a follow up call. The hot tub is next to the bedroom. The Housekeepers were friendly and came everyday. The premises are beautiful, there are lots of fish and turtles in the lake, beautiful fountains everywhere and beautifully detailed buildings, in a word, beautiful. Both of the pools have bars, towels and plenty of sunbeds. All the staff are friendly. There is a full activity programme for adults and children, most activities take place by the main pool but they are not intrusive to the rest of the residents. We found the bar food to be tasty and reasonably priced, although limited choice. You can buy a soft drink for $3 and get free refills. There are hot tubs by the pools, we were served Iced grapes whilst in the hot tub, touches like that really make this place special. There are two gyms with cardio machines, weights and toning equipment. Towels, headphones and water are provided. You can also control the A/C. There are plenty of BBQ's around the complex. We had 2 lovely BBQ's. The BBQ's are gas and look like they have never been used! However, they are checked and cleaned everyday. You can easily walk to the Outlet mall, we used the food hall there a couple of times. Publix is across the road, along with MacDonalds and the Outback Steakhouse restaurant. I can highly recommend the latter. We also travelled by I-trolley to other shops, restaurants and attractions. We used taxi's to travel to Disney on a couple of occasions, the charges ranged from $32 - $45. The rest of the time, we took the hotels shuttle services. The shuttles are $9 per person return journey. As a rule, we try not to stay in the same place twice as we like to have different experiences for our holidays, however this hotel will be the exception to the rule! I hope that this comprehensive review will be useful to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: RajBansal
Reviews.Content: Found a good deal for the hotel on booking.com Great place, huge rooms and a big area to explore. Large swimming pool area and sunbathing locations. Located next to the outlet malls too which was handy. Stayed here for a few days to get away from the busy hustle and bustle of the Universal end, is good for a few days to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling like VIP even in the rain”
Reviews.Author: paintcab
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights with our main focus being trips to Universal. The rooms on this property are quite lovely and clean. We stayed in building 5 on the 6th floor. I had asked for a quiet room and I certainly got one. We had no noise issues, but of course we were there at an off time. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large and even tho we didn't get to use it the jacuzzi tub looked very nice. The screened in porch was nice. Our building was one of the closest to the Outlet Mall. It was a very easy walk. We had a lot of rain and cooler temperatures while we were there so we only got in the pool once. It was not as warm as I thought it would be. We didn't use the pool by the clubhouse. We did use the game room to play billiards one very rainy morning and that was great fun. They had 2 tables and they were well cared for. The little food we bought on site was fine, but I don't really feel like we ate enough to comment on the restaurants. Coffee was provided in the room and there is a Publix grocery store on the other side of the resort. Everyone who worked on the property was super nice and approachable. We had a couple of minor problems in the room and the front desk always called later to check if everything got fixed. One item, the shower handle, did not get fixed, but I believe they tried. I would have called again if we were staying longer. It was a minor problem. If I had the opportunity, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay spoilt by a friendly cockroach and a non working toilet”
Reviews.Author: Muzi B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The hotel was lovely, situated in a good location near the theme parks and shopping malls. However I didn't feel uncomfortable when I spotted a cockroach in my room, coming out of the air con vent. I also had a non working toiliet which did not flush properly. I reported the issues to the reception staff at the Hilton, which resulted in a plumber unblocking the loo and the room sprayed with bug repellent. With this hotel being Hilton, I expected their standards to be much higher than this and was disappointed that I was not given another room. I would of give my stay a 5 star ratings if it wasn't for the problems I encountered during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: NANA007UNDRCVR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days prior to family coming down for a Disney vacation. It was a very nice property for a woman alone to stay, very safe with an outlet mall on the back side of it with exclusive access with your room key card. The staff was very helpful in everyway. I had a disability scooter delivered to the hotel and they were gracious in helping me get it to the room and getting it back for pick up. The cleaniness factor was right on. Very very clean. The one bedroom with full kitchen, washer/dryer is worth the extra money. Furnishings in unit were of very high quality and not worn out. Nice large jetted tub with glass shower in bathroom. The screened in porch with table & chairs is nice and with a lovely view. The buildings surround a lake with fountains and there is a waking path all the way around it. The pizza restaurant that is on property is very good, with free delivery to your room and with reasonable price. Would definately return to this property for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful affordable setting near the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: dcwoodley
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property near the theme parks. Very accessible to freeway but not on the freeway like many hotels. Very close to the theme parks but very good value (in other words, beautiful hotel that's affordable and you won't be paying the high end prices of the theme park hotels). It is set up with many different buildings (villas) surrounding water with fountains (lit up at night). There is a walkway across the water to the main facilities. There are 2 pools - both looked very nice. We did not use them due to being at the theme parks and some bad weather so cannot comment on the service around the pools. Everyone we met in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. No resort charges and parking is also free. They have daily activities (crafts for the kids, etc.) - some are free, others have a charge. The rooms have nice furnishings. The only downside of our entire stay was the food at their "pizzaria". It was awful - not even edible in my opinion. Pizza dough is not made on-site and tasted like cardboard. The toppings were cooked in a way where half was overdone in terms of cheese too gooey and other toppings were completely undercooked. I can only guess that it's not put in a pizza oven but more like a microwave or an uneven heated oven.

Reviews.Title: “jut as good the second time around”
Reviews.Author: PatrickP
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at Hilton's Grand Vacation suites on idrive back in 2006 I was keen to get back to enjoy a break from New Zealands gloomy winter climes. On most fronts, The Grand Vacations didnt dissapoint. Our suite was roomy, comfy and incredibly well equipped - from the fully kitted out kitchen through to the whirlpool bath and free wifi/cable TV it was a standout destination. There are two pools - one thats popular with the kids and the other thats slightly more quieter that we spend much of our time relaxing at. There is an outlet mall directly behind the hotel, and across the road there is also a publix supermarket. Publix as it turns out is still a real godsend as the only real failure of the HGVS is the near complete lack of decent room service food options. Orlando has a lot of eating out but sadly they're mostly big chain restaurants whose primary cuisine skills consist of stodge, fat, salt and/or sugar. Thankfully we were able to buy and cook a lot of our food, but this something that HGVS coudl easily remedy by hiring some decent catering staff in order to realise a lost revenue opportunity. Grizzles about the lack of good food options aside, there is a hell of a lot to like about HGVS. Compared to a lot of other similarly priced options it is a definite step up and is an incredibly easy/comfortable place to stay. We will be back but I really hope the management team read this and get their catering act together...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful landscape and very spacious room”
Reviews.Author: EyeDocBrazil
Reviews.Content: This property has a very beautiful setting with a lake and waterfountains in the middle of it. I have chosen this one among other hundreds of hotels because it is located contiguous to Premium Outlet, with a small walking bridge connecting them. I would say that shopping at this "outlet" could be not an great reason for choosing this hotel as the prices are the same you"ll find elsewhere in Orlando, like in Florida Mall, where you can eat at decent restaurants in a all conditioned place. I stayed in their smallest room, but there was plenty of space with a big tub, and separate living room. The kitchenette is nicely equiped with plates and etecetera, so you can easily make your morning end night meals. Just take your car, cross the road in front the hotel and you are at Publix where you can buy absolutely any kind of food to stock your fridge. Overall it is a very nice and daily cleaned room and hotel. One little point is that they "invite" you to participate in some paid activities at the hotel, and this is made by a recorded message at the phone and the message is looooong and if you hang up the message light will keep blinking all the night , so you have to har all the mess or diconect the energy cable of phone to stop the burdening.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with lots of activities”
Reviews.Author: bostonzu
Reviews.Content: If your going to Orlando with a family, you know things can get pricey real quick. This resort is a part of the Hilton timeshare properties if you're looking for something like that. There are daily activities planned that are geared towards families and children, which is great if you need a break from park hopping. The property is gated and safe. The staff is friendly and they can assist you with planning activities on or off site. Universal Resort is a short drive away (10-15 minutes, depending on traffic). There is also a massive shopping outlet next door as well as other businesses like a Public supermarket so you can make some of your own meals and save on eating out (our room had a full kitchen). They also had several restaurants/cafes onsite if you don't have time to run out or make your own meal. Rooms are very clean and the beds are comfortable. Pillows are little flat, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Holiday Location”
Reviews.Author: DCRLB
Reviews.Content: Our family of six checked into a 2 bedroom apartment in the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on International Drive (the quiet end) on the 1st of September 2011. The whole complex was set around a large lake with a swimming pool located at either end. Check in was a quick process and after a long flight this was exactly what we needed, the staff were very helpful and welcoming and they explained the layout of the facility in detail. We spent 2 weeks with the Hilton and throughout this time all aspects of the Grand Vacations Club were great. The cleanliness was first class, the recreation centre was organised with variety of activities and the staff were helpful from start to finish. The apartment was very spacious. The kitchen was well equipped with a large fridge freezer, dish washer and full size oven. Both bedrooms were ensuite with a comfortable pull out in the living area. Within close proximity of the hotel was a premium outlet mall, publix supermarket, Outback Steakhouse and a variety of day to day amenities all of which are approximately 5 minutes walk from the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a quiet and relaxing holiday or you are looking for a good location to the parks with first class service.

Reviews.Title: “We never wanted to leave.”
Reviews.Author: Kenn47
Reviews.Content: We came to HGV for mixed business and pleasure. We'll go back soon. Our suite was gorgeous, comfortable and felt like home. It was spotlessly clean, including a decent kitchen, dining area, living room and screened lanai. The bedroom was, comfy, inviting and spacious. The bed, typical of Hiltons, was comfortable. The bath included a separate whirlpool in addition to the shower. HGV is a vacation club with appropriate amenities, including tennis and basketball courts, two pools, an indoor playroom, fitness center and an internet/office center. The staff was wickedly gracious and helpful. It helped that we landed a great rate as well. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, large and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: heels94GreensboroNC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend and were very pleased with the accommodations. The suite was spacious and clean and the full kitchen was nice to have and I'm sure would have come in handy had we been staying for a longer period of time. It is located right beside one of the outlet malls in Orlando but to be honest, there are better outlet malls in other areas of Orlando. Also, the restaurants, bars and shopping are not close and are a healthy cab ride or drive down the road. If you have kids, this resort is great because there are at least two large pools with restaurants, etc. on site. We did go to Epcot and the shuttle from this resort was very convenient and a good value (I think $9 pp?).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Relaxing Week”
Reviews.Author: cubalibray
Reviews.Content: The staff was as friendly as I have ever experienced. The rooms were imaculate and the grounds were as well kept as anything I have seen. The location was perfect as you were close to everything from Entertainment to food sources, The pool area was very nice and the entertainment was great. We had the best time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: SorinMihaescu
Reviews.Content: This is really a home away from home. It is a huge space, with all you need traveling with family (kitchen, bathroom). Also location especially if you want some shopping it is perfect, it is almost linked with the Outlet Mall. It has a Jacuzzi style bathtub, unfortunately did not got to use it. Few parking issues in front of the villa returning in the evening, but not major ones. View from our room in Vila 3 was great, overlooking the inner lake. Will highly recommend it if you are traveling with family and need to wash some clothes or prepare some food for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: SumBeach_1
Reviews.Content: Not sure what more you could expect here. Location was very good and the rooms were excellent. Got placed here on business when my usual Hotel was booked. May not go back. Room was very nice and clean. The pool bar was great and the carryout was very convenient. Only negative at all was my room had a view of the parking garage rather than a pool or lake. Still, very nice resort with zero complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mightymouse076
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this Hilton Resort and we were not dissappointed. We exchanged our local timeshare points to obtain a full week here, and the accommodation is far superior to anything we could have obtained in South Africa. The location is great, as it is located adjacent to Premium Outlets at the end of International Drive. One can simply exit at the back gate to go to the shops. We stayed for a full week in a 2 room condo with all amenities, and a view of the lake - the block had recently been refurbished, and was in tip-top shape. Staff were friendly etc. Also to note is that there is a large Publix supermarket across the road, which is useful for self-catering, if required. It helps to have a car, but one can also use the i-Ride which stops right outside Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ProudGrandparents043
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located so much so that theme parks, shopping and restaurants are just a stone's throw away! Every member of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the grounds were lovely. Upon arrival there was a man making balloons for the children and I don't think I have ever seen my 5-yr-old grandson be more entertained! Pool was well-maintained as was everything at this hotel. I believe the only thing that could be added to this resort would be a "lazy river" for the adults! Overall...fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: frankierett
Reviews.Content: I could not wait to get back to write a great review on the Hilton Grand on Arrezzo Way. We had the best time there. And it is the most beautiful hotel! We are a family of 5, and because of one child with a disability, needed a full kitchen to store medicines, food, etc. in safely. We wanted to also have the option to cook in our room a couple of nights. We had a 2-bedroom suite with full kitchen and washer/dryer. We used it all! The beds were comfy, the balconies were awesome, and every single person who worked at that hotel (who we came into contact with) was pleasant and helpful. The pools were amazing. They had movies playing there for the kids two nights while we were there. The location was incredible if your trip is mostly going to be at Disney. We were 5 minutes from the entrance. I would rate this hotel A+++ and we are definitely staying there again when we go back in 2-3 years. I can't wait to stay here again! Thank you Hilton Grand!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Walshy03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before transferring to the Marriott grand vista resort for a week and this resort beat the Marriott hands down. The staff were excellent - very polite and attentive. The room was lovely - very modern and had everything you needed. The pool area is great and there are excellent food and drink facilities on site. I think the best thing was how close this resort was to premium outlets - you literally walk out of one of the side gates and you are in the outlet car park. I would definitely stay here again as I cannot fault the resort at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: VickieWexford
Reviews.Content: We went there as a honeymoon couple, it was very relaxing and enjoyable. The room we were allocated was a lovely size, only thing missing was the kettle. The pool area was very spacious and well kept. I have 12 twins and would consider bringing them the next time. It's very well located, approx 20-30 mins from Orlando International Airport, 5 mins from Orlando and very close to all the theme parks. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality. Convenience. Comfort. Relaxation.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferMK
Reviews.Content: There are more glossy, ultra luxurious and expensive places in Orlando, but the HGVC on International Drive aka Tuscany is my new favorite accommodation here in tourist-ville. My partner and I are in our first week of a two week stay, our first visit to this Hilton property. I am so pleased with the experience so far that I decided to write a review. Firstly, a compliment to the staff, who went out of their way to accommodate every request regarding our room preferences. We got exactly what we asked for - a gorgeous 2 bedroom suite overlooking the lake, without the afternoon sun, in Building 7, which is very quiet and the newest of the buildings. We have two balconies, a huge jacuzzi tub, second bathroom, spacious living area and large kitchen between the bedrooms. Everything was immaculately clean and we have had instant attention from housekeeping and maintenance over anything we have requested - more hangers, extra towels and shower gel...no problem. There is free wi-fi, just as important as electricity or air-con these days, yet far too often charged for - thankfully the HGVC in Orlando decided not to peeve their guests by stiffing us for this basic service. Everywhere we walk, on this large property, we are greeted cheerfully by staff who are happy to help with advice and information. There is no stiff formality, but a warm and friendly professionalism that makes one feel at home immediately. The property is very close to Disney World and Sea World, and shuttle transport is available. Some low cost attraction tickets are offered by Hilton for folks willing to attend a timeshare marketing presentation. Another plus is the Publix grocery store over the road, making it easy to set up a home away from home. It's great not having to eat out all the time. We even pack lunches to take to the theme parks so that we can avoid the endless junk food binge. There is a big outlet mall very close by, also - you can walk there within minutes, by crossing the hotel parking area around building 5 and 6. HGVC caters to families, yet it's also a nice place for mature guests, offering various daily activities like yoga, movies, kids activities & child care. Some are free, others are charged at a modest fee. If you want to feel close to the "action" you might like buildings 1, 2 and 3 most. If, like us, you are seeing space and time out in the quieter part of the property, buildings 6 and 7 are probably the best choice. Ask for an upper level room with a view of the lake. Sometimes the ideal vacation is one where there is plenty of fun to be had nearby, a lighthearted atmosphere, good dining and amenities within minutes, quick and easy access to attractions, and a spacious comfortable suite. This kind of time-out is why we chose Orlando; the HGVC is a perfect fit for this visitor-focused locale. No resort facility can possibly please every kind of vacationer, but both my partner and I have traveled extensively all over the world and stayed in all kinds of hotels, from B&B to 5 star international. I can honestly say that HGVC pleasantly surprised us and exceeded our expectations. We are already talking about coming here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and awesome front line staff.”
Reviews.Author: kitkat62
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff at Hilton Grand Vacations. The on-site Expedia concierges Vincent and Javian were very helpful in booking shuttles and tours. We did not have a rental car and getting around on the shuttles and i-trolley were very easy. Rooms were clean and the pillow top mattress was the best and much appreciated after a long day at the parks. This resort had excellent access to groceries across the street as well as the i-trolley to I-drive and the Premium Outlets (if time permits you must check out both outlets, south and north). We would not hesitate to re-book at this Hilton resort for our next Orlando trip.

Reviews.Title: “For extended stays, Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Manzel
Reviews.Content: This resort was a top of the line place to be for the time that my wife and I stayed. It is, as I stated, a resort, and a Hilton Honors membership is a huge plus. Like most resorts, you will be asked to participate in a presentation for the time share opportunity. However it is still a highly entertaining and all encompassing resort. The time share opportunity is one to consider, as it is with Hilton Resorts. There isn't anywhere in the world that you can't find one.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, beautiful suites”
Reviews.Author: bensagle
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, beautiful large suites, lush landscaped grounds with two large swimming pools. Right off the I-4 and close to Walt Disney World and shopping, yet all of this is well disguised. Wi-fi is a bit weak.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Geokev
Reviews.Content: This is like staying in mini condos. Sundecks overlooking the pools, little kitchens complete with fridge, microwave and dishes. Two beautiful pools, friendly staff and across the street from one of the two premium outlet malls. With a rental car, eady access to all the theme parks Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We're still here and will be sad to leave”
Reviews.Author: SchubertFamily
Reviews.Content: We still have a couple days here and we have really enjoyed ourselves. I am here with our daughter,her father and grandmother. I just want to say, everyone is extremly friendly. Everywhere we go at the hotel there is always an employee waving or saying "hello" , asking us how we are, or asking us if we need anything. When we checked in...my 2 year old daughter was greeted with a balloon and stickers...She was excited. We're on the 8th floor in Tuscany building 7 " I recommend it" It faces the water fountain.The rooms are clean and I love the balconies. I have a 2 year old and because the balconies are screened in...I do not have to worry. They are also very private. We have 2 kings size beds are they are really really cozy & comfortable. I sleep like a rock. We all do. The ponds are filled will fish and turtles and you can walk the bridge and see them. ..we do this on the way to the pool which we enjoy daily. I never write a review...never ever. But I am really happy here. It's just really nice place to stay. This was a great choice and yes we will be back... no question!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Drive”
Reviews.Author: happytotravel127
Reviews.Content: We have not been back in Orlando in over 30 years and we loved it. The Hilton Grand is a wonderful place to stay. When we pulled up after our long drive it was like a breath of fresh air. The staff was very helpful and friendly except the concierge. They did not set us up well for a show and we were late and missed the best part; seeing the horses and finding our seats without flash lights. We couldn't read the menu because it was so dark because the show started when we were taken to our seats. Use the concierge with caution. There were so many buildings and that was hard to get adjusted to but we figured it out after the first day. I could see why some people would not like how large the property is but we liked it. We walked around the pond and sat on the benches to watch the fish and turtles. Our room was a suite with an adjoining bedroom/bath/refrigerator/microwave/sink area. We had the adjoining area and the other couple had a large bedroom with a large bathroom. Between the bedrooms is the living/dining/kitchen area and it was spacious. The kitchen was well equipped and modern. The washer/dryer is just off the kitchen and helped us not over pack since we could do wash while the men napped. Each balcony is private and our view was of the pond and fountain. We did not notice too much noise at night. The two pools were great. One had the bar/grill area which at night became a outside movie theater and party area. The area also had DJ's during the day and other entertainment during the day. The other pool area was quiet and smaller. It even had a walk in area for people who could not use the steps and for little ones who could not go in the deep water. The location of the hotel was great except that it was in the middle of all of the traffic. International Drive is a very busy road. It took us two days to figure out the back way to the hotel to avoid the traffic. I would stay in this hotel again. I am not sure the price due the fact that the other couple winning this from their vacation in another on of their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, but a bit dim!”
Reviews.Author: trvlrfromMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club for a single night in September. I had a single room which is much nicer than a standard hotel room - comfortable queen size bed, mini-fridge (very nice!), sink, microwave, etc. All things you would like to have to make snacks and even cook up a small meal. The grounds were lovely (but they were resurfacing the parking lot while I was there - which was a minor inconvenience but a temporary one). I visited the quieter pool at the very back of the resort - small but nice and not crowded but it was very off-season and mid-week. Right nearby the pool was a cute little BBQ area with grill - which would be nice if you were there for a week and wanted to grill instead of eating out. The resort is very convenient to everything - there is a supermarket right across the street (so if you were staying longer you could stock up the mini-fridge), fast food joints right there and an Outback Steakhouse all within walking distance. There is also a great outdoor outlet mall adjacent to the resort - great shopping and a full food court. It is also convenient to the parks - it was about a 10-15 minute drive to Disney area. My only negative is that the room's lighting is very dim. There is too much use of low wattage energy saving bulbs - especially in the bathroom. I struggled to read and to use my laptop comfortably in the main room and hated the dimness in the bathroom. In my room the tub also did not drain which was not pleasant but I am sure it is something that maintenance could have fixed - but I was only there for the one night.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again, just for the pool”
Reviews.Author: ExecAALB
Reviews.Content: Our room had a less than desirable view of basketball court and was a little outdated, but had a nice kitchenette and nice screened porch, we were hardly in the room anyway so had little impact on my opinion. I gave only "Very Good" because of concierge desk - the employee said she couldn't help me with my request that another employee would be rigth back to help me, as she stayed on the phone with her child for 5 minutes while I waited. So... this still didn't ruin my opinion of the hotel, why, because the rest of the staff were brilliant and the pool area was amazing - all but one day was spent laying at the pool and eating at the poolside bar and deli, not too mention the outlet mall and grocery store within walking distance. would definately stay here again and recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel , location, service”
Reviews.Author: Singingsal17
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 6 day trip to tje Orlando and stayed at the Hilton Tuscany propery on International drive. I upgraded to the 1 bedroom from studio and the room was clean, modern, large and had a nice jacuzzi righ between the bedroom and bath. Had all the coveniences of home and next to Publix and Orlando Premum outlets and restaurants. Plenty of parking and the main pool area was very nice with a good restaurant and bar area and activities all day if you choose not to go to the theme parks. There are 2 pools and very close to Sea World and Disney and a 15 minute car ride to Universal. All in all very satisfied and would recommend for families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this show very much.”
Reviews.Author: phamptn
Reviews.Content: This was very exciting, all of the different marine animals and the shows that they put on were pretty awesome.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for families, weak for business”
Reviews.Author: Hamitup
Reviews.Content: A beautiful gated hotel (many buildings) and 34 acres of grounds. Very well kept up. A nice Italian Tuscany theme. The staff are super A+ and will service you to death. Wonderful pool. Definitely up to Hilton chain standards (I use them all over the world). I took a King studio suite, since I was going to be there for a week. I prefer suites so that I can bring in a few groceries and make some of my own meals. I guess I should have paid more attention to the pictures, etc. I thought all suites were suites, and some with a decent kitchen. That has been my experience so far. However this one is really just a small wall of microwave, university size fridge, coffee maker and toaster. No stove, no dishwasher. Comes "fully equipped" which is a joke. Hardly anything in the cupboards. Two plates, two cups, two forks, two, two, two, etc. You get the idea. I asked for an ice tray since I had a small freezer compartment, and wanted to make my own ice. They said "no" since it was only a "studio" suite. The wireless Internet was marginal, but worked. Not great for business. The price was very good and I got good value, so I am not upset overall. I might come back sometime with the family.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the most beautiful places that I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: phamptn
Reviews.Content: Talk about a wonderful vacation to Orlando, after the horrible flight and falling down the escalator at the Orlando airport and having to be taken to the hospital because my feet and legs were pretty mangled. I had broken one foot, the other foot had stitches all across the bottom of my feet and toes. My legs were bruised and skin torn from the knees down. I called the hotel when they discharged me and let them know what had happened. This place (Hilton Grand Vacation Club), not only got our room ready early, they went ahead and checked us in over the phone, so all my husband had to do is show Id and sign the paper.
