They met us outside of our villa with a wheelchair to get me to my room. They sent up a gift basket, with a get well soon card signed by everyone and have called to check on me each day. They have gone out of their way to accomadate us. What a wonderful, beautiful place and the greatest staff possible. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly gorgeous, amazing staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Pyxxydust
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel would be pretty, but I had NO idea how incredibly beautiful it would be! It's a Tuscany theme and they did it so well. Every detail is absolutely perfect. The staff was so nice, from the check in, to the maintenance, the people in the little store, absolutely everyone. My kids are 6 and 9 and already asking when we can go back! When we drove in, it was so beautiful, that I was afraid they were going to kick me out for not being rich enough, as silly as that sounds, because it was so amazing and we got an amazing rate for the night. The pool is sooooo cool and the kids loved the oversize chess board. There's also a great covered playground for kids. The rooms are probably the nicest I ever stayed in. And it's right next to the Orlando Premium Outlets which is great. In fact, the location is perfect in every way. There's a huge lake in the middle of the property and a walkway connecting them, with turtles and fish swimming around, and fountains. I just can't say enough about this place! It's very peaceful and quiet. I would reccommend to absolutely everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not for business!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, if you are a family on vacation, its a beautiful hotel. Parking is a nightmare, and I had to park 5 buildings away from my room. There is no room service, except for a pizza place. The room walls are paper thin. When the tourists in the room next door woke at 6am, it was not quiet until they left. The internet service is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: kathy29917
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, lots going on at pool. Staff was really friendly. Hope to go back someday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun in Sunny Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Chad S
Reviews.Content: Room Type – 1 bedroom condo Room Quality – High – No expense was spared, the only issue was some of the furniture was starting to show its ware Grounds – nicely manicured Kid friendly – Pool side activities daily for kids / parents, splash pad for small children and 2 large pools to choose from Food – Pool side bar / grille - food was good but overpriced, Starbucks located onsite Staff – very friendly, but it was difficult at times to communicate with the housekeeping staff as English was not their native language.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property - Everything HGVC brand offers!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler011
Reviews.Content: Everything that you would expect from the HGVC brand! Spacious rooms, full kitchens, comfortable furniture, professional staff, wonderful amenities. The main pool area was recently renovated. Nice boardwalk around the lake area -- flat and good for walking or running. The completely screened balconies are perfect when the temparture is moderate. The parking spaces on the side of the property that is adjascent to the outlet mall fill up very quickly in the early evening and are almost always filled if returning from a late night at the theme parks. A secured doorway is available to go from HGVC International Drive to the outlet mall. Very convenient - and eliminates the need to drive to the mall. If you are NOT interested in the outlet mall or if you DO desire to be close to the recreation center, main pool area, and children's covered playground, then request a building on the opposite side for more parking convenience.

Reviews.Title: “About as good as it gets with timeshare properties!”
Reviews.Author: mat'sgirl
Reviews.Content: Not many photos to add to the numerous photos already posted...but all-in-all, our recent stay at the Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on International Drive in Orlando Florida was simply great. My husband and I just returned from a 7-day stay at this property. It was a time-share swap and one of several trips I've made to Florida within the past few years. In general, my husband and I really enjoyed our stay at this property. The people are nice, the location is great, the units are clean and well-appointed, restaurant is good and the price is good...what else is there?? For starters, the location of this property is a great base for exploring all things Disney and other Central Florida attractions (Universal Studios, Sea World, outlet malls, dining, etc). The property is minutes from Interstate 4 and other key local routes (including the road to the airport). John and I managed our way over to the Gulf Coast to house-hunt and gather information, which proved to be a breeze. In general, the location is great. Be warned, though that many of the local access roads are "toll" roads, something quite common in Florida. So make certain that you have dollar bills or exact change ($0.25), especially upon leaving Orlando International Airport. The property is very pretty and impeccably clean. Housekeeping was provided x 1 @ mid-week. The two pools are beautiful and well maintained. John and I never had problems snagging a lounger by either pool (however, the first week post-Labor Day is apparently the slowest travel week for the area, so we were told). Our 1-bedroom suite was huge and larger than many Manhattan apartments we have seen (and lived in-smile). Full kitchen was well stocked. Bathroom with separate jacuzzi area is huge by any standards. I must say that the bed was one of THE MOST COMFORTABLE beds I've ever slept in. I slept like a log all but one night (and I usually have terrible insomnia). Views from our large, screened-in balcony were great. We even had our own, regular-sized, stacked washer and dryer, which I LOVE having when on vacation. As an aside, I love doing laundry during a vacation, so 1) I do not deal with packing stinky clothes for the return trip home, and 2) I do not have to do load after load of laundry upon returning home. Overall, vacationing here for one week felt like being at home minus the hassles of home-lol. The staff were all great. John and I ordered nachos by the pool one day and they were super tasty. Our waitress was nice. John and I actually were the winners at one of the "Not-So-Newlywed Games," being offered pool-side. I had loads of fun...not so sure about John-lolol. But yes, WE WON!! Our prize was a great bottle of wine (per John 'cause I do not drink wine). Anyhow, I have NEVER been able to talk John into entering any pool-side games in all our travels. This is an indication of how comfortable we BOTH felt at this wonderful resort. Not much more to say except that per usual, the lowest point of the week was dealing with the timeshare folks. Not surprisingly, my husband likes to hear the "pitch" so he can compare "deals" to what we presently have in the way of timeshares. He also likes to think ahead about swapping, trading, selling...something I have ZERO interest in doing. Anyhow, despite the never-ending grief that WE bring onto ourselves by attending the timeshare pitches, our vacation at this property was quite enjoyable. I've stayed at hotels, resorts, timeshares, etc a lot in Florida and for the price, this property is about as good as it gets. Do not hesitate to stay here...you will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, I will go back.”
Reviews.Author: ohgirl16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011 with some friends. We loved it,,,the staff was friendly, the grounds were beautiful, internet was a little difficult at times but it won't stop me from going back. The pool area was beautiful. Housekeeping was very pleasant. Very nice location to get to other Orlando attractions as well. We will positively go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect suite, tons of room for 2 adults 3 kids”
Reviews.Author: TRDAMJ
Reviews.Content: We really loved the property and the ammenities. The drawback was the number of people there on "free" vacations due to time share sales stuff :(

Reviews.Title: “always enjoy this place!”
Reviews.Author: loving-bears
Reviews.Content: We have been to this particular hotel several times, even ended up buying a timeshare there after a while because we really love it! The setting is beautiful, the rooms very very comfortable, jacuzzi bath in the suite, well stocked for full kitchen, comfy living area, great pool, great activities daily by the resort. 5 minutes from Disney World, right next to Nickelodeon Park, Sea World, and can walk to the outlet mall from hotel. Great grocery store right across the street, as well as a Walgreens, so have everything you need right there! The service has always been fantastic, wonderful people and personalities throughout! When my husband did not feel well we had to cancel an activity we had planned for that day. He was sent a get-well card to our room from the front desk, which I felt was really thoughtful! They have a pool side restaurant /bar that is nice when you don't feel like cooking in or going out. Decent varied menu at decent prices, which we use frequently. We will be going back again end of this week to just relax and recoup, walk the beautiful grounds around the man made lakes, and just enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, small minor details missing the mark. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: BoilerSammy
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a marketing plan for 4 days/3 nights. Checkin was smooth. They have 1 main pool that is beautiful and lots of activities for the kids. If you're looking for quiet, don't go there - go to the other quiet pool. It's smaller but indeed quiet. The day we got there there was a DJ and Mardi Gras party starting at 11a. Couldn't hear my wife talk 2 feet away from me it was so loud. However, kids liked the activities. Food/drink prices reasonable. Now the minor details. This is nitpicky but I'm a hotel snob with all the travel I do. I had my "personal conceirge" send me an email asking if there's anything I need before arrival. Sent two emails back, left a message on phone and no reply. A welcome packet from the concierge came the following day with restaurants and coupons. Would have been handy as I went to a restaurant the first night that I ended up having coupon for. Not a biggie but why pay a personal concierge when info is late? Pool towels are so thin you can almost see through them. Other than that staff was very nice. Bellman exceptional and always asking if you need any help or golf cart shuttle to front desk. Positives: Outlet mall and Publix within walking distance from hotel. Nice staff. Beautiful grounds. For marketing presentation, they were very professional. They were not that pushy and lasted about 2 hours. You get $100 free stay certificate for future. Tip: If you don't have a rental car and are doing taxis and shuttles, call a taxi service/town car limo service and prearrange a deal for the week. I saved about 30% by doing this.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for a queen!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne2229
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Suites on International Drive in August 2011. We LOVED it! The staff was EXTREMELY friendly and helpful. It was so nice to be at a place where literally everyone was happy ALL the time. Anything you could need the would give you. We stayed in building 4 which is right above the small, quieter pool. It is also closest to the Outlets and trolley pick up. We "discovered" the big pool later in the week which was great for people watching. There are always activities going on around there for children and adults. The room was amazing and has everything you need to cook (except plastic wrap/tin foil). Publics is right across the street so we would walk over and then take a cab back to our room when we had our groceries. We got room service from the restaurant by the pool which was great and we had breakfast from the place by the big pool which was also awesome. I can't speak highly enough about how friendly and helpful the staff is here, not to mention the BEAUTIFUL grounds! I would absolutely come back to this hotel again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gave it a try on Biz Trip...”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business and thought I would give the “vacation suites” a try as I would be there over several days. I enjoy the amenities of the Hilton Garden Inn brand while on the road in other major markets, but I was not going to chance it in Orlando during July. I was not disappointed, the rooms were will appointed, and well maintained. Ample space and no noise issues from the other families on vacation. I did have nonstop internet and Cellular phone signal issues in the room throughout the stay. It may have been the location of my room ground floor. For the average vacationer probably not an issue. The exterior hallways worked well on the ground floor for moving baggage to and from the car every day. Staff was cheerful and wanted to help. Would I return? More than likely, but remembering it’s a great vacation property and not designed a business offering.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel would love to stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: ckenne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 18 nights we booked it on line and paid up front for the best room rate. I can normally find fault with something but I struggled to here. We arrived about 10pm after travelling up from Miami our room was ready and was spotless (we stayed in block 5 which they told us has recently been updated). We had a 1 bedroom apartment the bed was massive and the sofa bed in the lounge for our girls was great the matress on it was really thick like a normal bed mattress. Flat screen TV in both bedroom and lounge, the bathroom was huge with jacuzzi bath walk in shower, double sinks the room was cleaned every day with clean towels and beds made. There are 2 swimming pools we were nearest the smaller one but my girls preferred the larger one where they used to show movies on a massive 20ft inflatable screen whilst the children could swim which proved a real novelty. The bar was great you could by a soda for $3 and have refills all day which we did. Glass of wine was expensive at $9 but I saw that price at several restaurants around Orlando. There is a deli with a small stock of groceries again quite expensive and we only really used it for ice creams. The Publix supermarket over the road is fantastic I would compare it to a Waitrose really good products. The outlet store next to the hotel is great and we enjoyed shopping and getting great bargains from Lacoste, Raupl Lauren, Juicy Couture, etc. Our stay here was great you are right at the far end of International Drive so you do really need a car to get around there is an i hopper bus that stops right outside the hotel that you can use but we decided to keep our car. There are only a few restaurants in walking distance we loved Outback across the road, Mcdonalds for a quick bite when you shattered from being at the parks all day, you can also cut through to Longhorn by cutting up by the GAP and Nike store. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone we loved it and would stay here again when we next visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed luxurious stay at hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaO
Reviews.Content: WE had a two room 'apartment' and it was fabulous. Our daughter was thrilled with the enormous bed all to herself and of course her own TV. they were adjoining rooms which was perfect. normal kitchen facilities everything we needed - even a kettle for the brits! the balcony was cleverly enclosed with a fly screen so you could sit out and not get 'bugged'! next to a huge outlet centre if you want to shop and walking distance to a great steak house. Lovely pool that is open until 11pm. ok onsite food for snacks but dont expect fine dining! you dont need it with so many great restaurants on international drive. word of warning if you get the i-ride from the hilton (number42) down to the stops in the twenties it will take about an hour because it visit all the water parks! it is worth it as it only costs a dollar and a taxi costs $27

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, awesome, would definetly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Amy W
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my vacation with my boyfriend. It was our first time to Orlando, and I read only great reviews about the hotel, and they were all right. Everyone that works there is soooo nice and friendly, which goes a long way. Cat at the front desk asked what floor we preffered and I said the higher the better. She set us up on the 6th floor at the end with a great view of the lake and fountain. The grounds are beautiful and the pools are very nice with lots going on for everyone. The only thing is the drinks and food are a bit pricey. We ordered two drinks on our first night and it was $25 with tip. Needless to say we went to the stores across the street and bought our own. On a couple nights when we got back late and had to park farther away the driver was right there to drop us off at our villa. I have already recommened the resort to people and will stay again if we go back to Orlando!!! It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: madonna11
Reviews.Content: Just a wonderful resort had our grandchildren with us. call for pick up and they were there right away. great pools and food i thought was price right for a resort. everyone was helpful. we had a two bed condo with a great screen in porch. the only neg thing i could say is they need new TV in the unit's. my grandchildren couldn't hook up ther PS3 TV was to old. other than that great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, but a Few Issues with Service”
Reviews.Author: Redsox3
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week's stay at the Hilton Grand Vacations on International Drive with my family and some of my extended family. The hotel has beautiful and large grounds with the guest buildings surrounding a lake with two pools on either end. The location was great: essentially between both Disney and Universal and next to a whole lot of restaurants and stores (including the grocery across the street). Our room, which was a two bedroom, two bathroom with whirlpool and balcony was absolutely huge and gave each member of out family their own space. The room (which consisted of a large living area with pullout couch, chairs, dining room table, an exit to the large corner balcony (with a fantastic view of the grounds) and a full kitchen, a master bedroom with whirlpool and bathroom, and a separate studio with a kitchenette, bathroom, and a balcony of its own) was also very clean and a great deal ($210.00 a night). The only issues (which were very few in number) that I expericenced involved the service. After a long day of traveling we arrived to the hotel at 6:00 P.M. and were told that only the living area and the master bedroom part of the room was cleaned and the studio was not ready. Nonetheless, we agreed to go to the room. Upon arrival to the room we discovered that we were on the ground floor on the backside of the back building of the complex where we would not be able to sit on the porch or even open the shades because we would be basically sitting in the parking lot. We asked if there were any other rooms available and were told that there was another one available on the other side of the building on the sixth floor, but it had no view either and that it would not be ready for another hour to an hour and a half. Nonetheless, we agreed to move. We then left the hotel and returned at 9:00 P.M and were told that only the studio part of the room was ready and that the living area and the master bedroom were still being cleaned. Finally, at 9:30 to 10:00 P.M we gained access to our whole room and found that we had a fantastic view of the entire hotel grounds. Other than this issue and the fact the internet connection was weak, my family and I had a great experience at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough, Just go and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Nigel M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay at the Hilton with my wife and 2 children !4 & 19yrs. Read some negative reports before going but all we can say is this is without doubt the best resort we have stayed in. We have previousley stayed at the Marriot Cypress Harbour which was wonderful but the Hilton just edged it with it's wonderful recieption staff, bar staff, and general service around the resort. Car parking can be a little difficult if you are in a building furthest from the recieption but there is always either a shuttle bus that constantley circles the resort perimiter road or staff in golf carts that fit 6 passengers that will transport you to your condo if you can only find a space at recieption. We will most definatley be returning. Note:- only negitive is when checking in It became clear we were being set up for a timeshare presentation the next day in returne for discounted park tickets. If this happens to you just do what I did and tell them that your salery is no where nere the $70000 a year required to purchace a condo. After i told them this they left me alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: adamsyn
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! It is close to everything. Quiet hotel and beautiful rooms. Parking is free! Felt safe and security is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Stay, but don't go if you can't say no.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl39604
Reviews.Content: We accepted a 3 day stay here" if we would listen to a sales pitch." The stay was very satisfactory, the grounds were very close to Disney and convenient to dining and other activities. The suite and grounds were beautiful and meticulously kept. The staff were very professional and accommodating. The pool stayed open till 11pm and had activities for everyone. They made your stay fun. Make no mistake this was an over all positive experience. The sales pitch was 2 hours. The salesman was very professional and did a good job. However the price that we were quoted was $23,000. at 27% interest. HA, :-) I'm sorry I will continue to rent...Don,t go if you can't say NO...

Reviews.Title: “terrible , not safe . dirty rugs . smoking. phones did not work .bad parking”
Reviews.Author: eileen054
Reviews.Content: never had suck a terrible vacation. this was a family get together . we had 5 rooms. had to drive far to park my car. carpet was dirty. no phone s at night when tried to call manager about smoke. did not get any rest workers weeding from 9 in the morning outside my window. dryers did not work. no carts to check out. no one to help my 80 year old sister draging her bags threw the parking area to my cars. workers just passed by. very uncareing place. been to a lot of hotels . in my years . this is my first review. be careful no camera on elvater or in parking area. hotel maids were good.

Reviews.Title: “We have just checked in this evening”
Reviews.Author: MamaBear3024
Reviews.Content: We have just checked in about 2 hours ago. Our condo/ room is beautiful, huge with kitchen, living room, bath with jacuzzi & separate shower, laundry & private screened porch. Clean, beautifully decorated. Within 3 miles of Sea World, outlet mall next door. Very quiet & beautiful. Service is excellent..

Reviews.Title: “Wow - so glad we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon_Bradshaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous! We were lucky enough to get gifted timeshare points from a family member so cost didn't deter us from staying here. Boy, were we ever lucky! The multiple (beautiful) pools, the fountain that greeted us upon entry into our building every night, the playground, the staff - it was all really exceptional. The hotel room was gorgeous. And I loved that each room had its own screened-in balcony. The bed was super-comfortable! (I have a bad back so this is particularly important to me.) And I loved the separate jetted tub and shower. The only important point to remember is that this is a long-term hotel, so cleaning service is only weekly (though I believe you can pay extra for daily). Though they do pick up trash outside your door daily, and will replenish anything you need with a phone call. I can only hope to be so lucky as to stay here again! Let's make it a full week next time . . . :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveltoday1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Suites in August and had an amazing time. This was a family trip with 2 kids - 10 & 13 yrs old. We had a 1 bedroom suite that was outstanding. The kitchen had granite counters and great appliances. The dining and living room had plenty of space (even with the pull out sofa). I was amazed at the bathroom - it also had granite counters, glass shower and a great size. The bedroom had a jacuzzi tub off to the side. There was a door to the balcony from the living and bedrooms. The balcony was equipped with a ceiling fan, table and four chairs. The best part of the balcony was that it was completely screened. The whole resort was a "tuscany" style. The pool was 3-4 ft deep with a huge waterfall and volleyball net. The resort also had it's private entrance to the Outlet Mall behind it. That was a bonus! The resort was so great that we decided to stay 2 extra nights. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel - location not the best!”
Reviews.Author: PJB748
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we didn't get the chance to use the hotel to it's full potential as we were only there for a couple of nights - and one of these was after a trans-atlantic flight! None-the-less it was nice to see complimentary wi-fi (unlike the Hilton in Miami Beach we later stayed in). The room was decorated in typical Hilton style and was clean and very comfortable with a nice bathroom and shower (which was nice and powerful - a must for me!) The location itself wasn't as great - I was hoping to be able to catch a trolley/bus to WetNWild or Universal but no such luck so we had to drive in the end. Also a cab to downtown to experience some of the nightlife was around $35-40. I would imagine this would've been a great place to bring a family but for a couple of guys wanting to experience some of the wilder things, probably not the best location.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: phark
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando for a Disney wedding. We had booked the room with a separate bedroom. The room had a complete kitchen, washer , dryer, living room . Our hotel was equiped with everything we needed except for more time to spend at the hotel to enjoy it. We did have time to relax by the beautiful pool. We are planning another trip to Orlando and we'll definately be staying here again. The employees were so courteous and friendly . The hotel was also close to all the disney attractions and airport. We just can't say enough about it. You will not go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: RedLichtieArbroath
Reviews.Content: Myself, my Wife and 2 boys- aged 10 and 12- stayed here in a one bedroom unit during July. The unit was fantastic - everything we needed- clean and spacious. We had originally put a request in for a unit in building 2 on the ground or first floor. When we arrived to check in n the first day they said all they had was a unit in builiding 4 which is further from the main pool. We said we wanted something closer to the main pool and they then said they had a unit in builiding 2- so if you do get there to check in please be firm with what you want. The unit was spacious, cleaned every day and the service was superb. Fresh coffee for the machine, beds made, even dishwasher empited. If you wanted to have a lie in or an aftrenoon nap the cleaners would come back at your convenience. The pool,was superb with activities for the kids, entertainers, scuba diving etc etc. We loved the ice cream sundaes and the beer tasting activities - only 3 dollars but worth it. The atmosphere around the pool was superb with everyone saying hi and chatting away - if you wanted that too. Around the hot tub at night was always busy and people taliking to each other. Security was also excellent, the cafe and bar bistro was handy - but a bit pricey for beers etc- . The resort itself and grounds were beautiful- the lake and pool architecture was stunning. The location is excellent for all the main parks and malls but the main junction on I4 (68)can be very busy at peak times- so give yourself time to get to where you want to go. Publix etc right across the road and 10 minutes to Disney main gateway. The outlet mall was attached to the premises and was very handy to get some retail therapy in the afternoon and a nice break from sunbathing and the heat at the pool. If you get the chance to sample some superb food, go to the Cheesecake Factory and Brio Tuscan Grille - both at the Mall at Millenia- you will not be dissapointed. We cannot wait to come back to Orlando next year and if we get good rates we will stay at Grand Vacation right away. YOU WILL NOT BE DISSAPOINTED

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Kitkat27893
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Hilton Grand Vacations Club on International Drive. (We stayed at Parc Soleil in January which is another great Hilton property.) We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, screened porch with a water view. We had a wonderful time! The location is very close to Seaworld, Aquatica and a short drive to Universal and the Disney Parks. It is next door to Orlando Premium Outlets and has a Publix grocery store across the street. (FYI, they have the BEST Key Lime pie EVER!!) It is also on the Lynx busline and there is also a special tram you can by passes for that picks up from the hotels/condos on International Drive. The resort itself is lovely and tropical. Everything was clean and well maintained. They have LOTS of activities for kids that are free. They also have activities for a fee, ie: tye dyed shirts, ice cream sundaes or floats daily by the pool . They offered free ice pops by the pool the day we arrived as it was very hot and had a luncheon cook out for a resonable fee. Basically, this resort has everything you could want. You can take advantage of as little or as much as you have time for. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and welcoming, always checking to see if our needs were being met. We had one day we did not receive maid service,( we were in and out alot and had put out the do not disturb sign while inside), we called when we got in to get necessary items and they quickly responded along with a follow up phone call to make sure things were fine. We were very happy with our choice to stay here and would happily return if we ever go back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms and Lots to Do”
Reviews.Author: blessedt0travel
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this resort as part of a timeshare presentation deal. The property is so beautiful and is located perfectly for trips to any of the Orlando theme parks. We had a one bedroom suite and enjoyed the Tuscany decor, kitchen, jacuzzi tub and having a washer and dryer in our room. Our son isn't typical in that he's not into theme parks but loves swimming. To keep it interesting for him we were allowed to take him one day to the other HIlton vacation property Parc Soleil free of charge. The pool there has a water slide which he thoroughly enjoyed. Although we didn't 'buy in', the timeshare presentation was good and we did not feel overly pressured.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: 2travelforever
Reviews.Content: As others said, great location, loved the space, a kitchen helped keep our resaurant bills low. Grocery store, Publix was across the road as was Walgreens. Our room was clean. Had a high floor room, so we saw the Disney fireworks at night. Sat in our screened in porch, perfect Next door neighbors were a little loud, but only heard them in the living room, bedroom was very quiet. Premium Outlets were next door, easy to walk to. Lots of activities for all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: savi2
Reviews.Content: It's one of the best location I feel, just right next to the outlet mall (within a walking distance). The outdoor pool is so beautiful with waterfall. There was a lake nearby too! So it simply has a great view! It's one bedroom suite and it is well decorated, pretty new but surprisingly the kitchen is not fully equiped like I thought (limited cooking items). It's a very busy hotel. By dawn, the parking lots are full!! You might need to park far from your location but the hotel provides a shuttle so you're allowed to hop on for a free ride to your place. One drawback is the cleanliness of this hotel. There're ants over the counter & sink even on the day we just checked in and some other insects!!! The bed was smaller than I expected but the jaguzzi was great! The hotel stuffs are helpful so overall I did enjoy my stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Resort”
Reviews.Author: zhq01
Reviews.Content: What a great resort. You feel like you are far away from the real world. Very large and fun pool area, very modern and spacious rooms/villas, easy parking, great A/C in rooms, close to everything that matters (Shopping Center across street w/ Publix supermarket to stock the full kitchen). Every staff member said hello. Great service from check-in and throughout the stay. And a great value as well.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks - the 2 & 3 bedroom units are terrific for a family stay at a great place for family fun.”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Minnesota-Mojito
Reviews.Content: The place is beautiful, great rooms, fabulous pool, and close to Disney, Islands of Adventure, Seaworld, everything. Rooms range up to 3br units that are very family friendly and nicely decorated. Each unit has a nice screen potch and each unit above studio has a full kitchen. Lots of activities (from beer tasting to ice cream socials to exercise classes to a kids scuba primer) multiple pools, main pool is beautiful, with a terrific poolside bar. Located off trolley route (or reasonable cab or car) to tons of restaurants and the best of Orlando. We bought a Hilton Grand Vacations timeshare because of this place - and love it. The staff is friendly and helpful, there is handy deli/market on site - making it easy to supply if you prepare meals in your unit. Publix is handy across the street too. If you are headed to Orlando, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Valve9
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on International Drive. We stayed in room 5402, which was a 1 bedroom suite. The room was located in building 5, right next to the pool, spa, and pizza grill. It was also across from the shopping outlets, with a walkpath on the other side of the parking lot. Parking was not an issue during oir stay, even on the nights when we didn't return until well after midnight. The staff were very pleasant, accomodating, and readily available. The hotel itself is located within a few miles of numerous restaurants, shops, and entertainment including Disneyworld, Universal Studios, and Seaworld. It was very clean and well maintained, the beds were comfortable, and the screened in porch was a nice spot to relax after a busy day. Overall I was extremely pleased with this hotel, would recommend it, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sneeuwwitjeroos18
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great pool. Clean rooms. Located next to outlet (you don't notice anything of that like noise or anything else) so very nice for shoppers. Service 4 because there was a disagreement at the rception about being a diamond member. So diamOnd members no upgrade or free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Lostinsnowball
Reviews.Content: The resort is huge! We stayed in the building closest to the more private pool which was super nice. The food they offer tastes great and we had excellent customer service. The only 2 (minor) complaints I have is: 1. On the day we were checking out we called the front desk to have someone come get our luggage, 45 minutes later no one arrived so we had to troop it to the front with all of our bags 2. Upon arrival we were given a piece of paper that read "welcome gift", we were pretty excited about it only to find out the gift was money off the parks, but only if you attended their hour and a half timeshare presentation. Other than this our entire stay was great!!! Their beds and blankets were the most comfortable and softest we've ever experienced in a hotel/resort. It is a little far from the parks and if you are taking a taxi expect to pay around $40 roundtrip, however the trolley is much cheaper ($4/day or $1.25 each trip) and it will bring you right there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: benjsda
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 days recently in a one bedroom apartment and I have to say it was fabulous in terms of comfort and cleanliness. We stayed in Tower 4 overlooking the quiet pool. Very close to outlet centre and in house pizzeria. There is a small shop also on site which was good for basics but within a ten minute walk there is a Pulix where you can quite literally get anything. Example. A beer in the Bar was $6. You could get a six pack of coors for the same price. There is also a steakhouse and MacD's nearby as well as pharmacy, chinese, subway etc.... You are also on all the main I Trolley routes. I couldnt recommence this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “The best location of the 3 HGVC facilities in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Nisse2ears
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the HGVC units (1BR). The apartment: Our 1 bedroom unit was located in building 6 in the corner with partly lake view. The screened balcony was perfect for breakfast or afternoon drinks. It even has a ceiling fan! (I am not used to that). The screen is really dull but probably necessary to keep insects out. The units are a bit out of style but functional with an old fat TV in living room. (They have flat TVs in some buildings though). No DVD-player. Radio, fully equipped kitchen incl dish washer and dryer and washing machine. We brought our own dish tablets and washing powder, not needed if you don’t intend to wash often since some are included. Onsite and eating: Onsite is a Pizza Hut and a pool restaurant/bar and a minimarket. At the minimarket you can eat OK breakfast buffet for abt $8 if you don’t want to prepare your own. There is also a pool table and internet accessed computers to use (not for free of course!). I think there is a gym as well. Pool area: There is one main pool at one side of the resort and a smaller one at the other. We only tried the pools in late afternoons and evenings – then there was never a problem getting a sun bed. Around the pool area there are activities almost all day long every day of the week, such as wine and beer tasting, pop quizzes, movie night (twice a week) and mainly lots of children's activities. We found the pool a bit crowded by youth water activities at times. You do not go there for peace and quite. Then use the smaller pool - a bit calmer. Transportation: Hilton has a taxi you can use which is $14 if you go to Disney area. Or they arrange any taxi for you. Affordable. Or you can take the cute IRideTrolley for $2 anywhere up the International Drive. It stops all the time and take an hour from one side to another – but since the end stations are at the Outlet mall you get a chance to get a seat so it is OK. (Not very comfortable though). Along the ride there are many restaurants and activities. (see their website). Also the resort has at least one transfer to Disney area at 8 in the morning. Neighborhood: Just walking distance away from the hotel area you have a few restaurants – The Outback Steakhouse (Very inexpensive and so good!!) and Carrabas (longer walk). You also have McDonald’s, Walgreens and Publix supermarket just across the street, which is perfect – none of the other HGVC Orlando resorts have that. The Premium Outlet Mall is literally next door. It closes at 11 at night so you can do all your shopping afterhours :) We are very satisfied and would definitely stay here again. On the down side is the lack of restaurants onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: AJStravel
Reviews.Content: This resort was so nice! We stayed in a one bedroom suite that backed up to the outlet mall. Nice to be able to walk right over! The smaller of the 2 pools was also near our room. The room was very neat and clean and housekeeping came everyday. We had pizza one night from the restaurant, which was pretty good. The big pool was a short walk away, and they always had lots of fun activities going on. I also got a massage there (by Nancy) which was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “No customer service”
Reviews.Author: greenbirds
Reviews.Content: We were staying here for our honeymoon and arrived June 27, 2011. Couldn't believe we had to wait 20 minutes to check in while there was only one person ahead of us with only one check-in agent in the early afternoon. The first night we stayed here there was a party happening in the suite below ours from 11pm and called the front desk numerous times throughout the night, they responded by sending the security to speak to the residents. By 3am the security knocked on our door and advised they had asked them to keep the peace for the last time and came into our suite and listened for any noise, at which point it was quite for 2 minutes and the music started blasting, the management moved them to a different room and 15 minutes later, next to the suite they were staying, the fire alarm was triggered. This event threw off our schedule for the next day. My wife wrote a letter to management 3 weeks ago regarding our 8 night stay and requesting a one night refund and still no response. The suite was nice, but bring some slippers as they never mopped the kitchen floor. The suite was as shown on Tripadvisor and had a laundry machine and a sauna tub, all pots, utensils and soap was provided, felt like home or like a timeshare. This is not a quality constructed building and you will hear everything in other suites especially if they bring their own stereo! Better to stay in a Hilton tower as it is concrete construction. 3 minute walk to the Premium Outlets where there is a food court and if you like there is a Mcdonalds across the street or for groceries there is a also a Publix. Costco is a short drive away. Close to Universal Studios and Disneyworld by car.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: disneygoof1966
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the HGVC-Intl Drive. Our room was ready when we arrived @ 1pm, room was clean and well stocked. We were not staying on points, so we received daily cleaning. Location has a number of daily activities, some free, some include a fee. We had plans each day, so only utilized the pool and walking/running path. Both the feature pool and the quiet pool have food options attached - deli near the feature pool, pizza near the quiet pool. We had a 1 bedroom suite, plenty of room for 2 adults and 2 children. 1 king bed and 1 sleeper sofa - the sleeper sofa is actually comfortable, has a pillow top mattress. Nice sized kitchen, full sized appliances. Publix is across the street for groceries as is McDonalds, Outback and a couple other options. About 15 minutes to Downtown Disney if the traffic is good. We had a car, so we didn't use any of thier shuttle services. One negative was parking. They seem to have underestimated the number of people who would be driving to this location and don't always have space available close to your room. They do have carts circulating throughout the resort to take you from your car to your room and I never had to wait more than a few seconds for a cart to appear! Also - have to offer some kudos to their maint staff - husband dropped our car keys down the elevator shaft on arrival day - got them back within 30 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “another excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: Brian300
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time we have stayed at the Hilton Gvc on International Drive and each time we have been received with an excellennt welcome and a perfect apartment. The resort has all the amenities anyone coud want and restaurants such as Outback are walking distance away ( as is Premium outlets for the shoppers amongst you). The staff are helpful,informed dertermined to make your stay happy,the only issue we had whilst there was a faulty coffee machine and this was replaced in 15 minutes followed by an apology. The resort is easy distance to WDW and Sea World and no problem to reach Universal. The apartments are clean,smart and upmarket and the pool facilities are excellent. The central lake even has small turtles or terrapins swimming, which really excites the young ones. Although I have no connection with the Hilton brand I would recommend this resort as a must stay inn Orlando (only not too many so that it means I cannot get in when I return next year ) Brian UK residentt

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: peapod2000
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to HGVC on Intl Drive. We enjoy this hotel primarily for its location - its proximity to the outlet mall next door, publix grocery store across the street, and the attractions - epcot, seaworld, downtown disney are all a mere 10-15 minute drive. The staff was topnotch during our second visit. The lady at the front desk was able to assign us a round immediately upon arrival which was a few hours prior to 4pm checkin time. The door man was very quick in calling us a taxi upon our departure. He was extremely busy as many people were calling on him for his service. He worked very hard serving 3-4 people simultaneously. The only dislike I have for this trip to HGVC is one unmetered taxi guy provided at the hotel significantly overpriced our trip to Epcot. We are very aware of what the taxi fare is to get to certain places. If you are travelling by taxi this is what you should expect using taxi from HGVC: Airport to HGVC - $45 HGVC to Epcot - $20 HGVC to Downtown Disney - $15.00 We had lunch at TREX in downtown Disney. Get there early to get a table other wise it's a long wait. We enjoyed the restaurant. The staff was great. The food was enjoyable. The price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not handicap or business traveler friendly”
Reviews.Author: Today123
Reviews.Content: I arrived on crutches for a one night stay. The price was right. I was in town for business. This is not the place for business. No internet access. I am a Hilton Honors member and did not have water in my room when I arrived. I was on crutches. I specifically asked about the location of my room and that it be closed to parking since it was near 100 degrees and I have to struggle to get far. The front desk attendant asked if I minded being on the upper floors, I said no as long as I don't have to go far to get to the elevator and not far from the elevator when I reach my room. The design of the Bldgs is a U shape. She said there were elevators on each leg of the U and since the legs of the U came out towards parking I thought I would be fine on the 3rd floor. When I departed I asked the men posted at the entrance if I could get assistance with my luggage. They followed me on a golf cart and were there when I arrived, which was nice. When he saw which room I had he said this is far for you to walk. He called the front desk to see if they could get me another room. He was put on hold and then told the computers were slow. He finally (since we were standing outside) suggested I be placed in the room they gave me until an alternate closer to my car could be designated. He got me to my room and made sure I had what I needed for my wait. 2 hours later I hadn't heard from anyone. I called the front desk and was put on hold and transferred (spoke to 3 people) and was told they would look to see what they could do. I told them I needed to get dinner and to just move my items and I would stop at the desk when I got back to find out where they were moved. The maid was outside when I went to leave so I told her I had been in the room and used the hand towel and sat on the bed and was being relocated so she may need to freshen the room. She didn't speak english well and didn't know what I was saying (hope the next occupant didn't enter a partially used room). As a gave up with her, my room phone rang. The front desk had a room for me but I needed to be present to be relocated so I waited. The bellman arrived in about 10 mins (bell staff was really great with service and timeliness). I was being relocated to the same room on the first floor. I specifically asked for something near the parking lot. They have several bldgs all with a U shape and with the legs of the U extending to the parking area, yet I was kept in a corner room. If the lady at the desk had had to haul her behind that far on crutches in the summer heat, she would have relocated herself. I gave up and just sweated my way to dinner and back and didn't go out again. EXTREMELY FRUSTRATED! IF THIS IS HOW THEY ACCOMODATE SOMEONE WITH A BROKEN LEG ON CRUTCHES WHO IS A FREQUENT CUSTOMER (HILTON HONORS DIAMOND MEMBER) WHAT WOULD HAPPEN TO SOMEONE WITH A PERMANENT HANDICAP??? I do not recommend this hotel for anyone that is looking for quality service and client focus. It is a good buy if you just need a place to stay with a kitchenette and the grounds are nice and near an outlet mall and not far from the amusement parks. The doors to the hallway are not well sound proofed though so get a high level room away from the elevator. The halls echo!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding...Will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd2709
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 11 nights during April/May 2011. The locations of the hotel is a real positive, and there is also a big Publix supermarket opposite the hotel. It is around 10 mins from Disney and around 15 mins from Universal, the hotel pool area is great, with a bar and is always spotless! The rooms are really big, with plenty of space, the rooms were cleaned every day, with clean linen. The maid also would wash up on certain dishes left! The jacuzzi in the room is a big thing about the room. If you like your shopping then you wont be disappointed here, there is a big shopping mall literally outside the hotel and malls such as the florida mall are around 20 mins away which is recomended. Went into downtown Orlando and there really isnt much there but the Orlando Magic! If you have got a family I highly recomend staying here, there is also a see through mesh which stops children falling over the balcony and insects entering your room. The only bad thing about the hotel was that there were a lot of flies flying around the pool area. But apparently they only come out during the months of april and may and then they go away.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION WILL GO AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: sage97
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week. The location was great...the hotel/room was very clean. The only problem is they don't clean your room everyday. The price was great. All the rooms had a screen in balcony. The outlet was a two minute walk from our location. I will use this location again and again. Hotel was convenient to all the theme parks, beaches and other locations of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmd69
Reviews.Content: The suites are spacious, clean and very well maintained. We stayed in a 1 bedroom which also had a full kitchen and washer/dryer. There are two very nice pool areas at the hotel with the main one having a large outside bar and restaurant with reasonable prices. The staff was friendly and attentive. The hotel is about 10 minutes from Disney parks and very easy to access. Excellent overall value for $149/night.

Reviews.Title: “loved it again!!”
Reviews.Author: aura631988
Reviews.Content: after our 4th stay we still feel that this is the best accomodation in the disney area. we were disappointed not to get this for our full 14 nights and only managed to get our last 4 nights. we stayed at the hyatt regency which was ok but couldnt wait to get here. the pools are wonderful for kids, the entertainment is low key but good in the evening after a long day at the parks, the rooms are very well equipped and the direct access to the premium outlets is a bonus, just cant fault it!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel0975
Reviews.Content: Our trip was amazing! Okay I have to be honest I was so hesitant about staying here after reading the reviews....specially the one about the cockroaches! Me being OCD..OMG I thought. I called ahead to make sure the room was cleaned, I didnt want to deal with too many issues, I even packed bug spray just in case...But when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean to my standards...which I am so anal about hotels. They offered lower floor or upper floor I asked for upper being that I thought it would keep out pests a little better. I didnt see one bug there the whole week! I promise. I love the screened in patio with the ceiling fans that was the best. The breeze and you keeping the bugs out. I was happy. The rooms were clean the kitchen was clean, We were very impressed. I must say I dont think you would be sorry if you book here. I mean you may have to just confirm some things and I always pack a few cleaning supplies anyway. But I didnt have to use any. So Im not saying that the other reviews were wrong Im just saying we didnt experience any trouble, no parking issues nothing. Oh 1 more thing the swimming pool was freezing! lol

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MillPri
Reviews.Content: Frequent visitor to Orlando, but first time staying at this hotel. Since not visiting theme parks, decided not to stay on-property. Room rate for this hotel was great and location met our needs, so decided to try it. Exceeded my expectations. Never met such friendly staff. Not just at front desk, but were greeted with a hello and smile by everyone we met. Room very comfortable and quiet. Large pool and hot tube. Had problem with TV day after our arrival and reported it to the front desk. Repairman arrived within 15 minutes of my call and was able to correct the problem. Then, I received a call from the front desk to follow-up and ensure the problem had been fixed. This is something I've never experienced - a follow-up to make sure I was taken care of. Only down side was having to pay for use of business center. Unless visiting Disney, will definitely stay here on my Orlando visits.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: bedn0043
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a last minute trip to Orlando. We enjoyed everything about this hotel, from the stocked kitchen in our room to the movie nights by the pool. It is conveniently located near the parks, with lots of shopping and dining near by. We hadn't planned on going to Orlando, so this hotel was a nice surprise that made our trip all the more enjoyable. I know that if we do go back someday, this will be our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “first time,not my last!!”
Reviews.Author: mikie2011
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 4th june for 2 weeks,were given keys to a studio in block 6 .. 3rd floor..from the balcony there was rather a large din from an extractor fan adjacent to small pool . this we thought was a no no. 2 weeks with this din ,im afraid not..We went back to reception and were given another studio in block 2..reception were brillaint and no quibbles..studio was on 3rd floor off block 2. good enough for 2 people for 2 weeks. fridge microwave .ps there is no kettle but if you ring down to reception they will send you one up. ours arrived in 5 mins with a welcome basket..(very nice touch) The hotel itself is very good, free towels by the pool, ample loungers and severs that go around all day and into the night (10.30pm) taking orders for drink and food..say hey to megan and jenny,say the english and irish lads say hi. (remember its curtios to tip at least 10% off your total bill if your happy with service given). This hotel mainly caters for time share owners about 75% with a few studios and suites they rent out for holiday makers..The deli is nothing to write home about, it does the buisness breakfast, coffee tea etc..,small shop adjacent to it.If your renting self catering go across to publex ,gate opposite main entrance, your pass card will open it.Very good and cheap large supermarket with very nice staff.Its a bit off a track to get meals out side off your hotel but get a 7 day ticket for unlimited travel on i trolleys...green buses that come every 15 to 20 mins..POINT ORLANDO .I TROLLEY NO 24 check out houlihans .very good for meals say hey to martha if you see her.or if your on a budget with kids check out sizzlers next door. a bit like harvester free salads free desserts free ice cream!!! all with a main course for about £10 each.Theres an expedia desk in reception for tickets to disney, universal kennedy etc but check out other resort desks as tickets could be cheaper..example disney store at the premuim compex across the bridge and through the gate at hotel..Premium Stores are very cheap for clothes and i mean cheap!!!.Overall my first visit to orlando and the hilton complex and diffiently not my last. Will stay here again..ps there is word off thieves being on the prowel at the hotel. i never seen or heard anything about this but thats why you got a safe in your room to keep every thing off value safe..cleaners are very good..change towels make bed nothing but praise for them, reception brilliant,servers brilliant. say hey to jenny and megan again lol. Hotel over all was very good..i have no doubts whatever off staying here again hopefully very soon...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort........but...”
Reviews.Author: ktroth
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Vistana in Orlando but it was booked when we called so we exchanged for the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on International Dr. Our standards are fairly high because Vistana is so great. We've never stayed anywhere better than Vistana, but the Hilton came the closest of all the other resorts we've stayed at. It is beautiful. The grounds are immaculate. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. There are only two pools, as opposed to Vistana's seven. However, despite the huge number of guests, we didn't have any problem getting chairs at either pool on some very hot afternoons. The reason this doesn't get a perfect rating is because we killed four cockroaches in our room. We called down to the front desk after the first two finds and they came up and sprayed while we were gone. They left us a little gift basket as an apology. However, that very night we came back and found two more. I know roaches are a pesky problem in FL, but it's disturbing to be staying at such a nice resort and have to deal with pests.

Reviews.Title: “Jewelry stolen from room”
Reviews.Author: 1cruiser2004
Reviews.Content: As the person who entered a review in August 2010 I have never submitted a review. We stayed the Hilton Grand on International Drive in June. I didn't have my jewelry in the safe as we were not supposed to have housekeeping because we were only staying a partial week. When I returned from my day at the pool I discovered my diamond ring had been taken from inside a box in my nightstand drawer. Security came and seem concerned but not surprised. They filed a report and gave me the number of the police department to file the theft report. Security told me they would interview the housekeeper before she left for the day but I received no follow up regarding this interview with her. I am so angry that a hotel would employ people who are stealing from their guests. I have discovered their are over 40 pawn shops in Orlando. Be careful when traveling to the Hilton Grand Internation Drive as it seems theft from rooms are common to this property!!

Reviews.Title: “Rough Start, but Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: luv2gogogo
Reviews.Content: My 3 children and I decided to join my husband on his business trip to Orlando so we could see Disney and local attractions while he worked. My husband is a Hilton Honors Diamond member who stays 3-4 nights every week in Hilton hotels. He requested an upgrade since we were traveling with him. The front desk was very rude and told us it was not available. When my husband called the Diamond Desk and got them involved, there was suddenly a cancellation and a 2BR 2 Bath became available - -but they wanted to charge us $100 more per night for the upgrade. My husband pressed and was finally able to get the upgrade at no cost as it should have been all along - - but BEWARE that you will need to be firm and get the DIAMOND DESK involved because the front desk staff is not helpful in this regard. With that said, the condo was amazing once we got checked in! The grounds are meticulously cared for and the pool was fantastic. It had a waterfall and meandered along so that no one place was too crowded in the pool. There was also a splash pad of fountains for the kids and dive in movie nights which my kids enjoyed. There is also ample shade under the waterfall cabana area. Drinks and food is served poolside or delivered to your chaise by the wonderful waiters at the Fresco grill. (Their pizza is great!!) There is also a lifesize chess set off to the side in the pool area that my kids enjoyed and a ping-pong table. There is a second, less crowded, but more plain pool on site as well. The business center was large and roomy with a huge tv and comfy chairs. The outlet mall is adjacent to the property and you can walk over if necessary. Laundry in the condo was GREAT! The only cons (other than upgrade issues) were: 1. Parking is a HUGE problem. They do have a shuttle that helps, and it appears they are doing some rennovations that may mean the problem is temporary. 2. Housekeeping was not consistent. They would come in and do some things on the list they were to do, but not all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the amenities”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTraveler11
Reviews.Content: The Pictures on the website are not a true accuracy of the resort. The pools look a lot bigger and nicer and there were not enough chairs at the smaller pool. The smaller of the two pools was dirty at times. The gyms were not equipped in comparison to other hotels. The shower in our room was so small that we kept banging into the walls when we turned around. We have been to many other hotels in Orlando that we enjoyed much more than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Superb property”
Reviews.Author: mpaterso
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Feb 2011 for the 2nd year in a row. 2010 stay was an offer from HGVC, where we attended a sales presentation at Parc Soleil in exchange for a low rate at International Drive. We loved International Drive so much we decided to look into the best way to stay there every year. The property is superbly maintained and very tranquil. The rooms are spacious (we've had 2bd/2ba both times) and very quiet. We love the screened balcony for our small, active children. We also love the enclosed, tent-covered playground area for them. The front desk staff is very attentive and responsive. This year we rented a timeshare for part of our stay, and then tacked on a few days as a hotel stay - no problem at all. Already made a reservation for Christmas week 2011, on the Hilton website no less! No need to prepay, or rent a timeshare from someone else. This property is about 7-10 years old, but it is definitely the best fit for our family in Orlando. It is also right next to the Outlet Mall, which is a very nice shopping experience. It is about 5-10 min from Disney, and very close to I-4 although not close enough to be bothered by any noise. This year we're looking forward to free wifi in all the rooms - that wasn't yet available in Feb. Pool is heated and very relaxing and quiet. The crowd at this property seems to be primarily retirees and their extended families from the Northeast and Midwest. A very happy bunch of people when they're in FL during the harsh northern winter.

Reviews.Title: “Went for a timeshare presentation and absolutely loved the property!!”
Reviews.Author: littlemom5
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on the property before visiting... the positive definitely outweighed the negative. I was very pleased with the property and the staff. We had the two bedroom/two bath. The kitchen and baths were beautifully updated. It was very clean and comfortable. Even though we didn't purchase the timeshare... if given the opportunity again I would definitely stay here. It's very ideal for families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: andyllc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our trip to Orlando and stayed here. We traded a week from our timeshare through RCI and we are very happy. We had a one bedroom which has also a full kitchen and family room as well as screened porch. The room was great. Despite what others have said, we could never really hear our neighbors which was nice. The place feels relatively new and looks like it has been kept up well. The pond is great, the pools are great, the pool bar extra great. :) The location is very convenient to anything tourist related. Shopping is close, restaurants on I drive are close, Disney, Universal, Seaworld are all close. This was a great choice and I would be happy to stay here again. I asked for a room in the first two buildings as I knew parking was limited and I am glad I asked for this as we wouldn't get back until midnight most nights and if we were staying in a building further from the lobby then it would have been a bit annoying. For those with kids, the pool area is great. They had music and games and ice cream for the kids so the kids in the area seemed happy. The only thing I didn't quite like is that since I was a timeshare guest, they only cleaned the room once during my stay but that isn't a huge deal just fyi.

Reviews.Title: “Can we stay here next year???”
Reviews.Author: animarie03
Reviews.Content: That's what our 7 year old daughter asked after our stay this past march. We enjoyed everything about this hilton property. The room was beautiful (1 bed suite) and spacious. We were right by the "quiet" pool, which was really convenient, but the main pool was close as well. My daughter loved the kids crafts that were available everyday. The location is good, close to everything which also means dealing with all the crazy orlando/disney traffic, but that's to be expected. We did do the promotional tour, but that was booked in advance, in order to get a great deal on our stay. It is a long presentation and we had to keep our 2 year old occupied, which was not easy. Overall, we loved our stay and if possible, we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: merhou
Reviews.Content: My parents belong to Hilton's Vacation Club so they invited all of us down for a little family reunion/vacation. My sister has a 12 and 13 yr old, my brother a 2 yr old, and I have a 6 month old...everythone was thrilled with this resort. The kitchen was fully stocked and ready for cooking, the staff very friendly, and the property was beautiful. The Publix grocery store is right across the street, and unfortunately (due to it's location near several resorts) it's very expensive, so food was pricey for the week for the whole family. Drinks were reasonably priced for being a resort (a beer at the pool, for example, was $5). The pool is fabulous and was never so crowded that you couldn't relax or enjoy it. It is a bit of a drive to Magic Kingdom and Universal, but Sea World and water parks are right down the street. Our room had a fabulous jacuzzi tub (which we never got to use). The resort also offers several activities throughout the day - trivia, beer tasting, capture the flag for kids, waterarobics, etc...I didn't plan on doing any of them but my sister and I found ourselves doing trivia when we were at the pool. It was fun. There is no shuttle to/from the hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to spend a week off with family!”
Reviews.Author: JMJL
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed at this location for the first time. The rooms were perfect, and adjoined together. There was plenty of space for the 8 of us to be comfortable. There were plenty of activities to keep everyone happy. We found the kitchen to be well stocked for preparing meals and helpful to have a washer and dryer in our rooms. The pools were nice and the staff was excellent! We were able to check in early and use the facilities even after checkout! It was great to have gas grills and nice outdoor tables at our disposal too when we wanted to grill out for lunch/dinner. The only downside was parking later in the evening- when people return to the resort after spending time at the local attractions the parking became difficult. We stayed in building 3 and had to park beyond building 4. Not a big deal but a slight downfall. We are newer Hilton Grand Vacation owners and really look forward to many more years visiting places like this! We are already planning our next vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for staying off the Disney property”
Reviews.Author: Brad_Lazorka
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very clean rooms and an excellent pool. The restaurant is a bit lacking as it is has a limited fare but works for the basic burgers and sandwiches. The kids activities were absolutely fantastic. Very well organized and my son had a blast. The movies by the pool were the most memorable part for my kids. The pool is huge and never got too crowded even the week beore Easter. I would return to this hotel and plan to head to the Parc Soleil on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tipptop_1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in May and overall I would say we enjoyed our time. The location is great, we had hired a car and visited both Disneyland & Universal Studios - both of which were a short drive from the hotel. Also Seaworld is even closer however we did not get there due to the short time we were staying. Orlando Premium Outlets is practically on the hotels doorstep - we certainly took advantage of the excellent value on offer. The hotel itself is well laid out, the grounds are very well maintained and look great. The rooms are spacious and well equipped but could do with a little brightening up. During out stay, the handle on the toilet would not work and despite reporting it, it remained unfixed for the duration of our stay which was disappointing. Luckily my husband did not mind flushing from the cistern. The pool area was very nice and the barbecue areas are fantastic for groups and families. However the bar menu was limited and could do with a bit more variety. Overall I would recommend a stay here and would certainly stay here if I return to Orlando in the future

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for Disney/Universal Fun”
Reviews.Author: autah
Reviews.Content: Great location--close to parks, grocery store, restaurants, shopping. Very clean. Helpful staff. Having multiple televisions/bedrooms and bathrooms is a must when you have 3 teenagers for a week long vacation. This was a good value. The grounds were lovely. Pools good. Having a kitchen and washer/dryer in the room made everything easy. Only negative was that the parking lots near your building may often be full so you may have to walk a bit. Small inconvenience for other ammenties at this reasonalbe price.

Reviews.Title: “We accidently found a Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: tinagwaltney
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Orlando without a reservation and Hilton on Disney properties referred us to this "sister" property. Wonderful location, Absolutely Beautiful and an amazing staff. I can not wait to find a reason to go to Orlando again. I fell head over heels in love with this place. The atmosphere is so relaxing and shopping is steps and away, just use your room key to open the gate and you are in the middle of the Outlet Mall! A very short distance from Sea World and Disney. We already have a all-inclusive booked for later out of the US but, are considering staying here to relax instead! Highly recommend this property! The most reasonable luxury resort I have ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend. Check in was a breeze. We were greeted with cold water and escorted to the desk. We were on the 3rd floor of the 3rd condo. Very nice view of the lake. Beautfiul grounds. We were in a studio lock out. Beautiful room. Very clean. Loved the screen balcony as bugs in Florida can be quite bad. Location is great for this facility as there is a grocery store across the street, a drug store less than a block away, restaurants everywhere and a huge high end outlet mall right next door. I would definitely stay here again. BTW... you don't have to be a timeshare owner to enjoy this facility. We went down for a presentation. Actually the cost was very good. So if someone calls with an offer and you need a 4 day/3 night vacation. I would jump on the offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice!”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: The suites were very nice and clean. Comfortable bed and pillows. Location is right across from the Premium Outlets and easy walking distance to grocery store. Staff were very pleasant and accomodating. Lots of poolside activities and BBQ areas if you are inclined to use them. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the three HGVC, but age starting to show”
Reviews.Author: sltex38
Reviews.Content: Arrival could not have been better, representative met us at the car with cold water, escorted us to the check in desk. Very nice. Room was on high floor with good view, very clean and comfortable. The room was clearly long used, sink scratched, faucet dented, nothing bad, just noteworthy. This HGVC is very close to restaurants, grocery store and connects with the outlet mall. We have stayed in all three, this is our favorite. Now, bad. Charge to use the computers, charge extra for a postage stamp, charge, charge, charge for everything. Nothing is free or part of the package. No free shuttle anywhere. Still a great place to stay with very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ksweed04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in a king studio kitchenette with balcony room in May 2011. Room was very spacious, huge bed, nice bathroom and balcony overlooking lake. Kitchenette with mini fridge in the room. Very clean, room serviced daily. Resort is very large, has 2 pools, both nice, main pool has a bar/bistro. Excellent value for money. Resort offers transport to theme parks for $6 pp return trip. There is a few resturants nearby within walking distance or you can catch a taxi to Lake Buena Vista which has more variety. You cannot walk there as you cant cross the highway but they are quite close. There is also a good supermarket right across the road.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay, but it's a definite that we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: nyg16606
Reviews.Content: I found this resort after searching google, all of the travel sites and AAA over and over. I moved away from Orlando 3 years ago and my husband and I go back frequently due to family events and holidays. Usually we stay with family, but this time we were looking for more of a tourist trip.....this resort was perfect. I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg but wanted to be around the action and this provided both! The rates are INSANE for what you get!!!! The pool is gorgeous and relaxing accommodating both adults and children. The service is friendly and the grounds are kept perfectly. The room was so clean and detailed- the kitchenette is a huge bonus and the comfy bed was the cherry on top. And a screened in balcony??? I really can't think of much more to ask for. We will DEFINITELY be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: D2gauth
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here and I will absolutely come back. Close to Disney (15 minutes) with an easy less-trafficy way to get there. About 10 minutes from Sea World and about 25 from Universal. The pool is so relaxing with plenty of lounge chairs and a pool side bar. Waiters and waitresses come Around and take drink orders. The rooms are huge and very clean. Our dirty dishes were even done for us, and the washer/dryer was great. The patios are screened in and we were able to sleep with our patio door open. Staff was friendly, courteous, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience.”
Reviews.Author: amharris829
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club on International Drive. Firstly, the grounds are kept impeccably and the scenery on the resort is beautiful. You can step off of your balcony and get a gorgeous view of the pond that is available. When asked if we could check out late, our request was handled quickly and we were told we could get a 2 hour delayed check out. We stayed in the one bedroom suite and although the furniture seems a bit old, everything seemed clean and we had a full kitchen, living room, bathroon with jacuzzi, bedroom and balcony. The room also comes with a DVD player so we were able to rent movies and relax while in the room.The security on site is impeccable. Most of the security folks remembered me by name after day one on the site. In addition, you cannot get onto the property withut the proper key indicating you are a resort guest. I would definitely recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Treacle2011
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted with a smile at the security check point. Then at check in there was someone waiting to direct us to reception. We had a one bedded apartment which had everything that you could possibly need in it. Full kitchen, laundry, living room and bathroom with toiletries. The resort is large with two pools, a small deli, bar and onsite pizza hut express. Across the road is a publix supermarket and next door an outlet mall. Its ideally located for all the theme parks and shopping. There is a good choice of restaurants a short drive away on i-drive. A car would be recommended but there is a Lynx and i-ride stop straight outside the resort too.

Reviews.Title: “COCKROACHES!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chinodad
Reviews.Content: Arrived in April 2011 here very impressed and satisfied initially with the grounds, cleanliness, facilities, staff. Then, things turned sour when I noticed cockroaches around our building on our 4th day here. Then, on our final night, we noticed several cockroaches inside our room, and a very LARGE cockroach sitting on one of our children's toothbrush which was overwhelmingly disgusting. Notified staff about the situation, they said that they would "spray down" the room in the morning which we did not know was done or not since we left before that was done.
