If it weren't for the cockroach problem, would consider staying here again, but after seeing the cockroach on my child's toothbrush, will probably never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “When can I go back??!”
Reviews.Author: Kjcharron
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel and a great value! Rooms are great and love the kitchen and laundry. Screened balcony is a great place for coffee and breakfast. Jason at the Clubhouse bar was awesome. He was very accomodating and always willing to change the channel so we could watch the different NHL playoff games. My daughter loved the pools and planned activities. The only negatives are parking is hard to find if you come back late in the evening and pools are very crowded. Most days it was hard to find a chair. The resort is large - I think an additional pool would have been a good use of space. Beds are very comfy and we had plenty of room in our one-bedroom. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for :(”
Reviews.Author: MsV79
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nicely decorated, but the noise level was awful! The walls are paper thin with cheap drywall you could hear everything from upstairs and next door. Also, if you are going to Disney or any of the other parks, beware, there are only 3 shuttles that leave, and 3 that return. There is no in and out for cooking, resting, or any thing else, you will have to spend money on a can or rent a car. Very inconvenient. You are better off staying at a Disney property which we have done in the past and will do the next time instead of trying to save money. The little money that you do save goes into renting a car which can get up to over $100 per day, or catching cabs which they have contracted a certain company and they get expensive. Also, if you bring or rent a car, the parking is HORRIBLE at night!!! OMG There is virtually no where to park the entire time we stayed after 8 at night. We stayed for over a week. The front desk said something about it being a homeowners association and people can bring as many cars as they want to. So if you come back after a long day, and/or have small children with you, be prepared to park at the front building and walk for miles in the dark to your building. The claimed you can hop on one of their little buggys with the worker guys, but one night they never showed so we just had to walk in the dark to our building. We were already very tired and it felt unsafe to us, and wish we had just stayed somewhere like a Disney resort since we never have to bother with any of these issues. The perks are that the pool stays open till 11 at night, they let children ride on Segways, they have 2 hot tubs, and again, the kitchen, and very nice decor, but again, noise was horrible. Doubt we will ever come back again. Also, the food at the restaurant....one word>>>>>>>>>>>>>AWFUL!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent Hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: Linemon
Reviews.Content: Typically stay at a competitors timeshare resort/hotel property that also offers nightly stays, but a bad taste in my mouth there during my last stay prompted me to try somewhere else in area, and usually with Hilton's you can't go wrong. The many plus's here over many other resorts are the free parking and no resort fees. The property is still relatively new and is well kept up. The main pool was inviting and the hot tubs were nice. Nice pool bar nearby. I was in a studio unit in building one, which offered a microwave, sink, coffee maker and mini-refrigerator. Nicely styled current bathroom. King style bed was more comfortable than my own at home. Nice current decorating, flat screen tv and free wi-fi for your laptop, or multiple computers available in the business center. Screened in porch with table and two chairs. Centralized AC was quiet and the ceiling fan was a nice touch. Bad news is the construction of the walls between units allowing you to hear the screaming children next door. Secondly building one is in the shape of a U, and due to that you can hear the kids yelling to hear their echo in the center of the complex from the exterior hallways. Deli is available, but limited selection and the Pizza Hut didn't open until 4PM on the Thursday I was there, thereby not having a good lunch option. Good value afterall, with nicely landscaped property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Hilton Grand Vacation Club”
Reviews.Author: GerryNJ
Reviews.Content: We had a fantactic trip at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on international drive. We had a one bedroom suite which was fine for Two adults and two kids. The pull ou tcouch was extremely comfortable and didn't feel like a pull out at all. The Kitchen and laundry in room were extremely convienient. The staff was fantastic, so friendly and responsive to anything we needed. The location was great. Right in the middle of Universal, Seaworld and Disney. We only went to Universal and Sea world this trip but disney was close. I can't reccommend this hotel enough. I would definately stay there again. You need a rental car to get to the parks. Only negative is they need a good restaurant but there are plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Pepper02Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week at the end of March 2011/beginning April 2011. On arrival we were greeted by the staff and offered complimentary water. Check in was quick and easy and we were taken round to our room in building 2. Our room was very nice and exactly as described - had all the amenities we needed (toaster, kettle, microwave, fridge etc). The hotels grounds are lovely - 2 pools, 2 gyms, pizza hut, deli, pool bar/restaurant, free internet, bbq areas and concierge desk. We didn't eat at the pool bar but did use the pizza hut on a few nights because it was convenient after a full day out and the food was fine! The pools were nice, often busy during the day and the gyms had the key things you want in a gym! The concierge desk were brilliant - we booked the shuttle bus from them as we didn't have a car. Return shuttle from the hotel to disney, seaworld or universal is $6 per person which we thought was reasonable. You are limited by times (3 time slots in the morning and 3 in the afternoon/evening) but the shuttle buses were really punctual. We also got i-ride passes from there for the day ($4 for an unlimited day pass) - the i-ride stops right outside the hotel - its a cheap way to get up and down international drive if you're not limited by time (it can take ages for one to arrive!). This hotel was in a good location with the mall next door, Publix and Walgreens over the road as well as Outback Steakhouse and MacDonalds across the way as well. The only thing with the location is that if, like us, you haven't got a car you are limited with the food options (fast food basically) nearby so have to venture further if you want to go for something different! I would recommend this hotel to anyone - its good if you're a family or a couple and I would go back (except this time with a car just so we have more freedom).

Reviews.Title: “Great once again”
Reviews.Author: robsmustang
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in orlando for a visit to disney world and of course the daytona 500 up in daytona. We stayed at this hilton three years ago on our honeymoon. the hotel hasn't changed much. still has great staff and all the amenities that we remember. we would choose this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Fabulous Service, and GREAT Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Adam_Mandy
Reviews.Content: I am a very, very picky traveler. Cleanliness and quietude top my list of expectations for hotels. This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. From the moment I arrived, the property looked well manicured, clean, and welcoming. When I checked in, the staff was very helpful and pleasant. They were quick to provide me an overview of the area and tips on navigating it. The room ( I got a King Studio with kitchette and balcony) was emaculate- it looked like new. No nicks on the walls or furniture and CLEAN! I did have some trouble with the blowdryer provided with the room- but I called down to the front desk- and a BRAND NEW blowdryer in the original box was sent up immediately to replace the other one. That was amazing. Also, we had some trouble finding a parking space- as the hotel was at 100% capacity- so we ended up parking a ways away from our building... It could have been a negative- but management anticipated this, and the hotel shuttle was right there waiting for anyone who had to park in the last avail spaces-we were quickly escorted to our section. There are several shops within walking distance, and a fantastic outlet mall right next door. The pools were clean, gorgeous, and well maintained. This hotel is an EXCELLENT Value. I cannot recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at Tuscany”
Reviews.Author: archdent
Reviews.Content: We went for a second visit to Tuscany and had a much better time than the first time. Here's why: We got a unit away from the main pool and it was quiet. It was also a penthouse unit, so we didn't have anyone above us. The resort is now completed and is very nice. It is adjacent to the Premium Outlet Mall, which was packed Labor Day Weekend. We were able to park in the resort and walk through a little gate in the wall to the mall. There is everything you need within walking distance. I took the teens to Universal and the new Aquatica and dropped them off. The trips both took a minimal amount of time. No more standing in line at theme parks for me; I have done my time. I highly recommend the spa at Portofino Bay. You can drop the teens at Universal Studios and head to the spa. Arrange to meet them at City Walk at a certain time and you can be sipping Mojitos while you wait! Tuscany's features are very nice. The kitchen is modern and clean. The living room for the two bedroom lacks seating for a full family to watch a meeting, but you can either bring a chair from one of the bedrooms or the kids will lay on the floor with pillows. There is a Blockbuster machine inside the Publix across the street; the resort has movies, but not as big a selection. Just on the other side of I-4 there is just about every restaurant known to man. We ate a Golden Corral (not a good choice) and cooked in a few nights, after a great lunch at Cracker Barrel on the way there from Miami. There is so much to do in Orlando, Be sure and buy a local paper and see what's going on for free. There are tons of parks and concerts, etc. There are also sales in some of the outlets that you won't find unless you get the paper. Grab the coupons at the restaurants and hotels before going to the mall. (I stopped at the Thor-lo sock outlet by Universal Studios and got a deal-deal). There were so many activities for our teens at the resort, we were very happy just to relax while they checked out the dive in movie, the video game tournaments, etc. The security there is excellent and there are people riding around on those "Sequeway" vehicles - always with a smile on their face and ready to answer questions. We did not have housekeeping scheduled because we were only there for a long weekend, but if we needed anything, we just called and they brought it right up (extra towels, soap, etc.) Don't forget -- this is a timeshare resort and not a hotel, so the rules are very different. If you are not sure, ask. Close to Disney, Sea World; about 20 minutes from Universal (use Universal Boulevard). Coming from the South? Take Osceola Parkway and head west. The exit 535, take a right and go up to World Center Drive and take another right. Go straight until you see the left turn for International Drive; resort will be a few miles up on your left. (The directions on the web site may take you way out of your way - look at the map first). .

Reviews.Title: “Where can I park my car?”
Reviews.Author: rafatuma
Reviews.Content: Awesome resort. Pros: Nice location (about 15 minutes to Disney theme parks) Easy access from highways Nice and hot pool, open until 11 pm Just cross the street and you are at Premium Outlets Cons: Impossible to find a parking spot after 8pm. Need to leave your car at front desk and get a golf car. Comments: We went with 3 couples. 2 of them got upgrades to suites and 1 got the top floor without paying. I wasn’t even informed for a possible upgrade. I am very disappointed with the check in people about that.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand Vacations on International Drive Orlando FL”
Reviews.Author: Kama78
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from our Disney adventure in Orlando, staying at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club (HGVC) property on International Drive (also referred to as “Tuscany” due to the resort decor). We are owners, which probably makes us bias, however, during our stay we heard countless positive comments from first-time guests. Returnees would agree with them, and our sentiments were echoed many, many times. Guests, to include ourselves, love the accommodations as they are clean and include a complete kitchen for those who would like to save on eating expenses (so we can occasionally splurge at the Resort eateries). There are a Publix and Walgreens directly across the street, and an Orlando Outlet Mall is directly behind the HGVC property for all shopping conveniences. Public transportation is available just outside the gate as well. The resort itself offers the best in family fun, with an Activities Center that keeps children of all ages busy with exciting games and crafts as well as catering to the more mature guest when such a dynamic is present. We love to take romantic strolls at night around the Lagoon, and found a great alternative to the Resort Fitness Center treadmill early in the morning (as do others). The Lagoon also serves as a great educational experience for the little tykes. Personal favorites are the ducks, but the turtles and fish seem to be a big hit with the kids. As this was our first trip seeing the Resort through the eyes of a four-year-old, we were even more impressed with what we already saw as a great home away from home. Management and staff members go to great lengths to ensure that the guests of their Resort are made comfortable, happy and are thoroughly enjoying their experience. With that said, management is well aware of complaints with parking and have addressed this issue with a shuttle service as other alternatives are explored. The only other complaint we heard, and agreed with, was regarding guests leaving towels on the lounges at the pool and leaving the area for quite some time before returning to what is prime seating (we see this only during PEEK vacation periods). Posted signs prohibit this practice and advise that belongings could be removed, but that does not deter some guests. Our advice is to get to the pool early and obey the rules posted for all guests. We travel extensively so this writing is not from novices but from a couple that knows that any stay at Tuscany will exceed expectations, which is the primary reason it is our home away from home. Thank you HGVC Tuscany staff for making it so.

Reviews.Title: “If you're in orlando definitely stay here.....its awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Rowdy2003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the last part of march '11. This place is so nice. The grounds are immaculate and very well kept. All of the staff from the front desk to the maintenance were very friendly and courteous. Both the pools they have are heated and the main pool is huge. The room we had was very nice, the pictures on hiltons website don't do the room justice. This is our first time at a hilton and we will be back here on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was the highlight of our trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Cammando2317
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. We got a great rate and couldn't believe the quality of hotel it was. All rooms overlook a gorgeous lake with fountains, etc. The best part about the resort was the pool. It was incredible and is where we spent most of our time. It gets crowded and getting a chair can be difficult. Across the street is a Publix which is convenient because there is a small area in the rooms to make up a sandwich, utilize the fridge, etc. The location of the Hilton was great. Close to everything!! THe staff was awesome. They sent up a welcome basket to us, as this was a weekend of significance for us. When we go back to Orlando for Spring Training we will never stay anywhere else. It was a great experience. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort relatively close to everything”
Reviews.Author: mbflyflyaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a long weekend in January. This is a timeshare resort and is fully built-out. The buildings (7 total I believe) are well maintained and surround a beautiful lake. There are 2 pools, one large one and one smaller one. We loved everything about this resort (especially the bridge that crosses over the lake - an awesome walk at night), with the exception of the fact that the main pool was down for maintenance and no one told us when we booked or even checked in. It's obviously regularly scheduled, so they should do a better job of notifying guests ahead of time. Being January, not many people use the pools anyway, but it was still something we'd expect to know about ahead of time. The room (a 1 bedroom) was perfect for our needs. Plenty of space and all balconies are covered with netting so no need to worry about bugs. The hotel is adjacent to the Outlet Malls which makes for convenient quick shopping if desired (there are 2 special hotel entrances - key required - to access the mall). Parking was a bit tight if you came back too late in the evening, but with the pleasant Orlando weather, we didn't mind an occasional stroll. There was also a Pizza Hut express onsite. Highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Apartment @ Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BagzRPkd
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this hotel was the highlight of our most recent Disney experience. The parks were packed and it made for a stressful visit, but the highpoint was the lovely apartment at this facility at such a cheap price! We were concerned that at under $150 a night, we had gotten snookered somehow, but the place was very large, very nice, and within 10-15 minutes of the parks. The apartment has a large king bedroom, large living room with fold out couch, fully equipped kitchen (including washer/dryer), and large bathroom with jacuzzi tub. Perfect for when you don't want to share a room with your teens, but don't want to pay for a suite or two rooms at a Disney resort. Maids came daily and changed the towels and straightened up. The view of the back of the outlet mall was not so great, but the lake and landscaping is nice and the pools were well maintained. Kids enjoyed the ping pong, arcade room, pool volleyball. Only chain restaurants nearby, but with the money we saved on the hotel, we enjoyed nice dinners at the various disney resorts after a dip in the pool each night. Alternatively, there are lots of BBQs scattered around the grounds, alot of families seemed to eat in, and there's a Pizza Hut take out on the grounds. We would definately recommend this place to families who need a little extra space but want to be close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rachel_988
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the hilton for a 4 night stay and have to say i was pleasantly surprised. Being a travel agent i am generally very hard to please but it had absolutely everything you could want. Location wise it was a 2 minute walk from the hotel to a huge outlet mall with all your brands at very low prices. The hotel itself offered a pizza hut delivery as well as a range of other places to eat. There were loads of pools and the grounds were beautifully landscaped with greenery and lakes. The rooms were not huge but big enough for you to function, with a lot of storage space. Very comfortable beds. And lets face it when your somewhere like Orlando, how much time are you actually spending in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: blountch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got to stay at this hotel 3 nights in February and absolutely loved it. The rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable. The grounds are so beautiful (one of our favorite things) Their little lake in the middle with the bridge is the best. The pool is quite large and heated. Plus there are great dining options and fun things to do. And if you like shopping, the outlet mall right next door is a great fit. We'd definitely go and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: shamrock84
Reviews.Content: I worked for Marriott and Westin and stayed in many nice hotels. Having said that, it takes a lot for me to say I would stay somewhere again. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The rooms were spacious and clean. The maids were very friendly and helpful. The pools were well maintained. The woman that worked the pool bar made it a priority to talk to each person sitting by the pool to let them know she was there if they needed something. The front desk and bell people were extremely friendly and willing to give you advice or suggestions. The grounds were impecable, I didnt see the first sign of trash. If pressed to say what I didnt like, it would have to be the parking and the traffic around the hotel. Trying to get back to I-4 was a nightmare on a couple days( 30 min to go 1.5 miles). All in all though, a very pleasent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family resort...”
Reviews.Author: Middle_Aged_Man
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a big convention. Normally I would have picked a business hotel instead of a resort hotel, but Orlando was full. I ended up here and really enjoyed it. The suites (and they are all suites) were quite nice and well appointed. The staff was incredibly helpful and the grounds (the hotel covers a large area and incorporates several buildings around a large lake were very nice. The hotel is definitely geared toward the family and tourist market--it would be a great place to bring your family while visiting the amusement parks and a really good place to relax between Disney World and Universal Studios, etc. They have a lot of family activities (bingo at the pool, kid's "drive in" movies at night). This is NOT a place to go for a good night life. The bar (outdoors) is pleasant but slow and not a place to stay if you don't have a car. Other than a shopping mall, there is not a lot close by. GREAT free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: travelgal253
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful. My husband and I stayed here a few years ago for our wedding and honeymoon. Since then, we've returned to the Orlando area on different occasions and have tried different hotels and timeshare resorts. This property however, by far, is our favorite. We're excited to just have made a future booking (RCI exchange) for this property as well, looking forward to our return. You will not be disappointed when staying here, it's exquisite. Also, if anyone was ever looking to be an owner in a timeshare property, this would be it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great price”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaKate
Reviews.Content: Large condo-like buildings surrounding a lake with 2 pools on either end. Our studio with kitchenette/screened balcony was $99. Beautiful landscaping, right behind Premium Outlets and across the street from Publix grocery store. Has a small deli onsite.Very friendly staff. Can be noisy if in building near main pool. Request room not on ground level for balcony privacy. Quiet location - do need to have a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: pemeigh
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely place, however the TV's are outdated, and my biggest complaint is no in room movies, and forget room service (there is none). Without a rental car you will spend a lot of time on the trolley going from one end to the other like I did. Also, I wasnt able to check in till 4pm when they knew I was arriving early. I would probably NOT stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone, but otherwise decent overall...”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights while trying out a few hotels in Disneyworld and found that this hotel just wasn't convenient as I didn't have a car this trip (usually i do have a rental). This meant taking a taxi everywhere or each time I was coming or going to Disneyworld as their discounted shuttle rates of $6 per person daily had limited times for each leg. The rooms themselves were quite clean and very large, just bad luck that my location had a view of some parking lot and was relatively far away from the main entrance which was a decent hike. The outlet mall next to the resort was pretty decent and definitely walkable. The service staff was relatively pleasant and anywhere from good to above average. No real Hilton benefits from status since its really some sort of timeshare type place for the most part. That being said, I think that this place is fine for those people that want to relax a bit more and stay outside somewhat of the Disney craziness. As far as convenience to the parks, its possible, but I wouldn't recommend it if you have young kids and need the flexibility and convenience of Disney Transportation. Lastly, while there was free Wi-Fi, the fees were outrageous to use their wired computers or printers in the small computer business area (something like 75 cents a page or 50 cents a min for surfing....not sure of the exact numbers, but just sort of an insult.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: John60612
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2010 during a stay in Orlando for a business conference. The room was excellent, with kitchenette and private balcony overlooking the large lake in the center of the complex. Giant outlet mall right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic resort”
Reviews.Author: hotdub
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2010 with my husband on our honeymoon. Got a great deal on this through 1800-hotels for about €120 per night(would have paid three times that)- stayed 14 nights.We were a little daunted by the sheer size of the place at first and had read some reviews after we had booked that warned of persistant timeshare salesmen calling at all hours of the day. So we were a little nervous of our decision to stay here. I have to say we did not have one phone call from any timeshare sales reps. Absolutly loved this resort. Exceeded our expectations. Had a 1bd whirlpool apartment & it had everything you could possible need. A home away from home. Shopping centre accross the road, premium outlet mall next door. Because it was our honeymoon the children were left at home. They would have loved it though! One evening after a day at the parks we were having a drink at the pool bar, the hotel had put on a "dive in movie" for the children. fantastic. Im bringing my children there this year on their summer hols and just hope the hotel keeps up their high standards.Only negative was the fight for car park spaces each evening if you got back late from parks but other than that, Cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: AngloAsian
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised by this place. It's very big but set in beautiful grounds surrounding a large lake. We were on an RCI exchange and had a 2-bedroom suite that was large enough to live in. Everything was there that we could have wished for and wonderfully clean. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Directly opposite (in walking distance) are outlet stores and a massive supermarket - very convenient. The only minor negative thing was that you have to pay to use their computer if you don't have your own (free Wi-Fi).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jesathome
Reviews.Content: Just a get away week end for my husband and myself to Orlando. Hotel was in a good location, very easy to get to. Nice, clean, spacious rooms. Spread out buildings. Nice having pizza delivery to room and convenient little deli with breakfast items. The only thing negative is the 10 am check out.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fabulous resort with a beautiful lagoon for swimming and relaxinglocated next to Prime Outlets.”
Reviews.Author: funinsun02
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again. Everything was wonderful!!! Located near mass transit. Take the trolley or the bus. Can get to local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, Great staff - would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: SuMacd
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay here for 26 nights! We stayed in a fully equipped 1-bedroom suite which allowed us to cook meals. Housekeeping attended every day-emptied trash, changed towels,made bed & loaded dishwasher. Also replaced washing-up liquid, soap powder,coffee & toiletries. We were initially given a room which overlooked outlet car park, but, I immediately phoned & the bell-boy appeared in a couple of minutes with cards for our new room which overlooked the smaller swimming pool. It also had no interconnecting doors- suited us perfectly. We had a shower & large jacuzzi bath. We had free wi-fi in our room which we used every day. Good enough to Skype.We only had one morning where it did not work. Staff worked very hard & were at all times pleasant & helpful. Grounds were very well kept. Parking appeared to be getting busier but usually staff on buggys were availabe to transport guests, A Publix supermarket is across the road . The I-trolley leaves from the Outlet Mall or outside the front gate. Tickets need to be bought at resort reception before going on trolley. Attended timeshare talk at Parc Soleil - worthwhile to get half-price tickets for Epcot- other options available Thoroghly enjoyed our first visit to Florida. Also found this a good base for visiting other parts of Florida. Would return again in January - only state in USA which did not have snow while we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Was a great stay”
Reviews.Author: router1313
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. Its huge with 7 buildings . The Pool was awesome and the rooms are big and bright. Housekeeping is not that great .overall great place to stay and will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but don't expect any sleep”
Reviews.Author: Litl1
Reviews.Content: Pros-The staff is fantastic and goes out of their way to be helpful and make you feel welcome. The grounds are immaculate and the rooms are clean. CONS-The studio room has a tile entry way that magnifies sound from the exterior courtyard. Room had an adjoining door and thin walls which allowed our neighbors' conversations/activities to keep us up all night.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: JuJuTN
Reviews.Content: While this IS a Hilton, and we generally LOVE the accommodation & service experienced there, this one was a real dud. The staff was non-attentive and there was NO wi-fi as stated, in the room. The entire building's wireless connection was not working. The room was lovely; the bed divine! My husband and I were interested in learning more about the Hilton Vacation Club, yet when we asked for a brochure to learn more about the program, we were told we would need to stay and attend a meeting. Our time was limited, and we thought it would have been helpful to read a little about the program before spending valuable time 'meeting' about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay For Pleasure Trips”
Reviews.Author: Mr242
Reviews.Content: For the typical traveller like me, it was a wonderful experience to stay here. From the front gate my fiancé' and I were greeted with nothing but smiles. I think they train their staff to smile all day. The room was excellent, clean and surprisingly huge. Most hotel rooms in resorts that I have stayed have been tacky, shabby, dirty and small, but the room at the HGVC was exceptional. Staff catered to our every beck and call. It was about 48 degrees when we stayed last week and when we called down for more blankets, we got them. They even provided heated blankets for us. A stop off the club house, and there was Olive Garden, Red Lobster and Chili’s brought to our rooms, fresh from the restaurant. (For an additional fee off-course) But that was fine by us. We went jogging every morning and evening around the spacious grounds , stopped off at the gym and pumped some iron then off to the game room where we had fun, reminded us of child hood days and shopping right next door to the Premium Outlets was outstanding. Very close to 99% of the attractions in Orlando and easy to find. The two problems that we encountered were that we stayed in Villa di Falconni and when we got in at nights which were around 10pm, we would have to park almost at the entrance. the upside to that is, we always caught one of the many golf carts patrolling the grounds, to and from the building that housed our room & they made you pay for using their computers to surf, it was like $1.00 per minute which is outrageous but free Wi-Fi was offered in the rooms. Having said that, I will return this summer with the 3 kids and the wife and we will have a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and great shopping close by.”
Reviews.Author: Horsebox09
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Only problem we felt with it was the distance if is from the theme parks and bars. You either need to hire a car or get taxis every which are not that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever! Beats everyone else hands down!”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed999
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at lots of top hotels and time share...this is by far and away the best. Fantastic location with the facility to walk (unusual in Orlando) across to a fantastic shopping outlet, and go out to dine at night without taking a car. Buses and trolleys can all be picked up from the main road taking you to all of the attractions. The resort itself was spotlessly clean...both inside and out. Staff were incredibly polite and efficient and the facilities were second to none. Even using the Grand Floridian, the Waldorf Astoria (New York), the Little Nell (Aspen), and any Fairmont Hotel as a measuring stick, ....the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on International Drive is above them all. It ticks all the boxes and more!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: T2quaile1324
Reviews.Content: To start our trip off I had two rooms booked for myself and partner and then for my mother and nephew. The room that my mother was given had been slept in and trash all over so it was never cleaned. I gave her my room so I could deal with the issues. They put us into another room to which it looked ok. Then to find that what appeared to be feces on the bathroom door and long hair on the floor. So making them aware of this issue not once but twice and being told this would be cleaned ASAP. This is a hazardous issue seeing that hepatitis can be spread from feces. Having a 2year old that touches everything you can see my need to worry about brown markings on a bathroom door. Not until the 2nd time calling them and telling them to move my room. I was offered an upgraded room. Since then the 3rd room has been great and clean. To sum things up you have to tell them what you want if you have issues with anything. They will not offer ANYTHING for your trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Orlando !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WMK46891
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at HGVID for four nights in Jan '11... Considered a lot of different Orlando motels/hotels before booking at HGVID. Was not disappointed. Real nice place, great location, super friendly staff (prob the friendliest hotel staff we have ever encountered), an overall great value for the cost.... We had a studio room which was big enough for two. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Bathroom, patio and kitchennette area was good. We used the paid upfront non-refundable option to get best price possible and we booked about 10 days before our arrival date. Car travel is easy in an out on Vineland Ave. and you are in center of all the Orlando action....you are close to everything. You can get most everywhere in 10-15 minutes. Publix right accross street is a nice convenient bonus. We had read in reviews that parking was sometimes tight but we found parking was easy (free as some places charge for parking) and we were always able to get a spot in front of our building (we stayed in bld #2) no matter what time we returned at night. No pressure for timeshare sales after we turned down free TS info breakfast at check-in. Not contacted re: TS sales during our entire vist after check-in...so if you are concerened about being hassled you do not have to worry if you opt to not attend the breakfast. The ability to walk to the adjacent Premium Outlet Center using keycard exit is also great feature that we used a number of times. We did not use the pool as the weather was on cool side but it is AAA+++ pool and definitely would have spend time there if the weather was warmer...but it was January and 65-70 degress was terrific compared to 20's back home even if not ideal pool weather. We could not get the wireless internet to work in our room but used cable internet option they had in room and it worked just fine. SUMMARY: HGVID is a great alternative to typical Orlando hotels...but way more bang for the buck and, again, super convenient location. There was really nothing to be unhappy about regarding our stay...way exceeded our expectations. I would definitely stay here again on a future trip to Orlando....

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Spotlessly Clean & Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: SilverBirches
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Vacations Club primarily as our daughter is currently working for Walt Disney World and it is located close to her apartment and because the rooms have fully fitted kitchens as my daughter wanted some "home cooking". The rooms were spotlessly clean and the kitchen contained everything required to make a roast dinner etc. The pool area was great and the staff very helpful and pleasant. The location of the hotel is great - all the main attractions are within 1/2 hour drive. We would definitely recommend this hotel to families who don't want to eat fast food 24 hours a day and like a home cooked meal! We did get a bit fed up of the large portion sizes and fried foods so a healthy salad without tons of dressing on it was most welcome. For people who get fed up of the heavy food, we would definitely recommend "Seasons 52".

Reviews.Title: “Overall an excellent resort, but a few bumps along the way”
Reviews.Author: POKtraveler10
Reviews.Content: The property itself is spectacular, and the staff is excellent. Our room was well appointed, and clean, except for the one day in which our room did not receive housekeeping. We called the front desk, and their records said the room was clean, when it was clearly not. We asked to have the garbage and old towels removed, and for new towels to be delivered. When the towels arrived, we were told we would have to move the garbage and old towels ourselves to outside the room. Clearly unacceptable. Also, the bathtub is downright dangerous, with a smooth surface and no grab bar. I'm 45 years old, and was terrified of slipping in the tub when it became soapy on the very smooth surface. They need a different surface, bath mats, or a grab bar, or some combination. Finally, the location is OK, but under no circumstances should you try to exit by driving towards the outlet malls on Vineland Ave. Go to International Drive, and head to I-4 and the theme parks that way. We tried going around in front of the outlets (as recommended by the Front Desk) and literally took one hour to travel what could be little more than a mile. Extraordinarily frustrating. Having said all of this, we might return to this property. There are a lot of positives, and would hope the housekeeping issue would not repeat itself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, shame about the staff!”
Reviews.Author: del8395
Reviews.Content: Our choice of hotel was suggested by our travel agent who recommended this hotel as an alternative to our usual stay when in Orlando. We frequently visited the hotel website in excited anticipation of our stay. True to the website photographs the hotel is beautifully laid out and really close to all the location leisure attractions. We have been a few times to Orlando and know our way around there pretty much. So We tend to spend less time doing all the usual rushing around seeing this and that and visit the things we only really interested in. Giving, us more time to chill and relax. One of the unique advertised features of the hotel is its lakeside BBQ areas. We planned on two occasions to use these facilities. On both occasions we had to call the engineer to light the BBQ. The second time we had to wait for more than and hour & half before they came to light it, by which time the sun had set and we had to try cooking our food in the dark and cold. What a let down...... as this was the last day before leaving for our cruise the next day. During our stay, we believe someone had attempted to get into our electronic room safe. This necessitated the security man to come and open the safe on our behalf. The safe has an automatic cut out system if the wrong number is entered more than three times. No further enquire was made by the staff as to why this may have occurred. We sometime later realised that a small amount of our UK money my wife had left in the room (£60) had gone missing in addition to a pair of gloves. As indicated by other posts we were harassed by the concierge trying to get us to attend a sales meeting of their new time share apartments. After seven times of telling the woman we were just not interested, I rudely had to ask her 'what part of no don't you understand?' Only then did she get the message. We had booked our hotel in advance before our cruise (12 days) and (2) days after the return from our cruise. Again on the last evening before our cruise we were seriously let down by the hotel staff. We waited for more than hour for our luggage to be collected by the bell boy, in the end we pushed the luggage trolley ourselves as we were already late for an evening appointment. The hotel staff were full of excuses that they were short staffed, but its not something I expected to hear, had we been told this prior to waiting the hour it wouldn't have been a problem and we would not have been late for our appointment with friends. We had a similar issues with the hotel staff when returning after our cruise. Our travel agent made a mistake in booking us into the hotel a day early whilst we were still on our cruise. We were greeted by the reception team with 'you should have been here yesterday! We were taken a bit aback by the of the receptionist's attitude. We had not realised that a mistake had been made. They were not prepared to credit us with the error for the unused room. We were further told" the room is booked at a reduced rate anyway, so we wouldn't be inclined to offer a refund or room upgrade on that basis.' you need to sort it with your travel agent.' We were stunned by the poor attitude. After getting our room keys we then waited almost forty minutes for a bell boy to collect our luggage and take it to our room. The bell boy arrived with a Mc Donald's milkshake in his hand. I leave you to think what our thoughts were......... Its true we could have left the bags to be brought over to the room later, however we had some fragile items in the bags and needed them to be treated with some care. Some things you need to know about the hotel. It is a massive place with apartments built around a large lake. Luggage and guests etc are ferried around too their apartments by small trucks. Only specific members of the hotel staff are permitted to drive the trucks, so if you don't drive you have to wait for these to be available. I believe that the site was previously all timeshare apartments, which are now being reverted to a hotel complex, due to the fall in the timeshare market. The swimming pools, gyms, games rooms etc are some of the best we have visited in our worldwide trips. The rooms are ok, but dated, the carpets in both rooms could have done with a clean, or replacement. The televisions are dated. The tv channel hotel welcome page is one of the poorest I have seen. Check the the adjoining door is locked to your room as we had children coming to our room after we had gone to bed 00.30! Our fault for not checking the door was locked on our side.. If you are located to a room near the lifts, the lift pings all day and night on each floor. The corridors are open air with quay tiles. Four to six storey high As people are arriving day and night there is a lot of noise from luggage trolleys, children and the closing of the heavy apartment doors. The beds are comfortable, and the rooms are cleaned daily. The drinking water is horrible, full of chlorine. BAthrooms are excellent and clean & the water hot. All rooms have balconies over looking a big lake. The balconies have netting, keeping out the bugs, which was really great. Charging for the use of telephone was really good for local calls. The hotel is rated as a five star, I would rated it as three based on our experience. Would we stay there again, no way! if anything I would like to kick them in the pants, especially the concierge team, who need some lessons in good customer care.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation & service response”
Reviews.Author: Jasminelive
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay and service has been top rate. We requested for a small screwdriver at the concierge to tighten a tiny screw for our son's eye glass and a service man was sent to our room with a tool box. He managed to whip out the right screwdriver and gave excellent service by waiting for us while we carry out the job and helped us to search for the tiny screw when it was accidentally dropped on the floor. Our hats off to him. Overall a fantastic holiday and great accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “4th stay just as good.”
Reviews.Author: EMUP
Reviews.Content: I think we have stayed in every room possible and done everything possible in our four stays. We love it and keep saying next year we will go somewhere else but end up right back there at least for a few days. This was stop two on our tour around Florida and we did think of staying somewhere else for about two seconds and then thought why reinvent the wheel. My kids love the entertainment by the pool. We try and stay at the hotel as many evenings as we can as we love the atmosphere by the pool and find it so relaxing to hang out there. Supermarket nearby and outlets next door. Can't beat the location for getting to all the parks. We are however going somewhere else next year.....or are we????

Reviews.Title: “Very advisable for families on vacation. Not so much for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: marco_and_nadine
Reviews.Content: Attending exhibition in Orlando and in need for an hotel last minute, I found a good deal with this HVC. Now, this place is really advisable for families on vacation and lots of idle time to spend. Lots of space, very nice pool, well maintained (it's a new resort). However there is a very important point to remember: this is NOT an hotel in the traditional way, but rather a time-share property, where the rooms have they own mini-kitchen. So, if you are in a business trip you might find annoying and time consuming the big walking distances between reception and your room (which can be wherever in one of the buildings within the resort). Also there is NO dedicated room for breakfast, so you have to go to the Deli/Starbucks within the resort and have your breakfast there. Again, this could be surely nice for a vacationer, much less for a limited-time business traveler. Two general considerations: the resort is at the south end of International Drive, so a little far from the center of the action (which you can join by taxi - 20 min- or by bus - 45 min and more). The only interest at walking distance (litterally 4 minutes) is the huge Outlet Shopping mall which guarantees hours of good shopping. The only really annoying things are the fact that the room walls are REALLY thin, and, above all, that it is impossible to completely shut off the a/c system in your room, so that even if you don't need it, it will go on during the night, adding noise and cold air to your sleeps. I will end with a very positive note regarding the free wifi connection at the room. Working really well and fast. This is something that a business traveler always enjoys.

Reviews.Title: “Just excelent”
Reviews.Author: Jezini
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing. Rooms were like new and everything worked as expected. It is very close to Disney and has a door directly to Premium Outlets Vineland. As we were there on Black Friday/2010 this easy access to the mall and back was very useful. No complaints and had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for my family.”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMonkey1969
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to take a mini vacation right here at home (we live in Orlando.) So to do it up right, we chose to use our points here and do all the theme parks since the kids are no longer babies. This place gave us everything we needed for our vacation. A full kitchen with everything you need, an awesome jacuzzi tub in the room (that fit two kids perfectly) and the beds were very comfortable. After a long day walking a Disney park, it was great to come back here and rest up before the next long day of walking. The only drawback was parking...the lot was full if you stayed out too late but the staff was great by picking you up at your car and take you to your building and then vice versa. The place is huuuuuge!

Reviews.Title: “WOW - just amazing”
Reviews.Author: leeregan
Reviews.Content: This is one of the greatest hotels we have ever stayed in. The grounds are magnificent the pools are amazing. Pizza Hut delivered to your door. AND the BEST of ALL is your right next door to the largest outlet stores Premium outlets... you have your key card so you can go back and forward from your hotel room to the outlet stores with all your purchases :) No need to take the cars...

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenhan1311
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got married and we went to USA for our honeymoon. We've stayed 5 days at this hotel and we felt very special in the way that they've treated us. They were very friendly and helpful. You can go shopping in the Prime outlet Mall just by walking. The trolley that drives the whole International Drive stops in front of the Hotel. Room is clean, only a little noisy sometimes, but that didn't bother us very much. Great view, great service.... We've got a nice detail for our honeymoon, 1 bottle of White Zinfandell and chocolate strawberries. We're definitly going to stay at this hotel again in the future!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Service, Super Surroundings, Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: djkiwi
Reviews.Content: Just back from seven nights in the HGVC on International Drive and couldnt be more impressed. To a person the staff were pleasant, professional and eager to help. From the friendliness of the cleaning staff to the helpfullness of the bellboys I just couldnt fault the staff. We had a studio apartment which was perfect for the two of us and it was cleaned every day to a great standard. Huge beds are so comfortable you just dont want to wake up. The pool and jacuzzis are super and even in November there was a nice buzz around the pool with live music, games and the coolest big screen movie screen they errect for dive in movies. Small requests like late check out were not a problem so really struggling to find any complaints. In terms of location its a shoppers haven with a key card to access the Premium Outlets next door. Taxis are quite pricey in Orlando with Disney c$15 and Universal $22 but if you use the iRide Trolley which has a stop just outside the door you can sample all of International Drive for $1.25 a journey. Limited dining options on site but to be fair the poolside food is really tasty and reasonable and the coffee shop has a buffet breakfast that looked tasty although I don't eat breakfast myself. If dining out the Pointe (stop 24 on the trolley) has a nice selection of restaurants and I would recommend Cuba Libre and the Italian as the best. One bit of advice avoid the Outback Steakhouse across the road from the hotel, went there the night we arrived just out of convenience and it was very poor. You will get much better if you head up to the Pointe. As for Orlando, we'll be back asap. 7 days no way near long enough to see and do everything. Of the parks Universal Islands of Adventure was superb and Disney a great day out but dont expect as much fun rides as Universal. Went to Kennedy on a day trip by coach but would recommend to drive yourself as you can really see it all in half a day.

Reviews.Title: “comfort, convenience , nice resort”
Reviews.Author: mickychan
Reviews.Content: It a great resort . We booked a suite which accomodated a full kitchen , a separate bed room has one king bed and sofa bed in the living room. There are washer and dryer machine in the room. It is very convenience. The bathroom also has a jacuzzi . We really enjoy our trip .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location coupled with excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: towerdiy
Reviews.Content: 5 of us (4 adults and a 5 year old) had a fantastic 7 days at the HGVC International Drive. We had a top floor 3 bedroom unit in the newest block (no. 7) of this excellently located resort. The unit was well furnished and provided all we needed for a week of touring the local attractions. On the 1 day we decided to take a rest from the parks the non-shoppers amongst us enjoyed the resorts large swimming pool and deck while the shoppers went to the premier outlet stores which are next to the resort. (they even provide a keyed access to the outlet). I cannot stress enough how convenient this resort is for touring all the parks. Seaworld , Discovery Cove, and Aquatica are 5 mins drive away while the entrance to Disney World is approx 10 mins drive away. We will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what happened here...”
Reviews.Author: dbadalov
Reviews.Content: We checked in expecting a 2-bedroom suite. What we got instead was a 2-bedroom lock-off. Having two young children, this was not an option. I called the front desk where I was told that nothing could be done because all 2-bedroom suites were booked up. I ended up calling my friend who is the owner of this timeshare, who ended up calling Hilton Grand Vacations directly, and within 5 minutes we were being moved into a real 2-bedroom suite. WAIT.. I THOUGHT THOSE WERE NOT AVAILABLE? Let me also add that there was a wad of hair in the tub of the original suit.. Once our logistical issues were resolved, there were only some minor ones like sand in the bathtub (wondering how well they actually cleaned?), a dishwasher that was so loud I could hear it in the bathroom with the door closed, the oven that wasn't thoroughly cleaned from the previous occupants that resulted in black smoke filling the room when I turned it on. I am very conflicted about coming back. We were actually considering this resort for a timeshare purchase, but I am no longer certain.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ivyrobinson
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in orlando so we didn't much about the area. We programmed our GPS and everything and everywhere we wanted to go was within 10 miles. The hotel was awesome I recommend this place to everyone including families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: bethpager
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weeks stay at this great hotel. everything was perfect from the location to the pools and grounds to the huge suite. we stayed in room 7806 which was the top floor of building 7. the desk clerk Alicia gave us a beautiful room and was exceptionaly friendly. the large pool with the bar was great. Ana served us and she went above and beyond to find us in the pool area to deliver our food and drinks. the grounds are really beautiful with a lake and walking path which goes around the lake. hilton has really provided its guest with the best, from the room ammenities to the location to the staff. we are very particular about hotels and we will definetly come back here. thanks to all the staff. if anyone has ?'s about our stay here please e-mail!

Reviews.Title: “superb experience”
Reviews.Author: julia_harvey2
Reviews.Content: Having exchanged for many years and several times in Orlando, this is the first time my husband and I could not fault our apartment or the complex. We requested and were allocated an apartment in a villa overlooking the lake and fountain. Very quiet even though it was the height of the holiday season, really comfortable bed and spacious apartment. The pools obviously were busy during the day and so as a serious swimmer I would get up early and walk to the pool, do my laps with one or two other serious swimmers( main pool is huge) and walk back over the bridge with the sun rising and hot on my back, watch the ducks and turtles in the lake, a few joggers out and perfect silence, bliss. Grounds were immaculate, staff the friendliest and most courteous ever encountered. There was a buggy kept going round the blocks so no problem if you had to park away from your villa, and even if you were just out for a stroll they would stop and ask if you needed a lift anywhere. Security was ever present, very tight at the main entrance even used to get a salute, and staff again very friendly. Just opposite our villa was the gate to the factory outlets, using your swipe card, crossing the road were all the shops you need. However if you want upmarket stores ie Saks Fifth Avenue, Nordstrum etc for a dedicated shopper like myself was just 15 minutes away, an car is a must to get around and see other areas especially in the 90degree heat we encountered. We went to view a Tiffany exhibition at the Morse museum of American Art in Winter Park, turned out to be a beautiful little town with tree lined streets and lots of individual boutiqes and restaurants. Best experience of the visit has to be Le Cirque du Soleil, worth every penny, breathtaking displays from acrobats, never seen anything like it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the family of all ages.”
Reviews.Author: tcraigred
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute get away which totally surpassed all my expectations. Check in was quick and easy. Rooms were nice, comfy beds. We requested an extra blanket, it was delivered quickly and 10 minutes later I received a call to verify we received our request and it met our needs. The pool area is beautiful! There is a quiet adult pool area, away from the busier family area. The lazy river is wonderful and beautifully landscaped. Our family participated in a volleyball game. The older boys golfed on the mini course. Husband loved the fitness center. Staff was always friendly and very helpful. Couldn't have asked for a better stay. Can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant resort!”
Reviews.Author: GraceKavanagh
Reviews.Content: Loved this place very friendly staff. Pool area is amazing. Would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “The best resort we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: lindalarsen
Reviews.Content: big rooms - everything is in super-standard - nice pool - nice people and great location

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: TanaMichigan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from an 11 day stay at this beautiful hotel. We do not belong to the timeshare. I came across this property on trip advisor and liked the resort type feel. My daughter is 30 years old and has been ill for the past 10 years and has not been able to travel. She has been better of late and I wanted to treat her to a fabulous vacation at a beautiful property and I certainly found that in the Hilton Grand. It totally surpassed my expectations! When we first arrived I asked for a beautiful view on a higher floor. I did not think that my request would be granted since I was not a club member, but to my surprise not only did I recieve a gorgeous view overlooking the pond on the 4th floor, but I was given a suite in Bldg.7 one of the newest Bldg. Never once were we asked to sit through a timeshare meeting either. Our suite was spectacular and we loved the screened in balcony where we drank our coffee in the mornings and played cards in the evenings. It had a ceiling fan that kept us cool too. The pools were gorgeous and the grounds well kept. We really enjoyed the salads at the snack bar down by the pool. Apple salad was great too, and reasonably priced at $8. I did think that the Margarita's at the bar were a little high though....$17 for two. Housekeeping was not a problem either. Girls worked hard! Be sure to tip, they deserve it. In the future, if this property is offered to the public for the great rate that I received, I will definitely be going back. We loved this place and had a fantastic time!!

Reviews.Title: “2010 Ace Teachers conference”
Reviews.Author: boyscoutsteve
Reviews.Content: Although our reserved rooms were overbooked, the young lady at the desk, Niki worked with us and made our stay a pleasure. We had 3 rooms reserved but, due to over booking they were unavailable. She managed to find us a suite with roll out bed accomadations and made it possible. Kudos to Niki, she did a great job and was very effecient and made it all perfectly painless. Definite management potential. Due to our hectic schedules, there is no way we could have possibly made all of our appts work without Niki's unending efforts to help us out. We will definitely use The Hilton hotel chain for all of our travel needs and again this is all due to the help of this young lady. Thank you. Sincerely, Stephen C. Page Room 771 2861 Sanborn Ave Naples Fl. 34120 239-403-4436

Reviews.Title: “Husband says, "best vacation ever."”
Reviews.Author: 2ndglance
Reviews.Content: You couldn't possibly be disappointed with these suites -- roomy, clean, well-appointed and generally quiet -- but I'll give you the downside first: It is a resort-type property, so they will try to get you to join their vacation club (this is pretty common in Orlando, even Disney and Universal do their pitch), but if you're not interested, just tell them that you're not interested/ready/able to commit to a timeshare sort of thing. Also, the toilet was a bit loud, but that's probably due to the sound echoing in a bathroom that is larger by itself than most other whole hotel rooms. No worries about water pressure, and the shower alone was about the size of the total square footage of other hotel bathrooms. We've traveled a lot, so we're not easily impressed, but the staff here was awesome, and the only time we heard other guests was when we accidentally fell asleep without closing one of the two doors to the screened balcony. The screen is a great touch if you're traveling with young children and/or if you want to sit outside without bugs joining you. We made the most of the full kitchen too (equipped with pots, pans, dishtowels, paper towels, plates, flatware, blender, coffee maker, toaster, and dishwasher with detergent) to have some real sit-down meals and even bake cookies (a rare treat for this busy family). There is a real grocery store literally right across the street from the hotel, and we used the UPS store in the same plaza to send things home. I normally prefer to ship my dirty laundry home rather than lug it back in a suitcase, but there wasn't much need for that this time -- the suites have a washer & dryer right off the bathroom. I did, however, opt to buy my own detergent rather than use the kind provided by the hotel (I have sensitive skin) and then I used UPS to ship home the rest of my detergent, plastic wrap, foil, and unused non-parishable food at the end of the week. In theory, there is plenty of parking, and it is free, but don't expect to be right in front of your building if you come home after about 10pm. On the other hand, you don't need to drive that often since many shopping venues (from Nike and Champion to Burberry and Coach) and personal services (several nail & hair salons) are either adjacent or across the street. Right on the property, there's a deli (with Boar's Head brand!), Pizza Hut Express, a friendly poolside bar, and even a little shop that sells pool toys at surprisingly low prices (like $11 for a lifesize alligator or shark float). Oh, and free wireless internet too! They also have a full menu of activities each day, like playing Wii games on a giant inflatable screen near the pool, ice cream socials, and even a beer tasting. Of course, most don't normally choose to visit Orlando for the pretty rooms and waterfall in the pool, but it's nice to find all this within a few minutes drive (or shuttle ride) of the theme parks. While you're there, make an effort to check out our favorite Orlando restaurant, Thai Thani, which happens to be close by; order the chicken satay even if you're not a big fan of Thai food. We've visited them several times in the last 6 yrs and every meal was just wonderful, so it was just a bonus that the front desk gave us a discount coupon for a place that we couldn't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “New manager needed”
Reviews.Author: katgirl21
Reviews.Content: I stayed in here for a week on my Honeymoon. Apartments were so nice,comfy beds,lovely kitchen and really helpful staff all but the manager. Its awhile since we stayed now but only just figured out how to post comment.Sori It was the last night of our honeymoon in orlando things couldn't have been any better. We had been in Disneyworld all day and on our return to our apaertments found our room door left open. This was a little frightening as we were unsure if someone was inside or worse had we been robbed. To cut a long story short someone had been in our room ate some of our stuff and had left our apartment door open.We reported this to the lovely girl in reception who was shocked called the manager who tock at least 20 mins to arrive .On the managers arrival he as much as told us we were making this up and he would call security. After a half hour wait for security and due to it being the last night of our honeymoon we told him we could wait no longer and could he look into it.He was to ask security to call to apartment and we were going to check was anything missing .Security gard we have yet to see no one called. At no stage did anyone from the Hilton come and say sorry or offer any type of reason. When we woke the next day there was a letter under our door we thought it might be to say sori but no it was a bill for .35c for a local call to order a pizza from there complex. We paid €1000 for our stay here and it really was a lovely place but never again our passports or money could have been stolen and who would have cared not the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value on I-Drive”
Reviews.Author: kyhoma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really a hotel, but six or seven buildings in a complex centered around a lake. The buildings look all more or less alike, but differ in proximity to the central pool and recreation area. Building Nr. 1, for instance, faces almost directly onto the main pool area. Building Nr. 2, where we stayed, was far enough from the pool to be quiet, but not so far that it was an inconvenience to walk back and forth. That being said, the bridge that crosses the lake connects the resort in such a way that none of the buildings is isolated. There is a second pool in the "back" area of the resort, with a seasonal bar as well as a Pizza Hut restaurant (which delivers). There is an activity center, with planned activites for all ages (mostly centering around the pool area), as well as billiard and chess tables, etc. The resort is directly next door to a huge outlet mall, and across the street is a Walgreens drug store and a Publix grocery store, both open 24 hours, which is convenient if you are late arriving. The location is on the far south end of International Drive, which doesn't really matter since you need a car in Orlando, no matter where you stay. The rooms are brilliant...roomy and nicely furnished. The kitchen has all the necessities, and a washer and dryer are there, as well. A Starbucks/Deli serves breakfast. A bar and restaurant offer poolside service, but we found it to be a bit overpriced. We reserved a one bedroom, which had plenty of room for three of us (using a fold-out sofa in the living room). We had a lovely stay and would recommend this resort to anyone spending some time in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beverley29
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely resort, beautiful suites, very clean and well appointed with great facilities and very polite and helpful staff. Very close to Disneyworld, Seaworld, Discovery Cove, Universal Studios. Great choice of restauarants and shops all within easy reach, huge mall next door. We had two 3 bedroom suites for 8 adults, they were so spacious and comfortable. The beds were huge and we slept really well. The bathrooms were beautiful, we had a huge whirlpool bath in the master bedrooms, which was bliss at the end of the days spent walking miles around the theme parks! The resort itself is lovely, the pools, pool bar, the deli and all the facilities are excellent. All the public areas are kept clean and tidy. All the staff were polite and helpful. Somehow 1 apartment missed its midweek clean and housekeeping sent a maid during the evening, as well as leaving extra towels. I couldn't log on to the PC in the lounge to check in online for the flights home, so the guy on reception did it for me and printed all our boarding cards too! The only complaint we had was that we arranged so much to do we didn't have enough time to enjoy the resort! we would have loved to have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Just Relax”
Reviews.Author: Gernsbid
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip to celebrate my wife's birthday. As a Hilton Honors member I am all too aware of the standard Hilton has set regarding comfort, safety, amenities, and cleanliness. In writing this review I will hit on some of the highlights and then give some negative insight also so as to allow readers to make a fully informed decision. The Pros: The location, if anyone is headed to the Orlando area in order to hit the theme parks, is incredible. Unless you stay on the property of the theme park you could not stay closer. The security is amazing. Constantly patroling and keeping things in order and safe. I found the security personnel to be courteous and professional and the security gate at the front entrance is just that - total security. The landscaping is beautiful. The lake is clean and is a wonderful healthful walk totalling about 1/2 mile all the way around. There are ducks, fish, and other fowl in the lake which is essentially a center focal point of the property. The Outlet Mall is just outside of the gate area and is an easy walk. There is a great food court at this mall that is definitely worth a visit. The service staff are also professional, courteous, and attentive. The meal we ate from the deli was delicious and served right beside the pool in the outdoor eatery. The pools are both amazing. Large enough to never feel crowded and plenty of seating. The check-in took all of 5 minutes. And much of this was spent telling us all about the incredible amenities of the property as well as the directions to our suite. Our suite was large, inviting, and had a wonderful view of the lake and one of the pools. There was plenty of parking outside of the suite also. There is a grocery store right across the street within walking distance. The high speed Internet was just that - high speed. And convenient. Now for some negatives: The A/C in our room did little to cool the room. Because we spent most of the time outside of the room it did not ruin our experience. And it was running normally; I have little doubt that it was doing what it was meant to be doing. There is only one restaurant on the property and it is a little pricey. The food was wonderful but another restaurant would be nice. There is a deli but $9 for a sandwich is a little steep in my book. The location, while incredibly convenient, also forces you to fight traffic to get to the Disney properties or some of the local restaurants. Just leave early and plan an extra hour for the traffic. The door on the suite was really heavy. Good for security but bad for trying to close quietly. If left unattended it would slam hard on its own no doubt disturbing the rest of others. Throughout the night I would hear other doors slamming as other guest faced this same issue. One elevator in our building (number 3) was HOT. The A/C in this elevator was clearly out. The second elevator was cooler than our room! Overall, and in summary, this was a very relaxing get away for my wife and I. We would definitely visit the property again but would not unpack unless the A/C was working. It is filled with photo opportunities from the architecture, professional and courteous employees, and just an incredible and memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: dbbohner
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at our home resort since purchasing through HGVC. We own a 3 bedroom and have 3 children. On arrival to this property we were happily greeted by every employee we came in contact with. Our kids were very impressed with how nice everyone was and how neat the initial building was. Our room was on the first floor. This was something I never thought about. The room were shown was on a higher floor with great views so never even thought to ask. Our actual room was on the first floor and was adjacent to the parking lot. Sitting in our screened room gave us no privacy. This was a let down for my husband who had hopes of catching a sunrise or sunset. I also noted the rooms we had were not renovated. I had specifically asked for renovated rooms. Oh well. They were still very nice. Throughout our stay staff was very accommodating. The pool was great and the daily activities were fun. We will likely go there again as we enjoyed it and it is close to local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home..don't stay any other way!!!”
Reviews.Author: karenmw67
Reviews.Content: It was beautiful, and it was like a home away from home. Full kitchen, enclosed patio, washer dryer combo, walkin shower, jacuzzi. It was great. Publix, grocery chain is located right across the street along with the Outlet shopping. Publix was kind of expensive, but the is the most customer service friendly and cleanest store that I have probably ever seen!!!There is a super Walmart a couple of miles away. Use your navigation and you should find it. 2 thumbs up to Sprint Navigation, it was Great!! We got groceries for the entire stay, and here it was I thought about eating out everyday, but really enjoyed my own cooking with no risk of getting food poisoning. Cant wait til next time Everything was wonderful up until I fell......Whole nother story, fault of someone who put a faulty handicapped sit in the shower....

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: LifeKidsTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: I am up at 6:21am. I cannot sleep. Let's start...I have stayed at parc de sol property and we purchased. This is my first trip using my points. We opted for studio because we are in town for a few nights. I travel alot and stay at 5 star or better. At first glance carpet was a little dated...didn't complain...room was not cleaned...still didn't complain....but what happened this morning is disgusting!!!.... I am sleeping feel something crawling. My husband is like please gong sleep...I turn on the light and my husband looks and......A WATERBUG is in the BED!!!!! WTF.. I paid 15k for a timeshare and a WATERBUG is in my BED!!!!! I am freaked out of course. They switch rooms put us in a different building and CODY tells me I am in FLorida and sometimes this happens!!! I don't usually blog but I am disgusted and if my husband was not sleeping I would get up and go use my Disney timeshare points and stay at the Yacht Club. I have been to FLORIDA so may times. Nothing like this has ever happened to me!!! We travel in the Caribbean all the time. CODY if this is FL I am never coming back!!! And I want my money from Hilton!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, standard of hotel”
Reviews.Author: a_preece1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks in HGV club on International drive and I cannot praise this hotel enough. We actually used it as our timeshare transfer and was really surprised at the luxurious surroundings. We were allocated a 3 bedroom apartment, which was actually a 2 bed apartment with adjoining room of a studio apartment. So we had 3 bathrooms and two kitchens. We even had a jacuzzi in our master bedroom. What luxury. The staff couldnt do enough for us, they were always pleasant, offering their services and asking how our day was going. When we had problems with our electricity in the en suite they repaired it in 5 minutes. They change the bedding and towels often and the beds were better than my own. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The facilities are second to none, with two pools, 3 jacuzzi's, games room, quiet room, basket ball court, table tennis and giant chess at poolside and bbq areas should you wish to cook your own food. The towels for the pool area are free and I was always able to find sunbeds and shade. If I could find a criticism, it could be that we did not have a view from our balcony!!!! but that was of no real concern to us. We had no problem parking outside our block at night as some people have stated. The location is excellent for Disney parks, 10 minutes away and there are lots of good restaurants and a publix supermarket on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: juliet01
Reviews.Content: We travel yearly for conventions and have stayed in many great hotels attached to convention centres throughout the US. Being our first year in Orlando, we decided (initially based on room rate- cheaper than the hotel convention room rate) to try a condo. The moment we drove up to the resort, the staff were very friendly. Our room was ready on arrival in builidng 5. We had seen previous reviews on this site for this particular resort and understood that building 7 was newer. We asked to have building 7. As they were not expecting a change, there was about a 1hour wait as they needed to prepare the room. This gave us enough time to "venture" out for a bite to eat. The staff were accomodating in every way. Our room was fantastic! It had a fully equipped kitchen - stove, dishwasher, fridge, microwave. Plates/silverware (setting for 4), cooking utensils including all the extras such as pots, pan, broiler pan, cookie sheet, cake pans (2), bowls, strainer, plastic containers, hot plates and cutting board. Dishtowels were provided along with the dishwasher soap. A comfortable sitting area was off the dining area with a flat screen tv. The bedroom was large with not only a tv but also a massive jacuzzi tub (2 person for sure). The bathroom was separate with a shower.
