It also had a washer/dryer in the room which actually came in very handy. A large screened in balcony was wonderful. Had views from 3 sides (two of which were water and the fountains) and also had access from the bedroom. There was a full size round table and four chairs with room to spare. What a nice place to just relax. Housekeeping came daily and actually cleaned up any dishes and started the dishwasher. They also vacuumed the condo. I found this to be a little uncomfortable as I am use to picking up after myself but any used cup lying around was either put in the dishwasher or the housekeeper washed the dishes in the sink. Right across the street is a large supermarket "Public" and there is nothing they do not sell. Also just across the parking lot (1 minute walk) is a gate to the Premium Outlet Mall (access with your room key). Also, we found this resort centrally located and easy to get around. A bus stop is just out front as well and a special bus to take you to the three outlet malls in the area. It took approx 15 mins by car to Universal Studios theme park and Sea World is just down the street about 5 minute car ride. We definitely will book here again. No doubt. Our next year venture is Nashville and the year after Las Vegas - we definitely will be looking for the same type of accomodations. All the comforts of home (including a door bell outside your room). No problems with finding a parking spot at any time.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Alvin1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel is as good as it looks in the photos and for us was worth every penny we spent, you can get 4* hotels cheaper but having a 1 bedroom suite made the holiday and i think saved us money overall as we often made our breakfast and lunch in the fully equipped kitchen. We even used the washing machine/dryer on a couple of occasions. Very quite location with security on the gate and the Premium Mall just outside our block (7) - never been shopping at 11pm before, so cant say enough about the location - Public (grocery store) just across the road. One negative point was the 'Presentation Event' we agreed to attend in order to get $400 off week long tickets for Universal - the scheduled 90 mins event finished after 4hrs and on a rather sour note when we for the 10th time informed them we weren't interested in buying any timeshares - so BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with big suites”
Reviews.Author: FwaysGreens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Hilton Grand Vacations promotion. We got a very good rate but had to attend a presentation about HGV one morning as part of the deal. This hotel is nicknamed "Tuscany" because of its architecture and theme. We have 3 relatively young kids and got a 2-bedroom suite (2 king beds) that had a sleeper sofa in the living room too. People at the front desk were very friendly and helpful when we arrived. There are special concierges devoted to helping get park tickets, etc. The hotel also has many activities for kids, teens & adults. We didn't get to take advantage of these because we were so busy going to parks, but they looked like fun. Our room was quite nice and very big. Beds, furniture, kitchen things were all clean, nice, etc. Having the kitchen there was great -- we ate breakfasts in the room and could store snacks, etc. Each of the three rooms had its own TV. Bathrooms were big and nice. We were really quite happy with the rooms. There are two pools, the main one by the lobby and a smaller one at the other end of the property. Our room was by that small pool. We only used the main pool once (being so busy). It's good, but is more of a relaxing type pool (no slide for kids, etc.) which was fine for my wife and me. The grounds around the hotel are quite pleasant. There's a huge lake in the middle and all the buildings surround it. The rooms had free wired and wireless internet. I only used the wireless and it worked fine. There is a Publix grocery store right across the street from the main entrance to to the hotel complex which is very convenient. We stopped in the first night and got supplies for our 4 days there. Many restaurants and shopping areas are within a mile. One negative has to do with location: The easiest way to the hotel from I-4 is exit 68 (Highway 535). From that you get on Vineland Ave to go to the hotel. The Orlando Premium Outlets mall is off that road. At various time such as the early evening, when you leave the hotel to get back to I-4, the right turn from Vineland Ave to get back onto 535 (and then I-4) really backs up, perhaps even 1/2-1 mile. It can be a huge wait. We did our best to avoid that at critical times. There is another way to get to I-4 using International Drive as well. It is longer, but may be better at particular times. Note that Hilton's other Grand Vacation property very close to this is called Parc Soleil. That is where our HGV presentation was. (I believe there is another on International Drive too.) This one (Tuscany) and Parc Soleil are very similar in style, their rooms are quite similar. Parc Soleil is a little newer and nicer, I would say. For example, the rooms have LCD TVs there versus CRTs at Tuscany. Similarly, the pool at Parc Soleil looks a little more exciting for kids. Parc Soleil is kind of in the middle of nowhere though, while Tuscany has much very close around it. Both properties are quite nice, however.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort - Wish we would have found it sooner”
Reviews.Author: Capers_10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a lot of places over the year's during our trips to Orlando but have never stayed in a place so beautiful. I requested a building near the pool and was given a 1 bedroom suite with a pool view. Absolutely breath taking. The grounds are very well manicured, rooms are very spacious and clean and the staff are very friendly. We have two boy's ( 8 - 12) who like to keep busy and there was so much to do together as a family. The resort is next to to the Premium Outlet Mall, grocery store and lot's of restaurants to choose from if you desire. I have no negative things to say about this resort. We had so much fun during our 10 night stay. What you get for the price you pay per night is worth it. It is so nice to be able to cook your own breakfast/lunch and not have to drag bags of clothes to washing machines....it's all right there in you suite. We can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bluedreams1810
Reviews.Content: It's taken me too long to write this review, but we stayed here in May 2009 as part of our honeymoon. We were doing a cruise leaving from port canaveral so we decided to go a week early and do Orlando. We found a great deal through this hotel, stay 2 nights, get 1 free, so we stayed 7 nights, we ended up paying I think like $100 a night or so, it was a great deal! The room was huge, it had a living room, dining room, kitchen, big bathroom with a standup shower, a whirlpool tub, a separate bedroom, a washer and dryer, and a balcony, which we had overlooking the lake. The hotel was beautiful!!! The pool was huge! so even when there were a good number of people out there, it still wasn't crowded. The staff was very friendly!! everything was just beautiful. There was a bar/cafe type thing by the pool that served dinner. They also had a little cafe with coffee and ice cream and little odds and ends. There were grills to BBQ if you wanted as well. I know people on here were saying they were bugged with calls about buying a timeshare, but we were called when we first arrived and my husband told them we weren't interested and that we were on our honeymoon and we never heard anything from them again. There were only a couple of negative aspects... 1) one time we called for towels they never brought them to us 2) the shower had no place to put anything so you had to put all your shampoos/soaps on the bottom of the shower so that was a little inconvenient 3)the safe in the room locked us out and we called for someone to come and reopen it and it took them like 30 mins to come. But those things really were minor! The hotel was really close to everything! It was only 5 minutes from sea world and probably about 10 minutes from disney. We LOVED this hotel and cannot wait to stay again!! We are hoping to go back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around..”
Reviews.Author: I.Z.E.
Reviews.Content: First of all, as stated in previous reviews, this property is a timeshare venture managed by Hilton and frequented by Hilton Grand Vacation Club members. However, I am not a timeshare owner or a Hilton Grand Vacation Club member. Nevertheless, I am a Hilton Honors member and this is our second visit to this property. Our first visit was in 2007 during the construction completion phase. Our dates of travel were 30 June through 4 July. Our stay was in a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen, large bathroom, living room, and screened balcony in building 3(can not remember the imitation Italian building name with the Tuscan/Tuscany theme) room 3602 on the 6th floor. POSITIVES: Our speedy/efficient check-in and check-out process was handled by the lovely, professional and courteous Ms. Alicia Murad. She should solely get paid for her beautiful smile and geniune personality which deserves an emphatic "WOW!". I have witnessed very few hospitality professionals with her sincere enthusiasm. In other words, I was very impressed with the service from Ms. Murad. Moving on to other areas of our stay, the 1 bedroom suite was very clean. However, as true in most hotel properties, the corner suites provide much more space. Parking is wonderfully free. As mentioned in previous reviews, the Premium Outlet Mall is a short walking distance across the parking lot near building 5. At all times, on site security was very visible, friendly and non-intrusive. The swimming pools access is on the ground level at the rear of all buildings. In other words, as you face the ground entrance of the guest buildings from the parking lot, follow the hallways pass the suites to the rear of the buildings. In one direction on the sidewalk behind the structures in front of the pond, the sidewalk leads to the main pool by the cafe and the other pool near the pizza stand and outlet mall entrance in the opposite direction. Due to an unexpected incident, we called the front desk at 0630 a.m. for a housekeeping issue. Just like a Dominos Pizza delivery, they responded in 30 minutes or less. Also, we got a follow-up call from the front desk to schedule housekeeping service for the remainder of our stay. Another note about housekeeping, there were plenty of clean towels in our bathroom combined with friendly fast service. Our screened balcony had a ceiling fan, patio furniture and electrical outlets in excellent working condition and suitable for late night laptop usage. Even though the wireless service was flawless, we noticed at least three networks. the network named HGVC was usually at medium strength early in mornings and late evenings. But, the public access and the curiously nameless(?) wireless network was always at full strength. Due to our suspicion of hackers, we chose not to use the public access network or the mystery guest network option and I did not inquire about the wireless situation with the front desk staff. Very nice gas grills are available in tents near the pool areas equipped with patio furniture. The grills seem to be reasonably clean to avoid outdoor HGVC bacteria while cooking among very few cigarette butts scattered nearby. The pools were slightly heated, clean and full of eye burning chlorine for random multiple guests swimming. There's a small, covered and litter free playground near the main pool for toddler size children. NEGATIVES: Of course the property does not look as pristine as it did during our visit in 2007. As a matter of the fact, the guest building parking lots, courtyards and fountains look like "tar ball" casulties of the Gulf oil spill. The youthful pool side bartenders need a little more training in beverage classification. We requested two glasses of sweet or semi-sweet wine and the young man could not think beyond white, red or rose'. Unfortunately, I engaged in a brief discussion with a seemingly less than qualifed HGVC bartender about the nuances of chardonnay, rieslings and zinfandels. Anyway, we did not let this lack of competence spoil our stay. The whirlpools needed a lot of TLC near the pools. However, the thrusters and water jets seem to be in good working order. The suites' kitchens are not as fully equipped as they once were in 2007. The minimal inventory of pots, pans and utensils made cooking meals somewhat challenging but maybe saute' pans and spatulas are available upon request..? To our dismay, the hot tub did not work but it made an odd and interesting humming noise. The televisions need to be updated wtih plasma or LCDs ASAP! Also, the BOSE system is a nice feature with a radio and DVD player but it does not intergrate properly with the video on channel 2. HGVC is charging too much money for nightly rates to not provide updated and functional electronic entertainment equipment. WORTH MENTIONING!?!: The street address, 8122 Arezzo Way; Orlando Florida, did not work well in our GPS. Before our GPS navigational days, we used the directions from the HGVC website. It is good to remember that the property is off International Drive on Vineland Avenue which is the same street for the Premium Outlet Mall near Interstate 4. Arezzo Way appears to be a drive way off Vineland Way exclusively for the HGVC Orlando International property. The property has two entrances. The main entrance is gated with a guard on duty 24 hours and 7 days per week. The other entrance is only accessibe by registered guests and staff with a cardkey. Off site, we enjoyed some excellent meals at Padrinos Cuban Bistro and Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza. Also, we discovered an asian cusine gem in Seito Sushi in the same shopping plaza as Whole Foods Market on Turkey Lake Road which intersects with International Drive right down the street from a Super Walmart. CONCLUSION: All in all, we had a great Orlando, Florida stay avoiding the parks, driving 45 minutes and enduring three toll booths east to Cocoa Beach, Florida. We are looking forward to our next Orlando trip to either this HGVC or the recently built Parc Soleil.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to have as a home base in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: travelnchica
Reviews.Content: It was such a lovely 5 day stay in May, from the beginning to the end. When you arrive you at the hotel gate they check your name off a list. And, they wait outside of the lobby to welcome you in by name. There was also water container with floating fruit available, so refreshing. I thought that was such a lovely touch and I've never had that happen before. We stayed in a two bedroom suite. My mother was in essence in a studio with an adjoining room. Both rooms were lovely and had a view of the fountains in the center of the property. My only complaint is the clothes dryer took forever to dry. And, the parking. Yes, it's crowded. Most nights we were able to park nearby but it was a little bit of a pain to park at the next "villa." There is a supermarket right across the street and you can't go wrong with that when you are in a timeshare. We were at the amusement parks all day, but I do wish we had squeezed in a day to enjoy their nice pools. Overall, I would definitely stay here again if we are not just doing the Disney experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TamikoBold
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the HGVC on International Drive when he had to attend a conference nearby. Check-in was amazing, as we were greeted by the gate guard, parking attendants, and front desk staff by name (the gate guard called ahead to tell them we were on our way). We were given a one bedroom suite on the top floor of Bldg 4, overlooking the far pool. At first we were concerned about noise, as there was a door to the adjoining studio suite, but we never heard any noise from that direction. We did hear a lot of noise from the hallway outside (it is an outdoor hallway), especially from unruly kids who didn't seem to realize they should use quiet voices until out of the building (gotta blame the parents for that one). But it wasn't anything that would ruin our stay. The kitchen was nicely equipped, and the gas grills scattered througout the complex were great (there are 6 or 7 of them). The unit was clean, large, and very comfortable. I was able to walk to the Outlets Mall, which was great for shopping (but not so great for the pocketbook!!). We both thought the value for what we paid was fantastic (less than $150 for a one-bedroom suite, with full kitchen including full-size refrigerator, resort with two pools, beautiful lagoon, evening movies at the main pool, etc, etc, etc). Nice staff, beautiful suites, great pools and grounds...all in all a wonderful place to stay. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “yuck. never again.”
Reviews.Author: kmlb
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this place are very nice. The staff is very nice as well. The negatives for us, were many though.... first of all we were put in a two bedroom, two bathroom with a view of the the parking lot, and another building. We had absolutely NO view. Second of all, our room was right across from the trash. I do realize that these rooms need to be occupied as well, but why charge someone $259 to have a view of the parking lot? These rooms should be given at a slight discount because it's extremely disappointing. Cleanliness was also a factor. There was shaved hair in the bathtub in the second bathroom, and you could see that it had not been cleaned. Oh, and if it couldn't get any worse...two the drawer fronts in the bathroom fell off the cabinet and on to the floor for no apparent reason. No one was even in the bathroom at the time. I'm sure that there are other rooms that are MUCH nicer at this hotel. We just won't be back to see them!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and enjoy Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_lotter
Reviews.Content: Hotel and grounds are great! The only complaint we have is the parking. We stayed in building number 7 across the pond from check in. If you got back to your room after 10 you had to park on the other side of the ground and walk or hope for a golf cart to carry you back, not really a big deal just annoying! The plus at staying in building 7 is you are literally steps away from the outlet stores. Just go through the fence and you are in the parking lot. The rest of the facility was exactly what we all expect from Hiton Grand Vacations.

Reviews.Title: “first class resort loved it”
Reviews.Author: garythestokefan
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say that has not already been said by other reviewers. The staff from the receptionist to the cleaners all give you the 5 star treatment. From when you 1st enter the security gate and meet by the entry guard every member of staff speaks to you in a very welcoming as i said 5 star manor. The resort is set approxamtly 2 mile from seaworld on international drive. It is set on a large lake with fountains at either end and a bridge across the middle. All lit up at night and has a walkway around the outside approx 1/2 mile long that goes to each of the 7 buildings.All in a secure area.there are two swimming pools either end of the resort. there are 2 fully covered barbacue tents with gas fird cookers free to us again 1 either end.The resort is a RCI gold timeshare resort and in my view fully deserves this gold mark for everthing from staff to location and amenities. .We had a 2 bedroom appartment which is two appartments with a adjoining door that can be closed and locked. The main room had a queen bed very comfortable and the jacuzzi bath between the bedroom and bathroom.All the items of furnature and kitchen equipment and utensals were very clean and of a very good standard.There was a very nice screened balcony with excellent views over the resort/lake.Same can be said of the 2nd room good size bed and its own kitchen and balcony although smaller the than the main room. The food at the main pool area is of a good standard and price and served by again very friendly staff.We hired a car and had no problems finding a parking space we used the car every day to get to the parks etc.The staff use 5 seater golf carts to drive themselves and visitors around the resort and are always on hand to do this anytime of the day or night all you have to do is call reception.We only had 1 problem and that was getting the gas cooker at one of the barby sites to light but within 2 minutes of asking for help a member of staff was there with a smile. If I was to visit orlando again this would have to be the first thing i would book.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I need in one location!”
Reviews.Author: FedFlyer
Reviews.Content: Great facility, fun stuff for everyone! Next to an awesome Outlet Mall! Ladies go shopping while the men chill. Clean, roomy, friendly staff, MY PREFERRED Place to stay near Walt Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations paired with a friendly staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaShannon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom, 3 bath villa June 11-18, 2010. We were in Building 2, Villa 2601-2602. We liked this location, as we were close to the main pool, which is near Building 1. The resort accommodations were perfect for our family. A three-bedroom villa consists of a studio and a two bedroom. There was a master bedroom with a king bed and jacuzzi tub and a very large bathroom with a walk in shower. The second bedroom had two double beds and a full bath in the hall just outside the room. The studio side had a king bed and sitting area, a mini bar, and another full bathroom. There is also a nice sized kitchen, granite countertops throughout, a comfortable living room, and a screened-in porch off of the living room (and master bedroom) and another one off the studio side. The only thing I would request next time is a full view of the lake. We were located on the side of a building, and would've preferred a complete lakefront view. It was a really beautiful place. The kitchen was well equipped, and we also had a washer & dryer in our unit. For those staying in a studio that don't have this luxury, they offer complimentary use to washers/dryers in each building. This is a timeshare resort and we stayed on a trade through RCI. We were never contacted to attend a sales presentation. Other bonuses of the resort are it's convenience to the Premium Outlets (next door!), its family-friendly activities and the proximity to all theme parks (10 min to Disney, 3-5 min to Sea World/Universal),

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation and good location”
Reviews.Author: Gasman28
Reviews.Content: This resort is in an excellent location with an entrance from the resort to the nearby outlet mall and within a short drive of the theme parks. We had a two bedroom apartment that was very spacious and well equipped with all of the facilities you will require during your stay also free Wifi is provided in the apartment. All of the staff were very friendly and the facilities were very good. There is a choice of two pools and and the grounds are very well maintained. A definite five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: Nana4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our daughter and grandchildren. The accomodations were very clean, friendly staff, close to outlet mall and Orlando attractions. The resort had planned activities for children,adults and families. The pools were refreshing. The whole experience was very relaxing and great for families. The staff and activities were very well organized. We would stay again. Our son and family stayed at Parc Soleil, which we visited, and was also a very well organized, clean and friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, especially when you're in Orlando to see Disney World”
Reviews.Author: mhot
Reviews.Content: We booked a double bedroom which was really spacious. The hot tub in the bedroom is fantastic! All you need in a hotelroom is there and more. There was enough parking space in front of our block. The swimming pool and jacuzzi were great! We loved the location, because it was just a 10 minute drive to Disney World and the outlet is right next to the hotel! For those who don't have a car, the hotel offers a shuttle bus to Disney and to the Universal Studios, but this takes a while, because they have to pick up guests at other hotels as well. In front of the hotel stops the I-Line Bus which will take you anywhere on International Drive and also to SeaWorld, but again, this takes a while as well. Across the street from the hotel you'll find a supermarket, which is a good thing, because the "supermarket" in the hotel has very limited products. We had a great stay at the HGVC and definitely recommend this to other travellers!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base when visiting Orlando attractions”
Reviews.Author: DOPBucharest
Reviews.Content: The whole property looks very nice and is well taken care of. Our suite, located in building 7 (the newest building) had everything we needed, and more. Staff were very friendly and prompt if we wanted something. For the days when we did not visit Orlando attractions, the hotel provided excellent choices to spend time or to relax: two pools, billiards, the restaurant by the main pool was very good, kids play area, etc. The Publix supermarket is within walking distance so you can buy whatever you need for your stay. And the Orlando Premium Outlets are also dangerously (for the wallet) close. We all liked it very much and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel & Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lynchn1
Reviews.Content: Had a fab holiday the staff where brilliant the location is great for Universal & Sea World & the shopping mall is right across the street just go ahead and book it its great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to outlet mall and...”
Reviews.Author: DocHollday
Reviews.Content: Great location close to outlet mall and theme parks. High quality room and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: babs17631
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel Loved the walking path around the lake. Everyone was soo nice. The room was spacious. We stayed at buiding 7, walked across the bridge to the pool and thru the gate in the back to the outlet mall, Perfect location near Disney, Universal and Sea World. I've stayed at a few other hotels in the area and this one was the best!!! We're planning on coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: PTJ
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this property for a long weekend getaway and found the accomodations to be very nice. The room was very clean and well appointed - good linens, nice screened balcony, free wifi, etc. There are two pool areas, each very clean and well designed. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The only negative was the on site dining options. There is no full service restaurant. There is a deli on site with decent quality food, but we experienced poor service there. The property is very well located for those interested in shopping or visiting SeaWorld or Discovery Cove.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: flfan01
Reviews.Content: This place is a joke. The room was dirty. They want to charge you for clean linens. The place is worse than a cheap motel. The air conditioner made noises when on.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH FOR THE ROOMS WITH ADJOINING DOORS.. NOT GOOD!”
Reviews.Author: SusanHalifax
Reviews.Content: I booked and asked for a room that was on its own as I know with many hotels in Orlando they have adjoining doors that can connect two rooms together.. We checked in andof course to our suprise we had a room with adjoining door.. I went down to talk to receptionist to change our room and she said there was nothing they can do.. We ended up having people being loud which I could not get sleep from and to top it off while we were sleeping someone started knocking that was obviously drinking as they kept laughing as well.. NOT FUN! I was disappointed with this and addressed it a couple times to the front desk. Otherwise it was all good but that was a Major issue as I went to escape with my husband for few days without the kids.. now the kids wakin me up at night isnt so bad compared to the experience we had!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - would definately stay again - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BostonGal83
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at Hilton Grand Vacations. The room was perfect of us, a small kitchen area if you did want to eat in, very nicely decorated, lovely bathroom, and everything was kept very clean (maid service came every day). The pool area was great, there were always beds available, all the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was ideal for us. We didn't hire a car and so liked being right next to the I trolley stop and the premium outlets. There are also restaurants, shops and a supermarket right across the street from the hotel. The shuttles to Disney were quite limited, I think only 3 per day, all in the morning with limited return times - all after 6pm - which for us was just a little too long walking around Disney in 93 degree weather! They also only go to Epcot, from there you have to make your own way to the other parks on Disney Transport, which is a little bit inconvenient. Considering you do have to pay for the shuttle, taking a cab was only slightly more in cost and was definately a more convenient option for us for getting to the park you actually want. All in all for the price compared to nearby hotels, the Hilton Grand was excellent. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan feel resort -- Great amenities and space”
Reviews.Author: tracyj79
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this beautiful property on a visit to Disney World. This is a resort that could be your week's vacation (if you don't want to go anywhere else)... There are many activities for the kids and the adults were having as good of a time visiting with friends and family by the pool. The rooms are very quiet, clean and luxurious !! This was my favorite time share stay so far !!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sfc17
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay and the only regret is that we could not stay longer. We stayed in a 1 bedroom jacuzzi suite in building 7 on the 8th floor (room 7810). I can be very picky about hotel rooms but loved this suite. We had a gorgeous view and enjoyed breakfast every morning on the balcony overlooking the lake. The room was nicely decorated, modern and well equipped with everything we needed (washer, dryer, cooking utensils etc). My two daughters (8 and 11) loved the pool area and the daily activities the hotel offered. We utilized the shuttle to Disney ($6.00 return trip per day) which was very convenient. ALL of the hotel staff went above and beyond. They were very friendly, accomodating and quick to respond to all of our requests. I would definetly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms. Busy pool.”
Reviews.Author: Business_Traveler_MI
Reviews.Content: Tucked away from the business of the other end of International Drive is this gem. We had a great visit in Orlando. Twice visiting Sea World which was only 5-10 minutes away. Disney was a bit farther. We had a car but there is apparently a city shuttle that is very economical. The rooms are big and very well decorated. We had a two-bedroom suite and for the price, they are probably the best rooms I have experienced. This is a time-share so you will get plenty of opportunities to sit in on a presentation. We politely declined. The ground are fine - nothing too fancy. A lake in the middle of the complex. We were near the main pool and it was busy at times. One thing I noticed is that people got up early to stake out there chairs and put towels and other personal items on them. The chairs were occupied maybe 25-50% of the time but were hoarded for some reason. I found this disappointing and attribute it to not having enough chairs to accommodate peak time. We rarely went to the pool at high time so this didn't present too much of an issue for us but wanted to warn others. All in all, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Place”
Reviews.Author: afcb74
Reviews.Content: Very, very good place. Location - Just right, being near enough to all the parks without being too manic. Also great for the shops with a keycard entrance to the adjacent Premium Outlets. Staff - Brilliant, and extremely friendly. Everyone from porters through to maintenance staff said hello and made us all welcome throughout the visit. Rooms - Can't really moan, and any problems were fixed straightaway. We had a lovely 7th floor room with balcony. Very clean and up to date. Free wi-fi was welcome. On site - The deli was great. The poolside bar was good, if slightly expensive for the basic food. Also nice to have a Pizza Hut! There was a kids playground under cover which was very popular. The gym had a very high standard, and seemed to be brand new..with complimentary ear phones for those of us who forget our ipods. It wasn't big by any means, but then I was always on my own in there! Does anyone go to gyms in the US ;-) Pools - The pools were exceptional, and our kids never wanted to leave. The only slight downside was that the toddler friendly pool was on the far side of the resort so didn't have any poolside service. The only significant concern some might have is the poolside entertainment. It was fairly loud and cheesy. For those who have booked into the rooms by the pool it may well be quite noisy when you would want to chill out?

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Was Vacationing Here instead of Business!”
Reviews.Author: lizardsong
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. Everything from the time the staff greets you all the way to check-out, they provided a great experience. This hotel is less than 5 mins from Disney and Epcot. The hotel has a great pool, two gyms, and rooms have a microwave and large fridge. I wish my family was here on vacation. This would be great for kids as well. The prices were very good. Definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed three times, fourth booked for August”
Reviews.Author: EMUP
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love this hotel. I think the children think that it is our house. We have stayed in a one bedroom suite, and in two bedroom suites twice (once it was a one bedroom adjoining a studio and the second time it was a true 2 bedroom suite), so I can safely say that we have tried all the accomodations and have not yet had a single complaint. I love the whirlpool bathtub, it is amazing after a crazy day and the kids are in bed to have a glass of wine in a huge bubble bath either reading a book or watching TV (If my memory is correct the studios don't have the whirlpool tub and also the second bathroom in the 2 bedroom suites don't either which is actually better for the kids). Staff have always been friendly and helpful. We love to eat by the pool some evenings and relax while the kids swim. The kids love the playground and we used the basketball court the last time we were there. We have always had our requests honoured for the building we like and the floor we like to be on. I suggested to my husband that we stay somewhere else in August and he is usually the one that wants to try something new but he was adamant that is where he wants to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great services !!”
Reviews.Author: janneman10
Reviews.Content: Booked a studio for 90 dollar, had a quiet one in block 6 with nice view on the little lake. Bed is small, but the room is very nice with balcony, all very clean. Housekeeping did a great job in our room. You do not need a car to visit the mall, its just near the hotel, still its well kept away of the hotel area. Parking was not a problem, after 8 pm you have to look for one. Staff is very helpfull, did offering us some nice deals (free breakfast, coupons for the prime mall etc). Nice total experience we had. Again, services are great

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the 1st stay here and/or "I'll make a note of that."”
Reviews.Author: janetmarieo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago and I rated this 5's almost all around. Our second stay has not been as great. Lots of new buildings but the same number of pools makes it really crowded. It's a little obnoxious when people are reserving pool chairs at 8 am and not using them until noon or so. We waited 4 hours to check in and would have waited longer but I checked back to ask how much longer. Check in person was fairly rude. The baggage check forgot to refrigerate some perishible items. Needless to say, they had to be trashed. Today, we went out at 9 and came back at 3:30. The room has not been cleaned. I called for towels and told them to forget the service. Also, if you express disappointment, the party line here is, "I'll make a note of that." Basically meaningless. Orlando has much better places to stay and we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: bdr639
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a bit lengthy but the room was gorgeous, clean and very large in size, well equipped, very prompt services. An in-house Pizza Hut was a biggy especially with kids and arriving late in the night time. The Hotel was conveniently located within the vicintiy of Disney, Sea World, and the famous I-Drive of Orlando. Customer service and helpdesk was very prompt, and courteous. Got free bottles of water. Location is very good. Only down sides were old carpets and parking. One day we came in late in night after Disney, and there was no parking space in the allotted parking area. Overall it is a nice place to stay in Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all around”
Reviews.Author: CatguyJV
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about HGVC International Drive! The property was very clean, the grounds well-maintained and attractive, and the staff helpful and friendly. We slept very, very well and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Winnipegmelody
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at this Hilton and I wished we could have stayed more. It was the last night of our vacation so we had to go home. I was so pleased with the one bedroom that we had in Building 4 on the 2nd floor. A previous review went into a lot of detail about the same kind of room we had and I agree with everything they said. The kitchen had everything you could possibly want - full sized fridge, dishwasher, full oven and flat top stove, microwave, coffeemaker (didn't try the coffee), blender, toaster, lots of different utensils, casseroles, etc. There were double ceramic sinks in the granite counter in the kitchen and his and hers sinks in the bathroom, a dining room table with glass top and four dining room chairs, lovely sofa and lounge chair with ottoman. The TV's were definitely older in our room, but got lots of channels. The screened-in balcony would be lovely on a warm evening, overlooking the lake and smaller pool area. There were even ducks on the lake. Bring your own bubbles for the double jacuzzi tub. There is a McDonald's and Outback Steakhouse across the street and if you like to walk, it's easy to do. A pretty nice McDonald's actually. There are a stacked clothes washer and dryer as well. I think they give you a small pouch of laundry detergent, enough for one load. We loved the place and would love to stay there for a week or more another time. We also just used the walk-through to the Outlet Mall next door. You just need your room key to get through the gate, there and back. Otherwise you would have to walk out to Vineland Avenue and walk along it to get back to the hotel complex. The only noise came from under the front door but it didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping / state of the room - substandard and a letdown”
Reviews.Author: Farmerinthedell3
Reviews.Content: It's a shame that it seems this Hilton believes it's OK to allow check in to a room with a maintenance problem. Our first two days were spent making phone calls and receiving phone calls and multiple maintenance visits for a toilet problem, no clean up offered after two trips in with a dreaded ' snake' to unclog the toilet and drip drip drip through the bathroom, kitchen/entry and in and out the suite door. Housekeeping did not respond to our request for a bathroom clean after the second visit. The suite furnishings in the living room were worn. The wireless internet or lack thereof, and a call to get a signal / assistance took 20 minutes per call ( three times ) and two in-person visits per day plus the attendant phone calls for follow up and requests for feedback. We ended up using the wired connection because we didnt want the multiple calls, the hold time with the help desk, the feeble 'sorry's ' . The kitchen was OK but lacked enough dishware for a family of 6. The washer dryer was a nice thing to have on hand even for our four day stay. The weather was unseasonably cool and we didn't take a swim in the pools. If we had had the opportunity to use more of the outdoor facilities we may have been able to overlook the issues with the internet, but a working toilet or one fix to a toilet should be enough to deal with. Im left with the feeling that the guest who informs the staff of unit problems helps them troubleshoot where these things should be checked on routinely to avoid the guests having to report it for them. All in all, we would not try this property again unless the price point was a steal. Old timey TVs. Worn carpet. Would try elsewhere to get the unit inside that the outside of the buildings and grounds convey.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Perfect Place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: alertkm
Reviews.Content: Just got home from 5 days at Hilton Grand Vacations Club on International Drive and we just loved it. I booked a studio but when we arrived I decided to upgrade to a one bedroom ($30 more a night). It was well worth it. We have twin 8 month old boys so we really needed the extra space. As soon as we checked in they wheeled up 2 cribs for us which were no frills but were clean, safe and seemed comfortable b/c our boys slept well. The room was VERY nice and VERY clean. The balcony was really large with a table and 4 chairs and a ceiling fan. Unfortunately we couldn't spend any time out there at night b/c it was too cold in the evenings but I could see it being really nice in warmer weather. Then later in the stay we requested high chairs and they brought those up right away also. There was plenty of space to throw a blanket down and let the babies play and I wasn't worried if they touched the carpet like I would be at other places I've stayed in the past. The hotel staff from the front desk to the grounds people to housekeeping and the restaurant staff were really, really nice and pleasant. We got coffee one morning in the deli and got burgers at the pool one day for lunch. Burgers were good and they have Blue Moon on tap which was a bonus for us! Parking was no problem but we weren't out late like a lot of other reviewers. The outlet mall next door was great - we just walked over one morning and it's open really late at night (11pm). We walked to Publix (note - they make great sandwiches at Publix deli - way better than Subway which is right next door to Publix). Definitely go over there and get coffee (the coffee in the room was BAD) and some snacks and drinks. One thing I really liked about this place was that it wasn't full of rules. Families were at the pool with snacks and lunches for their kids and no one seemed to mind. We would bring beers from our room and no one had a problem with it. We ordered a couple drinks from the bar but mostly just grabbed beers from our own fridge. One day the bartender was handing out mango and banana drink samples. That was really nice (and good marketing b/c we then bought a drink!). We spent time at both pools. They were both very clean and nicely heated. We never had a problem finding pool chairs, but then again it wasn’t perfect weather. They didn’t have a baby pool but there were lots of stairs in the pool that a baby could sit on. And a zero entry pool for younger children. There was also a jungle gym area but no swings. Couple tips – ordered carry-out from Outback across the street and it was excellent (there was an hour wait for dine in!). The concierge can make reservations for you or give you cards for certain area restaurants and in exchange the restaurant will give you a free cocktail or appetizer. One night we went to Big Fin http://www.bigfinseafood.com/ because we wanted a nice seafood dinner. It was really good and they knocked $12 off our tab because we had a business card from the Hilton. Overall we just loved our vacation and we spent the majority of it at the Hilton b/c we didn’t do any theme parks. Highly recommended. Oh and we didn't hear one peep from any other room! Noise was definitely not an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “If you have young children, this is the PERFECT place to stay for your Disney visit”
Reviews.Author: ebalestro
Reviews.Content: I will start my review by stating that I am a PICKY traveler. I have traveled for a living, and have distinct preferences and standards for a hotel. The price of this resort was so reasonable (and I had also read some negative reviews)—I was worried we'd be disappointed with the property. I chose the resort b/c I was traveling with a 10 month old and a 2-year old. I needed a full kitchen to heat and wash bottles, clean utensils, and a washer for bibs and pajamas etc. We booked a 1-bedroom King suite. Upon arrival at 2:00 pm, the room was not ready yet but they took my cell phone number and said they'd call me when it was ready. We were able to dine poolside at the bar/grill, and they held our luggage etc. with the bell staff. There are two pools at the property, with beautiful chaise lounges. The main pool has a bar/grill with table or chairside service. Pleasant wait staff and bartenders, typical of a full-service resort. I did not expect that from a timeshare. Poolside activities go on throughout the day (there is a schedule) and lots of things/crafts for the kids. The pool was meticulous and heated to a wonderful 85 degrees (or higher!) There are also two jacuzzis. The secondary pool features a zero entry kids area that was perfect for my 2-year old! There was also a Pizza Hut Express at that pool, in addition to a smaller bar for poolside cocktails. Our room was located in Building 4, on the 3rd floor, with a view of the lake and secondary pool. Screened in balcony was lovely, with a full table and 4 chairs (you can dine out there!) Very roomy accommodations, and upscale design. Everything was clean and in perfect order, except the carpet had stains in some places and even a few tears where the carpet met the ceramic tile. Could use replacement, but it was not skeevy or a major factor in my opinion! Kitchen had granite countertops and a full size refrigerator and plenty of cabinets for your stuff. Lots of pots and utensils etc. Plus, they stock your room with dish detergent, sponges, dishwasher powder and even laundry detergent! Big dining room table with chairs too. Bathroom featured a tiled stall shower and double sink with nicely lighted vanity/mirror. Lots of drawers too, so your stuff does not have to clutter the counter!! Between the king bedroom and the bathroom, there is a foyer area that has a huge closet and a huge jacuzzi tub with beautiful tuscany columns. It made bathing the kids difficult b/c it was so deep...you actually had to go in WITH THEM, but I imagine it would be nice to get to enjoy a soak for an adult!!!!! All bathroom amenities were Crabtree and Evelyn, and supplied daily. Living room featured pull out sofa, and they provided both highchairs and pack-n-play for my kids. Could have used a little more drawer space for clothes...but we utilized the closets which was fine. I did not have any issues with neighboring noise...the only noise issue was that the living room sound system was very loud (BOSE surround sound) and you can hear that pretty easily, even at a low volume, from the bedroom. Not a huge deal! Wireless internet was FREE and worked great. Lovely grounds feature bridges and walking paths, great for strollers! Parking was never an issue, never had to park more than 50 yards away...and most of the time we got a spot up front near the building. Service overall was friendly and immediate. We had a broken lint screen in the dryer, and I had a new one within 5 minutes of contacting the front desk. Location was fantastic in my opinion. Publix across the street, 7-11 and Walgreens a block away. A few restaurants with curbside to-go are also nearby. But International Drive is FULL of restaurants...and this property is literally 5 minutes from DOWNTOWN DISNEY...which is awesome for nighttime strolling, getting ice cream, shopping, or dining/cocktails. And, the Orlando Premium Outlets have an entrance right from the resort...you can walk there!!!!! Plan on 20 minutes to Disney's Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom, we always parked at a resort and took THEIR transportation. If you go to the parks you have to pay $14 dollars, and then take a tram AND a ferry or monorail. This is a pain with strollers. So at the resorts you can just take their bus etc. Just tell the gate guard that you are dining at one of the restaurants. Sea World is around the corner...a 3 minute drive. Anyway...long story short...it was a wonderful stay and we'll definitely choose this location again for our next visit b/c the convenience and value made it well worth it. In my opinion, paying more for a room within the Disney Parks is not a smart idea...you get a small room with two double beds. This way, you get some living space for a family...feel free to email me with your questions!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolynLeanne
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this resort. Ill try to keep this as to the point as possible. Service: - We arrived at 11am and they have both our room and my parents connecting room clean and ready for us to check in, allowing us to head straight to the parks! - One night we had a family in the room above us who were extremely loud, screaming, hollering and stamping their feet (i believe they were watching a football game from the westcast as it was 1030pm) We called downstairs and within 15 minutes they had security up there and we had no more noise! Rooms: - Very cozy yet spacious. Comfortable bed, dressed with a tv on top, microwave, coffee maker, mini fridge, sink, utensils, cups, plates, bowl, etc. - Bathrooms were big enough and clean. We did have an issue with a leaking shower curtain, but in all fairness we never complained about it and I am sure it would have been fixed promptly if we had. Our room has a shower/tub combination where as my parents had a seperate jacuzzi tub and glass shower. I wish we had gotten that aswell as it looked very nice! - We had a living room between ours and our parents room. Was a delight to have as we really only wanted to be in our bedrooms to sleep and get ready for the day. There was a dining room table, full kitchen, flat screen tv, couch and chairs. There was also a screened in balcony. Grounds: - Great landscaping. Paths were made to look very nice with lots of palm trees and other shrubbery and flowers. - Their were 2 pools on this resort. One was a quiet pool which was a good size and also had a large hottub. The other was a much bigger and louder acitivies pool where they had music playing and a grill to eat at. We enjoyed both depending on our mood. - The middle of the resort has a giant lake with fountains and a bridge that makes a lovely walk if you want some excercise. Really made the place look fancy. Location: - Very good location if you are planning to do Disney. It was only about a 10 minutes drive from here. - There was a drugsstore and grocery store located just across the street, aswell as many many restaurants. - There was a huuuge outlet mall located next door within walking distance to the property. Our only complaint about this place was that we didnt have time to ENJOY it more. We only stayed for a week which was completely consumed by Disney. If I ever return to florida, I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: evian1
Reviews.Content: This property is pure luxury,located at the nice end of I drive. The room was plenty big enough for 2, with a nice big balcony and huge,comfy bed. The swimming pools are gorgeous, lovely and warm at all times. Especially liked the outdoor hot tubs located throughout the gardens , 2 at the main pool and 1 at the smaller pool. Service was fantastic ,al staff friendly and helpful. Within walking distance of the mall and supermarket and Outback steakhouse which has the best staff! 1 tip, if u dont already have Seaworld tickets, (or possibly other parks), go to the concierge desk at reception. They gave us 2 tickets for seaworld for $42 the pair !! Instead of $81 per person. In exchange we just went along to a timeshare meeting at another Hilton nearby, we had no interest in it and weren't pressured at all, so we came away very happy with the deal! Only 2 minor criticisms, the maid service was a bit hit and miss at times, in terms of the time they came, often they knocked at 9am when we were still asleep and then never came back! Also we were in a room by the lifts so was a little noisey in the mornings but if u avoid these rooms you should be fine ! All in all, thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.....”
Reviews.Author: Nomoresnow111
Reviews.Content: The resort was absolutely beautiful, and the staff was amazing.....Minutes away from shopping, attractions, and nightlife. Took a 4 day winter getaway from large amounts of snow. Looking forward to going back. The Howleys from New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: kpookiem1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here once before and absolutely love it. The rooms are clean and spacious with a two tv's, a jacuzzi bathtub ,a screened in balcony, granite kitchen, dining table, I could go on and on. It's so easy to get to Disney from this hotel, it's only about 2 miles to the entrances to disney. Last time I was there the only store nearby was a Walgreens but now there is everything, Prime outlet mall across the road, restaurants, gas stations, etc. The only improvement they could make more parking. Although I did see some sort of parking garage there but didn't want to use it, wasn't sure if it was for the hotel. If you get back late, it's a huge place and end up parking quite far away. Although they do drive around in golf carts to give you a ride to your building.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: awesomenessness
Reviews.Content: well, it was nice, the rooms were nice, everything was nice, overall. but we were freezing, because the 2 weeks we stayed here, it was the coldest it was ever in Orlando, ever since temperature keeping was invented, which was pretty stupid I think.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mc00721
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Feb4-10. I have positive and negative comments on this Hilton. Here are the negative things: I had originally called 1 month before my trip and again 1 week before my trip in insure I had both rooms close to each other. I was traveling with my husband and my 1.5 yr old son along with my mother and father. I booked 2 rooms and wanted the rooms close to each other but when I arrived at the hotel they had us on 2 different floors. They were kind enough to switch the room after about 2 hours. The second negative thing is that I wanted flowers, cake and balloons in my mother room when she arrived ( it was her birthday) and the staff did not do this. I had to call the front desk to find out where the items were and they eventually delivered the items to my mothers room. The third issue was the T.V in my room. I had to call every night for 3 nights in a row to get my tv fixed. I kept turning off after being on for 5 min. They fixed it and eventually replaced the t.v. with a new one. They came to my room quickly even though it was passed 9pm. They replaced and fixed the problem in a quiet manner while my son slept. Positve things: The hotel ground were beautiful and located away from the other hotels. It was located next to the premium outlets and across the street from a Walgreens and Pulix grocery store. Were were 5-10 miles away from any of the parks-Disney, Seaworld, Universal, etc. You are able to get to the outlets from a gate in the front of out hotel. We stayed in Building 7 which is the newest building located across the pond and next to the outlet. The gate to get to the mall was next to our paking lot so it was very convienent. The rooms are beautiful especially the jacuzzi tub. It was quiet and comfortable. Houskeeping came every day to do the bed, and clean the room. They even did started the dishwasher to clean the dishes. Our flight was cancelled and the hotel accomodated us another night. When everything is said and done I was absolutely stay here again though I had a few bumps in the road. The staff is wonderfull and called us daily to ensure we were we doing o.k and that they were meeting our expectations. Ohh and I forgot to mention that they have an expedia conciege person on site. You can buy any tickets in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: lr554
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful and the staff is amazing. We spent the weekend here for our anniversary, when I booked on line I told them it was our anniversary and that we would like a quiet area. They gave us exactly what we asked for!! They even had a card filled out by the front desk and a wonderful wine basket waiting for us when we arrived!! When we arrived we had some problems with the DVD/CD radio player, this was takin care of right away!! Everyone is so friendly and helpful!! We stayed in the one bedroom with a hot tub, washer/dryer and everything else you can possilby need and/or want!! The grounds are beautiful and well kept!! I would recommend this place with no problem!! You really couldn't ask for more!! I will be back with the children, they have so many wonderful activities for the kids young and old. Can't wait to go back. Thank god I live in Florida, so I know I will go back a soon a possible!! Kids can swim in the pool and do activities while the adults can hangout by the poolside bar, what more can one ask for. lol

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay even though it was cold......”
Reviews.Author: CCCLady
Reviews.Content: We were in Florida the week of January 9th when the temperatures went down to 30 degrees. Since it was too cold we did not use the pool during our stay. We stayed here for 3 days as part of a timeshare promotion. We were in a one bedroom apartment with an adjoining studio. The room was very nice. The master bedroom had a whirlpool tub and a large shower. The apartment had a nice sized balcony, living room, diniing area, and kitchen. The washer and dryer came in handy. When we arrived, we were given a 1PM the next day to attend the presentation of the timeshare at Parc Soleil. We tried to change the time but we were told no other times were available. The next morning we received a phone call at 8:30am asking us to change our presentation time to 9AM. The presentation was good....no pressure to purchase. The price was $$$$$. As others have said, there is a Publix supermarket across the street and the Prime Outlets right next door. The location is right off of I-4 near Interanational Blvd.There is a Pizza Hut Express locate on the property. It is about a 10-15 minute drive to the major parks of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations but location a good drve from parks”
Reviews.Author: apv2636
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as a part of a timeshare presentation deal with Hilton. the resort was great - very clean, well updated. the bathrooms had a jacuzzi and shower. there was a full kitchen and the hotel is within walking distance to a grocery store. the hotel did special games at the pool every day we were there which was nice for families with children. the only downside we had to this location was that it was a good 15-20 min drive from universal studios which is the theme park we were visiting. while this wasn't that bad if we were staying the entire day at the park but it added to the cost because we had to pay to park. the hotel did run shuttles to and from universal 2 times per day but they were not at times that accomodated us and other public transportation (besides expensive taxis) ran to universal. not sure about transportation to other orlando parks b/c we only did univeral.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value and great accomdations”
Reviews.Author: skyfriendbrighton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment. The living area has a large open plan kitchen diner with a living area too. There is a nice balcony which is screened and opens to the bedroom and living room. The apartment was top floor and looked out onto the lovely lake. The apartment had a full kitchen with all crockery etc.., and a washer and dryer. There is a huge whirlpool bath in the bedroom. There is lots of storage. The place was spotlessly clean. The bed was really comfortable. Prime outlet mall and associated food court is right next door. There is an outback steakhouse about 3 minutes walk away. At the weekends it is hard to park next to the units, and you need to park near reception. The super friendly staff then whizz you home in a golf cart. This didn't bother us at all. We never had a problem with traffic as the freeway access was close by. This is an outstanding, very comfortable superbly equipped place to stay and I would recommend it without hesitation. The pictures on the website are accurate but the rooms are nicer than the pictures show.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: Yasap
Reviews.Content: I waited for many months to be able to use my RCI points to get a week here at this resort. I read all the wonderful comments from previous guests and I was decided to stay here for our vacation. The only time available is January, so I exchange my points. But guess what? what a disappointment. We have our room on the fifth floor on building six. We were told by the lady who checked us in that this is a newer building but when we get to our room I could not believe my eyes, all the drawers were pulled out, the cushions from the sofa were stacked on top of the coffee table and there was one baking dish sitting on the granite breakfast bar. I put everything back on its place before my husband and our guests arrive. We stayed in many resorts but nothing like this one. I dont mind tidying up but the room that we have needs TLC. The carpet is filthy, toilet needs serious scubbing and they need to add more pots and pans. Another thing that annoys us was the keycard, it always failed to open the door. So much for the newer building that the woman told me. I appreciate people's comment but really to see is to believe. I just charge this to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: shamrock08
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in December in a studio. The room was clean and updated, and we didn't have any problems with noise, although I'm a light sleeper. I especially liked the screened-in balcony. The property is very pleasant to walk around, and staff was friendly. The glitches: housekeeping kept giving us stained towels. They had definitely been washed, but possibly without bleach? Also, there was a litter of stray kittens by the quiet pool. I saw them over a period of several days. At that point, I saw a lady try and trap them in a cage. Although I don't blame the hotel for the incident, as someone obviously dropped these poor cats off to fend for themselves, I do think they should have done something about it sooner. And finally, my husband and I were almost hit when a golf cart, driven by an employee, rounded the corner into our area of the parking lot at a high rate of speed. I'd probably stay here again, but the problems I experienced do give me pause. The hotel sent me s survey afterwards, and I told them about the issues. They never responded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway !”
Reviews.Author: puddin928
Reviews.Content: Came her with my daughters and grandson ! I can agree with other individuals that the walls are thin. But I don't let that stop me. To avoid the noise from the workers at this resort. I usually get the building in the back and get a room away from the elevator. They do need to have more options beside coffee. I'm not a coffee drinker, tea would be nice. Overall it is a great place to take the family or jus the two of you. There are many options of other hotels. But I choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Barsuchok
Reviews.Content: Last time we stayed in the hotel which was half the price of Hilton GV and we found it to be much better value: we had free shuttle there (in Hilton $6 per person) and free basic breakfast (in Hilton one should pay), all other amenities like location on Int Drive, flat screen TV were also there... Yes, Hilton rooms look very cosy and decorated nicely, but indeed they are not practical at all, for example, due to filmsy doors you can hear everything in corridors and since we had connecting rooms, we could hear the neighboors in the connecting room as well. Personnel start getting noisy behind the door from 7am, so you will have trouble with late nap. There is no kettle or tea in the room, but coffee and coffee mashine. Toilet flashing was problematic, at least in our room. Also, in the middle of the night our fire alarm went on without any particular reason. Hairdryer and ironing desk were really outdated. Some rust in the bathroom. On the plus side, great reception staff and great location close to shopping, I trolley and Publix supermarket with some dining options around.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here when on business”
Reviews.Author: Travellinggirl2010
Reviews.Content: If you like a larger than average hotel room, with a nice whirlpool tub, then you will like it here. You get a condo; bedroom, full bathroom, laundry, full kitchen, dining and living area. It's perfect for the business traveller because it's close to the I-4 for easy access, plus you can come and go, as you please. I go to the Publix across the street, buy my dinner and breakfast and I'm all set. The front desk are very accommodating, once you get to know the property they will gladly move you to your choice location (mine is building 6 or 7 floor 7 - newer buildings and closer to the outlet mall). It's not as close to all the Disney attractions or nightlife, but then within 5 minutes you're on International Drive, and it's worth the drive because its a really nice property and good value. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spotlessly clean, great location, shame about the food...”
Reviews.Author: Elsterz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in a studio 11-26th December, wouldnt stay in a studio again due to the noise from the lockout next door. Studio was a decent size, good condition, bed was super comfy, balcony overlooked the internal lake, nice view.... Food at the main pool bar was poor, expensive and not exactly 5* - far from Hilton hotel standard I must admit I was a little surprised.... Pools are clean and towels and plentiful, great facilities and great location. You dont really need a car if you plan on doing the parks and Premium Outlets (which is literally 2 mins walk away thru the back gated entrance) Staff, although very polite and helpful were very prescriptive and didnt think around a solution or a question, rather just quoted policy or a stock answer....perhaps this is a little harsh, but it was my experience here.. Would I stay here again - yes, but not in a studio and I would never, ever eat at the HGVC

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Norwaykek
Reviews.Content: we were in orlando 07-11dec2009. we stayed at the HGVC on International Drive. we did not go to orlando with the intentions of only going to Disney. we had a two bedroom suite for the five of us (kids are 5, 5 and 7). the adults had enough seperation from the kids and we all enjoyed the room. the kitchen was well equiped and housekeeping was thorough. we spent one day at the pool, one day at disney and one day at the pool room and around the property. the easy access (walking) to the Premier Outlets was convenient. was not terribly impressed with the bar/bar food at the pool. it was expensive and not quick. pulix is conveniently located just over the street. would love to go back another time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent price and roomy suites!”
Reviews.Author: Hookradio1035
Reviews.Content: This place is a great find for me- i always stay with Hilton Properties and this is probably one of my favorite finds. I have made it a point to switch around from hotel to hotel in Orlando because of the vast amounts of them, but i think i will be returning to this one. i found my fav! Pools are excellent, staff is courteous. Watch out for the 10am checkout, ask for late checkout and they will happy to accomodate. My friend and I got a one bedroom suite with oversized patio overlooking a gorgeous lake, dining table outside on the patio etc. Everything about this place is great. Check it out for yourself, esp. if you find a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute Fabulous Find”
Reviews.Author: tsmith5651
Reviews.Content: Went to a "no fee" hotel booking site called http://hotel-guides.us/ and was looking for a last minute weekend getaway. And came across a fabulous deal for $60.00 a night. Was there 11/20-11/22. Have lived in Florida over 25 years and had Seaworld passes and never knew this vacation club/hotel was available without "owning" a timeshare membership. The entrance way was "grand" Had a security gate that was for new arrivals and another for registered guest that you could use your key. We parked our car in a circular drive and was greeted happily by a doorman. Once inside, a desk clerk quickly greeted us and was checked in less than 5 minutes. Not one time during the entire weekend did anyone ask us if we wanted to do a tour. Asked me our preferences on type of room /floor level and location. I asked for non smoking and a top floor. Got the 6thfloor in the "Georges House" building. Our room was totally new and remodeled. In room safe. Cleaning supllies, vaccuum, mop, laundry soap, dish detergent. Plenty of trash bags, Ironing board etc. Had granite counter tops, tiled floors in kitchen and bathroom. Small fridge and microwave, sink and dishes, silverware, glassware for two. Very tastefully decorated with a West Indies look of dark woods and floral pictures. A Phillips Flat Screen TV with good assortment of channels for everyone. But who is there to watch TV. Plenty of activities for the kids and adults alike. Spa services that were reasonably priced. A tennis pro available for lessons with a appointment. Hd a nice screened balcony with 2 chairs and table. Pools were heated with exception of one that shut down overnight, so the temps in all the others was around 82 and the broken one was 72 degrees. Plenty of towels were always available and no stress on getting them. No one monitoring how many you were taking. Pool side coral grill to eat lunch. Hot tubs were nicely placed throughout the pool area. Lush tropical landscaping. Parking was ok. plenty during day but in the evening could fill up after everyone home from nearby theme parks. This hotel is nicely located near everything. They give you a great instruction map for all your local shops , such as Super Walmart (only 2 miles away) . International Drive is a short 10 minute drive away. This is a quiet off busy interstate and "hotel row" resort. Saw lots of young people with jogging strollers on sidewalks in front of the resort. Very safe. One employee named Julio was very pleasant and greeted us, introduced himself and offered to help us with anything we needed throughout our stay. Everyone we made eye contact with said hello. Just an overall nice weekend. No stress, no pressure sales or invite to see any presentation. Checkout was just as easy as check in and you could check out from your phone. We did receive a call from Guest Services asking us if everything about our stay was acceptable. Housekeeping even called and asked if we needed anything because we left our "do not disturb" sign on the door. Would definetly stay here again. was a quiet hotel, seemed very kid friendly with lots of families, but no noise. The people staying were very respectful as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a great location next to Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Rodeonr20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel because of it's location next to Seaworld. Me and my girlfriend walked from our room to Seaworld in about 10 minutes. It was slightly confusing once we got across the crosswalk heading to Seaworld, the sidewalk ends and it's just grass but keep walking and you will find the parking lot/entrance into SeaWorld. Follow the big sign on SeaWorld's main sign that says Pedestrians and you will find it. The room was very nice and the staff were helpful. I made my reservation online and it didn't go through but they made me a new reservation with my military discount right on the spot. The hotel is also close to some Orlando nightlife called The Point which me and my girlfriend also enjyoed and there is no complimentary breakfast. If you want to go to Seaworld I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: dayoirl
Reviews.Content: UP SIDE-----stayed in november with my girlfriend for 10 nights. its about a 30-40 min drive from the airport,which by cab costs between 40-50 dollars. from the minute you get to the hotel doors,you are met by very friendly staff who escort you to reception.while checking in i asked would it be possable to get an upgrade to a bigger room,in which they amazingly went ahead and done for free! We then got a lift to our room on one of the many buggies driven again by very friendly staff.The room was incredable.very spacious, clean and cosy and a beautiful view over their lake.The pool was great very big ,not the warmest but definitly bareable once u dip in. Bar was great,very close to the pool,and i would give the food a 10/10. Premium outlet malls is only a couple minute walk from the hotel,and this is where you can also catch the very cheap and reliable i-drive which is a must if you have no transport and has some great deals.and publix shopping centre is across from the main entrence to the hotel, well within walking distance again. there is a small shop on the hotel grounds that has the essentials.but publix is definitly the way to go if your staying for a while. DOWN SIDE------- there are very few downsides to your stay here ,but i will note a few small ones. you are probably best off staying here if you have your own transport,as it is maybe a 10 minute ride away from parks and the main i drive strips.however if you dont mind public transport,then this doesnt matter. internet is not free. dont use the on site pizza bay as it is terrible :D. the shop is small (has the essentials tho) but is quiet a bit more expensive than useing the shopping centre publix. in my opinion,i would say the hotel and atmosphere probably suits people more 30 years +,but im 25 and had a great time. thats it i guess.and im just nit picking there OVERALL---- An excellent stay for an excellent price,i would recommend it to anyone.Friendly staff and beautifully maintained grounds. 9/10

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kirstenmc
Reviews.Content: The HGVC is an absolutely fantastic place to stay. We stayed in a King size suite in Building 5. The room was large, fully furnished with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The kitchen area, although compact contained everything required for our two week stay including a full size fridge. Building 5 looks onto the smaller pool which had lots of sunloungers and there was always a supply of fresh towels for you to use whilst at the pool. Pizza hut was a 2 minute walk from building 5 and is on site. Premium outlets shopping centre is also no more than a 2 minute walk from building 5. An electronic gate opened by your room key affords you easy access to 250 shops. We could not fault the cleanliness of the hotel. Our room was cleaned every day through out our stay including saturday and sunday. The maids worked exceptionally hard. The hotel facilities were excellent with plenty of activities forchildren over at the main pool. The deli shop contained basics to keep you going. The screened balcony was also perfect. We were able to sit out in the evening without being pestered by bugs. The staff were friendly and polite. We were regularily asked if we required a lift from our car to our building by the security staff and the mini bus driver. The compound is very secure and due to the regular tours made by the security staff you felt very safe walking around late at night. Due to the hotels location, a further 5 minutes drive south of Seaworld, a car is essential if you want to explore central Orlando. HGVC is 10 minutes from the main I Drive tourist area. However there is a small shopping area across the road with a publix and walgreens supermarkets. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service! Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: cb00083
Reviews.Content: This resort had all you could ask for. I stayed there for 10 days with my parents, sister and 1 year old son and it was perfect for us! Good facilities, dining, entertainment, location, transport. Good priced, daily shuttle service to theme parks. Great for the Premium Outlets, literally across the road, actual walking distance (quite rare in America lol). Staff were extremely helpful, nothing was too much for them! Customer service hardly exists in England compared to America! Beautiful lake and fountains. Nice little play area for kids although we spent more time in the pool. Just Lovely all round. Highly recommended A***!

Reviews.Title: “The staff are excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn1366
Reviews.Content: All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Shaun at the conceirege desk went out of his way to book us a golf time at another resort. He even called them back to get us a better rate! The room was very clean and had everything we needed. The only complaint I would have is that we had to pay to use the internet. The pevious resort we were at had it for free. There are plenty of activities to do at the resort if you are tired of Disny and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and dangerously close to the outlets!”
Reviews.Author: elh76
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel in early November. I stayed for two nights in a 1-bedroom suite and it was perfect. I liked the toned down luxury of the room and the spaciousness as well. I had a terrace with a view of the pond and smaller pool. The location is on International Drive so you are close to everything, and really really close to the Premium Outlets!
