You can walk through the parking lot and they're right there - you need not drive! I ate dinner at the outdoor restaurant, one of only two on the property and it was pretty good. It had a family and sports bar atmosphere (Game 6 of the World Series was on) and the pools were right there. This place has a lot of family activities that you can do at the property if you don't want to hit the theme parks every day. My room had a lot of space just like a 1-bedroom apartment, with a luxurious bathroom and full kitchen. I was here for work and felt that I could relax when I returned to the room. The front desk staff and the 'runners' on the golf carts were really helpful and happy to be at work. That made it more enjoyable too. I think that this hotel is good for families or leisure travelers or even business travelers looking for a different experience than the typical Hilton Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Vacation Club Properties”
Reviews.Author: Balula
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this resort on a Timeshare promotion, you will get a cool condo suite which is huge and beautiful. There are a few things that require some improvement on this property. First, it is REALLY HARD TO FIND!The instructions they give you at the hotel from the Airport to the resort, skip alot of the little roads and only list the main roads. You will need a car to get to and from anywhere if you stay at this resort becuase it's not close to anything. Also, there is not much in terms of a restaurant on this property , just a little cafe that serves a really bland small buffet breakfast, no dinner, no other restaurants, and no roomservice . If you're using the Condo, go to the grocery store across the street and fill up the fridge. Otherwise you have to eat at the outlet mall across the street which has some great shopping and eating. Make sure you bring lots of one dollar bills for tipping the cart guys that take you to and from your suite( if you don't have a car). becuase the actual rooms are like 2 blocks from the check-in counter, and at 96 degrees, you 're not gonna want to walk! Overall, the property is beautiful but if your goal is to run around and sight see, you might want to rethink this location. Better to stay on the Disney Property itself, where there are buses that take you to and from each theme park, downtown and other locations and they fairly often so you're never stranded and you don't pay the extra expense of renting a car. This property is good for peoeple with vehicles and lots of people in their party. If it's just two of you, you don't need a condo, better a regular hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms at a good price, but limited services and do not plan on sleeping in.”
Reviews.Author: AviatorMR
Reviews.Content: I was here for three days for a conference in Orlando at the relatively nearby conference center. This time share hotel offers large comfortable rooms in an environment that is more like a large apartment complex than a hotel. The rooms are all suites and have small kitchens, washers and dryers and would be excellent for families. However, there are several important problems to be aware of. Definitely avoid rooms ending in 14. I was in one such room and it was directly next door to a mechanical room. The noise from the mechanical room would cycle up and all day and night (sounding kind of like a jet engine starting) making it almost impossible to sleep, even with ear plugs. I had to relocate to a different room. I decided to sleep in on the last day of the conference but had the housekeeper ring the doorbell at 8:30 AM (I had not put out the DND sign). Also, the hallways are finished in tile and the housekeeping carts make a racket as they are rolled from room to room. It is also important to note that the food service is extremely limited. There is basically a deli-style cafe with a fairly narrow selection of offerings (and it is a long walk from many parts of the property) and there is no room service other than an embedded Pizza Hut Express. Finally, I was shocked to learn that the check-out time at the hotel is 10am. While I was able to extend it to noon, I have never experienced a hotel that expected you to be out of the room that early on the day of departure. All in all, I would say that the hotel is well-suited for families on vacation to Orlando who are planning on longer stays. While the room sizes are good and the free internet access is nice (although rather slow), the limited service makes it much less appealing to a business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort we have stayed at to date!”
Reviews.Author: KrysNJeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Orlando for our anniversary. In preparation for our trip, I did a lot of research of the hotels/resorts in the area...I wanted to stay at a resort with class and elegance, but for a resonable value. I found the best rate on Sams club.com (almost 60 less than expedia, ect). We decided to book the GHVC since it was a good location to the PRemium outlet mall and Disney...it is located literally next to the outlet mall (if you park in the garage, you can see the resort - less than 100 ft). Upon arrival, we were greeted by a friendly staff member who escorted us to the front desk represenative. We stayed in a bedroom suite in building 7 (the newest building)...our view overlooked the pond and fountains (beautiful). The rooms were very clean and elegant! I was impressed with the bedsheets and down conforter...it was almost like I did not leave my own bed! The balcony was a nice area to sit back and relax after a long day at the parks. Suggestions/Tips: the elevators must not have air conditioning, the parking is not accomodating - but they have security that will drive you to your complex), house keeping does not regularly come out, they do not have a full length mirror. On the plus side: there is a nice flat screen TV and a DVD player in the room as well as a kitchen area with all the items you need to prepare a small meal (microwave, coffee maker, toaster, mini fridge, microwave, blender, and dishes/utencils). We elected to eat breakfast at the Fresco deli on site...not a good idea! The food was not great for 9.00...if you are ok with fast food - I recommend leaving the hotle, or bringing your own breakfast. The pool area was very nice and there are 2 hot tubs in the main swimming area...if you want to relax witout a lot of noise, I suggest the Laguna pool located near building 5. They have an onsite photographer that will take several pictures of you and your family throughout the resort and you recieve a 5x7 photo complimentary! There is a shuttle that costs 12 to get to the parks as well as an on-site area where you can purchase tickets at a discounted price - FYI - the shuttle times were not great, so we paid the extra 2.00 and drove our own vehicle. The best part of our stay was when we arrived to our room on Saturday to find an anniversary card for us (signed by ALL the front staff) as well as a chesse/cracker/fruit and wine basket waiting for us in the fridge...that truley blew us away and eliminated any "suggestions" we had for improvement. I would definately recommend staying at this resort....we were never even called for the timeshare offering; in fact, I learned about that part when I searched the hotel to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dk1980
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from staying here for two weeks and thought the hotel/apartment complex was excellent. We had a one bedroom apartment with a kitchenette and balcony overlooking the lake and the premium outlet mall was right next door, which was very convenient. The hotel was really nice and everything was really clean and the hotel grounds were lovely. the staff were very helpful and friendly and the made service came everyday and did a good job. the hotel offered a full days entertainment each day, which would be ideal for young families. there was a pizza hut on site which was nice, i think it was around $10 for a pizza and 2 fitness suites located at each pool, but were bit on the small sized. The hotel is opposite a Publix and the outback steak house (which i would definitely recommend - we had some great steaks from here) and the i-ride stops right outside the hotel, but you could always go over to the premium as the i-ride's bus terminus is located here. it would take about 1 hour to 1 and half hours to travel the full length of i-drive on the i-ride though. There was a shuttle bus to the parks which costed $6 per person return trip, 3 shuttles in the morning, the last of which was 11.30am, and 3 pick ups, the last of which was 9pm, but double check this as our last pick up was 7.15pm 1 hour after universal had closed. the only problem we had with this occurred when we wanted to have a night out in city-walk. as we would be getting dressed up for the evening we couldn’t really get the 11.30am shuttle! So we had to get a taxi there. plus there was no late evening shuttle as well, not even at the weekend which i found strange. the scheduled transportation was the only let down of this hotel. i have stayed in other hotels in international drive which offer free transportation to the parks which run several times in the morning and once or twice early & late evening, the last of which was around 12am/1am. I cannot understand why other hotels can offer free transportation to the parks but this hotel cannot. Anyway a taxi to universal is just under $25 each way and i think to go to downtown Disney it would be around the same price. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and i would recommend it however if you are thinking of not hiring a car while you stay in orlando, i would recommend staying in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Hilton”
Reviews.Author: sftnslky
Reviews.Content: First off let me say this resort is GEORGOUS!!! The grounds are huge and stunning. It is all built with an Italian/Tuscan theme. We really did not know what to expect as we had never even heard of this hotel before they called us. We literally were in the middle of planing our Disney Cruise vacation and trying to find a hotel big enough for the 7 of us for pre cruise, when we got a phone call from Hilton Grand Vacations Club [HGVC] offering us a free stay in Las Vegas. At first I said "No thank you." And explained to them that we were already going on vacation and didn't have the time or dollars for another one. So they asked what days we would be in Orlando and then said if they could get us a two bedroom suite for 3 full nights for basically free, as long as we agreed to go on a time share tour, would we be interested. I thought about it for less then a second and said "Yes!!!." After flying cross country from Northern Ca, to Orlando for 7 hours, then spending another hour waiting for our rental car we could have slept on the concrete for all we cared, but thankfully Hilton had other ideas. As we pulled up to the guard station, he already had all of our parking passes ready and pointed us to the reception desk. When I checked in I asked the gentleman at the desk if they had already placed the rollaway bed in the suite...he looked a little confused and said "Ma'am we haven't had rollaway's for a few years now" I instantly thought "oh great here we go." I explained to him that the gentleman who called assured me that you would have a rollaway for our sons to sleep on. he then asked how many of us were there. I explained 7...3 adults and 4 kids. He told me the room that we had was what they called a 1/studio. Another words it was a full one bedroom with an attached studio. The bedroom would sleep 2 in the king, and in the studio 2 can sleep on the pull out and 1 or 2 in the queen bed. He then offered that they could bring a mattress from one of the other fold out sofas and put it on the ground for my son. I was happy with that so as we were finishing up all the paperwork, when this other gentleman came over and punched something into the computer and said "give this to them please." They had a full two bedroom with 1 king, 2 fulls and a queen pull out sofa bed that they had on hold for someone, but they had canceled at the last minute. So yippee skippy we are on our way to our room. We were in tower 2 on the 5th floor. The bellman brought ALLLLL of our bags up..poor guy, thankfully hubby tipped him well. The suite was AWESOME. A full kitchen fully stocked with plates, silverware, coffee maker, pots and pans, etc... beyond the kitchen was a dinning/living room, which was very large. with a dinning room table that could seat 6, and the living room had a desk/chair, large sofa, 2 overstuffed chairs/ottomans. Directly off of the living room was the fully screened in lanai with a patio set that could seat 4, ceiling fan and light. The lanai was also accessible from the mater bedroom as well. Off to the left of the kitchen was a hallway with a stackable washer and dryer..which came in handy several times. The second bedroom with a full walk in closet, 2 queen beds, a very large dresser, and large flat screen tv. across from the laundry area was a full bathroom, with a tub/'shower combo and your standard toilet, sink etc... across from the bathroom was the master bedroom. As you opened the door you were greeted with a MASSIVE Jacuzzi tub that could have easily have held 4 adults, or several children. There was a super comfy king size bed, with two night stands a chair, a smaller walk in closet with an in room safe. There was also the bathroom with an amazing walk in rain shower. The shower was also MASSIVELY large and could have held 4 or 5 adults. As you can guess we were VERY tired from all the traveling and did not feel like going out to get something to eat. We found a pizza hut magnet on the refrigerator, and found out they were onsite and would deliver to your room. So hubby called and ordered pizza while myself and brother in law went across the street to Publix grocery store to pick up some basic supplies. When we returned, hubby had taken all the kids swimming and to see the outdoor/pool side movie. Two days a week they show family movies on a huge blow up screen in the pool area. After swimming and pizza we all fell into bed. The next morning came VERY early for hubby and I. We had agreed to go on the tour and they had reserved our time to be 8:15 AM...which for us is 5:00AM. We went on a non stressful tour, watched the informational video and was asked several times if we were interested in purchasing. After the 1 1/2 hour tour we went back to the room and met up with the rest of the family. We found out from the front desk that the property backs up to the huge Orlando Factory Outlet Stores, and we simply had to walk across this wooden bridge to the back gate, use our room key and walk across the street to the outlets. Our wallets wish they would have never told us this "secret." The pool area is very large with the pool its self looking like the Olympic rings with a gorgeous waterfall that resembles the Olympic cauldron. There is a small cafe/deli pool side and several bars, and during certain times of the day there is a young lady that will do hair braiding and air brush tattoos. There is also a small gift shop. There are 7 towers that all encase a very large manmade lake. The grounds are landscaped very nicely with many palm trees. There was also several screened in basketball courts that we personally didn't not use, but saw several folks enjoying them. The final morning came quickly and with a 10AM check out time [YIKES} we were off to enjoy the rest of our vacation. We could have easily spent an entire week at HGVC, and might in the future. One downside, besides the early checkout is they offered no shuttles to any of the surrounding tourist areas. And the overly priced deli items via poolside, but I guess that is to be expected. I only wish we would have arranged to stay here for the 2 nights after our Cruise, but that is another report.

Reviews.Title: “HGVC - Great location for the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: minnow1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this HGVC on one of their "previews" or timeshare presentations. The resort is pretty new and decorated in a nice Tucson style. It's also quite large-surrounds a little lake and has two nice pools. All the rooms (even the "studios") include a kitchenette which was nice because there is a Publix grocery across the street to stock up on whatever you need. Due to the proximity to Disney and the other theme parks there were a lot of kids-even in late September. They serve food at the bar & have a Pizza Hut Express but that's about it-there aren't a whole lot of choices in walking distance but there are some transportation options that aren't too badly priced. Overall it was okay-the staff was very good, definitely above average, the accommodations were nice. A perfect place to stay if visiting local attractions, but wouldn't be our first choice for a relaxing get away that we planned to spend poolside. The sales presentation was high pressure, but that was to be expected. Just know you'll be spending half the day with a salesperson if you opt to go this route--not the 1.5-2 hours they 'estimate.' It was still a good value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly and relaxed place.”
Reviews.Author: Blaeu
Reviews.Content: Just got back from here and found the place wonderful. We had a one bedroom apartment in building four which was beautiful. It was quite a way from the main pool and reception, which whilst it made it a little walk, it was away from the noise and music at the main pool. However, we were almost right next door to the secondary pool which is a much quieter, albeit smaller, place. For food, there is a pizza hut on the site, and well as Hiltons own grills at each of the pools. The food at the grills was generally very good, though the menus were perhaps a little limited. There is also a deli on site, and since our place had a kitchen, that was also useful. Wireless internet was free and also rather quick. A pleasent surprise. The hotel buildings are set around a small lake, which has turtles and fish swimming in it. There is an on site gym, though I did not use it. There is a free computer for printing boarding passes, though it did not seem to work for my BA flight. In the immediete area there is a retail outlet park right next door, and Hilton guests can access it through a private gate. An easy way to spend money on designer labels! There is also a supermarket in the other direction and a few restaurants. Theme parks Disney, Universal and Seaworld are all fairly close. The hotel has three shuttles a day each way at the cost of $6 per person. The staff are friendly and helpful, although the shuttle bus firm they use for transport to the parks are a little unfriendly. Generally I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dangerouslyfluffy
Reviews.Content: When we first caught sight of our hotel, a beautiful water feature welcomed us. The staff were kind and we had no problems while checking into our rooms. When we got there, our bags were waiting for us, like they should have been, and our room was in order. Since a member of my family was getting married, we rented one of the glorious ballrooms and had a fantastic wedding with beautiful decor and amazing food. The beds were comfortable and clean and the room service was quick and very tasty. Overall, my family and I had a great stay and are staying there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: tdudley55555
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. At first I was a little disappointed in the location of our room because it was across the lake (building 6) but afterwards taking the stroll across the bridge every night I learned to love the peace and quite we had since we were not close to the pool where you could hear people swimming and playing at night, it was a nice relief on the ears. The hotel offers a movie night and the kids loved it and it was something to do other then stay in the hotel room. They could swim in the pool while watching a Disney movie. The food was fantastic and we ate a couple of times at the bar. The only down fall I could see was the kids would jump backwards off the pool under the waterfall and one night a boy cracked his head open and the pool was closed for two plus hours while they cleaned up the mess. This could have been avoided had there been someone from the hotel telling him to stop. Unfortunately there are no lifeguards on duty at the hotel, parents please watch your children... The mall next door is great if your looking for some shopping fun and they have a food court. Pizza Hut is in the hotel and they deliver... Plus on that note.

Reviews.Title: “A Resort for All in the Center of it All”
Reviews.Author: scbleo
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hilton resort with all the extras you expect and more. The fact that it is adjacent to the Premium Prime Outlets off International and Vineland is attractive. The fact that the rooms are villas with plenty of space to spread out and relax is comfortable and inviting to stay longer. The kitchen is fully equipped right down to salt and pepper shakers. The towels, soaps, and bath extras were generous and the suite was spotless, all added to the plush pampering. We had a one-bedroom villa with a king bed, whirlpool (just like the hotel's website pictures), a queen sleeper sofa, a screened in balcony with a ceiling fan/light that had a patio table with seating for 4. The staff is a team of professionals who continue to earn their positons. From the parking attendant when we arrived to the departure front desk staff, these are the best in their fields. Friendly, efficient, and observant and yet, they are not intrusive. There is a massage staff, photographer, activity center, and several staff waiting to serve you. Even more impressive to us was the safety we felt in the evenings. The security staff is excellent with patrols watching and caring for you and your vehicles. Parking can get tight, but there are sufficient spots on the property, it might not be near your building. However, with the frequent security golf carts stopping to ask you if you would like a ride back to your room, no need to worry about exercising, unless you want to. Not one Hilton staff was rude or cold, whether on duty or not, these are people who like their jobs and it shows. There even a preview center filled with over 125 salespeople who greet you and may try to soft sell you but are not overbarring or rude. The rest of the amenities are on the web, 2 pools, 2 fitness centers, etc...Near Sea World, a car ride from Universal, or Disney, this is the best kept secret in Orlando. We can not wait to go back. The only recommendations we could make would be to add a full length mirror to the rooms, helps to see your complete outfit and if you are visually impaired, like I am, a mirror to get closer while putting on my contacts is very helpful. My husband also suggested a over-the-shower bottle holder for there really is no place to place the shampoo/conditioner bottles within the standing shower.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort with Excellent Customer Service. Going Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel1974
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week long stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation Clubs on International Drive. My husband and I reserved the one bedroom suite, while another couple traveling with us reserved the studio room. This hotel was wonderful! The one bedroom suite was clean and had modern furnishings and a very comfortable bed. I agree with other posters, who stated that the parking at night was a little inconvenient, however it was no different than parking at Disney. We only had to park a short distance from our building (Building 6) and each night there was employees providing rides via a golf cart. Security was very visible via their segway transportation devices. Check in was easy and I only received one call from the front desk requesting our participation in the Time Share Presentation. My husband declined and we did not receive any other calls. The resort is well maintained and there is a Pizza Hut Express on site. Unlike many resorts in the area this one does not charge a daily resort fee. The location was perfect as there was a Publix Grocery Store, Outback Steakhouse, and 24-hour Walgreens located across the street. There was easy access to the Premium Outlets next door. The entrance to Disney was less than four miles from the resort. I would definitely recommend this resort to couples as well as families. The staff was superb and I am already trying to reserve a room for January 2010. I would recommend that you request a room on the top floor with a lake view. The only downside was the heavy slamming doors.

Reviews.Title: “You won't want to leave :-)”
Reviews.Author: McQueen81
Reviews.Content: The hardest part of leaving florida was leaving the resort. The suite we stayed in had every modern luxury anyone could ever need: fridge, stove, microwave, 2 tv's, king size bed, whirlpool tub, him/hers sinks, washer/dryer. The hotel has activities planned every single day of the week. So even if you can't go anywhere else for any reason, they have you covered. We had a gorgeous view of the lake, fountain, and laguna pool from our very suite balcony. There were no bothersome phone calls from any of the staff like some other reviewers complain about. We did participate in a wine tasting night. it was 25$ per couple and you went home with a bottle of wine of your choosing. The pool are always warm and just deep enough that kids can still get in and not be in too much danger. The hotel is the perfect distance from all of the theme parks (excluding busch gardens in tampa). There are shuttles to take you to the park if you so choose. I did all the driving while we were there. You also have instant access to the Orlando Premium outlets thru a back gate in the hotel, and trust me... there is every store you could imagine. If there is any one tip i could give anyone it would be to remember there is a supermarket, liquor store, subway, and mcdonalds across the street if you want to buy some regular food. On the other hand, who wants regular food when you're on vacation? Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful resort!”
Reviews.Author: bappo
Reviews.Content: Right from the start, we knew we had made the correct choice. Our 2 bedroom unit was just beautiful. Had all the comforts of home plus a great view! Pools were clean and the movie by the main pool was wonderful for my friends 9 yr old. Pools are not deep, between 3 and 4 feet at the main pool, and the other pool was from 1 foot to 4 feet 6 inches. Perfect for children and parents. Main pool had a poolside bar and restaurant. Very nice and not too expensive. Staff were very helpful. Resort has a shuttle to parks, for a fee, and taxi service is available as well. Publix is across the street along with many restaurants. Would I stay here again, YES!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Emphasis is on sales, not customer service; No lifeguard in busy pool!”
Reviews.Author: nyblondieLongIsland
Reviews.Content: We purchased a 2 bedroom (5,000 pt) unit last year and despite being there during Tropical Storm Faye, we managed to enjoy ourselves immensely. Which is why we bought it, obviously. Everything was wonderful. We returned this year with much anticipation for a 10 night visit, and were promised accomidations very much like what we had the year before (building 4, facing the smaller pool and lake), as per our specific request. We were put in Building 5, which is without a doubt the worst building they have. And not only was it the worst building, it was the worst room: it had a view of the Premium Outlet parking lot. We could hear nothing but road noise, breathe in nothing but auto fumes. We called to complain and were told the only room available was in Building 3 overlooking the lake, but that the air wasn't working, and we would just have to wait until it was repaired, when ever that was---probably tomorrow. So I unpacked. Less then an hour later, they called to tell us the room was available for us if we wanted, so we moved. It was steaming hot. We waited another hour. It got hotter. We complained again. This time we were moved to the top floor (the best view), and everything seemed OK. Housekeeping was scarce, definitely. When you ask for more detergent, its like prying coins from the ferry man. The pools are busy, but fun for the kids. The main pool has a bar and grille, but its pricey like everything else in Orlando. There's hair-wrapping and tattoos, homemade icecream, and free ice pops. They offer social activities like karyoke night, dive-in movies ,and music. They also organize stuff for the kids, but I found the staff somewhat unfriendly. The biggest problem is that there is no lifeguard on duty. The rules are not enforced. Other children were jumping into the pool on top of my kids, and were first asked not to do it, then told to stop because it was unsafe, ran to tell their mother. A very low-brow confrontation ensued, with the children crying theatrically and me being cursed at by their heavily tattoed mother and grandmother. Security did nothing for us. It spoiled our stay somewhat. What really put the kabash on it was the stultifying and oppressive checkout time: 10AM. And they mean it. We called to ask for more time that morning (they tell you late check out is available when you check in), and at first they refused, they had the room booked. We said we only need till 12. After haggling for 10 minutes they finally said we could have until 11. So while we waited for the clothes to dry, we swam for 20 minutes. I swear they were watching us. When we returned at 10:45, they called at 11:05 to see if house keeping could come in, afterwhich she knocked 3 more times, and had management call again at 11:45. We were more than a little pissed at the shove out given their extremely late check in time (4PM), but just ignored them. I know if we had purchased more points we probably wouldn't have been treated that way. Not so sure we'll stay here again, and if so it would not be without stipulations.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Florid1957
Reviews.Content: We have been owners for 5 years, we love every miniute we spend there and are looking forward to visiting again in august with all our family and partners. the rooms are great, services and staff first class. We have been travelling to Forida for 25 years and we regret not buying before. Book and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Resort was gorgeous and very well run!”
Reviews.Author: Spieslak
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous & meticulous grounds. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Food was excellent. Amenities/activities great. Rooms were beautiful. Highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Just Like Hotel Site Pictures!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gcollins2
Reviews.Content: Ok, first thank you everyone for giving candid reviews on this resort. I did a lot of research on different hotels to stay at in Orlando and based on reviews I chose the HGVC @ International Drive. I just returned about 2 hrs ago and felt it was worth to give a review. The hotel was AWESOME!! No bogus pictures on their site, the hotel looked exactly as the hilton.com pictures. Rooms were beautiful. I stayed in a king size studio suite with frig, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, etc. Everything is upgraded. I traveled with my 10 year old son and he had a great time. Honestly when we were at the parks, he was talking about how we were going to go back to the hotel and chill!!..He looked forward to the arcade room, the activity center that housed two pool tables, checkers table and chess. The pools were beautiful and well maintained. Water was nice and warm and the spa whirpools were great. I must say the prices were also incredibly reasonable to include the food prices. They had a pizza hut onsite that charged the same prices as any other pizza hut in your local neighborhood and the food at the tuscany bar and grill was awesome. Drinks were made well, no water down and adults could sit by bar or lounge by pool and keep a nice eye on the children. Staff were always friendly and extremely helpful. I arrived at 11:00 am and my room was ready although check in is 4:00 pm. They also allowed me to check out 1 hour after regular check out time. They have seven bldgs so getting to the front building can be a bit tiring, but you can call the bellman and someone will come pick you up. However if you enjoy scenery, take the walk to the front of the hotel around their beautiful lake. They also have washer and dryers on 2 floors of everybody building, which was great to be able to wash bathing suits and towels. Although the hotel provided nice warm towels for the guests while at both of their pools. Someting to do everyday all day to include wine and cheese tasting, karaoke, live music outdoors, bingo, trivia, etc.... The biggest thing for me is that although the hotel was top notch as far as the looks and amenities, they also were so family friendly!!! Plus there was a food store right across the street to stock up your kitchen. The screened in balcony was a plus to eat bfast in the morning. ENJOY!!!!!!!! P.S. They also ran me about $80 a nite using my AAA card.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel & great pool!”
Reviews.Author: SkyVixxen
Reviews.Content: I love HGVC, the rooms are awesome with kitchen, washer & dryer...everything a family needs; however the service here as not as great as it is in Vegas but this hotel is definately more beautiful. Also without informing us they put us in a "hearing impared" room. It seemed every time someone rang the door bell that the fire alarm was going off! That got old real fast having 3 kids with us who like to push the button & watch everyone jump! I had to tape a note over both door bells DO NOT USE! We were supposed to have a 3 BR suite, like we book in Las Vegas. Something must have happened since we ended up with a 2 BR suite plus a mini studio suite attached. Double check your reservations! We made ours almost a year in advance only to find out 3 months later, after we already had confirmation that they LOST our reservation. Must be how we ended up in this room. The spa is not really a spa, I suggest going someplace else for spa treatments. They do offer lots of activities by the pool to keep the kids occupied, they even had a blow up big screen & they played movies on it at night. They offer a shuttle to and from Universal, I was not too impressed with this schedule...it could be better. Some of our family took it one way & were not happy about not knowing it made so many stops.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: lawheel
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old daughter and stayed here for 4 nights while having some fun in Disney World together before heading further south to see my parents. I knew the place would be pretty good from all the reviews, but WOW, everything exceeding my expectations. We were able to check in quickly and had a fabulous room in Building two. We had a King Size bed suite with full kitchen, living room and washer/dryer. We had an amazing view of the water and it was wonderful sitting on the screened in porch overlooking the water as we had a snack or ate breakfast. The room was very clean, comfortable, we had a great whirlpool tub which we used every night and it was fabulous. Housekeeping was great, came in everyday and did the dishes, emptied garbage, made beds and kept everything neat and clean for us. The grounds are very clean, the workers were some of the most polite people I've ever met. Everyone smiled, greeted us warmly and always asked if there was anything we needed. I was so impressed with the staff. The pool was immaculate and my daughter loved it. It was a lot of fun to have movie nights out by the pool and the staff also had games you could participate in as well. The bar staff was friendly and the food and drinks were great. There was a deli to purchase food in as well, or you could order from your room and then pick up in deli. There is a pizza hut on site as well. We also rented a movies from the lobby and watched it in our room a few nights, since there is a DVD player in the living room. Originally we planned on staying three nights, but it was so wonderful we stayed an extra night. There is a pier that crosses over from the resort to the shopping outlet mall and it's a beautiful walk. There is also a photographer at the hotel and they offer a free photo of your family/party. It only took about 15 minutes and we have great pictures of our time there. Location is fabulous, only a mile from the Disney World entrance and a mile from Sea World. It only took us a few minutes to get to Downtown Disney, Magic Kingdom and Sea World. Neither of us wanted to leave and I can't wait to go back. I want to take our whole family back next time so we can enjoy it even more! If I had to pick anything as a negative, the only thing I can think of was the parking. There never seemed to be enough spaces for everyone, especially if you came back very late at night. One night I had to park by another building and walk to ours, but the security was amazing. Always someone on the grounds on segways and carts, lots of lights in the parking lots, always felt safe the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome”
Reviews.Author: db16
Reviews.Content: We have spent many a vacation in the Orlando area. This time we chose the Hilton Grand on International Drive. We have stayed att many timeshares in the area and I would definitely say this is by far the best and would highly recommend. The unit was a two bedroom unit and it was more than spacious. We were in building one which overlooked the main pool. The beds were more than comfortable and I loved the bedding and the decor. I felt like I was at a carribean island and never wanted to leave. There were numerous activities planned at the resort mostly around the main pool. There is a pool bar and the food which was offered was delicious and I thought very reasonably priced. Every night ice cream sundaes were available for $3 which was a hit with the kids. The Hilton was centrally located to everything that Orlando has to offer. There is a publix right across the street so you can stock up items for the week since the condo is stocked with cooking tools if you chosse to make some meals. As for the customer service I felt everyone that we came in contact with were professional and welcoming. I was only called once to discuss a timeshare presentation. After expressing that I was not interested I wasn't bothered again. I wold highly recommend the Hilton Grand and would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: BethNJ
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this hotel! The room was beautiful and very clean. We were in a king studio, so I expected a very limited kitchen at best. We had a small frige, microwave, toaster, blender, full place settings, silverware, can opener, cheese grater, cutting board, real knives, storage containers, silver ice bucket... If this is what is in the kitchette, I can only imagine what the full size kitchen is like! The pools were beautiful and not that crowded, even in June. While we did not participate in any activities, there seemed to always be a game or something going on. I did not know that there was a playground, but there is a very nice one that is covered! That was a great surprise and my two year old loved it! Overall, no complaints at all. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: overnighttraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort for two days in June 2009 at the end of a combined work/leisure trip. I reserved a studio room about a week ahead of my visit at a fabulous advance purchase rate through the Hilton website. I was able to check in early in the afternoon after my conference ended and requested a quiet location with a good view. The lady at the front desk gave me a choice of two different lake-view rooms an ultimately recommended one in Building 7 (newest building). It was only when I got to the room that I realized she had upgraded me from a studio to a one bedroom. What a great surprise! I only wished I were staying longer. Everything appeared new and clean. Loved the furnishings, decorations, granite countertops, huge jacuzzi tub, etc. I found the bed extremely comfortable and it was the best sleep I got during the whole trip. I travel frequently for business and this is truly one of the nicest properties where I have stayed. I had read in reviews that parking could be a problem, particularly in the newer sections. I wasn't out late, but had no problem finding a close spot anytime during the day or when returning from dinner. I loved the location of Building 7 and views were fabulous, although you did have to cross the pedestrian bridge to get to main pool, or down a path to second pool between buildings 4 and 5.. The only negative thing I'd say about the resort is that hallway noise could be a bit loud at times which I'd say could be an issue if you were in a studio room or using the living room sofa bed in other units. Could also hear some walking noise from the unit above but it wasn't particularly loud. Overall I had a great experience at this resort and I would highly recommend it. I stayed at the Walt Disney World Swan and WorldQuest Resort on this same trip and found HGV highly superior to both.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Updated -- Great hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: LegoJoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have also stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations @ SeaWorld, and this hotel is by far superior & much newer. Location: GREAT location...you can walk to the outlets. Across the street from Downtown Disney. We booked the suite room and it was fabulous. We were in building 3. Granite kitchen tops, large spacious living room, sunken tub & updated shower/bathroom. Great patio that overlooked the lake. Fitness Center--a little small; however, their is a larger center in the main resort complex. This resort is huge, so there are 2 fitness centers. Pool-huge and fantastic! There is entertainment (DJ & kids entertainment), which is a nice touch. I don't have kids but enjoyed watching & enjoyed the music. Pool bar & restaurant--no complaints! Jill, the waitress was excellent and took care of all my needs. If you need a drink, just put your drink sign up and someone will come right over. Also, had the salad-very good! We have stayed at a LOT of hotels in Orlando because my husband travels there for work a lot; however, this hotel is by far the best one. Please feel free to email with any questions. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: pbobonis
Reviews.Content: I stayed from May 29 through June 2 with my family. I stayed because of the convenience of a two week trip, and staying a couple of days to get organized, and clean clothes, plus go to other parks, The room was a one room suite with a sofa bed. It was really nice. I would probably stay here again. The room service is only change of towels, and making the bed. But overall I would recommend this place. It's close to everything, in a nice area of International Drive. The only thing we did not like was the parking. It was small, and if you came late you have to park far from your room. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It! -You Will Too!”
Reviews.Author: kathyngregg
Reviews.Content: This property is lovely. I stayed there with my wife and father for 5 days in April 2009 for a little R & R. The property, the rooms, the service were all excellent. Everything is modern and well maintained. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. I experienced a little trouble accessing the internet on my laptop. A staff member came to my room promptly and got me up and running. The pool and hottubs were great. We were allowed to invite 3 guests one day. Overall a great place to visit.. We can hardly wait to go back with my son, his wife, and children next year. We Loved It! -You Will Too!

Reviews.Title: “no response to security concerns by management”
Reviews.Author: wallertwinmom
Reviews.Content: the maid left our room unlocked. we complained. since nothing was stolen, there was no response from management. we repeated our complaint, again no response. This about ruined our trip as we did not feel safe in our room or even able to leave our room. The management of Hilton only cares about getting your money and does not care about guests concerns. I will never stay in the Hilton family of hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont get scammed”
Reviews.Author: mike42979
Reviews.Content: Well, i booked this beautiful 2 night stay at the Hilton Grand vacation resort by phone with advanced pay to get a discount, the catch is no refunds on advanced pay. This would have been fine had i not received an email about my booking stating not only the wrong Resort but also the wrong room. After calling the advanced booking department to tell them of the mistake i was told i would have to keep my booking and their is nothing they can do about it. I wasn't looking for a refund just a transfer to the correct property but they would not budge or pass me on to a supervisor. I tried repeatedly to explain their agent made a mistake and she insisted rules are rules. I was so mad i drove to the property where they booked my reservation luckily in the same town and after going back and forth with the front office manager who was of great service and the deranged woman on the phone she told him he can refund me at the property level. Not a transfer a refund so i get no room unless i rebook which at this point i think is highly unlikely. BTW the room was supposed to be a king suite with a balcony and the reservation booked me for a studio without a Balcony in the wrong property. In all its a great looking property though i didn't get to stay, just don't do advanced booking and you might be ok!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Caseybum
Reviews.Content: We atayed at the Hilton for 5 nights May 14 through May 19. We stayed in a one bedroom unit. The first unit we were given was on the first floor in building 5. It had a view of the parking lot. My husband called since their website states "one Bedrrom units have a lovely view of the on grounds lake" and spoke to the room coordinator who promptly moved us to building 6 the 7th floor. We had a beautiful view of the lake! The unit was clean and well equiped. We found the bed to be fairly comfortable and their was also plenty of hot water :) Our room was cleaned everyday and we were given fresh towels. We never got to use either pool since the one day we alloted for that it rained! We ordered room delivery our first night from the on site Pizza Hut and the delivery was extremely slow. The food was just warm barely warm when it finally arrived. Parking is a big problem. If you arrive after 6 or 7pm, Expect to walk quite a distant to get to your room, unless you can round up an employee with a golf cart to take you back to your building. The resort is close to everything! 5 minutes to Sea World, 10 to Universal and 15 to the Disney parks. We would definitely stay at this resort again. The biggest problem I can find is that they try to stick most people in a room with a bad view. If you take the time to complain, you will be moved to a much nicer room. So.....complain away!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Twinkletoes_25
Reviews.Content: The HGVC was absolutely fantastic. I have no complaints whatsoever! My boyfriend and i stayed here fo a week at the beginning of May. Upon arrival we were taken in a golf cart to the furthest building from reception, we didnt mind this as we are both young and fit and loved the 5 minute stroll with beautiful surroundings to the main pool or reception. However we did mind the view we had from our room upon arrival, we had travelled for 17hrs to be landed with a view of a multi-story parking garage. I immediately phoned reception and they sorted our room out very quickly without hesitation. Our new room was in the opposite building and had a view of the smaller pool and the lake so we were happy out! The room was studio style with a lovely and clean bathroom, very spacious screened in balcony and kitchenette with toaster, microwave, sink, coffee machiene and frigde (no hob). The main pool area is beautiful, the sun loungers are very comfortable, friendly staff, a flag on each bed that you raise for service and an excellent daily entertainment programme (we didnt really participate in any of the programmes but it was great for the kids). The pool remained open until 11pm every night which was nice but the pool bar closed with the pool and there was no place else to relax and have a drink unless you did so on your balcony. Drinks were a little pricey, for two cocktails including the tip it was about $21. We ate at the poolside bar twice and both times the food was lovely. There is a deli by the pool that make yummy wraps to order daily. There are resort shuttles running to all major attractions for the price of $6 return which is good value. They only run at certain times and we found the times a little inconvenient. The overall complex was beautiful, there were gas grills located in nooks all around the complex if you wanted to have a barbecue, we would have absolutely availed of them had we been staying longer. Supermarket, Pharmacy, Subway, sushi and chinese restaurants and of course the outlets all located accross the road from the hotel but nothing else nearby which made the complex quiet and relaxing. For some lively action try City Walk at Universal although it will cost you around $40 return in a cab. We went to see the Blueman Group at the theatre in universal and it was almost the highlight of out whole holiday, they were brilliant! We were never bothered by people trying to sell us time shares, we actually felt we had plenty of privacy at this hotel. The maid service was excellent, the complex was so clean and we found all staff that we encountered went out of their way to be friendly. We will be returning next year, our only complaint is that we didnt stay long enough!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is definitely NOT for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: melissaj1993
Reviews.Content: The internet connection at this hotel is so poor that it's practically useless. I am staying in building 11 (Tucker Town), and when I called to inquire whether there was a special code that I needed to access the "high-speed internet" that is advertised, I was told that the wireless was "for the whole resort," which is why it is slow "at times." At times???!!! Try ALL THE TIME!!! I am traveling on business and really need to be able to access my work email and folders on my company's secure drives, which I typically access through VPN. Although I can logon to my VPN, the connection is so slow that every time I try to access my work email or work email folders, I get timed out and cannot access them at all. After an unreasonably long wait (~hour), I was provided with an ethernet cable, which did absolutely nothing to improve the internet situation. I have since stopped using the ethernet cable. I think it is completely inexcusable for a hotel to have such poor internet access in the year 2009. If this hotel is just for families traveling without computers, who do not require internet access, then it should be advertised as such. It is infuriating to think something is going to work and then have to do without it. And on that topic, the clock radio is supposed to have the capability to run an ipod or mp3 player, and this function does not work (in my room at least). I also had to take the stairs 6 floors down when I left the hotel this morning, and 6 floors back up when I returned. The elevator was not working. This is particularly problematic considering that the hotel where my conference is being held is approximately 1/2 mile away (although it would be a lot less if not for the ridiculous fence around the property--how hard would it be to allow residents' room cards to work to open the gate in the fence?). Walking 1/2 mile, in heels, in the rain, every time I want to go to or return from the conference hotel is a tremendous inconvenience. The only other option is to take a cab (there is no complimentary shuttle service available). Another thing to be aware of is that there is another hotel with a very similar name in this area (there are at least 3 Hiltons actually), so it's necessary to be very specific with cab drivers or you'll end up at the other property (yep, this happened to me).

Reviews.Title: “Overall Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: nillarilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights from 4/30-5/6. Overall I would give this hotel a 3.5 rating (out of 5) and would probably stay here again, though might explore other options. Pro's: -Roomy 1 BR suite which had everything we needed including washer/dryer, dishwasher, dishes, utensils -Nice pools. We stayed in building 5 next to the Laguna pool which had zero entry. Our 2 1/2 year old loved both pools. -Covered play area next to main pool. Our son only wanted to play there 1 time, but he enjoyed it. -Reasonably priced food at the Main Pool Bar and not bad food either. -High Speed Internet Access (though slow at times) -Location adjacent to the Outlet Mall (2 minute walk from our suite), literally across the street from Publix, 10 minutes to Sea World. -Fairly quiet/peacefull overall. Pools were never too crowded (we went late a.m. and early p.m.) -Very responsive staff. The maintenance staff were especially friendly. -Gas grills were a plus! Cons -Asked for a room on an upper floor w/ a view. We got a room on the top floor with a view of the Outlet Mall parking garage. Not quite my idea of a 'view'. We were able to switch to a room with a view of the Lake and Laguna pool. -Toilet clogged 3 times. Housekeeping told me they could rinse out the 'disposable' plunger in our room (since they did not think they were 'disposable'). -Thin walls. Could hear hall noise and noise from family above us (at 0240). Luckily we read about the thin walls and brought 2 loud fans with us to drown out the noise. -Dirty floors. My son took a bath and minutes later I noticed the bottom of his feet were black. -Ignitor on the gas grill next to the Laguna pool never worked, so we had to call everytime we wanted to use the grill, then wait for someone to come and light it. -Housekeeping was inconsistent. One day they left dirty sheets from the sleep sofa on the chair. We forgot to flush the toilet and when we came back to the room, the lid was open, toilet unflushed and the fan was on, as though housekeeping was trying to make a point. I do not drink decaf coffee, yet everyday housekeeping left decaf, so I ended up having 6 packages of decaf and 1 package of regular coffee one day. The coffee packets were strewn across the counter. -Toilet roll was loud and woke me up one night even though the pocket door to the bathroom was closed. We ended up removing the toilet paper from the holder. -Room was dark in the afternoons. -Light switches seemed mis-placed. -Shower had water saver head so the flow was very weak -Extremely loud dishwasher (they ought to invest in water saver dishwashers if they are concerned about water usage). -My husband found the bed very uncomfortable which ironically is one reason we chose the Hilton since we always found their beds to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Rndthewrld
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible time here a year ago and returned this year for the two free nights we were given as a result of the poor service. I am happy to say that the customer service was greatly improved! We had a wonderful short stay here the second time. This is an excellent location for families in close proximity to all the major theme parks. They also offer a lot of activities to keep kids interested. The new outlet mall right next door is great for teens. There is a path right to it from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: Tripper096
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation to Disney, spending 4 nights at the Hilton. Overall this was a pretty fantastic place for our needs. The hotel's grounds & pool are beautiful and well-maintained. I booked a package through orbitz and got a great rate. After a mix-up with my room, which was supposed to be next to my family, I was upgraded for free to a 1 bedroom suite which was absolutely HUGE and gorgeous--full kitchen & dining area, huge bathroom with jacuzzi and large separate shower, screened in porch. Also arrived around 11am, and they had the room ready to go--impressive. The studio rooms are also nice, but the suite really made the stay and would definitely be worth the extra expense, especially for families. Maid service and amenities were excellent. We were in one of the buildings at the end of the property, by a smaller pool, but a bit of a walk across a bridge over the lake to the main area. We didn't mind, but could be an issue for the older folks. On the plus side, we were located directly next to the gate for the huge outlet mall across the street, which was really a great place to shop. Ate at the food court there a couple times--good selection and fairly cheap for a resort area. There is also an Outback and some fast food within walking distance across the street. The large pool area was also a beautiful area to relax in at the end of the day, ate at the poolside restraunt a couple times which was pretty good. Had movies by the pool some nights. The one main negative of our trip was the rudeness of the time share presenter that my parents experienced. They originally booked their room with a (slightly) reduced rate in exchange for attending a 2 hour time share presentation. After acting like their best friend and pressuring them to stay longer, my parents declined to immediately decide to pay the $37,000 time share buy in (not to mention maintence fees, etc). The presenter was extremely rude--shoved his chair back from the table, abruptly jumped up and loudly announced, "This presentation is OVER." Come on--how many people actually agree to spend that much money without thinking it over? It kind of ruined the first day for my mom--she just couldn't get over how rude he was. The ironic part was that they actually are interested in purchasing a vacation home or time share, but it sure won't be from Hilton. Finally called and caught me the next day, trying to offer discount Disney tickets, etc--got a big NO. Other than that, the staff was extremely pleasant, going out of their way to be friendly. My husband and I typically stay at Marriott resorts, and I was favorably impressed in this regard with the Hilton. One thing to keep in mind for those who don't want to rent a car, is that the shuttle service ($6/pp round trip to Epcot, from there you take a bus or monorail to Disney or MGM, AK) only runs 3 times in the morning, and 3 returns starting at 6pm in the evening. Takes about 15 minutes to get there. From what we heard, cabs cost about $30 one way. Worked out okay for us, and the shuttle company seemed to be well-run. Cab fare from the airport is about $45-50, with Mears shuttle being $20pp. Overall this was a great trip and beautiful place to stay. I would come back again if I got a good deal, with all the other hotels in the area to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “really was easy to walk to outlet mall”
Reviews.Author: gmar12
Reviews.Content: If you are in the back of the resort, the gated outlet access (using hotel card) was across a well lit handicap parking area and an easy walk. In fact, our unit seemed closer to the shops than the outlet's own parking garage. Most buildings are around a lake, so don't be disappointed if you're not overlooking the pool, the lake views are very nice!! Parking (lack of) is the only major problem. It would be nice to at least have a load/unload baggage area at each unit, but that would take up even more parking. Employees use golf carts to get around, not sure if some of those are roving bag handlers, but that would help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel could not deliver on basic service”
Reviews.Author: Travelink-ca
Reviews.Content: This gorgeous hotel could have been the highlight of our month-long vacation in Florida. But after experiencing incredibly poor customer service, we strongly suggest that you find another hotel that can provide such amenities as a basic clean room. We stayed for 5 nights in a studio suite, which was clean, but a bit small. I am told the one-bedroom units are about twice the size. Check-in was quick, with a young lady who dashed out to our car and brought us into the lobby for personal check-in. The internet didn't work for the first 2 days. Front desk definitely not helpful. All was reasonably fine until the third day. We returned about 10 PM after a day of sightseeing. To my surprise, the room had not been cleaned. The bed was still the way we left it, and the dirty wet towels were still sitting in the tub. No one had taken out the garbage. Eventually I was able to persuade the front desk to send up some fresh towels. They didn't offer to do anything else. We cleaned up the room ourselves. Imagine my dismay when we returned the next night to find the room had still not been cleaned. The bedsheets were a total disaster. There were now 6 wet towels in the bathtub. And fruit flies were buzzing around the sink where we had eaten fruit the night before. I called the front desk, and they offered only to send me some garbage bags so I could take out my own garbage. I did, and it was still sitting there 13 hours later when we checked out. I wrote to the general manager when I got home to find out what happened and guess what? He's been ignoring my letter for the past 2 1/2 months. This could be a beautiful hotel in the staff and management got their act together.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Grand Vacation”
Reviews.Author: patandfiona
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in March and fell in love with the place. From the moment we checked in we were made to feel like we were family. The staff are only brilliant, they could not do enough for us. The one bedroom apartment we stayed in was beautiful, far too big for just two people and very well apointed with a fully equiped kitchen. The grounds are only glorious and the pool area is one of the most spectacular we have ever seen. The only gripe we had about this lovely place was that there were not enough parking spaces outside each block which meant you had to park outside the main reception area which is about a 10 minute walk from the farthest block. This annoyed us a little at the start of our vacation here but once again the staff came up trumps because they have a couple of minibuses and golf carts on hand to give you a ride to your apartment, no matter what time of night you turned up at ! We loved this place so much that we have already booked to go back again in October this year.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: rnrluvin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our stay. It was 5 minutes to SeaWorld and 10 minutes to Disney attractions and was conveniently located on International Drive. The hotel was beautiful. We stayed in a studio room that was plenty large enough for the two of us, with a screened in patio. The main pool was huge and all the kids there loved it, we also had a smaller pool right next to our room and was used more by the adults. All the employees at the resort were so friendly and helpful. Only thing to complain about was the prices of the food/drinks, little expensive, but you will find that at every place in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: WalterBWI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGVC for a small sales meeting. I had a one-bedroom suite, lots of room: living/dining area, full kitchen, screened in balcony, bedroom with jacuzzi and big bath (double sinks). The free wifi worked great. The paper was delivered every morning. I didn't visit the fitness centers, but instead ran around the lake (1/2 mile) very early in the morning. Once the sun came out it was too muggy for me. Both pools are great with nice bars (great margaritas!). The outlet mall is literally right there (if you're a shopper). All the staff were friendly and helpful. Very, very close to the Disney parks. If I were coming down here for leisure, I would definitely stay here. And as everyone else mentioned, the later you come back to your room at night, the more difficult it is to park. But a little walk after dinner doesn't hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Somewhere Else my Next Trip to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: KevN10
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and spacious enough, however, I did not appreciate getting multiple sales-pitches to buy a unit. For example, we purchased tickets to Disney at the concierge desk and were pressured to go to a meeting about purchasing a unit so we could get discounted tickets. One evening we received a phone call pressuring us to to go to a meeting. This is not what I expected from a Hitlon family hotel. If I had wanted that kind of visit I would have stayed somewhere else, at a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much!! affordable and beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: gabriella611
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayted here for new years! We loved it! The room wasn'y huge but perfect size for us. It was clean, up to date and had a nice screened in balcony. We were located in the very last building near the more so privatepool. It was a nice quite area and not a far walk from the main pool maybe 5-10 minuites. If you didn't want to walk they had a service that if you called they would pick you up on golf carts! the staff was awesome and wiling to help! We were only ten to 15 minuites from epcot and universal, seaworld was right down the road, about a 3 minuites drive. It was a perfect location for us. you only paid 800$ for a week!! We would deffinetly go back. The pools were beautiful as well as the landscape!

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing . . .”
Reviews.Author: vanillabeanHB
Reviews.Content: After searching the endless possibilities for lodging in and around Orlando, we chose the HGVC and we are so glad we did! We were in town for a cheerleading competition in Disney and were traveling with a young child. We got a great rate of $119/nite. The hotel is situated on a quiet part of International Drive, in an area where there seems to be some new resorts being built. It is adjacent to an outlet mall that you can walk to easily. In addition to the food court at the mall, there is a supermarket and a couple of restaurants across the street. We were tired each day after watching cheerleading and doing the parks, so we just ordered food at the convenient pool bar and relaxed while our child enjoyed the beautiful pool. The room had a fullly equipped kitchen, and if we return we will plan better and do some of our own cooking. One night they showed a kid's movie right next to the pool - our child was in heaven! The room was very spacious, beautiful, very clean, and furnished very nicely. We had a one bedroom unit with a king bed in the bedroom and a full sized pullout in the living room. If you had more people in your group additional bedding might be a problem as there are no rooms with more than one bed. (There was plenty of room for a rollaway , but I don't know if they have them.) Everything looked brand new. We were in building #2 which was the perfect location - very close to the pool without being exposed to the noise. Some of the other buildings are located across a body of water, connected to the rest of the resort with a dock- like walkway. I would not prefer those locations - it's not a really long walk, but we liked being close to the main part of the hotel. There is a pizza place and deli right on property. We had no trouble parking. We never waited for an elevator. The place was immaculate. The staff was friendly. The location was a short drive to Disney and Sea World. We loved everything about this place!

Reviews.Title: “best resort ever”
Reviews.Author: wjhedger
Reviews.Content: We pulled into the grand vacation club on the 8th of march and from the moment I steped out of the vehicle I was in love with the place. The front desk staff is helpfull, the main lobby is beautiful. When we got to our room I was more than pleased. we stayed in a one bedroom whirlpool suite and it was beautiful. We had a large kitchen and everything was so clean. We traveled with 2 children and My husband and I and we had more than enough room. The pool is awsome. there is 2 pools. the bar was great to hang at while we were down at the pool and the food was great. overall I would return and I'am already considering going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Gwenus
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacations Club isn't really on International Drive but Arrezzo Way which is at the very top of one end of the drive. It's still very convenient for Disney & Universal and shops & restaurants are on the doorstep. We stayed in a one bedroom condo which had a sofa bed. The kitchen contained everything that you'd need including a washer/dryer which is handy if you are staying for more than a week and you don't want to check-in excess baggage when leaving home! The resort itself is very clean with attentive staff. We had a telephone power cut and maintenance staff were on hand at each condo area in case guests needed use of a cell phone. We have a silver loyalty card that seemed to work wonders when we needed to stay an extra night when nothing was available until they checked my "VIP" status. No complaints there then! The pool area and grounds were lovely. The gardens have access to the outlet store behind tho' it's no longer a key card access point, but that could be work in progress. All in all this hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE It!”
Reviews.Author: MickMick
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here in March of 2007 for five days. We are annual Disney vacationers and have stayed at many places. During this trip we stayed at HGVC in one-bedroom unit and were extremely pleased. About us - We love Disney (hey I'm named after the Mouse), but we steer clear of Disney resorts. She is a single and active Senior Citizen. I am a single, 30-something. We go to Orlando to shop, eat, and play. Initial Thoughts - The location has gated security. This was very important to us. We wanted to make sure that our car was reasonably secure. The site is relatively large and there is no such thing as 100 percent safe, but we weren't afraid by our surroundings. In addition, we were directly located behind the Premium Outlet Mall and across the street from Publix. The grounds were pristine and well maintained. The only thing is that, after the parks closed, the parking was a nightmare. We did find parking, but still...It was a nightmare. LOL Check In - The line was a little long, but we were able to use the Hilton card for express check-in. The Room - The unit was very clean and had all of the necessary amenitities (kitchen and bath). The appliances worked and were clean. We were not afraid to eat off with the utensils and plates. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. It was very quiet. We didn't hear a thing. The Amenities - Our unit had a Bose surround sound system. It was very nice because we did rent a movie one night. We also took advantage of the on-site photographer and had drinks at the poolside bar. We were so pleased that it quickly became the benchmark. We liked it so much that we are planning a return visit next week.

Reviews.Title: “Fully lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Buns4vs
Reviews.Content: Reading the Reviews on Tripadvisor had us wondering why the resort was so highly rated. As soon as we arrived, it was clear from the friendliness of the staff as to the reason so many recommend the resort. The cheery welcome and escort by buggy to the room was matched by the high quality furnishings and standard of upkeep. Normally one would expect to see signs of wear and tear in a room, but this was not the case. Knowing that this is a Grand Vacations Resort it would be reasonable to expect an owner arriving being given a good room but having booked via the Hilton Honours website, we were presently surprised by the standard of our Studio Apartment. The grounds and public areas were immaculately kept and we were pleased to see discrete, yet efficient, security in place - particularly as there were reports on the TV about home invasions occurring in the Orlando area at the time. The location right next door to an Outlet Mall was a bonus, as was the supermarket and drugstore across the road. If there is only one setback it is the lack of adequate indoor dining facilities. When we were there, a cold front came through and whilst Florida is described as the sunshine state, having to dine and drink outside is not fun. One tip is about traffic. On Sundays the traffic using Vineland Avenue to access the Outlet Mall and the nearby church can make accessing SR 535 (the route to Disney and the I4) a bit of a nightmare as it is single file. We will certainly return

Reviews.Title: “A Picture Perfect Paradise”
Reviews.Author: RWallace78
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Expedia as a bundled package. After reading the reviews and looking at the hotel photos here on TripAdvisor, we decided this was the place for us. I must say we were stunned when we pulled into the hotel driveway. As gorgeous as it looks in photos, they really do not do this place justice. This resort and the grounds it sits on are absolutely BEAUTIFUL! From the minute you drive through the gates, to the time when you leave to go home you are treated like a celebrity. The staff, is wonderful, courteous, and friendly as can be. We stayed in a studio suite, which is basically a standard hotel room. But let me assure you, there is nothing "standard" about it. The room has a kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator, and sink. Silverware, plates, and glasses are all provided. The room has an LCD television, ceiling fan, screened in balcony, granite counters in kitchenette and bathroom. The room also comes with complimentary wireless and LAN high speed internet access. As I mentioned earlier, the grounds are gorgeous and very well maintained. The hotel has two pools. The main pool has a grill and bar, and a wait staff that will bring food and drinks to you as you soak up the sun. Simply raise the flag on your chair, and they will be there to take your order in minutes. Don't feel like bringing money to the pool? No problem...they can charge any and all food and drinks to the room. The second pool is called the Lagoon Pool. It has a Pizza Hut Express and is more of a "low key" pool. At night this is a good pool to go to if you just want to be alone and want some privacy. Our week at the HGVC was perfect, and I would not change one thing about this place. The location of this hotel was great too, as it is 5 minutes from Disney, and about 10-15 from Universal. There is a Publix right across the street which was handy, as well as a McDonalds which was a perfect option each morning for a quick and easy breakfast before the parks. One thing nobody ever mentioned on here that should be mentioned is in regards to the toll road. Between the airport and hotel you have to take a toll road, and pay two tolls. The tolls are $0.75 each, which is not a big deal.....but it's good to know that you need to have $1.50 ready on the way to and from the airport. The parking here can be a little tricky in the evenings. We found that anytime after 8:00 PM parking in front of your building was next to impossible. We usually had to park clear on the other side of the complex, which is a pretty good distance. While slightly annoying, the walk isn't too bad. In fact the walk around the lagoon at night can be quite serene. This is easily one of the nicest places in all of Orlando, and if you are trying to decide on a place to stay, the search ends now. Stay here.....you WILL NOT regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: mcgratal
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this hotel. I chose this after seeing it was ranked highly among Orlando hotels, and when my family and I stayed there, I could see why it had received great reviews. Very clean, and the rooms were beautiful. The exercise room wasn't the best I've seen, parking wasn't always easy to find, and the service at the deli was bad, but these two details were not enough to take away from the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are huge, modern, luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: pattijor
Reviews.Content: Beautiful modern facility in a great location. Gorgeous bedrooms in a Tuscan theme. One room had a huge jacuzzi tub. Getting around is a hike and parking is sometimes scarce. There are flags on the lounge chairs at the pool and the staff was extremely friendly there. There was a small amount of mold in the enormous shower. There was a stain on my bedspread. Other than that, the rooms were spotless (not bad for a hotel).

Reviews.Title: “It was more than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: GCPPa
Reviews.Content: Although ours was a quiet vacation and did not include Disney and the Parks we greatly enjoyed our spacious, quiet room and comfortable bed. I suspect in season with children on vacation there would be less quiet, but the other attributes would continue. Being next to the Premier Mall of Florida was an added attraction. One quibble: I room was located far from the entrance and it took a little time to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at HGVC at Int'l Drive”
Reviews.Author: RLLYoungDoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HGVC @ Int'l Drive Februaru 10th - 15th for a business conference with a friend of mine. Our husbands joined us on the 11th, so we mized a little vacation with business :-). The resort is very nice; well-kept, clean, and easy to get to from the airport. We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite (rooms 7410 and 7411) in Villa di Pietro. There is a shopping center directly across the street which made it easy for us to pick up groceries. There is also a great outlet mall located on the backside of the resort, which you can access pretty easily. We received a parking pass upon check-in which allowed us to park the car ourselves and come and go as we pleased. Just be careful coming back at night; most of the parking spots fill up quick so you may end up having to park pretty far from your building. Housekeeping comes everyday to straighten up and give you fresh towels. The kitchen was very modern with granite countertops and stainless appliances.There is free Wi-Fi service throughout the resort as well. There are two pools on the grounds; the main one by the lobby was pretty crowded each day we went out there. The only complaint I had was that the workout facility was REALLY small for the size of the resort - only one eliptical and two treadmills! Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back. By the way, my husband went golfing at the Ritz Carlton at Grande Lakes (which is about 10 minutes away). He said it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place but sometimes customer service is an issue”
Reviews.Author: lindy_cheng
Reviews.Content: This property is part of the Hilton timeshare condo chain and I'm one of the owners.
