This was my first stay and I booked a one bedroom suite for six nights for a Disney holiday with my brother's family. My brother and his wife used to travel extensively for work and are familiar with many hotels but their reaction to this property was pure shock but in a good way. It's a different experience. The grounds are extensive and nicely landscaped with fountains, a recreational path, small but engaging playground for children, barbecues, 2 pools (with more fountains and waterfalls built into the pool!) and many hot tubs. This seemed pretty but not appealing because the temperature was in the 50's. To our surprise, the water was warm enough, that we could use the pools and hot tubs even in the evenings. The staff offer many kid-friendly activities every day and my 7 year old niece loved the "Dive-in" movie (giant movie screen next to the pool). We had tickets to the Disney parks and we had to drag my niece to Disney (!) because she loved the pools so much. We asked for a quieter location and received a one-bedroom suite at the end of a corridor. It was very quiet. Moving onwards to the rooms, we were stunned by the suite. It was spacious and offered the comforts of home: dining area, whirlpool tub, washer/dryer, kitchen with dishwasher, blender, toaster, coffeemaker, TV/cable, wireless Internet access, The bed was king-sized and the sleeper sofa full-sized. The balcony was screened it with some patio furniture. It was sooo nice to let my niece play on the balcony without watching her every second. The bathroom was lusciously large. If you have a group that's comfortable using the facilities simultaneously (hey - there's all kinds out there), 4 people can use the bathroom simultaneously, it's that big. The kitchen has enough cooking utensils that cooking breakfast was a snap, although a full dinner would have been a real challenge. However, the door between the bedroom and the rest of the suite had a gap which allowed lots of noise to travel. We had to be quiet to let the late sleeper rest. As for the neighborhood, there is a supermarket right across the street and a outlet shopping center right next door. The supermarket was convenient although surprisingly pricey. The outlet shopping wasn't very exciting but I'm used to shopping in Manhattan and even bigger outlets in California. The Disney parks are conveniently close. The Hilton does offer shuttles to the parks - I think it was about $6 per shuttle ride. It might have been better to use the shuttles than to rent a car. They do not offer shuttle rides to the airport. We found plenty of dining options within a mile or two of the property - everything from fast food to chains, to nicer restaurants and small Mom & Pop operations with some interesting ethnic food choices. It's worth it to spend about 2 hours driving around to check out your choices. The front desk was very efficient with routine tasks, check-in & out, requests for extra room supplies (they hadn't stocked the room with enough for 4 people staying for six nights). Their informational hand-outs were exceptional. They had the answers for routine questions clearly and concisely spelled out. In addition, I had a contact within the Hilton organization that I could call with special requests for information, tickets, reservations etc... She was wonderfully helpful with deep local information. By comparison, the concierge's desk was not equally knowledgeable. Unfortunately, for special requests and unexpected circumstances, the staff went into denial. It was as if they could not recognize a problem or think outside of their daily routine. Luckily, our problems were minor (the top rack of the dishwasher was stuck and we could not load it, so we ran the dishwasher half full). The difference in customer service is hugely different from the Las Vegas facility where people had a very different attitude. The room service is different from standard hotels. The information sheet laid out the schedule. I only recall that we were scheduled for one visit from housekeeping for the six nights. After thinking about it I thought the trade off for the other amenities was worth it. I mean, they were offering recreational activities and classes from about about mid-morning to early evening many days. I could swear that many of the buildings on the property were empty. We never saw too many guests and it was quiet. We went during the low season, yet the parking lots were full. Could it be the shoppers from the outlet center next door figured out a way to sneak into the Hilton parking? Probably. The parking at the outlet was packed. This is a time-share and you are offered every opportunity to participate in the sales pitch. To their credit, Hilton uses the "soft sell" approach. They'll crunch numbers for you, show you pictures, list health benefits of vacations, teach you tricks to maximize your membership benefits but they won't use raw sales pressure to get you to purchase. I didn't catch them lying the way I caught other time-share sales people. We walked through other features of the property but didn't get a chance to use them. The property included an "active" lounge with billiards and chess & other games, computer/business facilities, a quiet lounge for reading. A ping-pong table located in a gazebo, a deli, a pizza place (offered room service), a small videe arcade, a spa and a small fitness room. I even saw hoops for basketball. The court was small but the hoops looked regulation size. Overall, I would recommend this as a value for a family or large group vacation. You are surrounded by theme parks so the hip will be bored (seriously, the Dumbo ride?). The property is very pretty but there doesn't seem to be enough privacy for a romantic get-away because the buildings are densely packed with many rooms. We didn't make it to downtown Orlando, so no opinion on urban/cultural destination. Cape Canaveral isn't too far away but we ran out of time and energy - never made it.

Reviews.Title: “Warning scabies!!”
Reviews.Author: violetaaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton from January 5-9, 2009. On the second day we noticed that our 6 year old daughter is developing a rash. By the time we came home it was horrifying to look at. My child's arms (mostly) and the rest of her body was covered with red rash. After seeing a third doctor (dermatologist) we learned she got scabies. My child missed a whole week of school. We called the hotel to make them aware. Hotel manager seemed not to understand (or pretended) what we are talking about. We left it at that.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas / new year holiday”
Reviews.Author: ford maverick
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to the HGVC and although it was not as good as our first - it was still up there. We had a late flight frim NYC, however we were greeted by a very cheery lady (2am) at reception who made us very welcome. Unit was exactly as we had expected - plenty of room for 2 adults 2 kids, spacious kitchen, fully equipped, wash mach/dryer and good size bathroom. The facilities are great here -the pool area is large with plenty of loungers - they have added flags which you raise if you need bar service. Never seen this before - especially in the U.K. Christmas day was just another day which was strange for us coming from scotland - New Years was even stranger - no late night bar for us Scots to hit. (hogmany was not the same as back home. !!! - no hangover on New Years day.!!) We had an outbreak of ants - handled very promptly by maintenance - thank you. Room service was the let down here - our room was not serviced as it should have been and we ended up having to "borrow" pool towels to run a towel rota - Kids did the trash run . More an inconvenience that a disaster - did advise room service but nothing happened.!! Overall I rate this place very highly and would definately stay here again when in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Property but...”
Reviews.Author: Blueboro
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a Thursday, Friday and Saturday evenings late January. The grounds are beautiful, the units well appointed and beautiful, and the rate was great. With all of that you would think this would be one of our favorite places. But here were several problems: The most obvious problem is parking. I don't think I have ever been at a development like this with less parking. And this was the Off-season. The first night we parked about 3 units away which I thought was bad. On Saturday evening, there was a sign at the entrance that said all parking was full and we must park at the reception area. So, we parked a long way from our unit (at least a quarter of a mile). Fortunately they had a golf cart to take us to our building. However, the next morning no golf cart was around and we had to walk all the way across this huge development to get our car. What a pain. I hate to see what parking is like during the busy times. The noise was noticeable in our unit from people walking, talking and just normal conversation. I was surprised that was the case with what was spent on these units. The place is just too big. Beautiful pools, nice lake but it is a hike to almost anywhere. If you don't mind parking in the next county then you will love the place because otherwise it is very nice. But the lack of parking will probably keep us from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: HootieToo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this large complex which is right in the middle of a very busy area of Orlando. There is a high end outlet center directly next to the facility easily within walking distance. Very attractive grounds and exterior of the buildings. Large lake in center of complex with a pool at one end. We had a one bedroom condo whose kitchen was very small. The interior was clean with Tuscan decor. Overall it was OK, but nothing to write home about. The biggest problem we had was noise. We were located in a corner unit and could hear the stairway door slam everytime someone used it. And even worse, we could hear our neighbors through the adjoining door every time they were home. First it was just a couple which wasn't that bad because it was just loud talking and laughing. But, the second group was a family with screaming children. We contacted security at 11 pm to ask their assistance since our earplugs didn't work. After 1/2 hour, no change. We contacted security again and they said they didn't get our first report of a problem. We were heading out early the next morning and needed some sleep, so we put the bedspread under the adjoining door, closed our bedroom and bathroom doors and used earplugs to get some sleep. Bottom line is we would not stay here again, but for some people it may be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful large room”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: We take a lot of weekend trips to Orlando to visit the parks and try different locations. This property had wonderful rates on the Internet and it was a huge comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: batravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: Hilton Grand Vacations Club is a very nice hotel just off of International Drive next to the factory outlet mall. The hotel has two pools and all of the buildings surround a man made lake with a fountain and bridge. The hotel rooms are quite nice with a small kitchenette and a grocery store located across the street. The hotel has a Tuscan look and feel. The hotel has a small store with coffee and a limited food. The close proximity to the mall and International Drive make finding food quite easy. The hotel is quite peacefull dispite the proximity to International Drive and the factory outlet mall (next door). The hotel is about a 10 minute drive from Disney world and I would recommend staying here. The only drawback is the pesky welcome call at 8:30AM from the Hilton time share sales person.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week”
Reviews.Author: roundtripp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished a wonderful week at the HGVC International Drive in Orlando. We had traded a week from one of our timeshare properties through RCI for our two-bedroom unit there. We had read other reviews that said an RCI exchange would result in a less-than-desirable room. So, we were not expecting to have a great room. However, we were very pleasantly surprised when our room was on the end of the second floor in building 3 with a great view of the lake and the fountains. We sat on our balcony almost every morning for breakfast and really enjoyed the view. The grounds at the resort were gorgeous and we really loved walking around the lake on the sidewalk every day. The resort is adjacent to an outlet mall and you can walk through a gate (with your resort card key) and be on the mall property. We also walked across the stree to the Outback restaurant and the Publix grocery store. You can also catch a trolley from in front of the resort or use the resort's shuttle service for a small fee. So, the location is great. My wife and I enjoy working out and we used the workout facilities several times while there. The resort has two workout rooms. They are both small, but we had no trouble getting to use the machines we liked. Since we traded a timeshare week to visit the HGVC, we expected to be subjected to some high pressure to buy timeshare there. This was definitely not the case. We received phone messages asking to visit the photographer for our complimentary photo (which we didn't do), but that was the extent of the pressure. The pool areas were very nice and there were plenty of lounge chairs available. The resort also provided ample towels for the guests at the pool. At other resorts we have visited, this is not always the case. The food at the resort pool was very good and reasonably priced too. While my wife and I are retired and were there by ourselves, the resort had activities for kids everyday. All in all, we felt this was a great resort in a great location and a wonderful place for families and retired folks alike

Reviews.Title: “Great Fourth Visit”
Reviews.Author: cahow
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to HGVC International Drive. Our first visit was immediately after Hurricane Charley. See previous review in 2006. Our most recent visit was for 8 nights from 21st December, 2008. We are a party of 3 adults. We chose this resort because the service is usually very good, it has all the facilities and amenities we need and is close to areas we want to visit. Publix is just across the road. There is a Deli on site which can be useful. The property is within easy drive to Seaworld and Disney. We were not disappointed with our latest visit. This resort is clean, attractive and the suites are very comfortable. We like to have: living/dining/full kitchen with separate king sized bedroom and Jacuzzi, en-suite shower room and full washer and dryer. We have stayed at this property for the last three Christmases. Our check in was fairly straight forward although we had not been pre-assigned a room: I had to remind clerk that I had requested a 1 bedroom suite overlooking the lake, in my online booking. She had not read this on my booking but promptly assigned a suite in the second building. We said we were not interested in time share so we were not bothered at all during our stay. We stayed in this building on our first visit so were prepared when we found that the sofa had seen better days: it was a little worn. However the rest of the suite was perfectly acceptable and my daughter tells me the pull-out bed from the sofa was comfortable. My guess is that the mattress had been replaced. We had a good view of the lake and a side view of the main pool. We stayed on the fourth floor. One of the latest additions is a bridge across the lake making a pleasant walking circuit and easy access to the Premium Outlet Mall. The Mall gets really busy, at this time of year, so you can safely walk from the property without the hassle of parking the car in one of the malls car parks or crossing busy roads. Last year parking was a major problem because, often, we had to park a small distance from our building’s car park; this year, we were able to park immediately outside our building every time. The maid was efficient most days and if anything was forgotten all we had to do was ring Housekeeping and toiletries and towels were sent to us pretty quickly - always with a smile. We accept that in a busy property this can happen! The rate, this year, was exceedingly good which was fortunate because our exchange rate is dire! I would continue to highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeafsFan07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club - International Drive at the beginning of December, 2008. We were traveling with a small child and we were very pleased with the accommodations and amenities at the Hilton GVC. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which was exceptionally large. The suite contained a full kitchen, along with a large living room/dining room area. The presence of both a dishwasher and a washer/dryer made the suite very functional, along with the in-room DVD player. The room had a large, enclosed balcony overlooking the lake, which was also very pleasant. The two pool areas were very nice and kid friendly, particularly the smaller pool which has a nice shallow area. (Tip: The main pool area often got quite loud, so we would suggest that you request a suite away from the pools - buildings 6 and 7 were great.). The hotel is located next to the outlet mall and across the street from a Publix, which was very convenient. Our rate included the buffet breakfast, which was somewhat bland, so we wouldn't recommend paying extra for it. The poolside restaurant made for a pleasant meal, although the food and service were simply average. The hotel staff was generally very friendly and helpful, although there were some occasions on which we needed to make requests repeatedly to obtain certain items (e.g., a crib). You will receive a timeshare pitch shortly after you arrive - if you are not interested, we strongly suggest that you be extremely blunt, otherwise they will keep you on the phone. Overall, we were very pleased with the suite and facilities at the Hilton HGV and would not hesitate to stay there again (particularly, if the rooms remain favourably priced).

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, not for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: firstreviewqwert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a 3-night getaway. We paid $99 for three nights and 2 free Disney Tickets in exchange for attendance at a 2 hour timeshare presentation/tour. The resort is fairly large and there were friendly faces to greet us at check-in. The grounds are kept up nicely and the pool is beautiful, although the weather was too cold for us to enjoy the pool. We were impressed when we first walked into our room - a suite with 1 bedroom, a kitchen, living room area, and a very nice bathroom/ spa. We had a balcony that overlooked a lake. Although we were impressed at first sight, there were several things wrong with our room. There was a lot of hair left in the bathtub from the previous guest. We reported the hair and were told it would be cleaned but I'm not sure it was cleaned after our complaint. The shower leaked the whole time we were there. We reported the leak and we were told an engineer would be out to fix it, but that never happened. There was also hair and dirt stuck to our dishes. It was definitely not our hair because the hair was blond and we have dark hair. We didn't even bother reporting this because the hotel staff didn't seem to care about the issues we encountered. The worst part of our stay was the noise. The breezeway outside our suite was tile and it seemed like hotel staff were rolling their cleaning carts up and down the tiled breezeways all day long and the noise was loud and clear. We don't mind occasional noise, but this was extremely loud and annoying. Because we hoped for a romantic getaway, our stay was somewhat disappointing because of the lack of cleanliness and the noise. Other than that, we were impressed with the resort. If we were there for a family trip to Disney during the summer, we may have enjoyed it a little more because we'd be able to take advantage of the beautiful pool and we wouldn't be spending so much time inside the condo to worry about the lack of cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Neil&Sue
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights (party of 8 with 3 rooms) at the end of a 3 week Florida vacation. Once we got checked in, the stay was excellent, however our check in was a complete nightmare. Given we were there at a quiet time, where Orlando and the parks were very empty, I was amazed that this hotel was completely full. We had booked 2 x 2 bedroomed suites through the owner scheme, only to find that mis-communicated to the resort. Whilst check-in for most guests took 5 minutes, for us it took nearly 3 hours and visits to several unsuitable rooms with the manager. Eventually we ended up with 1 x 2 bedroom and 2 x 1 bedroom suites, which in fact were lovely and met our expectations. We were given an extra night free to offset the check-in anxiety. In fairness to the resort, our family members who had not been before said it felt as though they had 'died and gone to heaven' when the first saw the accommodation. It really is plush. The pool in the evening was just perfect, and all to ourselves. Why the hotel was full we never understood as we saw loads of cars but very few people. Maybe the resort is used as a winter retreat for people who hibernate. This is a great resort, but perhaps just too popular.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: up40love
Reviews.Content: Great family hotel, but not for a business trip. Issue one is hotel is too big and not easy to meet business associates, the bar is outside which is fine in summer but not in winter when the high is 40. Also, unless you plan on walking a half mile to and from your room not the best choice in November.

Reviews.Title: “Break From Convention”
Reviews.Author: AMM-PA
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a convention in Orlando and stayed at the above site for the first time after many visits to Orlando for both business and pleasure. This was only a 10 min. drive from the convention center and a great location within walking distance of an outlet mall and a small strip center across the street for food, etc. The unit was ideal and we had business friends stay in the unit next door. They were so pleased with their unit. The staff was good and the accommodations were great as the complex isn't that old.

Reviews.Title: “Happy time at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: RobJamesCarlisle
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacations club is brilliant. Me and my girlfriend went at the end of October for a week and paid about 600 sterlings. The staff are very friendly and the place is nice and clean. Our room had some kitchen facilities with a fridge, toaster, coffee maker and microwave and with a supermarket across the street we were able to make breakfast and sandwiches whenever we wanted. The complex has a pre-bookable shuttle service to Universal Studios for $8 return and a bus stop right outside the front entrance on International drive. There is a great shopping outlet mall next door. This place is spot on for people who like a great standard and facilities but who also like some independence on their holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomdations Worst Staff in the industry”
Reviews.Author: muff1234
Reviews.Content: The resort and its surroundings and location are AWESOM! The staff is the WORST including the MANAGER! I would not recommend staying there if you expect to receive ANY assitance from the staff or management! They can care less if you stay there and are not willing to assist guests with minor problems! The only good staff we came across was the Play Room staff and the guy who make home made ice cream (which is delicious). Resort is beautiful - great access to freeways - close to WDW, across the street from Seaworld - close to outlet malls!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: mwbcab
Reviews.Content: My wife was contacted by a Hilton representative to visit this resort as long as we agreed to listen to the "Vacation Club" spiel. The presentation was tempting, but we did not buy. The resort is absolutely beautiful! My two young sons enjoyed the big pool, waterfall, and fountains. I personally enjoyed the the walking trail around the lake. I found the rooms to be nicely appointed with everything we needed for our stay. Our family of four was comfortable in the one bedroom one bath. For teenage children, I would recommend a two bedroom for privacy. The grounds surrounding the resort were perfect. All the staff were very courteous. Major like = Convenience to all the big attractions. Only minor dislike = Too many speed bumps in parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: TamMacS
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation to Orlando. Hilton Grand Vacations was beautiful. We stayed in building 4 on the ground level - no great views, but the smaller pool was right outside our door (didn't find it noisy at all - just convenient). We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite - 2 full bedrooms with King size beds , 2 bathrooms, jacuzzi tub and a full kitchen(full size fridge, dishwasher, stove, microwave), 3 tv's, washer & dryer. It had everything you could need! The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was great. We didn't rent a car, but it was very easy to get around by shuttle or the I-Trolley just outside the main gates. The I-Trolley didn't go to all of the parks but it went to SeaWorld and another Outlet Mall (Prime Outlets). Premium outlet mall was right outside the gate - no streets to cross to get to it. The bell men would stop and pick you up with their golf carts if you wanted, so getting from one end of the resort to the other was not a problem. There is a Publix across the street for all the grocery items you would need, although the street is fairly busy and can be hard to get across. Overall loved this hotel/resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Andrewsmom94
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay. We were in building 7 on the ground floor. We had a three bedroom with three bathrooms, which was perfect for us. We didn't have great views, but we weren't around much until the evening. We only had a problem parking on one night. My husband said that it was the best vacation that he'd ever had. He stayed at the resort all day and hung out at the pool, while the rest of us went to the parks and shopping. My son said that the pools were too cold for him to stay in very long. The hot tubs were great! The new bridge across the lake really cuts down on the walking time to the large pool and the bar. The home made ice cream was a big hit. We will stay there every time that we go as long as there are openings.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: robsmustang
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our two week honeymoon stay at the Hilton grand vacations club. This hotel was everything we expected and much much more. Only a few minutes drive to all the parks (Universal, Disney, Sea world). The room was always clean new towels, dishes washed etc. We stayed in building #7 on the top floor, elevator is a little slow but an amazing view of the lake and grounds. parking was a little tite while we were there due to the parking lot being resurfaced. Great shopping right next door in the Orlando premium outlets. we will return to this hotel for all of our future visits to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Well equipped for a "non-suite"”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 3 on the 4th floor, overlooking the lake. This was a good location as it was half way between both pools, so you did not have a long walk, but did not hear the noise from the speaker system / music at the pool. It appears there are 5 buildings (#1 is by the large pool, #5 is by the smaller pool). Despite other reviews re : probs with not getting housekeeping, we had no problem - room cleaned daily. Pros: screened in outdoor balcony = no bugs! Our room was well stocked despite the fact that it was considered a non-suite! Included a microwave, coffeemaker with Starbucks coffee, toaster, blender, tea towels, papertowels, dishes & cutlery, a grater, and peeler, papertowels and dishsoap! Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries. Small kitchen area with separate "kitchen" sink. Hotel had Pizza Hut express by the smaller pool (right on the grounds). Location is great: you are virtually "attached" to the outlet mall - there are 2 exits off the grounds that allow you to walk directly into the outlet. The Publix (supermarket) is across the street - note: you need to cross a non-pedestrian friendly street to get there. Overall hotel felt like a 'resort' - very nice pools, organized games and activities by the pool etc... Grounds themselves are lovely and nice to stroll around at night. Cons: don't like being called to attend a timeshare presentation but on the plus side, they only called us once and didn't bother us again. I think they should just ask upon check-in if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: jamriner
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the HGVC Orlando and had a great time. Went with my wife and our 4-1/2 year old daughter. After the craziness and commercialism of Disney, Universal, etc. where everything is expensive and mediocrity is often the norm, the accommodations at the HGVC were an unexpected surprise. Friendly staff, nice rooms with a great jaccuzi tub, screened in balcony, and beautiful grounds. Free wireless internet was great, too. The room decor was nice, but the furniture was bit stuffy for our tastes, but not a big deal. Beautiful granite countertops, nice appliances (though dishwasher was LOUD!) and inroom laundry were all nice touches. Only two primary complaints - one, persistent Timeshare Sales people started calling at 8AM the next morning after a late night arrival - and they're all competing with each other, so expect multiple calls. Very nice, but persistent. Also, while the poolside bar is gorgeous (like the pool) and the events they have are very nice, there really is no substantial restaurant on premises - I know, it's a condominium complex and there are scads of restaurants in Orlando, but we got pretty sick of the onsite breakfast buffet pretty quickly. But those are pretty minor issues, would definitely stay again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wickboy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at HGVC on International Drive. From the minute we checked in the desk staff couldn't do enough for you. We booked the 1st night seperately from the rest of thestay and they moved us to an apartment with a fantastic view. We stayed in block 2, 4th floor. the apartment was great. The only complaint we had was a lack of housekeeping. The beds weren't changed all the time we were there. Some of the bar staff leave a little to be desired, but Jose the waiter is excellent. Always cheerful and very attentive. HGVC makes a great base for the parks and amenities of Orlando. Some good restaurants in the area. Try the blooming onion at the Outback across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon at HGVC on International Drive”
Reviews.Author: storey13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on International Drive for our honeymoon plus 1 (My 9 year old son came along). First we had a little miscomunication with the front desk. I called ahead on the way to Orlando to see about upgrading our 1 bedroom to a 2 bedroom. The lady on the phone told me the price and I said no thanks. When we arrived, I asked again, hoping for a better price, and the lady who checked me in said I did have a 2 bedroom. I asked her how much and she told me the rate and I told her I never agreed to that. Well eventually they straightened it out and upgraded me to the 2 bedroom for $30 more per night, which I thought was a fair amount. I originally booked this on hilton.com, and already had a great rate from a package I found, so the extra $30 a night was a good deal. This way my son would have his own bathroom, bedroom, and tv. This hotel is the perfect location if you want to stay off disney property. It took about 20 minutes to get to any of the parks, and about 10 minutes to get to DisneyQuest in downtown disney. We were assigned in building 4 on the 3rd floor with a view of the laguna pool. I did ask for building 2, but we arrived very late at night so it wasn't available. I must say that we were very impressed with the accommodations! When we arrived at our room, they had a cheese and fruit plate in the kitchen for us, and had a kids snack tray in the kitchenette area for my son. They also had a bottle of champagne which was nice as well. We ended up trading the bottle of champagne in for a couple of bottles of non alcoholic sparkling apple cider since we don't drink alcohol. This was a very nice gesture and very thoughtful of the staff, since I only mentioned it was our honeymoon on the phone earlier in the day. I must say that the bedding was excellent. The mattress was the perfect blend of softness and firmness, and they had a good blend of soft and firm pillows as well. The 2 person jacuzzi tub was a great way to relax after a long day at Disney. The tub fills very fast which is nice compared to some hotels where it takes forever for it to fill. We had daily maid service since we booked this through Hilton.com and not a timeshare program. The main bathroom has dual sinks, standalone shower. The kitchen has a refrigerator, oven with stovetop, microwave, and dishwasher. We ate breakfast everyday in our hotel room to save a little money, and at dinner a couple of times there as well. To our surprise, housekeeping would even load our dishes for us each day as well! The staff was the most friendly staff we have ever encountered at any resort or hotel ever. From the initial greeting at the security gate, to the final goodbye from a staff member on the way out, everyone greeted us with a smile and a hand wave. When we had an issue, it was quickly taken care of. We only had two issues during our stay. My son's bathroom had a moldy smell due to a shower curtain that was replaced very quickly and one day housekeeping forgot to restock the Evelyn and Crabtree shampoo and conditioner. They had a gentlemen bring up a whole bag of conditioners, shampoos, and lotions. Anytime we did call for a service issues, someone always followed up to make sure it was taken care of. I couldn't imagine our honeymoon stay to go any better than it did. Thank you HGVC and your staff. You made my honeymoon a wonderful one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: OSUBuckey
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney World. We decided to stay here from research I had done months before. The Hotel lived up to all of our expectations. It has beautiful grounds, pools and the rooms are nicely kept. There are two pools and the second pool as a wonderful kiddie pool that slopes down. We did have to switch rooms on the second day because we have a 1 year old and it was a little noisy for her to take her naps during the afternoon. We were in building 1 and, although its very convenient to the main pool and other services, you could hear all the games and activities going on over the loudspeaker from the pool. They were very nice and quickly moved us to another room in Building 3. I would definately request this Building if you want a quiet room. Its in the middle of both pools so you can not hear all the loudspeaker noise. We were in a studio and enjoyed the refrigerator, sink and micorwave. My parents were upgraded to a 1 bedroom and it was very large. They had a seperate bedroom, kitchen and dining area. Their kitchen also included a dishwasher, washer and dryer and stove, which the studio does not. Even with our move we were still very satisfied and pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, convenient”
Reviews.Author: carminey
Reviews.Content: Hilton Grand Vacations club review Date of travel- first week of Sept 2008. Day #1- Check in Bldg 2, room –08, gorgeous view of the lake, but right next to the elevator- too noisy. Staff was friendly and helpful. Was reassigned to Bldg 5, quieter, but had a view of the multi-deck parking lot and construction. Which was fine since we would not be spending too much time in the room looking out of the balcony. Hotel ground is very beautiful, very impressed. Pool and hot tub were nice too, but did not swim in it. Other reviews can give you a better insight to their opinion of the pools. Got a sales call, and told them no. Never got another sales call again (GREAT !). Few notes: 1) was surprised that there is no daily maid service. You get your room serviced on an assigned date. Not sure if this is customary at a time-share facility. 2) I stayed at a kitchenette. It has a refrigerator, sink, microwave, 2 sets of plates, cups and mugs and sufficient utensils for party of 2. 3) For such a gorgeous place, was surprised that there is no flat-screen TV. 4) No place to put luggage. Thus, we had to put on the chair and then remove from chair when I need to sit by the table. A disappointment. Room décor is standard and a bit on the smaller size. 5) Pillows were too soft- difficult to stack them and use as back support while watching TV. 6) Location is truly awesome. Next to the Premium Mall, right off I-Drive/ I-4 and right across from Publix/ Walgreens. Very quiet and serene and still close to everything. Would not be able to stay in a hotel directly situated on I-Drive- too noisy and too much traffic. It’s worth it just for the location and the beauty of the hotel ground. Day #2 Went to Downtown Walt Disney, about 10 mins away by car. Free parking. Was not too impressed if you are adult without kids. Too many stores, over-priced café/ restaurants (but Ghiradelli ice cream store is worth it). Like the section around Lego Land- saw landmarks made of lego blocks and a huge Loch Ness Monster in the lake. Kids will love this place- you can buy everything Disney-related. No place to shield pedestrian from the heat- either you have to go inside a store/ restaurant, but still no seats to sit around. It was not comfortable on hot sunny day. Went to the town of Celebration. The town center is called ‘Market Street’, it is very quaint and clean. The houses are absolutely beautiful- mostly Victorian and antebellum style. If you like architecture, I recommend a drive through Celebration. Went to The Crab House (Palm Parkway) for dinner. It was not busy on a Monday night, but got good great service and food was good. Can either order a la cart or buffet (not a lot of selection though). Buffet is approx $29.99 pp. Most of the seafood entrees start at $20.00. Food was good, but if you have several people in your party, it can get pricey. Discount Tickets- My husband works for a major corporation and he was able to get some discount tickets via his company’s partner stores. One of them happens to be All Access Tickets (8472 Palm Parkway, Orlando.). They ask you which company you work for and then let you know what the prices are. Not sure if it’s cheaper than other discount ticket places or online purchases. Here are some examples: Kennedy Space Center $34.50/ adult (list $40.00) Univ Studio, adult one day/ one park, $58.00 (list $73.00) 1-Day WDW and 1-day Univ Studio, Adult (NO park Hopper) package $135.00 La Nouba, adult $76.00 (list $86.00 for category 2 = seating preference) Our seat was toward the back, center row (there are no bad seats here. As a matter of fact, it’s better to sit in the back, you can get a better view of the aerial shows). Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Staying with a 13 month old”
Reviews.Author: sjr044
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a HGVC in Orlando, but our 4th stay this year in an HGVC property. Of the 4, I'd rank this last-- but that doesn't mean it wasn't nice. We staid in a 2 bedroom which was actually a one bedroom suite with a connecting door to a studio room (regular hotel room). So that was a bit of a surprise, since most HGVC 2 bedroom properties have double beds in the 2nd room... since my mother-in-law and her mom were in the studio, it would have been better to have had 2 beds, or at least been told about that ahead of time. We were in building 4- which has a pool directly behind it. The main pool, bar, deli are all off of building 1 which was a bit of a walk (in the pouring rain!) but not bad. We loved having the laguna pool so close to our room since there were less than 10 people there each time we went... the main pool was packed so we appreciated a calmer area for our son to play. The hotel is walking distance from some high end outlets- which made my sister-in-law happy! There is also a publix right across the street which was great! Disney attractions are about a 15 minute drive if there is no traffic and you catch 50% of the red lights- we budgeted 30 minutes when going to visit my brothers who were staying at one of the disney hotels and that was usually about right. They will call and ask you to see the timeshare presentation, but unlike some of the other HGVC properties- we said no once and they didn't bug us again. The hotel was very quiet at night- and they even provided an in-room highchair for my son which was great! Full size fridge, washer and dryer made it easy to pack light. Since my husband can't stay all the "Disney" craziness- we will stay at this property for all our Orlando trips!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: bscottMissouri
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay! We had a 2 bed suite and it was fabulous! It was like having 2 complete rooms with adjoining door. Used the free shuttle to Sea World and the staff was friendly and helpful. Washer & dryer, living area, complete kitchen ready to go! Whirlpool tub in the king suite. The extra bedroom was like a separate room with sofa, tv, sink, mini-frig etc. Both rooms had private screened balcony with patio set. The king suites was larger. The pools were spotless. Everything was elegant and well done. There were 6 of us in our party and we had plenty of space.

Reviews.Title: “Really Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bratzoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as timeshare owners. We flew into Orlando with (GASP) – ourselves (late 40’s), my parents (83, 78), Our kids (19, 13, 10), and each kid brought a friend (18, 16, 11). Let me tell you – traveling with such a huge group was a trip report in itself – but I won’t bore you with it. Unit Features (3 bedroom – 2 bedroom will be the same minus the lock-off): Bedrooms – Master bedroom has a king-size bed and a bathroom. There is one closet and plenty of drawer space. There is a television, which we didn’t use. In the room is a really huge Jacuzzi tub. The master bath has a 2 person size shower, toilet and one sink. Living/Kitchen Area – Sofa bed (the younger girls slept on this and it was a horrible sofa bed – I do not recommend it for kids under the age of 6), a lounge chair and a TV. There’s a desk area where you can use your computer – free wifi – but also a plug in if necessary. There is a big kitchen table. The kitchen had everything a full kitchen should have.  Laundry facilities are in a small closet by the kitchen. Deck – The deck is enclosed with large with a nice table and chairs. We rarely used it because our view was so bad. BUT - if you have a nice view- the deck will be AWESOME!!! Tidy Service – One tidy service was provided free of charge as timeshare owners - if you rent, you will get maid service daily. Pool Area – Absolutely divine. There were plenty of chairs. There were plenty of chairs – no need to reserve them as so many people are at Disney. The water was a perfect temperature – refreshing, but not cold. I loved the beautiful waterfall. There is a bar area where you can order burgers and chicken fingers, along with expensive, but important on vacation, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Restaurants/Marketplace – The pool bar has a decent menu. The children loved the freedom of going to the marketplace and buying extra food. This was their fun, though there’s a Publix directly across the street. Of course we stocked the fridge, and of course the kids preferred the junk elsewhere. Great resort - View matters to me - so I will tell you about that so you can attempt to do better. That said, even with a bad view, the resort is awesome - and don't let our ugly view talk you out of staying here. When we arrived, we were assigned a room that had a very ugly view. We were in building 7 – view of the construction. We had a 3 bedroom. My parents had a 2 bedroom in building 7 – slightly better view – but not great. They insisted that the three bedrooms only have bad views because they’re corner units. I do not believe this for one minute. Go for building 1 – 4 if you want to be closer to the pool (though we didn’t mind this part at all). Building 7 and beyond are across the bridge. Actually, I liked the short walk across the beautiful bridge to the pool. Lots of ducks and turtles greet you. We ate off site every night. Here’s a list of restaurants: Best restaurants (all off Disney) 1. Le Coq Au Vin - French (TOP NOTCH - reasonably priced) 2. Seasons 52 (TOP NOTCH reasonably priced) 3. Oceanaire (TOP NOTCH - expensive) 4. Moonfish (Great - most expensive!) 5. Capital Grill (Very good -expensive) 6. Antonio's (Good - huge portions) 7. Fishbones (hated it) All are within 10 minutes from the hotel – though allow yourself 20 minutes with traffic. Property – Magnificent – Lovely pathways, benches, and gardens make a lovely walk. There is a gym, which is very mediocre – 3 treadmills, one elliptical, 2 bikes, and poor weight machines. . The market place has plenty of what you need day one before you goes to the much less expensive supermarket nearby. The lobby is very pretty, and the staff was courteous. Sales/Staff – We were treated gloriously when we arrived. Then we were asked to go to a sales pitch (of course it was called an owners’ breakfast). We didn’t go. Planned Activities – Absolutely wonderful activities for the kids (adults – some – not as much). The kids could choose (most had charges) – hair braiding, tattoos, Wii challenge, make your own stuffed animal, pool party, dive movie night, on and on and on. Disney – We went to Magic Kingdom, Disney Studios, and Typhoon Lagoon. Remember – this was August and it was hot. Magic Kingdom was great because we used tours.com (from underground tourist). We followed the suggested route, and we had almost no lines. Most lines were air-conditioned, so although it was hot, it was very tolerable. We did arrive at 8:30 am – very important. We left at 2. The girls were exhausted, but the boys returned at 6 until 10 and had a blast. Disney Studios was another story. Again, we arrived at 8:30 am. We hit Rock ‘n Roller Coaster with no lines (LOVED IT). But after that, lines got long and it got hot. Typhoon Lagoon was not, in my opinion, as great as we heard – but there were some fun rides –and of course we weren’t hot. Suitability: This wonderful resort is suitable for everyone. http://www.picturetrail.com/sfx/album/view/20429702

Reviews.Title: “GRAND Hilton”
Reviews.Author: NRWSA
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through RCI and the agent informed me that it was a new suite in a fairly new resort. After a tiring bus ride from the airport we arrived at the entrance to the resort, bags in tow and exhausted from a very early morning flight. Anyway, we were bowled over by the beauty of the entire resort and the stunning room we received in Tower 7. I can honestly say it was one of the best resorts we ever stayed in. Check-in was a breeze, we booked our Disney tickets with the Expedia agent on sight(a few dollars more) ; it helps having them around for any info you might need. Also, there is a Publix across the street for stocking up on essentials and an outlet mall next door for some retail therapy if you have the time. We did not hire a car and opted for public transport instead which was fine if you don't mind the many stops on the way to Disney, this was our first trip to Orlando so obviously only focused on the parks this time round.The resort has a shuttle bus to Universal which we used. My only regret is that we did not get to enjoy the resort as much as we'd have liked because we were out all day and too tired to walk around or enjoy the pool and jacuzzi in the evening. Would definitely recommend and return if possible....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but if I had paid full price I'd be a bit more critical”
Reviews.Author: librarychick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a time share swap courtesy of a family member so only paid $164 total for the week. For that price-absolutely no complaints. Beautiful grounds, buildings, room, and staff was extremely friendly, efficient, and professional. The room (1 bedroom with a king, sofa sleeper) was huge. The bathroom was bigger than my bedroom at home. Having a full kitchen and washer and dryer were wonderful and I enjoyed the screened in balcony. Nice new Publix across the street as well as a gas station, Walgreens, McDonalds, Outback Steakhouse, and a fabulous Chinese restaurant-Citrus Garden, and oh yes, a liquor store! Also backs up to an outlet mall which my daughter and I had fun browsing during one of our many rainy afternoons. 2 pools, both beautiful. Plenty of lush beach towels provided, seemed to be adequate lounge chairs, 2 hot tubs. Lots of fun scheduled activities but we were unable to participate in the majority of them due to our daily plans and the weather (tropical storm Fay!). Our last night we were able to go to the main pool for the "Dive In Movie"-they have a big inflatable movie screen, showed a family movie, sold popcorn and candy etc-fun! The kitchen was nice but there was really no place to put groceries besides in the fridge. Parking was tight. We were there on what I would consider a bit slower time of year and still had trouble parking close to our building. Not a big deal but seems like it would be a major problem during high seasons. The ice maker in the freezer didn't work, some outlets didn't work, and the remote went out the 5th day we were there. Housekeeping also only comes once a week which didn't really bother us-we used the in room dryer to dry our bath towels because the humidity prevented any air drying; even with the AC on any opened food was stale in 24 hours. My only other complaint may be isolated based on the room we were in-we were evidently located next to some sort of storage closet for the housekeeping/maintainance staff and the one day we attempted to sleep in we were unable to because of the noise outside our room-the walls seemed thin. One more note-the staff was extremely good about keeping us apprised of the "hurricane" Fay situation in both voicemail messages and notes under the door (although they called Fay Kay). They did close the pool for 1 or 2 days and cancelled a lot of activities but we appreciate the proactive caution. Overall, we were extremely pleased. The hotel is gorgeous all around-the rooms, the buildings, the pools, the common areas. For what we paid, I would 100% stay again, especially because we do not usually stay in this class of hotel (because I'm cheap!) and my review would be the full 5 stars. However, I'm only giving it 4 stars because based on the going rack rate of closer to $150/night, I would expect perfection.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: travelpal28411
Reviews.Content: This place is a real gem! I am very selective when it comes to hotels and where I stay. Everything was extremely clean here and our villa was beautiful! We booked a 1br King room and got this enormous suite that was something so nice that you could live in it! It had a washer and dryer in the villa and starbucks coffee for use in the full size kitchen. The bathroom was enormous with double sinks, separate shower and jet bath. Everything was perfect and the staff was very courteous and helpful. Wish we would have stayed here the entire trip instead of spending 2 nights in Daytona. Stop looking around and just book here. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: starprincess02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the HGVC for our honeymoon. The resort is beautiful and very well kept. We stayed in the 1 bedroom jacuzzi suite. We checked in very late at night due to our flight being delayed, and the front desk was very friendly. We told her we were on our honeymoon and she ordered some “amenities” for us. The next day we found a bottle of wine with a fruit and cheese plate in our fridge. Both pools are beautiful. We only used the smaller one since it was closer to our room. We really enjoyed the homemade ice cream one night at the main pool. The only downside was the extremely hot weather. Florida in August is in the 90’s everyday. Overall, it was a great stay and I would definitely recommend it for an amazing honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family stay at Hilton Grand Vacations Club”
Reviews.Author: DesignDiva13
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (with 2 boys at ages 10 and 4) and just retuned from a 6-day trip to Orlando. We reserved a 1-bedroom king suite which included a king-sized bed + sofa bed + chair with ottoman that my 10-year old slept on 1 night. THE ROOM: Very pretty décor and nice furniture with marble countertops, new appliances, huge whirlpool tub, washer/dryer, flat-screen TVs in both the bedroom and sitting area, plus free WiFi Internet access in the room (bring your own laptop). The hotel gave us free laundry detergent and dryer sheets so we were able to do laundry during our stay and not run out of clean underwear for the kids! The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were clean and crisp. Since the property has 7 buildings, we were worried about the walking distance to the main lobby. Due to health/mobility issues, we requested a suite in building 1 and we were so happy to find out the hotel granted our wish, with a first floor handicapped-accessible room! While we enjoyed close proximity to the pools and main lobby, the downside to having a suite so close to the action is the noise. We didn’t even try to put the kids to bed before 11 pm every night, due to the dive-in movie (see below) and pool noise. Also, our room was right by the elevator where, as early as 7 am, people talk very loudly while waiting. We heard entire conversations while trying to catch up on our ZZZs. In hindsight I think we would have been better to request a higher floor in building 1, or at least a room not right by the elevator. Before booking this hotel, we read other reviews that complained about inconsistent maid service, but we never had a problem. Our room was cleaned every day with fresh towels, bath products, etc. They even cleaned the kitchen with our dishes and gave us fresh Starbucks coffee daily. PROPERTY: Beautiful lush & green grounds; heated swimming pools with a waterfall; interactive children's fountains and 3 whirlpool spas; active lounge with chess, checkers, pool tables, computer with Internet (for a small fee); quiet lounge for reading; activity center for the kids with art supplies, projects, games/puzzles, books etc; a professional photographer on site that we did not have time to take advantage of; and more! Everything is new, clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly. When we first checked in we were asked if we wanted to attend a 45-min timeshare presentation but simply said no thanks and that was the end of it. We ate at the bar/restaurant by the pool 2 nights & found the prices to be reasonable. There is also a Pizza Hut and a deli (sandwiches, salads) with small grocery store on site. Every day there are activities scheduled for both kids and adults. At night from 8-11 pm the hotel brings out a huge projection screen and shows a nightly “dive-in” movie right at the main pool. You can lounge in chairs by the pool, eat, watch the movie, or swim the entire time it is showing. One night we watched “College Road Trip” and another night it was “Penelope”. LOCATION: The hotel is about 20 min from the airport. The taxi from the airport cost us around $50 one-way. Location is 15-20 minutes from any of the main parks. There is a shuttle bus available at no charge to Seaworld, Aquattica (water park) and Universal. The free shuttle was great; the only caveat was the schedule. The bus only picked up only 3x each morning from the hotel (8 am, 10 am, and 12 pm) and only picked up 3x each evening from Universal (5 pm, 7 pm, and 9 pm). So if you plan on leaving the parks in the middle of the day or later at night, you’ll have to take a taxi for around $35-40. Another warning: Hilton Grand Vacations Club is the LAST pick up (or first depending on how you look at it), so we had to stop at 3 other hotels and 2 parks before we made it to our final destination of Universal. Overall, the ride each way took 40-45 minutes. If you are trying to meet friends for dinner plans after a day at the parks, take into account the delay. A couple of restaurants in walking distance: Outback Steakhouse and a sushi place included. We made use of the Walgreens and Publix grocery store across the street to stock our kitchen with breakfast and snack items. Due to the kitchen---stocked with pots, pans, plates/bowls, cups, silverware etc.---we were able to eat at least 1 meal in our suite each day and save some $ from eating out all the time. KID COMMENTS: My 10-year old says: “My favorite is the pools. They are better than other pools because they are kid-friendly (3 feet in most areas) and then they get really deep, so it’s really fun.” Worst thing about the hotel: “The movies at night because you can’t go to sleep earlier than 11 pm.” My 4-year old says: “My favorite thing about the hotel is sleeping and eating and playing in the room. [Note from mom: I think he liked the very large suite, as opposed to a regular small hotel room.] I liked going swimming. I liked looking for lizards.” Worst thing: “I didn’t like the waterfall.” OVERALL: The hotel was very responsive to our needs. The property and suite were beautiful. There was so much that we didn’t even have time to do. The hotel is actually a resort and if we hadn’t made previous plans to visit Universal and Islands of Adventure (part of Universal), we could have simply stayed and played at Hilton Grand Vacations Club the entire time, never leaving the property. Hilton also has another Grand Vacations Club facility closer to the parks. Next time we would consider staying there simply for the shorter shuttle ride.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?!”
Reviews.Author: BedouinAtHeart
Reviews.Content: A one-bedroom condo, with a full kitchen, whirlpool tub, screen-in porch, and all the amenities of a resort, at the price of a standard hotel room. This IS the place to stay. I cannot be more complimentary of the HGVC International Drive. The property was gorgeous and well-maintained. The staff bent over backwards to welcome you, make you feel at home and see to your every need. The rooms were gorgeous and comfortable. It's actually the first "vacation club" style place that I would actually consider buying into... It's just that great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: easycoolers
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. We had a one bedroom suite with a queen sleeper sofa in the living/dining area. It was just enough space for a family of 4 with 2 teenage boys. The pool area is fabulous. It was great having a washer and dryer in the room and a Publix grocery store right across the street. We did have a disappointment at check-in. We did not get the room location that we requested, but got moved to a room that was almost what we asked for. Over all we had a great stay at Hilton Grand Vacation Club. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Resort”
Reviews.Author: Iluvha
Reviews.Content: We are HGVC Members and booked through the HGVClub website in November of 2007. We were able to book a three bedroom which is a 2-bedroom with a one bedroom lockout which is just a hotel room with its own balcony and a kitchenette (fridge, MW, and sink with dishes and glasses provided in the cabinets). The pictures do not do this resort justice. You forget that you are in the middle of a metropolitan area. We spent a lot of time relaxing by the pool. There is plenty of shade and the weather was breezy and perfect. We thoroughly enjoyed the activities by the pool especially the dive-in movie and the ice cream sundaes. The staff was very nice and helpful. We had many suggestions and we felt as if they were taken seriously. The parking seemed to be a problem but not for us even though we were in Building 7. We parked on the other side of the main entrance and enjoyed a nice walk back along the lake. The resort is very conveniently located and everything is easy to get to especially the supermarket across the street. The only challenge was the traffic going from Vineland to 535. One lane of traffic trying to go back to I-4 or Disney and it can get backed up. We spent one day at Disney, one at Kennedy, one at SeaWorld and spent some time visiting friends north of Orlando. It was perfect for our needs and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Choice”
Reviews.Author: Disney0043
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton from July23-29th, we could not have been happier with our hotel choice. We wanted to pre-register for our room at 10:30 am and to our surprise it was ready and we could check in. We were in building 4 with a view of the lake, the screened in patio's are lovely. We visited the main pool area, plenty of lounge chairs, great service form the bar area, and the Fresco Deli was wonderful for sandwichs or a late night dinner which we had one night. Housekeeping was fine...fresh towels everyday. On the way out my husband was chatting with the resort manager, we told him we go to Orlando every year and we enjoyed this hotel as much if not more than the Disney ones, he was happy to hear that. So if your looking for a wonderful resort I would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellently ran.”
Reviews.Author: sammack13
Reviews.Content: I have owned with HGVC for several years. This was the best timeshare I ever stayed at. Very organized --from the moment we drove up until we left, not one problem. We arrived early and were greeted/escorted into the lobby. They called us when the room was (over an hour before check-in time). The room was perfectly clean. It isn't a "five star hotel" --I have stayed in nicer hotels --but by far, this was the nicest timeshare that I was ever in. Granite counters, flat screen TV's --very, very nice. --We have stayed at the HGVC-Sea World and International Drive room's are much nicer. (similar size) There were activities by the pool at night which was nice if you weren't at the park and wanted something to look at. They had a deli open most of the time that sold coffee, sandwiches, ice cream, etc. They had a small menu by the pool which included appetizers and burgers to steaks ---what we had was very good and reasonable (large burger with fries 8.95). There was also a pizza hut express that we didn't use. You could walk to the outlets --main gate closed due to construction but there was another by the mall's parking deck. Buildings are set up so (I think) everyone has a view of the lake -- beyond the lake varies. We had trees (we were in building 7) and pleasant view. --Publix and McDonalds were very close by -- could walk also. But it was peaceful despite the closeness of stores. There were ducks and large turtles to feed/visit in the lake. Everyone was very nice --all was organized. No pressure from timeshare salesman --received one phone message which we did not respond to. --Only problem was late night parking by the higher numbered buildings got full --but it really wasn't a big problem as there was lots of parking by the lobby and attendants were always right there waiting to shuttle you on van or golf cart --very helpful --or the walk isn't too horrible. It was 5 or so minute drive to Disney. Was very easy to park in Disney -- organized and get on a shuttle. I thought parking would be a pain as I normally stayed in Disney Village ----but it was actually less hassle than taking a shuttle. Great experience there -- recommend to anyone visiting Orlando area --

Reviews.Title: “amazing hgvc”
Reviews.Author: anne087
Reviews.Content: my two sons 14 and 13 and i are just back from a three week trip to orlando, the final week staying at the hgvc. i had booked it after doing a lot of research and based on trip advisor recommendations. it was truly amazing. we arrived early - 11am after leaving our other hotel and although check in isnt supposed to be until 4pm, we were given our one bedroom suite after only half an hour wait. we were in building 2 which overlooks the lake and the suite was beautiful with a huge jacuzzi bath in the master bedroom. the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and nothing seemed too much trouble. luckily we had spent the first two weeks of our trip doing the parks because as soon as we got here my boys didnt want to leave the property at all. there is a publix supermarket across the road and a huge shopping mall next door. also a lovely steakhouse 'outback' next to mc donalds. i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting luxury and a chill out holiday which was a perfect end to the madness of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand Vacations Club Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: LisaCarrasco
Reviews.Content: My husband and two sons (5 & 8) spent four nights at the HGVC while doing the Disney thing. I was pleasantly surprised at how roomy and attractive our suite was. We had a one bedroom with a pullout couch, which our boys slept on. The king sized bed was very comfy, like being at home! Everything was clean and decorated tastefully. Towels folded decoratively, Starbucks coffee provided. We were gone much of the time at the parks but it was a nice homebase to come back to each evening. We ate at the poolside grill the first evening and it was pretty good. The pool itself was lovely. Although there were no slides or extra cool stuff, my sons had a ball there on the last evening. It's a large resort with 6 or 7 different villas (buildings). We were in #6, which meant we had to walk a ways to get to the main pool and building. But it's a pleasant walk over a bridge and only took about 5 minutes. On nights where we returned after 10:00, there was no parking near our villa, which meant we had to park at the main building and a hotel van drove us to our villa. We never had to wait for a ride and it was only a minor inconvenience. In the morning, you simply call and someone is right there to pick you up to return you to your car. There is a free shuttle to the Universal parks and Sea World, but a $12/person charge for the shuttle to the Disney parks. We had our own car so we drove instead. The HGVR can provide you with a printout of directions and all kinds of info on places to visit. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I wasn't sure if there would be but we did have maid service each day and fresh towels delivered without asking. For the $ we spent, (about $155/night) this place was an amazing value and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing "Grand" about the Hilton Grand Vacation”
Reviews.Author: gancell
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was disappointing to say the least. Whilst the complex itself if very nice, there are certain aspects that do not meet the standards I have come to expect from the Hilton chain. If you are a Diamond HHonors member don't expect any of the usual preferential treatment. This is no exec. lounge, no room upgrades and no comp. breakfast. All you receive is a "$10" one off discount coupon. Check in is at 4pm and check out is at 10am, so if you are thinking of overnighting here...don't bother. We arrived at 1pm and were told we would be called when our room was ready. There was no call and we finally checked in at 7pm. Our first room was horrible. There was a very strong chemical smell in the room that is apparently used to mask the humidy/mold. It was so strong that after 10 min. my eyes were burning. The Resort Manager came to our room and at about 10pm we were moved to a 1 Bedroom suite. This was very nice but the following day we were told we would have to move. I am not a big fan of packing and unpacking at the best of times. The new room was stock standard. Overall our impression of this hotel is that they are out to attract families with a view of selling them "time share". Some of the service was great while other aspects were mediocre. Finally, the greatest surprise was that there was no restaurant on site. Horrible breakfast is available from an overpriced deli. I suppose most families eat in, but with no room service this is far from the resort standard we have come to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: brendansmon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property during the first week in June and loved it. We stayed in a one bedroom unit overlooking the main pool area. We arrived at the resort around 2 pm and pre-checked in, they told us they would call us when our room was ready. Imagine our surprise when they called us only 15 minutes later (we didn't even have a chance to grab a bite to eat). We requested a room close to the main pool and couldn't have been happier being in the main building right next to the pool on the 4th floor. Our room was spotless and had all the amenities we needed for our weeks stay. We also got maid service and fresh towels every day at no extra charge. The pool and bar area is fantastic. My son spent hours and hours swimming and making new friends. He also enjoyed participating in some of the many activities they had at the pool and we really enjoyed the twice a week movie night. We also enjoyed appetizers and drinks from the great and friendly staff at the pool bar. The resort is also centrally located to all the major theme parks, restaurants and shopping in the Orlando area. We never had to drive very far to get the the places we wanted to visit. We felt the property was very clean, we always felt very safe and never had any problems finding parking. All in all we had a great experience and we will visit this property when we come back down in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “A must if in orlando”
Reviews.Author: Whaursmakilt
Reviews.Content: Brilliant place to go. This was our first time in florida and we certainly weren't disappointed with the accommodation. Good facilities, nice staff. Any problems were dealt with quickly. Good location for transport if you get fed up with the car. Right across the road from a Publix, info center and a few local restaurants. Condo itself was really up to scratch - with everything you could ask for - if you can afford it - go for one with a separate bedroom - it really is worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great service”
Reviews.Author: mtlcouple
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this Hotel. We booked this hotel in March 2008 with our club intrawest time shares. I had asked for a first floor appartment and I got what I wanted. Appartment was fully equiped, jacuzzi in our bedroom, it was very clean. The proprety was also very clean. The property is very big so when you get to the hotel at night, you might encouter some problems to park the car but there is always a little shuttle or golf karts that are going around to give you a lift to your appartment. At the hotel, you do have the main pool which is always very busy but there is also another smaller pool where it is more quiet. Both pools have a bar and a restaurant. At the main pool you have a restaurant where you can order pretty much what you want. Next to that pool there is also a market deli. They do have sandwiches, salads, and also they sell whatever you are missing at your appartment. The smaller pool has also a bar but it closes earlier than the main pool. At that smaller pool you also have an express pizza hut which is also great. Staff are amazing. We never missed on anything. Accross the street from the hotel you have publix if you want to do some groceries. There is also a drugstore. Accross the street you will also find other restaurant such as: Subway, The outback, McDonald, Mexican restaurant. Next door to the hotel you have the premium outlet. Great place also to do some shopping. We were staying in block 5 room 5109. We were really located infront of the smaller pool and since I like more the quietness, I really enjoyed that part.. We were with 2 teens so if they felt like going to the bigger pool area they could do so on their own easily. It is a very safe place. Security and staff are all over the grounds day and night. Seaworld is 1/8 mile from the Hilton. Waltdisney is 5 miles from the Hilton approxi.. So great place to be..

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: beastiesmom
Reviews.Content: We were contacted this winter by HGVC and offered a preview promotion. We frequently stay at Hilton properties, but are not club members. When we arrived, we were greeted at the gate by the guard like we were arriving dignitaries and the same way at the front door. We were led to the check-in desk, where everything was as smooth as silk. We were on time for check-in...exactly 4pm. I expected a line, but there was none. We were directed to our suite...a 2 bedroom lock-off. I didn't understand the concept at the time of booking, but it is a 1 bedroom suite attached to a studio. This was slightly difficult for us as we have children of the opposite sex. Our daughter got the studio and our son slept on a pull out sofa in our room. Not great, but no complaints. My husband and I lacked some privacy, sharing a bathroom with our son, but it's not like we don't share at home. They do have conventional 2 BR condos on site, but none were available at the time. No big deal for us. HGVC leaves nothing to chance, every detail is covered. Kitchen supplies, toiletries, etc. The only thing missing during our stay was salt and pepper. Shakers in the units would be a nice touch. The only other suggestion I would have for the resort is placing a small teak bench in the master bedroom shower. It is massive, but there is nowhere for a lady to place her foot during shaving...a critical need for swimsuit weather! The grounds, furnishings and buildings were immaculate. Housekeeping was excellent, the room beautifully reset each time we left. Our only issue was that they only left decaf coffee for us, even after we left notes requesting regular. After speaking with some of the staff, it became apparent that English was not their primary language, so our notes may not have been understood. Certainly we could have gone to the front desk if it really bothered us, but it didn't. EVERY staff member we happened across welcomed us to their resort and asked us to enjoy our stay. The pools were very nice, complete with hot tubs. There were always plenty of towels available, even for a late night swim after returning from the park. I read on this site about the construction going on behind the resort, but it was never a problem for us. In fact, it was a bonus because we enjoyed some beautiful sunsets from the screened porch. The picture is blurry because of the screen, but you'll get the idea. We attended the required presentation, which was done very well by Sean. It felt somewhat like a car dealership, but not too much pressure. I wish we had this information 10 years ago, as Hilton's point system is far superior to the traditional time-share week system. If gas and heating oil prices weren't looming this winter...(we live in the Northeast)...we would have jumped onboard. Don't say no if they give you a call...well worth the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent: great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: FoxboroDan
Reviews.Content: I own a HGVC timeshare, and used my "points" to stay here for 6 days in a 2-bedroom suite with a full kitchen. Great location close to Disney and across the street from Seaworld, and the amenities were excellent. The master bedroom was very large with a separate area for an in-room jacuzi and a separate bathroom (with his-and-hers sinks). The second bedroom was smaller, but still had room for a full-sized bed for two and a couch and pullout couch. The living room was large. Each bedroom had a balcony with a small table. Disney property was 15 minutes away by car. Seaworld is just a long walk away. Our building (#10, Warwick) was recently refurbished, and cleanliness was A+. We just made breakfast in the kitchen, but it was very handy. The central main pool area was very lively, even at night. The poolside bar was nicely situated and appreciated. There was a smaller satelite pool behind our buidling which was nice for adults -- but kids may want to go to the main pool because of the activities and other kids. If you're looking for accomodations that are more similar to a furnished condo than a hotel, than this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top class Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: leewenliamdan
Reviews.Content: My family and I Stayed at the hilton on 2 June for 11 nights.Booked through Hotelopia. I have nothing but positive things to say about the resort. We have stayed at the resort before and requested an apartment in blocks 1-4,on arrival we were given a 1 bed in block 2. perfect. The rooms are huge and contain every facility needed for a family holiday. The kids especially loved the jacuzzi that comfortably fitted all 4 of us. The location is perfect IF you hire a car,a short drive to disney and seaworld and universal is easily accessible along i4. A large shopping mall with designer stores is next door and a large supermaket, publix, is opposite. The pool is massive and clean with a waterfall. Ideal if you want a break from the parks. The hotel runs an activity program for adults and kids including a 'dive in movie' twice a week. We had no problems from check in to check out and the staff,bar none were among the friendliest and most accomodating that we have encountered. We will definately return when we visit orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious accomodations at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Coll0610
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a one bedroom unit before departing on a cruise. The unit was clean, spacious and comfortable. We had a nice sized screened-in balcony with a couple chairs and a table. The full kitchen was stocked with dishes, silverware and pots and pans. The freezer had an icemaker, and there was a washer and dryer in the kitchen area. There are two pool areas. The smaller area has a pool with a zero entry area and a hot tub, as well as numerous lounge chairs. The other pool, near the main lobby, is larger. A splash area is next to it and there is at least one hot tub. I was very disappointed to find out that the walkways to the outlet mall next door were both closed, making it somewhere between difficult and impossible to walk there. I don't know if this was a permanent closure, as there was construction in the area. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider staying here again.
