Reviews.Title: “Fab !!!”
Reviews.Author: tracy45
Reviews.Content: The Hilton on International Drive is a FAB place to stay. The staff were polite and helpful . The atmoshere very relaxed ,.We were asked just once to go to a Timeshare , we said no and were left alone for the duration of our stay (2 weeks ).The appartment was clean and very spacey . We had a two bedded appartment , which turned out to be two appartments . My 10 yr old had her own , a rainy week in a caravan in Weymouth is never goint to be the same The two pools were lovey and spoiled for choice most days . And best of all it is close to a lot of things , by Florida standards anyhow. Prime Outlets just behind , Publix just across the road I carn't rate this resort high enough , they were fab in every aspect of making our stay memorable , thank you Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad property- no service”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: First I have to say we were given the $50 per night deal to stay as long as we listened to the Vacation Club sales pitch. Over all that was pretty painless. But due to poor service I would not stay or buy into this property! The Good: The hotel is in a nice location, with a grocery store across the street. The rooms are a nice size- a little worn, stains on the carpet and on the sofa. The Pool is nice but I am not sure it is nice enought to make it to the top of any prize lists. Having a kitchen and laundry facility is great. The Bad: The sofa bed was so awful my daughter would not sleep in it. There were blood stains on the sofa mattress and the sheets were terrible. My biggest complaint comes at Check out. I did not realize that check out was at 10am on Sunday morning (most hotels I stay out have 11am check out) At 10:10 housekeeping came pounding on the door and barged in- I was not even out of my pajamas. I had my husband tell them that we needed a few more minutes and they just hovered outside the door. Then 10 minutes later my husband goes to take out the luggage and they come walking in while I am trying to get dressed. It was 10:20 and I have never felt so pushed out of a room and the rudeness of them walking in- I could not even use the bathroom before we left! After treatment like that I will always stay at a Disney property and if I join a vacation club it will not be a Hilton- not with service that rude.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: cielo79
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Grand and I have hardly a complaint. Although check in was for 4pm we arrived closer to 6pm. Check-in was a breeze, less than 5 minutes as there was no wait. We were located in building 3, 7th floor. Wait for the elevator was less than 1 minute.(After reading previous reviews regarding longer waits, perhaps it was a busy time of year). When we arrived in the room, we noticed that housekeeping was just finishing up in there. That was strange b/c there check out time is 10 am but she was on her way out so it didn't bother much. We stayed in a 1 bedroom king sized room. I always do a walk through before anything else to make sure everything is proper and the room was very clean from the full kitchen to the bathroom to the outside terrace. The first evening we received a call asking how we are etc. and an invitation to view their plans for their new building with an offer for an 80 dollar gift card, i politely declined and I was never asked again. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. We had no problem with parking. Staff was beyond accommodating. We ordered once from their grill and had it delivered to the room, no complaints, pineapple sorbet was great. Though the brochure in the room states that housekeeping is an additional charge, she came in daily and I incurred no additional fees. Perhaps because we were on the 7th floor but we were unable to hear any sounds from other guests. The location of the hotel was ideal as well being close to attractions yet far enough not to feel too touristy. A publix supermarket, 7-11 and outlet shopping across the road. The pool area was well kept. Towels are provided and there was a staff member making rounds if you needed anything, or would like to order from the pool bar/grill. Though we don't have children yet, the place offered many activities for children as well as adults. There is one large pool and a smaller pool I believe for children. Due to the size of the place, another pool would be great although the main pool was never too crowded. Overall, we had a great time and would definitely recommend but only in the same building and on the same floor so you arent TOO close to the pool area which may become noisy when fully populated.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F
Reviews.Content: Hello I stayed at this hotel as an invitation to buy the Hilton Vacation Package. Well, besides the excellent presentation and friendless of the sales people I have some bad reviews about this hotel: - Late check in: 4pm ? This is way too late, however, we checked in at 6pm and they gave us a totally dirty room that looked like someone was still inside of it. They changed the room, but that was the first impression and welcome at this place. - Corridors full of trash: Housekeeping clean the rooms but leave the trash on the corridors until late hours. Not a good presentation at all; - SUPER EARLY check out: Management told us that the maximum he could do is 12pm because takes time to clear the rooms, yeah right, how come mine wasn't clean at 6pm? You know that bad word BS ? That what it is. - Not much parking at this location: You have to drive around the hotel to find a spot at late hours which is way ridiculous for a Hilton hotel that is trying to sell packages. Overall experience was disappointing. I would never return or recommend this location to anyone. I think if Hilton want to sell their vacation packages, they should start by giving a good service at this resort, which wasn't what I found here. Besides the bad things, the pool is very nice !

Reviews.Title: “O.K. experience at this location”
Reviews.Author: Sara W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in mid- april as he had some business meetings to attend. I was just a tag along on vacation. Overall, the hotel is nice, with a grand entrance! Check in was very slow, which is sad in my opinion, because there was only 1 couple in front of us. One thing my husband and I could not get over was that there was plenty of staff standing around behind the check-in desk, yet only one woman was checking people in. This was frustrating, but we tried to keep an open mind. After we were finally checked in, we drove all the way around to building 7 to find our room. (yes, this hotel is super big, to big in my opinion) The property is very pretty with well maintained landscaping. However, there is major construction going on right next to it, but the noise did not bother us at all. When we got to the elevators we waited and waited and waited. We were on the 7th floor. I am being completely honest when I say these are the absolute slowest elevators I have ever ever used! ***If you stay at this hotel ask for the lowest floor possible so that you do not have to use the elevators** We had to allow 10 minutes at least for the elevator ride. Many people complained about this, not just us. You could just feel the frustraion in the air when you were riding with other people. The rooms were nicely decorated. They could have been cleaner though. We had a 1 bedroom king/studio. We like to stay in hotels that offer a kitchenette for quick morning meals. Well unfortunatley, we had to wash all of the silverware in the drawer and the bowls in the cabinet. They were clearly dirty from the previous hotel guests. The room was pretty dusty as well. You could see my husband's hand print on the top of the coffee maker, the dust was so thick. Also, I don't think they ever moved any chairs to vacuum around them. The bed and bathroom were clean, and I guess that is the main thing! The pools were nice, however with a hotel of this size, they needed more pools. The location of this hotel was o.k. The outlet mall right next to the hotel is nice, but there is a much better one up the road. We visited downtown disney about 5 minute drive away. Fun for a couple of hours. Ate at the House of Blues, terribly disappointed. Even the waiter said that the food looked bad when we addressed it. Did have some good food though at other area places. So overall, decent hotel. Need to keep rooms cleaner and have a more attentive front desk/conceriege staff. We encountered the same problems at the conceriege desk as we did the front desk. Plenty of employees, but only one person helping customers. The line was pretty long and we gave up. **Very important if you stay at this hotel, make sure you get a room on a low floor, so you can avoid the elevator*** One more thing, be prepared that this is family hotel. Many screaming kids and the walls are thin. The family next to us, had 2 kids that screamed until about 11pm every night that we were there. Just know that there are a lot kids at this property, it is not a quiet and serene type of place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation at the HGVC!”
Reviews.Author: redward
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful one week stay at the HGVC on International Drive. Booked a two bedroom suite, which is actually two rooms -- a one bedroom plus a studio. We arrived for check-in just before 4:00 pm and were advised that our room was not ready as the hotel was unexpectedly filled to capacity, and the staff were trying to get the rooms ready ASAP. Having been on the move since 3:00 am that morning (had an early flight out of Toronto) and travelling with two young boys, we waited in the lobby until the first available room was ready. The first room we were directed to was in the building furtherest away from the main pool, on the opposite side of the small lake. The room had a view of the parking garage for the Outlet Mall next door. I called and advised that as I had booked and paid for the accomodations in full back in July, I expected to have a much nicer view than a parking garage. In less than 30 minutes, we received a call from the staff and were moved to a new room (with a much, much better view) in Building 4. The room(s) themselves were spotless and quite spacious for the four of us. The balcony with seating for four was also a nice touch (but the mornings were a little bit cool in November.) We took advantage of the full kitchen and the fact that a Publix grocery store was just a short drive away to enjoy a number of meals in our apartment. Also, the grounds were a pleasure to stroll around and the main pool was a lot of fun. The resort is pretty close to the major attractions (Sea World, Disney, Universal) and we personally did not experience any difficulty with the parking situation (however, we were always back before 10:00 pm each night.) We would definately return again.....someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but had a few problems”
Reviews.Author: ESQTeam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGVC International Drive from May 3-7, 2008 for 4 nights in a one bedroom. We are HGVC members so made the reservation using our points. This was our third trip to Orlando but second at a HGVC property. We stayed at the Sea World in 2004. I received a call the day before and was allowed to make some requests for rooms. Reading trip advisor I was told to avoid Building 1 (noise from pool) and Buildings 6 and 7 (because of Outlet construction). I was recommended Buildings 3 or 4. Traveling to the resort was a little difficult. We had a Garmin GPS that we brought from home and could not find the location. The Outback that people rave about also was not to be found. We tried the Premium Outlets but that took us on a wild loop. I would recommend using the Publix Market or McDonalds as the destination point. Upon arriving at the hotel around 10pm, we were told our requests were not available. The person at check in wasn't even aware of the construction noise. We ended up choosing Building 6. BTW, the walkway to the outlet are closed due to the construction so you gotta drive. The resort map does not show this nor did the check in person tell us this. For a studio, I can understand why there have been compaints about the construction. They started at like 6am EST with the jackhammers and the pounding. Thankfully, we had a one bedroom and there were two or three closed doors before the bedroom, but the noise was obvious. The HGVC- International Drive had all the amenities one would expect from an HGVC (full kitchen with frig and dishwasher, washer and dryer, jacuzzi bath, great cable tv channels, and free wi fi for internet). The internet was a little slow connecting almost every day but worked when connected. The screened in patio was similar to the Sea World HGVC. The deli shop could use some improvement. There were no magnets, no decent postcards, no HGVC logo attire. The lack of parking after 10pm is evident. NOTE: The 3rd HGVC in Orlando opening in 2009 is suppossed to have three floors of parking below each building. Overall, the ambience of the lake and swimming pools were impressive. Sort of makes you not want to leave the resort, but alas Disneyworld beckoned. The only other complaint I had was the wake up call. Every morning at 8:20am there would be a wake up call. I called the 2nd day and they showed no record of any wake up call. But it happened again the next day. Because we have a 2 year old we unplugged the phones, but before we left there was another wake up call. Quick Tips: Each building has a room with carts to carry luggage to and from the room. I believe it was located on the 1st floor. Also, the HGVC has a computer for free printing of boarding passes. Make sure to ask the lobby about the location of the computer. I would definitely stay again. Also, don't forget to get the free 5x7 picture. Appointments are only from Tuesday to Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton -- Always the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Creekinwa
Reviews.Content: Hilton can always be counted on to have beautiful furnishings and to provide a perfectly clean and comfortable unit. We stayed in a one-bedroom unit -- everything perfect -- well maintained and stocked. View of the lake from the screen patio and large jetted tub in the master bath. Kitchen, living and dining rooms were spacious and clean. Beds are "Heavenly" as are all beds in all Hiltons. I would definitely come back to this hotel and would stay as long as I possibly could!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gingerwife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights, and had a fantastic break. The hotel is set around large lake with lovely views and a huge pool area. Everything is new, clean and the staff are very helpful and friendly. Our "suite" room had a balcony overlooking the lake, a huge whirlpool bath, very comfortable bed and handy kitchen. Flat-screen TVs in both the bedroom and sitting area, plus free Internet access. The hotel's attention to detail is great - the pool-side hot tubs were properly hot, and you could help yourself to free, clean pool towels whenever you wanted to without the stupid "sign in/sign out" process some hotels seem to go in for. The food in the pool bar area was also excellent with a good choice of dishes. Location near to the theme parks is very convenient, and as we had a hire car, it was very easy to get around. There are also a couple of restaurants in walking distance - our favourite was the Outback Steakhouse over the road. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!!”
Reviews.Author: unc_pharmd2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 4 nights in April. He was here for a convention & I came along to relax. We booked the hotel directly through the Hilton resort website & got a great deal by agreeing to sit through a timeshare presentation. We also got 2 tickets to Universal. Check-in was very easy. We arrived a few minutes after 4pm. Our room was not ready, but they found another room that was available immediately. We were in Building 3 facing the lake. Our studio room was very clean and spacious. There was a mini kitchen with sink, refrigerator, & microwave. The king size bed was very comfortable. We really enjoyed the screened-in patio. Parking was never really an issue with us. The grounds were beautiful, very lush & green. The pool was amazing! The water was heated and there are tons of lounge chairs and tables. They even provide towels at the pool for you. We ate at the bar/restaurant by the pool one night & found the prices to be very reasonable (on the other hand, drinks were quite expensive -- though we did have a blender in the room and could have made our own!). There is also a deli and a Pizza Hut. The only negative I experienced was with the Pizza Hut. They were supposed to open at 12 noon on Thursday but didn't open until 4pm because someone didn't show up to work. When I called at 4 to order a pizza, the guy said it would be at least 1 and 1/2 hours before it would be ready. So we just ate somewhere else. The hotel is very convenient to the convention center, Sea World, Disney, and Universal. There is construction going on at the outlet mall next door, but it never bothered us (except for the gate being closed). The hotel staff has activities scheduled throughout the day, mostly for children. The timeshare presentation wasn't bad at all. It was kind of interesting to find out how it works. They were maybe a little pushy, but my husband kept asking questions so I guess they thought we were really interested! We had an awesome stay here and will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “HGW is an excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: Rugby09
Reviews.Content: We did a huge amount of research before choosing the Hilton Grand Vacations and were not disappointed. The 1 bedroom suite was very spacious for us and our 2 children (7 & 12) as well as being clean and well equipped - full sized kitchen, washer dryer and 2 TVs. Location was excellent, not more than 10-20 minutes from any of the main parks, close to a Publix and outlet mall but just far enough away from I4 to provide a haven after a long day at the parks. All staff were friendly and helpful. Found no problems with parking - worst day was arriving home after midnight and parked away from Building 3 but still only 2 minutes walk from the end carpark. Superb place - can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The best place i've ever been”
Reviews.Author: mrmojorisin0
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed for two weeks in this property with our two year old daughter in september 07 and we loved it, So much so when we came home we booked again for aug 08 as soon as we came home to Scotland, The rooms were exellent, plenty of room with full kitchen and jaquzzi bath. There was nothing else we could have asked for it was indeed home for home, The grounds itself were great with gas bbq's situated between the building's and a pleasent walk around the lake. I didnt hire a car as i was weary of driving and it was still possible to get around easily without it as there is a trolly stop outside the hotel, and a publix 'mcdonalds and the mall within walking distance. This was our first time in the states and would love to visit more as it was all i expected

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: SMcBaker
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here this past week. What a wonderful resort. We checked in early, at 2 pm, although check in was not until 4....I was prepared to wait but was given a room without any problem. We were in building 3 and had a corner one bedroom unit. The corner floor plan is a little different than the interior ones, from what I can tell by looking at the photos and also a floor plan that I found on a website. Walk in the front door and the bedroom is behind and to the side of the hall with access to the bathroom from the hall and from the bedroom....closet in the hall, then at the other end of the hall was the dining area and the living room, with the kitchen beyond and to the side of that. Sliding glass doors from the living room to the screened in patio. The bedroom was very comfortable and the bath was luxurious. This unit, again I'm thinking because it was a corner unit, did not have the jaccuzzi in the bedroom as the photos show....we had a double sink marble top vanity, a very large glass door shower, toilet and jaccuzzi all in one room. The kitchen was better equipped than my home kitchen and had a stacking washer and dryer behind the cabinet doors. The living room was comfortable with a nice TV with a Bose surround-sound system. We enjoyed coffee on the patio the morning we left. (coffee was much better when made with bottled water as opposed to the tap water!!) Everything was perfectly clean, I did not see anything out of place! The grounds were kept immaculate. The little deli by the main pool was good and not too expensive. The pools were beautiful and everyone, but everyone, that we encountered was friendly and helpful....from the front desk staff to the maintenance workers in their golf carts to the security guy who let my boyfriend try out his Segway. Everyone said "Hello", "Good Morning", etc. As expected, we got the call about the time share within 2 hours of check in....they just advised us that the presentation was at noon the next day...that's the last we heard of it. Housekeeping was a little slow...we left early the next morning and didn't return until 2....they had not been there....but they knocked at the door at 3 pm. We only needed some towels so it wasn't really an issue. We walked to the outlets although we had to get there via the front entrance as the construction has closed the direct walkway. As others have said, there is a Publix and a Walgreens just across the way. As much construction as there is in the area, we didn't once get disturbed by it. And although the parking lot tended to stay full, we didn't hear anyone around us....in fact, I wondered where all the people to whom the cars belonged were the whole time we were there! I found this resort to be both beautiful and relaxing. Everything was clean and convenient. A vacation in the area would be made less expensive by the option to cook breakfast or dinner rather than eat out.....the set up makes it easy! I would stay here again in a heartbeat and would recommend it to anyone....I was VERY pleased!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DJNyc
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year old and I had a nice home away from home experience here. We've always stayed at a deluxe Disney resort but wanted more room this time. How nice to be able to spread out. We stayed in a one bedroom overlooking the lake. Though we missed the wonderfully themed disney resorts, the full kitchen, washer/dryer and enormous jacuzzi tub at the hilton was wonderful. The pools were spectacular. Everything was very clean and the staff was friendly. We received one time-share call but refused and were never solicited again. Our 3 year old enjoyed the walking path around the lake and the covered playground. It was nice to have the supermarket within walking distance to stock up the fridge. My favorite part of the resort was our balcony overlooking the lake. It's large and screened and romantic to sit out there in the evening. My three year old loved the jacuzzi tub the best, which was big enough to be his own private swimming pool. My husband loved having a livingroom to relax in. The pull out couch was like sleeping on a bunch of broken springs but the king bed in the master bedroom was very comfortable. I loved the DVD player in the living-room. I brought the little one's favorite movies, which we watched while we ate in the dining area which is very nice. The bathroom has a walk-in shower and double sink. It's quite large. You can enter the bathroom from the kitchen hall and through the bedroom. There were also two big closets and plenty of drawer space. We had one very delicious lunch by the pool. It was too expensive to eat there again ($50 for a meal that should've cost no more than $30). It took us only a few minutes to drive to the Disney parks. We would leave the park on Vineyard, get on I-4 and we really had to pay attention because the exit to the parks would come up so fast. Leaving the parks we'd stop at cross roads for dinner (the mall with Goodings, Perkins, TGIF, tacobell, Pebbles and many other great places to eat including a chinese restaurant and an indian restaurant). This was also only a couple minutes from the hotel. There was construction going on but noise was not a problem. The premium outlet mall was next door with more restaurants. There is also a pizza hut magnet on the fridge for a quick pizza delivery for a night no one feels like going out. All in all, this was a very nice resort but I still missed the themed disney resorts so I am not sure I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very clean”
Reviews.Author: MonctonAcadien
Reviews.Content: We just return one week ago from HGVC! The resort is very clean..our room was the studio room.There is two pools at this resort,one of them was one of the most amazing pool I ever seen,there was some waterfalls(main pool).At the pool area there is a bar and two hot tubs. The room was very clean. The room had one king beb,kichennette and a balcony. The grounds at the resord were very nice. One night we order pizza hut at the resort il was very good and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: moniqueboo
Reviews.Content: We were invitied to stay at the vacation club in exchange for attending a two hour preview. This place was absolutely wonderful. It's very close to Sea World and right next door to Premium Outlets. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The outdoor heated pools and jacuzzis were great. We were in the pool at 8pm in February! I would highly recommend this location for a couple or a family. I can't wait to stay in another Hilton Grand Vacations Club.

Reviews.Title: “I will tresure the memory for years to come”
Reviews.Author: VivianAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I was contacted by Hilton marketing group that offered me this time-share 3 nights preview at GHVC for a reasonable fee. I have to say the whole staying was worth it even we had to sit through 2 hrs of sales pitch. My fiance and I were very skeptical about the sales pitch and were expecting aggressive sales tactic. However, the sales were trying hard to sale us the pkg, they weren't rude in any way. The pkg prices from $33,000s, it was just way too much for our budget. We decided we'll buy time-share when we are more financial stable because the resort was extremely luxury. It exceeded any 4-star hotels by far. They have amazing quality, lovely lake & pools. Did I mention Premium outlet is right next to the resort. The con was parking at night. They have way too little parking space for each building. We had to park on the other side of the resort, if it weren't for the severe thunderstorm, we wouldn't have problem walking, instead we had waited 30min for shuttle to transport us to our building. No free wi-fi. You can drive to close by Panera for free wi-fi. It was overall a very good trip for us. Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Squashblossom79
Reviews.Content: Loved this place!! Spent a night here at the end of our honeymoon and what a fun place! We actually had just gotten off a cruise and decided we didn't want to come home yet so we thought we would see Sea World, which is only a short drive from this property. Looked for a hotel on our GPS system and found this little gem. The price was GREAT for the room that we got. We had a jacuzzi tub and full living quarters, even right down to the laundry services in the room and the dining room table and dishes and appliances in the room. Really it was a little much for us, since we were only planning a one night stay but if you are looking at staying a week or so, what a deal!!! Not a bad thing to say about the Hilton Grand Vacations Club!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bryan5150
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed 3 nights at the HGVC in February 2008 and had a very nice time. The overall hotel service from check-in to check-out is excellent. We had a studio king room in building 2 and found it to be very nice. Additionally, the laundry room was adjacent to our room and was free! The best thing about this hotel has to be the pools, of which there are two. The larger main pool is huge and has water falls; however, was quite cold. The smaller zero entry pool was much warmer and fun for the whole family. The few negatives about this hotel - we booked our room 2 months out and could not ever get a larger room than a studio? The hotel offers 1 - 3 bedroom rooms and the studios. I'm a hilton honors gold and couldn't get upgraded upon checking in as the hotel was full. The other negative was the sales call from the time share guy. I'm on vacation, I will come to you if I want to inquire about your time share? We were supposed to stay the week but checked out to stay at the Ritz Carlton for the remaining week, which was excellent and the pools (including use of JW Marriott) were out of this world!! The HGVC is very nice and won't break the bank, but it's not the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “you have to stay at hgvc!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrae
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the HGVC? Actually quite a lot!! The hotel...I mean resort is amazing. There are about 7 buildings filled with apartments to stay in and at the time we were there in November 2007 there were constructing more buildings. ALthough we were never disturbed by it even though our building was right next door to the construction. The presentation of the whole resort was pristine, very lush gardens and a beautiful lake around which all of the buildings are situated. The complex is quite huge and we were around the furthest from the front lobby. So if you are in a hurry you can call the front desk and they will send a bellhop with a golf buggy to collect you!! Our room was a king apartment! The kitchen was fully stocked ready to cook in and with the Outlet stores just across the road and supermarket on the other side you can save some money having breakfast and dinner in the apartment. There was a great lounge room, really comfy lounges that lead to a small balcony with great netting to keep out the bugs. The bathroom was huge, 2 sinks which was great for getting ready in the morning with my boyfriend. The king bedroom had the comfiest bed I have ever slept in. There was a tv in the bedroom as well. This room also leads out onto the balcony so instead of the air conditioning we used the breeze throughout the night. Our room rate included breakfast but it is a selection of pastries and juices or coffee from the little deli store on the property. They have a grill next to the main bar where you can get meals throughout the day and also a Pizza Hut to order from. Also there is room service available from the grill. We spent time going to the theme parks but also made time to sit by the pool and have some drinks as we weren't expecting November to be such great weather in Orlando. They offer shuttle bus services to the theme parks and these can be prepaid for to make it easy in the mornings. The concierge was so helpful getting us tickets to the Cirque Du Soliel show at Downtown Disney and also organising taxis for us. All in all the HGVC was great value and we didn't want to leave after spending a week there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveleverywhere
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of a call we received from the resort because we are Hilton Honors members. We got a price of $99 for 3 nights total. The catch......we had to attend a "vacation ownership" tour. The presentation was not pushy at all and we were able to be done in 1 hour and 50 minutes. They gave us a 1 bedroom villa. It had a full kitchen, washer and dryer, king bed in it's own bedroom, pull out sofa sleeper in the living room, and a dining table with 4 chairs. The bathroom was huge and had a jacuzzi tub, a seperate shower, and two sinks. When we first got to the room, we check messages on the phone and found messages from past guests still on there. We erased them all. Just a tip, make sure you check the messages they leave daily. There are two pool areas. Both are very nice. There is a deli/sandwich/icecream shop and a poolside bar area that has a menu for cooked to order meals. One thing I thought was kind of crappy was the business center. Internet use is .10/ minute and printing is .75/ page. We decided that we wanted to stay an additional night, so we check availiblity on the internet (that we had to pay for). There were rooms available at a rate of 129.00/night. So.....we went to the front desk to book another night and were told that no rooms were available. When we confronted them about what we found on the website, they said their computer system was down at the moment and they would check for us later. Well, we went back and they all of a sudden had several rooms available. However we were quoted 189.00 and 200.00/ night. We decided that we no longer wanted to stay after being lied to. My guess is that they want fresh visitors in their facility to get them to attend the timeshare presentation. I wonder what they would have done if I just booked it online at the cheaper price. I asked if they had a book of other Hilton locations and we were sent to the "tour center area", because they have a giant book of all Hilton locations with numbers and addresses. Well, when we walked over there to ask to see the book, they had no idea about a book and asked who sent us over there. What a crock!! I hardly believe that they don't have a guide to their other locations. I loved the way we treated before our "tour", but after.....not so good. It's almost as if we had signs over our head the told the employess we didn't buy a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but needs better customer service”
Reviews.Author: Somavita
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place, pretty good for the money. Needs to brush up on some simple service issues. Slow response/poor excuses when calling front desk for items. When rooms are cleaned, things are always overlooked, such as trash being emptied and coffee being replenished. (EVERY DAY!) Also, very little information in room about local restaurants, services, directions etc. Only food on site appeared to be a Pizza Hut which was very odd. Often had nowhere near room to park and had to be shuttled. Looks like there was a garage nearby but maybe it didn't belong to hotel? Also the hotel is NOT on Arezzo Drive. What a HEADACHE this caused! It is on VINELAND. Please make sure you get proper directions, folks!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort!”
Reviews.Author: tp-mich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton with some friends. This resort is beautiful with really nice landscaping and fountains throughout. The hotel surrounds a pretty big lake and has two large pools. We spent most of the day at the huge pool. The water was a little too cold for the time of year, but there is a nice bar that serves drinks and food. The rooms are very clean with lots of features. There is a nice balcony with a screen to keep the bugs out. The location is very good as well. There is Publix, Walgreens, Subway, and Outback Steakhouse all within walking distance. Also, the resort is right next to a great outlet mall with tons of stores and it is within only a few miles of Disney World and Epcot. Overall, I would recommend this resort to anyone looking for a relaxing vacation and wants a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: labern116
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 1/25-28. This was a beautiful room and the grounds were amazing. Unfortunately, the weather was a little chilly for enjoying the pool but it was perfect for walking around the parks. We stayed here as part of the time share presentation which was for 3 nights for $115 and $100 dining certificate. The two hour time share was informative but seemed a little pricey after I learned the mechanics behind it. They are not pushy and it was a pleasant experience. Unlike the other reviews, our room was very quiet. We had a one BR suite and the bathroom was huge. Everything was very clean. The front desk was very friendly. Our room was ready about 2pm. There is a free computer to use for checking your airline flights. Outback Steakhouse is across the street. Other restaurants are very close by. The outlets are 2 minutes away. The parks are within a 15 min. drive. We rented an Alamo car at the airport for about $55. The whole trip was very cheap and the Hilton made it magical.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY but many amenities”
Reviews.Author: LionsTigersandBears
Reviews.Content: I was put in Building 1 (Villa Bianca) in a viewless room (overlooking the clubhouse side entrance). The noise from the pool and around the clubhouse at night was terrible. If they stopped at 9 or 10pm it would be OK, but the noise goes on till at least midnight and can be EXTEMELY loud if they are showing an outdoor movie at the pool. You can get by if you shut the patio door and keep your AC fan on. (Sort of like being in a room in a motel next to a busy interstate). They also play annoying music from speakers around the clubhouse most of the time. I would suggest avoiding Building 4 (Villa di Teodoro) and Building 5 (Villa di Ducale) also, as these are near the shopping center parking lot and the second pool/refreshment area, though it may not be as noisy--I have no direct knowledge. On the positive side, you will find the grounds nice with a walkway around their small lake, organized activities for the children, rooms with refrigerators & microwaves, and washers and dryers available. The little onsite deli has decent sandwiches, though the free breakfast muffin I got when I complained about the noise was noting special. The property is well maintained and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious accomodations close to Seaworld but a little far from Disney”
Reviews.Author: victorkomd
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a timeshare promotion the Hilton Grand Vacations Timeshare Club offered when they called me at home after I stayed at Hilton Homewood Suites recently. It was $180 total (~$50/ night) for 4 nights for a 1 bedroom suite. This is probably the nicest suite we have ever stayed in as a family (wife and a 2 and 4 year old). They are about to finish construction on the last building in the complex and should be open by June 2008. Our building was next to the Premium Outlet construction site and we heard noise starting at 7am each day. The pools were a bit chilly when we were visiting but the 2 of them are heated. One has a zero entry pool. There is a gym, activity room (computers with internet access, TV, pool table), quiet room, and a daily activity schedule. We had to sit through a 2 hour timeshare presentation which was painful and basically, you can buy the same timeshare through timeshare brokers for 50% the price. Of course they don't tell you this, but once we exited the timeshare presentation, we were not bothered anymore. There is a nice supermarket across the street which sells single serve items and premade meals. The room had a full kitchen (microwave, 4 burner stove, oven, dishwasher) and washer/dryer. There was a jacuzzi tub which required a lot of water to fill up. There are many food options up International Drive if you don't want to cook. There is also a covered playground area for toddlers. This is a great option if you decide to goto Seaworld, but I think you can find similar options which are closer to Disney World if that is your focus.

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned ...Construction with some strone faced customer service !”
Reviews.Author: WilliamsKorea
Reviews.Content: *FIRST THINGS FIRST - A SITE WARNING* Please be aware that the access to the Premium Outlets shopping centre which lies adjacent to the property is closed due to large construction works in that area. This construction site faces the back of buildings 5, 6 and 7 which you will hear and see if you stay there. It is a large construction site which starts on the right hand side of the main entrance and stretches down the length of the resort. Tell the resort that you know about the construction and that you want to be away from it, so try to stay on the opposite side of the lake where it will quieter. There is however construction work on the lake itself as there is a bridge under construction across it, although this was relatively minor in comparison and not as noisy. We were going to stay in the 'Floridays' Resort but decided not to because of construction in the area.....we were rather suprised to face the same issue when we arrived at the HGV Resort. Still with us...........still interested..........? We had arrived by taxi from the Disney Cruise terminal in Port Canveral with the fare showing $220 on the meter, but as the driver could not find the resort (she was not the only taxi driver who had trouble locating it, so if you do stay here, take some directions for the taxi driver) she accepted the only offer I was going to make of $150. There a number of HGV'S around the area and so the taxi may indeed take you to the wrong one...it happened to us twice. We arrived in HGV after two weeks of Disney (Resort + Cruise) so where a bit Disney weary at this stage and were looking for a quiet resort where we could relax by the pool and chill out, whilst slotting in Universal, Sea World, Cape Canaveral and some shopping in what would we planned to be an unhurried week sipping Pina Coladas. Arrival was smooth, with some valued assistance from the courteous and welcoming doorman who broughts our bags inside and stored them whilst we made our prescence known at reception. We had arrived some 6 hours before normal check in time, and so lazed by the pool for most of the day with the kids having a great time in the fenced off pool area and hot tubs. After 4pm we went back to reception to formally check in and get our room key and were taken to building 5. On the golf cart trip to the buliding, one look at the construction site (big enough to build a football field !) filled us with some trepidation. The room itself was great and for $165 per night...unbelievable value (see all the candid pictures). The location however was awful. Our balcony directly faced the multi storey car park for the Premium Outlets shopping mall, as well as the builidng car park. It was perhaps the worst room location on the resort. This was not acceptable, and we had to move and so we called reception to which the stern response was a 'not possible' until tomorrow. At this stage, we were looking at the yellow pages for an alternative hotel. Meantime, Brad, the bell boy who had escorted us to the room, went to get us some drinks and to see if he could assist us. He came back with an alternative room, and we went to see it, which was on the ground floor of building 2 facing the lake and closer to the man amenities. Much better ! Brad made us feel welcome and went out his way to help us (Thanks Brad !). Little did we know that this would be the most positive and helpful interaction with hotel staff we would experience in the next 7 days. Whilst unpacking, the front door opened and another family started to enter, who had onbviously checked in at about the time we had moved rooms and been given keys to the room. The next thing we know, the phone rings with reception asking us who we are and what we are doing there in a very accusational tone. Time for the yellow pages again....... We left it some time before we actually unpacked and made up the double sofa bed. We had to bother housekeepoing to bring correct bedding ( and it felt like we were bothering them such was the huffy response when we asked for bedding to sleep under), but aprt from that we had a quiet first night...pizza....from the onsite Pizza Hut Express. It was too late for anything else. ROOM ? - The room was very nicely fitted (a bit smelly...ground floor...damp ?) with comfortable beds, two TV's, kitchen, washing machine, dryer, dishwasher etc. Could not fault the room/suite. LOCATION ? - On the resort itself see my initial comments if you are staying for any length of time. The resort location is at the bottom end of International Drive and 'walking across the road' distance to an excellent supermarket (Publix) and Premium Outlets shopping mall. Disney Downtown is not too far by cab. There is a lot of construction on other resorts in this undeveloped part of ID but apart from looking unsightly when passing, does not affect you. It is not surrounded by eateries that you can walk to. HOW DO I GET AROUND ? - Hotel shuttle bus to Universal,Disney and Sea World. These are to a fixed timetable which ultimately did not suit us. Taxis. I-Trolley bus whic goes up and down International Drive, although we did not use it. DO YOU NEED A CAR ? - In the end we hired a car so we could have the flexibility to come and go at the amusement parks at times we (the kids) wanted, as well as try some different food spots around the area, and to prevent what could be a $60/day taxi habit to and from various places and restaurants. The GPS we paid for with the car was great and recommended. THE RESORT ? - Room - Great Pool - Nice...I would expect some sun lounger reserving goes on in busier and on warmer days. There were some serious sun worshippers you do not want to steal their lounger from. Eating - No restaurant but good casual food from the open air bar menu. The Deli had some basic provisions as well as good coffee and a nice atmosphere. Getting about - Some accommodation buildings are far away from the main amenity blocks, and with the construction on the go preventing you being able to walk all around the resort, it may take you some time to walk there for your Starbucks coffee and muffing in the moring from the Deli which was great. Not great if your not too mobile and hate walking. Kid's Activities - There is an advertised program, but at this time of year, not very well attended or lively (no kids !!) and of no comparison to what Disney were offering on the cruise, so we did not really use this. Customer service - Left a lot to be desired and was our biggest headache on a daily basis, with some rather questionable, unfriendly, unwelcoming at times, exchanges with reception staff. As one other reviewer has stated.....an apology here and there goes a long way when a guest is inconvenineced or has a legitimate gripe. One example being that the resort had us checking out 2 days before we were actually due to check out (the bill hanging on the door with the daily paper being a subtle reminder), requiring a visit to reception to sort this out before I could even shower and have a coffee. On another occassion, they seemed to have lost my credit card details and so they had sent a very stern letter under the door saying that my room key would be deactivated unless I immediately went to reception to corrected this matter. Another trip to reception first thing in the morning. There are ways and means of dealing with problems and perhaps this resort needs to go back to basics on this. This resort perhaps does not know if it is a hotel or a collection of high rise condo buildings, that happens to provide a few basic amenities just to keep you sweet for all that money you have put into your timeshare. The symptom of this identity crisis could well be the complacent/unwelcoming type of customer service experienced by those who have the audacity to pay a nightly rate for our suites. We would not stay here again in the foreseeable future due to the construction work, which does impact on the resort, and the poor customer service experience we had. Lots of other resorts in this area of International Drive have construction around them so be careful....the web sites may or may not tell you about this. Overall we had a great time in Orlando and Florida. The weather did us no favours during our stay, so trips to Florida Mall, after having done all the parks that we could manage, in our now essential hired car were a welcome break. If you do go to Florida Mall for a major shopping spree, you have to eat in the Nordstrom department store Bistro. The food is out of this Orlando world. Real food !!! Another good eatery was Taverna Ola, a Greek restaurant further up at International Drive. Alternativey, there's always Denny's or enough steakhouses/fast food joints to keep you energised.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend at the Hilton on International Drive!”
Reviews.Author: chancetravel44
Reviews.Content: I just got back from running the Disney marathon in Orlando and my boyfriend and I stayed at the Hilton on International Drive and make a weekend out of it. I'll start at the beginning! -Check in was fast and easy and everyone was ridiculously friendly. Maybe I'm just used to the nyc attitude but I found the staff to be smiley and cheerful our entire stay. -I had requested a Lake View room after reading other reviews of the hotel and we were not dissapointed. We stayed in Building 4 I believe and our room was AWESOME. I kind of expected this from looking at candid traveler pictures but nonetheless we were still pretty smitten by our huge kitchen, dining area, living room (with a big tv and dvd player), huge bedroom, extremely comfortable king sized bed and whirlpool tub (ginormous) leading into a full sized bathroom with shower. Seriously people, for less than $200/night?! Incredible. Once again, this is coming from someone who is used to nyc - paying ridiculous prices to stay in a box. -The property itself is gorgeous and extremely clean and well maintained. I saw people cleaning and doing landscaping almost every second of the day. The pool was great but we honestly didn't get to spend as much time as we'd have liked as we were only there for the weekend. Be aware that it's about a 15 minute drive to the Disney Parks which we actually appreciated as we liked coming "home" to a more secluded area. We looked forward to visiting the Disney Parks but we also looked forward, maybe just as much, to coming back to the resort and relaxing. Tips: -Definitely rent a car unless you plan to stay exclusively on the property grounds. We rented from Simply-Wheelz by Hertz and it was incredibly inexpensive and easy. -The property is pretty massive so you might be a 5-7 minute walk from the main lobby/pool area, however there is another pool near the buildings farther from the main lobby. -The "continental breakfast" (this was included in a package deal we got) is really only a muffin and cup of coffee from the little shop on the property. It was nice to have a free cup of coffee in the morning and a snack but not really what I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: GlobalK
Reviews.Content: We (husband, toddler son, and self) were in Orlando last weekend for a conference my husband attended. The rooms here were great - king size bed, sitting area, nice size screened in patio plus a mini-kitchen with fridge and microwave. The pool area is great for children, with fountains and a run through sprinkler area. At night they had karoake at the bar pool - which was hilarious and the margaritas were yummy too. And the staff was really helpful - I had dropped my husband off at the convention center and then went to check in. The resort is really spread out so once you check in you have to drive to your building so there was no bellman to help me. But a security guard named Hector saw me trying to unload my luggage and get my son in his stroller and he finished unloading the car and helped me up to the room. You are not on the main drag area of international drive at this hotel but that is kind of nice. It is at the south end, down by sea world. You can walk to Publix across the street to stock up your fridge with snacks and drinks if you want. There is also an Outback Steakhouse across the street. We went to Carabba's one night - which is less than a mile away and it was really good and because it's not on the main drag the wait time was really short. The Premium Outlet mall is also right next door! And Downtown Disney is only about 5 minutes away too. I would highly recommend this hotel for the rooms, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy doors!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian60
Reviews.Content: This place has those doors that close with a loud ka-CHUNK everytime someone leaves or enters their rooms. We had the misfortune of having a room that was directly across from a stairwell, with people (including hotel employees) slamming the door all night. We had asked earlier if we could switch rooms and were told none would be avaible for 4 or 5 hours. It's impossible to not hear the banging from inside your room, and we had to run the bathroom fan all night to try to mask the racket with some white noise. Also, at check-in we were given a key to a room that was occupied. After we walked into someone else's room (!), we returned to the front desk and got it straightened out, but were offered no apology. They need to realize that 'I'm sorry' goes a long way to making customers feel appreciated and satisfied. The place is fine overall, but the noise problem needs to be addressed before I'd consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: crsampieri
Reviews.Content: There's really anything I'd change of the property, excellent manteinance, excellent service...you get newspaper daily, Starbucks coffee packs (regular and decaf) for your coffee maker, very nice amenities (shampoo, cream, mouthwash, conditioner from Crabtree and Evelyn), and every one who works there is willing to take care and help you with anything you need. The restaurant is a little expensive compared to fast food, but it's worth it, my favourite was the buffalo chicken salad, the chicken alfredo pasta is also very good. When the outlet (really door to door with the hgvc) is full of people standing by to get a table in the food court, you can walk a little distance and grab a very nice lunch/dinner (the outlet closes at 11 pm) relaxing by the pool, leave your baggs in your studio/villa and go back shopping... Disney and Sea World at no more than 15 minutes drive..and as a side comment, I've read a lot of complaints about lack of parking space, believe me that the place was at 100% (I went from Dec 23 to Dec 30) and I never suffered to get a place in front of my building.

Reviews.Title: ““OK resort, poor customer service””
Reviews.Author: Chukcha
Reviews.Content: The resort is OK, the room where we stayed was clean, with well-equipped kitchen, washing and drying machine. The sofa in the living room and the mattress where somewhat uncomfortable, so I looked forward to go back home, because I could not sleep well on their mattress :) The pool and children play area were nice. I would agree with one of other review: "Disappointing aspect was terrible customer service. Without going into all the boring details, the staff repeatedly said all the things they'd been trained to say (empathizing with customer etc ...) but repeatedly failed to deliver the actions we'd agreed. " The service was terrible, I had an impression, that they just do not care. If you are staying in the building not near the WaterFall pull, you have to take a little walk (depending on where your building is located) we stayed at Smith building and it took us 5 minutes walk to get to the main lobby. They do have a golf carts picking up people, but you have to call to the hotel front desk and even so they tell you the guy is on its way, usually you wait for them minimum 10 minutes, so might as well just walk to the main lobby. It is not a problem to get to the building from the main lobby there was always somebody available to pick us up. Perhaps they have only one guy riding and picking up people. The shuttle service to attractions is limited and I think that the drivers do not care so as the hotel employees, the drivers were late all the time at the first point of destination . Usually when you take the shuttle the bus driver is giving you a little tour of the city (from my experience staying at other Orlando hotels), nothing like that here, but the huge sign on the front window "re tips" is there :) I would not recommend use the taxi service from the hotel, I got impression that they use some transportation for hire, which is more expensive that local taxi service. For example, the driver gave us the rate to Arabian Nights show one way as $45 v local taxi service $17.00. The deli shop was terrible, and very small for such a big resort. Go to the grocery store and fill out your fridge because the food quality and selection at the deli shop is very poor. If you forgot a swimming suite you will not be able to buy it in the hotel, there is no gift shop, but the deli shop sells some t-shirts. There is no food room service, you can order pizza only, but at the extension numbers provided nobody answers the phone (I guess they are too busy) Not a big deal, we ordered pizza online, this is only the one good thing that they provide wireless connection at the hotel free, you just need to have your laptop with you. There is only one restaurant, the breakfast buffet at the restaurant was ok, the dinner I did not like. I will not come back again to this place and would not recommend it to my friends. It did not worse the money we paid for it. I would rate this hotel as 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “time at orlando”
Reviews.Author: jackollidave
Reviews.Content: the time at the hilton was a good time and was very fun but you could not stay at the hotel all of the time. we had a villa and it was very spacus for all four of us. there was me my mum, dad, sister. when i first went i was about 10 years old and was in need of lots of things to do lukkly thair was a games room a quiet room, in the games room thair was pool, chess, a t.v. in the quiet room thairs a scramble, wi-fi, and a chess.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Place I've Ever Stayed”
Reviews.Author: ABak888
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed through RCI exchange in a two bedroom lock-out unit. We didn't know it was a lockout unit until we got there, and were pleasantly surprised. The unit was huge and gorgeous. We arrived before check-in time, and they were able to accommodate us right away. Through RCI, we have stayed at many nice resorts, and it takes a lot to impress us. Hilton did just that. The cleanliness of the room and grounds was beyond anything we had ever experienced. Of course the grounds and recreation areas were gorgeous. I was even impressed by the poolside furnishing. The furniture was obviously very expensive, and there were so many chairs there was never a shortage. We noticed that if anything was out of place or a lightbulb burned out in a public area, it was fixed before we passed that way again. There were two very large pool areas, which were so nice, we stayed at the resort much more time than we had planned. There was a playground, which our daughter enjoyed. They even had it covered so the playground equipment didn't get too hot in the summer heat. The resort is located conveniently across from the outlet mall, and there was a grocery store and Walgreens across the street. There is a Pizza Hut on grounds, and a nice (though overpriced) deli. I could go on and on about this resort and could never fully expressed how happy we were with our stay. Next time we are in the Orlando area, we will definitely try to come here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: blazergirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton on our trip to Orlando. The resort is absolutely beautiful! We had a wonderful check-in experience and a perfect stay. The room was spotless! We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite - kitchen with full size appliances, a living and dining area with TV, a king size bedroom with TV, whirlpool tub and a good sized bathroom with a fully tiled shower. The resort is just a few minutes from Sea World and about 10-15 minutes from Disney. Their is a big outlet mall right next door. The resort has 2 pools and 2 workout rooms. There are lots of activities on site for adults and children. I would highly recommend the Hilton to anyone visiting Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireFisher
Reviews.Content: I was 19 at the time of my stay and loved it!! The staff were freindly and a laugh and it even has it's own starbucks and pizza hut which is always a winner I feel!! There is a shuttle stop right outside which takes you to sea world and all the way up international drive..which was a bonus for me and my mate when we wanted to do something independant of the parentals!! The rooms were comfy and well air conditioned which is need when you are in florida in august!!! It is also right next to the best supermarket in the world PUBLIX!. I highly reccomend a stay there!!! It's a shame I wont be able to afford ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Elmer&Lizette
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great resort at a good location and for a very reasonable price. Rooms are great, staff is very helpfull and the poolscene is good. The only complaint we had was about the housekeeping. The garbage was put in front of the room (in the corridor) were they left it almost a day. The bathroom was not cleaned properly.

Reviews.Title: “I will only stay here when I return to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: davierae
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property. We are owners with Hilton Grand Vacations and this is by far the best property we have stayed at yet! Check-in took less than five minutes. Parking was free. Our room was extremely clean. Every room has a screened balcony, which was great to eat dinner on. The full kitchen made making meals a breeze. The bathroom had a standing shower and a roman tub. There are two pools, both very clean, and a game room with two decent pool tables and a big screen TV. Disney World is less than five minutes away, just around the corner. There is a gate on property that opens directly to the Outlet Mall parking lot. The grocery store and Outback Steakhouse are directly across the street. This will be the only resort we stay in whenever we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Yes!”
Reviews.Author: Tap5931
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a two bedroom villa for a week. I was there on business and the comfort of this place made my stay. The villas are beautifully decorated with a jacuzzi in my bedroom. I had other family with me and they stayed on the other side of the villa with their own bedroom and bathroom. We were able to save money by beening able to cook and eat in our big and beautiful dining room. We were on the 7th floor and it over looked the lake. We were treated with fireworks everynight and was even able to nap on the screened in balcony with the cool and comfortable breeze that blew everynight. I really enjoyed and will be going back for a personal vacation. The location was great and safe. We stayed in the newest building and even though construction was going on in the next parking lot, we never knew it unless we walked out and looked! Even the price was reasonable and well worth it. Look no further!!

Reviews.Title: “Good resort let down by poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_needed_now
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort, with comfortable well-equipped bedrooms. The pool area was pleasant - would have been even better if the pool was heated as it was VERY cold in October. Dissappointing aspect was terrible customer service. Without going into all the boring details, the staff repeatedly said all the things they'd been trained to say (empathising with customer etc ...) but repeatedly failed to deliver the actions we'd agreed. It was very dissappointing to be treated this way. Even when I complained to more senior staff there was no apology. This was our first stay as timeshare owners here, and if I'd known what the service was like we'd never have bought here.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: krgl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for xmas 2006 for two weeks. I had a problem with a Polo Shirt going missing from my room(it was white and I think it was taken with the bed linen etc?). But when I told reception about this I felt as if I was at fault. I have e mailed HGV a number of times but with no luck. The way I was treated would put me off staying again. I have been back to Florida and stayed at FLORIDAYS and had a great time with no problems and the reception staff are great. My view is HILTON is a BIG name with POOR SERVICE. I will not be back

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: alexgoh
Reviews.Content: Location - beside the Premium Outlet, Publix Supermarket, Outback Steakhouse, Walgreen. Not in the busy international drive but close enuff with a car. Check In - we arrived at 12 midnight and the recep was all set to give us a room. Room - we got a king bed with spa room. fabulously decorate with high end equipments and all. Check Out - there was a system upgrade done 3 days before and my bill was broken into 2 filios. Perhaps the receps were new to the system, they were took a while to check me out. Net net, this is a very good property as base to have a wonderful holiday. I will recommend to anyone who visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home - Hot Pick!”
Reviews.Author: Pamcakes0111
Reviews.Content: For my fiance's birthday I surprised him with a trip to Orlando and booked the Hilton Grand Vacations Cluub on International Drive. Normally my family and I stay at their 'sister' property near Sea World but there was no availability - and I'm SO glad! This property is beautiful! From our check-in to our check-out, everything was smooth sailing. From maintenence workers, the Hilton Concierge and even maid service, I have never met such a friendly staff. We stayed in a 1-bedroom villa from Thursday to Monday and loved every minute of it! The room was comfortable and had all the amenities of home - from a washer and dryer, to a jaccuzzi, granite counter tops, 2 televisions with channels galore, a large dining room table, a screened patio overlooking the pool complete with dining table and ceiling fan and a beautiful bathroom. Everything was spotless, comfortable and absolutely perfect for a couple. (They even have an on-site Pizza Hut with delivery for late night cravings!) As for the food, I had preordered food to be catered to our room each morning as a surprise. Everything was delicious and my orders were prepared perfectly down to the very last detail. The catering staff is great especially with specialty orders (ie: low fat, sugar free, diet, whole wheat, etc.) Feel free to be picky - they do their best to accommodate! I also had a massage which was wonderful and relaxing, but a little pricey for what it was. If you're going to get a massage make sure you pay for an hour - the half hour isn't worth the money. As for the staff, the concierge was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They even offer airline check-in free of charge! Our only complaint was the front desk staff who were friendly, but needed a little work in the hospitality field. During our check-in the staff behind the desk was clearly arguing who would not have to check us in and they continued to have personal conversations while we were trying to check in (we were the only guests on line.) With plenty of activities such as game room, 2 fitness rooms (though not great for those looking to do more than a cardio routine), pools, hot tubs and more - this is a true family friendly place - we didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Like everyone says, GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: C0met
Reviews.Content: Booked thru RCI. We had a two bedroom place with 2 baths and full kitchen. Place was great. We had room 5112 and 5113 the smaller pool was right outside our door, so was a gas grill. The large pool was a little chilly, but the small one was great. Only complaint would be the walkways outside the rooms seem to make everything ouside your room louder. For you football fans Sunday Ticket is available for free at the large pool bar! Won't rehash what others already said, just book it. And no parking problems either.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: iknowjack
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. Had read several Tripadvisor reviews - those reporting negatives must have gotten confused because we enjoyed a GREAT STAY. Many reported terrible parking - we had no problems - even parked right outside our Devonshire location. The pools were great - lots of kids, but not overcrowded and all in all a great bunch of well behaved people. Our room was perfect - lots of space, a nice full kitchen, screened patio which opens into the master bedroom and served as a great hangout for our little one. Ground floor was fine - little to no noises - corner rooms are a bit bigger. Enjoy your stay - well thought out game plan here. Happy Sales~~~~~~_/)~~~~~~~_/)~~~~~~_/)~~~~Jack~~~~_/)~~~~~_/)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room for a short vacation”
Reviews.Author: funson
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 wanted to try a new property in Orlando. We read the TripAdvisor reviews and decided to try the Hilton Grand Vacations on International Drive. We received a great rate through Hilton by agreeing to attend a timeshare presentation. The rate was $550 which included tax for 5 nights in a 1 bedroom unit. The room was huge, clean, and nicely appointed. We liked the 7th floor lake view, but being on the top floor made it easier to hear the highway noise on I-4. If you're a light sleeper you might want to consider a lower floor. The staff at check-in was excellent and they were able to accomodate all requests which for some reason were not captured in the original reservation. We spent most of the time in the parks so we didn't use many of the resort amenities. While there are many activities for kids, there isn't much is the way of sand volleyball, tennis, playgrounds, etc. The pools are great, though. You can't beat the location with the property being close to theme parks, shopping, restaurants, and grocery. We found everything to be great except for the integrity of the gentleman giving the timeshare presentation. Overall we would recommend this property and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, except for the cigarette odors...”
Reviews.Author: feggie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on International Drive the week of Oct. 12-19, 2007. We traded our timeshare through RCI for this unit. Before we even had our luggage upstairs, we got a call from the timeshare salespeople, asking if we would like to take a tour in exchange for a discount on Disney Tickets. When I asked the price, I discovered it was more than we can get them for by buying a multi day pass. I declined, and thankfully, never heard from them again. The unit was lovely. Everything we needed as far as utensils and start up soaps and detergents were there. Luckily there is a Publix Market grocery directly across the street. There is also a 24 hour Walgreens drug store, and an emergency medical clinic a few blocks away. The pool areas magnificent. There are gas and charcoal grills available, so you can have a BBQ, if you wish. A very nice children's playground, which is covered from the sun is a nice treat for the kids. My only complaints are that although it is a "non-smoking" facility, people sneak their cigs. in the bathrooms, apparently, as the bathroom reeked of smoke, from either above or below. It was more than just a whiff...very strong. When I called the desk, the receptionist stated that someone in a room near ours is probably smoking, but they can't go knocking on doors. This was continuous, and annoying. It even affected the smell of the bath towels. Maid service is provided halfway through your stay. You can keep ordering new bath towels, but they don't take the old ones away unless it is time for your maid service. Luckily, the giant jacuzzi was sufficient to hold all the dirty towels. When you are having a family reunion, and visiting the parks all day, who has time for a leasurely soak, anyway? There is a back gate on the property that leads to a large outlet mall, which is open til 11 p.m. A car is a must here, as the property is so large, it's a long walk to the grocery store. There is a $12 charge per person for rides to Disney. If you have 2 or 3 people, that would cover your rental car, so definitely get a car. All in all, it was a wonderful vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: stacy08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton as a RCI exchange. We were very happy with this resort. The main pool is wonderful and they have waitresses that will deliver drinks right to you while you are laying out (very nice). They also serve food at the pool bar as well. There is a small deli on site also which makes very nice sandwiches. Of course the deli and bar are a little pricey, but that is the cost of the convenience of it. There is also a second bar (between bldg 4 and 5) which is much smaller, but also includes a bar. We used both pools on different days and neither were very busy. We stayed in bldg 6 which had its positive and negative points. Building 6 is located on the other side of the lake from the lobby and main pool, so it was a little walk to get to those amenitites. On the other side we had a little gate right outside of the building which could only be opened with your condo key and it brought you right to the Premium Outlets. If you are staying here don't bother going to the Prime outlets since they are under construction and right now the Premium Outlets are much better. There is also a small food court located at the Premium Outlets and except for Sunday everything stays open until 11:00 pm, so it is handy for some late night shopping or a quick snack. We loved being able to go and sit out on the screened in porch and have breakfast or for calling home. The kitchen is very nicely appointed. We did not have a rental car while we were here and we were able to pick up the I Trolley and the Lynx bus right at the Premium Outlets (right out the back door). Although it takes a little while to get anywhere using either of these types of transportation it isn't really that bad. We also used the resorts transportation to Universal several times and that was very convenient. I was disappointed though that you actually have to pay for the shuttle to Disney even though it is just as close. We only went to Disney one day and we ended up paying for a taxi since it was about the same price as the shuttle and we could come and go as we wanted to rather than having to stick to the shuttle times. Truthfully I am glad that we didn't have a rental car becuase the parking seemed awful at this resort. Every night we came back there were no spots outside of our building and people were usually squeezed into spots that weren't actual parking spots. If you are planning on some down time (lounging by the pool) then this would be a great place to stay. If you are looking for a place to provide easy access and transportation to Disney then this isn't the place for you. I would stay at this location again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dakbail
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton grand Vacations for one night last December. It was the best hotel that we have ever stayed in and the price was great. The hotel has a fantastic pool area with a hot tub and excellent tiki bar. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room included a mini kitchen area, king bed and a small balcony overlooking a courtyard. We hope to stay here again for a much longer time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Nothing to Complain about.”
Reviews.Author: da_drow
Reviews.Content: My husband, My brother and I stayed at the HGVC September 21st through the 28th. This was an RCI exchange for a 2 bed room unit.Check-in was fast and pleasant we were assigned to building six. Room 6212 and 6213. This was a 2 br look off unit with a separate entrance for the other room and a small kitchenette. The main unit has a nice sized kitchen, dining area, living area, screened in lanai and a washer dryer. The rooms were clean. There were tons of bedding and towels. Beds were very comfortable. They also supplied standard amenities like, soap, lotion, shampoo, conditioner, shower cap and one box of tide. I'm a time share owner and I have to say I was impressed with the way the kitchen was stocked. There was lot of cleaning supplies and decent pots (cusinart stainless steel), coffee, maker, blender, mixing bowl and baking dishes. Cheap pots that burn everything is one of my major pet peeves and I was like HGVC listened to customer complaints and did all the right things. After we unpacked we went to the grocery store Publix across the street from the resort. The prices aren't bad. Just pick up a circular and buy what is on sale. I bought breakfast food, sandwich fixings. There are patio set and bbq grills around the property. The resort is next to Orlando Premium Outlets. By the front entrance near Publix is a Walgreens, Outback, and McDonalds. There was a pizza hut express on site. The restaurant at the resort was pretty good if not cheap. While we were hanging by the pool we bought lunch. Burgers and buffalo wings both excellent. We had a few drinks at the bar. Pool one by building six was nice the other larger main pool was also nice. We did get back late on night and parking was tight. I had to walk a little ways but no big deal. All in all HGVC was excellent. This was the best time share I've ever stayed at and I own 2.

Reviews.Title: “Small But Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: busowner
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort, although it is currently under construction and adjacent to a parking garage, also under construction. The noise was not detectable from within the room, but very apparent from the screened-in balcony. After a long business day full of meetings, we just wanted to chill and had requested a quiet "lake view", which should have been no problem, considering there are 7 buildings and most of them face the lake. We were placed in a room in Bldg 4 that overlooked the "secondary pool" with all of the accompanying children's shrills and thrills - it seemed that because we used our AAA discount rate, we were given this location instead of our quieter, lakeview requested room. All in all, it is a lovely complex, with lots to do for the kids - outdoor big-screen movies at the main pool, a walking path around the lake. Didn't use the deli as we were off early the next morning and only stayed one night, but there were shuttle busses available to take tourists to the many area attractions. Didn't really think the room qualified as a "suite" as it was very small and narrow, but it did have a nicely appointed bath, kitchen area and balcony. Bedding was luxurious, as is expected in a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and superb accommodation”
Reviews.Author: peteukmcr
Reviews.Content: We paid $89 per night plus tax for this hotel that is located just where we wanted to be, next to the Premium Outlet Mall, at the quieter end of International Drive and close to I-4 for access to all other routes around Orlando. The room was a King studio with refridgerator, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, cups, plates, glasses, and cutlery.
