There is an iron and board, ceiling fan, great sized screened in balcony, fantastic bathroom, in room safe and free WiFi internet access. Maid service was provided daily. The resort is huge and if you are in the Villa de Tomaso it's quite a journey from the main entrance. Although this is nearest to the gate that allows direct walking access to the Premium Outlet Mall. There is a Pizza Hut available on site, although the deli is a bit expensive but then there is a Publix store opposite the main entrance. The staff at the front desk are terrific, but you will be contacted and invited to breakfast for a presentation and offered $85 for your time. We politely declined as it is not practical for us to purchase a 'timeshare' in Florida as we cannot travel to the US as often as we would like. Once we declined, we were not troubled again. I would recommend this hotel and will use it again in future, it is great value for money, especially with all the amenties provided that we just do not get here in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday at HGVC - International Drive”
Reviews.Author: Vick2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 7th - 21st Sept 2007 and enjoyed an excellent holiday. After a quick & easy check-in we were allocated a 2-bed appartment. This was actually a 1 bed appartment joined to a studio appartment. The appartment was terrific, clean and spacious with almost everything you could want. The only things we would have liked were an English tea-pot & an electric kettle. Why do American timeshares never provide a tea-pot ? The bathrooms are spacious, with granite counters. Plenty of white towels & Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries. Unfortunately the maid had a habit of removing partially used toiletries and not replacing them with new. The same applied to the kitchen supplies. So, we had to keep asking for new supplies. These were delivered promptly to the appartment. The only bad thing about the appartment was that the air-con kept coming on at 2am which disturbed us as it was noisy & draughty. You can only switch the room thermostat on/off, you can't actually control the air-con. We were initially given a ground floor appartment adapted for handicapped people. We don't know why as we are both young & able-bodied ! We complained & we were given a much nicer appartment on the 7th floor of block 6. Also on floor 7 we noticed a woman in a wheelchair struggling to use the lift ! Very strange ! The view from our appartment was lovely as it overlooked the lake & fountain. There is building work taking place on site, right next door to building 6 so we also had a good view of the construction site. While we were there the exterior of the new building was being painted & the interior fitted out. The workmen arrived at 7am every morning and it was noisy & there was a strong smell of diesel fuel. If you like to sleep late don't stay in building 6. It didn't bother us too much as we were always awake by 7am & we were out all day. The site has 2 pools. We used the smaller one as it was nearer our block & it was nice & quiet, apart from the dreadful piped music ! There are also 2 gyms. I used the larger one regularly. The equipment was good quality & clean. There were towels & water too. Unfortunately there was no music to work out to, only 2 TVs. There were no free weights either, only machines. The appartment blocks are built around a lake and there is a nice walking path around it. It only takes about 8 mins if that to walk from the furthest block (No. 6) to reception/gym/main pool. It's hardly a long walk ! Even quicker if you run ! It's a very attractive site & the landscaping is lovely. Although the resort is on I-Drive, it's at the quiet southern end. The Publix supermarket is just across the road (Vineland Ave) and you could easily walk to it if you wanted. Premium Outlets was also next door to the resort & easily accessible via a secure gate. Excellent Thai restaurant nearby too. The resort was very quiet at night which was good apart from one night when we arrived back to find 6 police cars, an ambulance & a fire engine outside our block ! A "domestic" incident, apparently ! All the staff at the resort were friendly, helpful & courteous. We received one phone call asking if we were interested in buying timeshare. We said no & we were never bothered again. There is lots to see in the area apart from the theme parks. Visit Winter Park with it's lovely shopping streets, cafes, fabulous homes & Rollins College. There is also a boat tour of 3 lakes. Also worth visiting are Windermere with it's magnificent houses; Florida Mall; Millenia Mall; Prime, Premium & Lake Buena Vista Outlets; Cypress Gardens; Harry P Leu Gardens in downtown Orlando; Silver Springs & Blue Springs State Parks; the town of Cocoa; Merritt Island & it's mall. Avoid Church St. Station area in downtown Orlando as it's grotty, rough and there is loads of construction work going on. All in all, this is an excellent resort & I would definitely stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laurachef
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Expedia for $110, so I wasn't expecting too much. Was I wrong!!! Our 1 bedroom king suite was wonderful and very spacious, as well as beautiful. We had a large living area with a pull out sofa for our 3 year old, a big bedroom (where the whirlpool was located in an area between bathroom and bedroom), bathroom with granite vanity and two sinks, and best of all, a full kitchen with granite counters and full sized appliances. We made breakfast each morning here before hitting the parks. There was a dinig area with a large table and six chars, or you could sit at the table with four chars on the screened balcony overlooking the lake. the balcony was screened, which helped our peace of mind with a very active 3 year old. The room also had a washer/dryer, complete with a single-use box of Tide. The only aspect of the room that I didn't like was the size of the closet. It wasn't small, but compared with the rest of the suite, it wasn't impressive. The location is great. It is about 2-3 miles from the entrance to Disney, and a short drive up International drive to Sea World. There is a very nice Publix grocery store right across the street where we bought our breakfast stuff. There is a market/deli on the property that we didn't use. The pool areas are nice. The main pool is huge. My son liked the smaller pool at the back of the property best. It had a zero entry and lions heads statues that "spit" water into the pool. Both pools had bars, but only the bar at the main pol was open since we were there in late September. We were told that maid service was not included except on the third day of a seven night stay, but we had maid service each day of our 3 night stay. We were hit with the sales pitch phone call soon after arriving, but my husband told them we weren't interested and they didn't bother us again after that. This is a HUGE resort with lots of amenities. I don't know what it's like during the peak season, but our experience was super. I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: grandma50
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this resort and had a wonderful time. We were contacted directly by the resort and did participate in their time share presentation. It was very well presented and it was not a high pressure experience. The property was just beautiful and very clean. The pool area is very nice and our 1 bedroom villa had everything we could ask for. It is located not far from Disneyworld and there are many places to eat near by. There is a Publix across the street to buy some groceries if you want to use the kitchen facilities in your room. All in all, we would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Korin
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the appearance, layout and service I received at this hotel. Very peaceful setting with our room overlooking a pond. The rooms were clean, quite and contained a microwave, refrigerator, and a coffee pot. The property is located behind the outlet mall and also near several restaurants. It only took us about 5 or 10 minutes to get to Disney World. The only tip is that snack vending machines are not available in the different buildings. You have to walk all the way to the shop near the lobby if you want a snack. This is a very long walk if you are staying on the other side of this property. Drink machines are available so it should not be too difficult for them to add snack machines. I will definitely stay here again next year when I visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, love it, love it!”
Reviews.Author: rbrown5305
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I went just for a one day shopping, rest & relaxtion time and we were wonderfully surprised! The room was clean, comfortable and looked almost new. All the rooms have screened balconies - however, make sure to ask for a view of the lake, otherwise you may end up with a view of the parking lot next door like we did. We lounged by the big pool for a few hours and ordered margaritas and appetizers, then went down to the smaller pool (closer to our room), there is a small bar there and and pizza hut express, very convenient. We then went to our room and ordered room service, it was actually reasonably priced and very good. Will go back many times!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and spacious!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pineapplepule
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on International Drive and this place was by far the nicest, cleanest and friendliest hotels we've ever visited. Unlike some of the other hotels we've stayed at, there was never a problem finding a parking spot. Our room was a two bedroom suite that included a two baths, washer/dryer, giant jacuzzi tub in master bedroom, lots of closet space, granite counter tops throughout, stainless steel appliances, three large TVS with DVD players, high speed wireless internet (yay!), two enclosed decks with ceiling fans and so on and so forth. It was absolutely beautiful and hard to leave. The staff was top notch and were always eager to help. The outlet mall (which is extremely popular in the area) is across the street/parking lot , the Hilton has a private gate for their guests which we used and had a great time (got some great deals too). The hotel's main pool is phenomenal. They had wine sampling for the adults and tons of fun activities for the kids. They did everything from tie dyed tshirts, ice cream sundaes to creating colorful sand bottles. We are very picky about where we take our family, this resort was amazing!! Even our four kids didn't want to leave - now what does that tell you??

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Very Very Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBlondeHoni
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 10 day stay at this resort (July 22-31). The grounds, staff, pool etc were unbelievable. This place was spotless. The pool bar was out of the this world..the portions were more than generous, I ordered the nacho's...and it was easily enough for four people. The salads come in these great bowls and you can't finish it all....the french fries and turkey clubs sandi's...awesome!!! The suite we stayed in (1307) was incredible. The kitchen was amazing! State of the art everything! The fixtures were immaculate. The stove, dishwasher, you name it was brand new. We utilized the washer and dryer just about every day to freshen our clothes and towels. The Publix supermarket is right across the street. It's a good walk if you are in the mood but it's literally a 2 min drive across the street. The Premium Outlets, the theme parks, Universal, Disney...everything is literally 5 - 15 min away. It rained 7 out of the 9 full days we were there..but it rained the same time every day and the storms passed and the sun returned an hour or so later and all was well again. There was nothing they didn't think of when they designed this resort. We are owners at another RCI resort and decided to stay here instead of staying at our home resort..and we are happy to have had the experience at this Hilton! Inside the lobby bathroom there are real cotton washcloths for your use folded in a basket on the sink!! Ok, seriously I was blown away. I am a traveler who usually stays at the Ritz Carlton's and the like..and this resort was up there with the best of them. The cleanliness is something to talk about. Considering the volume and amount of small children that are on site with their families there was not a speck of dirt anywhere! The activity schedule for the children and activities, the ice cream sundaes at the pool, the furnishings at the pool and bar were top notch! I can go on and on, I cannot see anyone giving this property anything less than a 5 star rating. What else could you ask for? We were not badgered about listening to any timesharing pitches. We were contacted and asked to attend a presentation and we kindly declined and were not bothered again. I mean, I am not going to rant about being contacted, these folk have a job to do and they took "no" for an answer very well and left us alone thereafter. I would definitely visit this resort again if and when my family returns to Florida. The management is doing a fantastic job, and they are front and center making sure that this establishment remains top notch. HGVC you get five stars all the way from me and my family. Thank you for a luxurious time away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jbanker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 3 nights in a one bedroom apartment. Then travelled on to Indian Harbour Beach where we were supposed to stay for a week. However this Hilton is so nice, that after just 2 nights/days at the beach we went back for another 4 nights. This is a timeshare resort offering apartments in different sizes, swimming pools, pool bar, fitness room, wireless Internet in all apartments and other amenities. You can cross streets by foot to reach Publix, restaurants and even the Premium Outlet Mall. Sea World, Universal and Disney are less than 10 minutes drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Long sales pitch, beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTravlr
Reviews.Content: Hilton called us with an offer to come see/stay at a miniscule price and listen to the presentation in return. Great comfort , pretty decor and vast amenities. The 1 br/1 bath was pefect for a couple, but it was too small for us with the 2 older kids. he huge jetted tub was sooo relaxing! The on-site deli was a great place to pick up breakfast or have sandwiches made to take to the Orlando parks. The main pool had a fun waterfall you could swim under, and pool was large enough to be spread out from other people. There was a poolside bar and we liked the piped in easy listening music - relaxing! Towels abundant for the taking. No room key required, but you have to leave them at the pool area. Excellent construction of the buildings, you could not hear people walking above or along the hall. Super quiet. Bldg 5 was noisy on the balcony / porch beacuse of proximity to the physical plant - boy, it was loud! Hard to enjoy a cup of coffee and quiet conversation. Choose buildings 1,2,3 or 6 instead. Publix supermarket across the street made it easy to stock the fridge. If you plan to stay on Hilton's invitation to you, like we did ,be prepared. The sales pitch was really tempting....but buy it on the resale market if you really want to be a member of the vacation club. Our 90 minutes stretched into 2 hrs and 45 minutes so it did cut into our enjoyment of the property that day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Home away from Home.”
Reviews.Author: Dizzidezi2
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for hotels in the Orlando area. I finally decided on this one because it seemed to have everything I wanted. I am so glad I'm so anal about these things because the hotel was really exceptional and we had a blast! It was within 5 minutes or less of the parks, right next door to an outlet mall, tons of restaurants close by, and it had easy to access the highway and International Drive. The resort itself was beautiful. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite for 8 days for just over $1100.00. That works out to only about $137 a night. WHAT A BARGAIN! I got the rate by calling Hilton directly and got a non-refundable rate. We had a big comfortable bed with tons of pillows and new linens, washer and dryer with detergent, fully stocked kitchen (pots, pans, glasses, utensils, everything), a whirlpool tub big enough for 3+ people, two televisions with surround sound, and beautiful view from our fully enclosed balcony. Housekeeping was unbelievable. They even did our dirty dishes! We always had fresh clean towels, a clean bathtub, and a clean kitchen. It was really like a home away from home, but with your own maid. You really dont even have to leave the resort to have fun. They had two pools- our room looked over the quiet pool (Villa Teodoro), a restaurant, pay to rent movies, a cafe with fresh coffee, pastries and bread, a library with board games, a couple bars, poolside food and snacks, and an 'animal encounter'. (Which, for me, was the highlight of all the amenities.) You also get complimentary photos with your stay done by a 'professional' photographer. She was very rude, mostly jealousy I think. ha! Despite the need for her to get over herself, the photos turned out great- we took the two free ones and bought a couple extra. The resort as I said before is very well situated. I do NOT recommend taking the bus or relying on Disney's transportation system (which is always crowded and always took forever.) I felt bad for some of the little kids I saw waiting for the Disney bus/tram. They looked hot, tired, and uncomfortable. It is not impossible to get around without your own car (restaurants and grocery store right across the street, and bus stop right outside the main gates) but it was a HUGE advantage having our own rental car. With the car we could eat where we wanted, explore, and grocery shop for snacks. We rented an economy (a Turcel? Something I had never heard of) through Budget and were upgraded to a Pontiac Grand Prix. I map quested directions to the Disney parks, Universal, and the beach before leaving home. I found it was easier though, to leave the resort going left past the outlets until you get to International Drive (not the busy part at all) and go right until you see a Disney World entrance on your left. This road will take you to all the Disney hotels and parks. There are a ton of signs so its easy to navigate even if your not a Magellan, like my dear boyfriend. ;) We didnt get lost once. (Thanks to me!) Mapquest suggested we get on the highway- which I found to be more confusing than going down my 'secret passage road'. Like I said before, it only took about 5 minutes to get the Disney entrance, which was awesome. Discovery Cove and Universal are easy to get to as well and didnt ever seem to take us a long time. Maybe ten mins tops. Tip: We got a AAA parking pass, which lets you park in 'special' reserved spots at most parks. They never asked to see ours and told us just to "follow the green line", which also led to more parking that for some reason everyone wasn't allowed to park in. (Even though it wasnt full.) We never parked far from the main gates at any park by doing this. At one park- there was no parking attendant so we just drove around the cones, followed the green line and parked in AAA parking. We are big travelers but hardly ever find a hotel that we love enough to stay in again. For this hotel, we will make an exception. The location, price, and comfort of this hotel cant be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on which building you're in”
Reviews.Author: woolpitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on two separate occasions in June/July '07. The first visit was much better than the second because we were in one of the far buildings. On the second trip we had a room overlooking the main pool and it was very noisy. There was live music until just after 9pm (it was so loud we couldn't hear the tv in our room) and shouting/screaming from over-excited children in the pool until around midnight. So your experience here will, I think, depend on which of the many buildings your room is in. The rooms themselves were excellent - we booked a spa bath room on both occasions and were delighted with the size, facilities and cleanliness. The only negative was that, on our first visit, there was just one vending machine in the building and it was sold out of most drinks (including water), so we had to take a long-ish walk to the main shop by reception to get a drink. If you are staying here after a flight in to Orlando, I'd recommend using the Pizza Hut delivery service as it's prompt and easy - just what you need after a long journey.

Reviews.Title: “Sales Presentation Hell - Decent Property”
Reviews.Author: biglegchicken
Reviews.Content: Hilton offered us a reduced rate to stay at their property in exchange for our sitting through a sales presentation for the Hilton Vacation Club. When we did not purchase the package (range from $1,000-10,000), they basically kicked us out. The overall property was OK, but it is less like a hotel and more like an apartment building. The facilities were clean, nice and fine, but do not stay here is you are expecting daily housekeeping (we had it once over 3 days), room service or bell service. Pros: convenient to adjacent outlet mall, close to attractions, clean Cons: frequency of housekeeping, very pushy sales presentation, apartment-style rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: Sailcheckers
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 from the Midwest on our 3rd trip to Orlando. HGVC has the conveniences of a condo but also the maid & maintenance services of a top hotel -- without people constantly hounding you for tips. The maintenance worker who came to unclog our toilet arrived in about 10 minutes, fixed the problem and headed for the door -- I had to follow him outside to tip him. We stayed in a king suite; the rooms were well laid out and felt spacious; the screened in porch was great. The location is excellent: a short drive to Disney with a Publix grocery and Walgreen's across the street, Catholic church with daily mass nearby and easy access to the airport. The main pool is great fun with a nice bar. Fellow guests were well-behaved. Drawbacks: 1 - fitness room inadequate for a large hotel. 2 - nearby construction was noisy during the day, but we were not around during the day anyway. 3 - somewhat inadequate parking space at night -- you might have to walk a block to your room. We chose this over on-site resorts and were very happy with it -- HGVC offers real hotel quality, not theme-park tinsel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: tilbee
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TA, I booked this hotel for our family for a Disney trip June 20-25. Upon arrival, we were all pleasantly surprised at the appearance of of the resort/hotel. I say hotel, but I think these HGVC properties are created to be sold as timeshares. I'm not sure how all that works but we were solicited in our room with several calls from management to attend a 90 minute orientation meeting (free breakfast or lunch included) to listen to their presentation. I wasn't interested in that and politely declined. They were not quick to give up but didn't pressure us too much. I declined to answer the phone when it rang during the next couple days assuming that they were trying to rope us in again and figuring our friends and relatives all knew to call us on our cell phones. LOCATION: EXCELLENT - Just off of I4 at exit #68 the hotel is about 10 minutes from Disney, Sea World, Universal Studios and other attractions. We had a rental car and found it super easy to get to Disney from the hotel. Sea World and Universal Studios would have been just as easy to get to as well. From the Orlando/ Sanford airport it took about 45 minutes to get to the property and about and hour getting back to the airport during heavier morning traffic. HOTEL EXTERIOR: EXCELLENT - 7 Mediterranean styled buildings (each 7 stories high) surround a small lake. Landscaping and 2 pool areas were first rate. A sidewalk wraps around the lake behind all the buildings allowing you to easily walk to anywhere on the property. HOTEL INTERIOR: VERY NICE - The rooms are decorated more traditionally than our taste would prefer but they were well done including granite counters in the kitchen and bathroom which also had a large Jacuzzi tub. Nice porch area that is totally screened in which I liked since it kept bugs out. Every room space appeared to have a similar screened in porch. POOL AREA(S): EXCELLENT - There is a large pool area nestled between building 1 and the lobby area. The pool area is beautifully landscaped and seemed to have plenty of chairs towels and space - never seeming too crowded. There is also an open bar/cafe area at this pool where you can order drinks and food. We ordered food here one night while watching the outdoor pool movie (shown twice a week). Food was very mediocre but hey, it was convenient. There are also 2 nice hot tubs in the large pool area. We did not spend time at the smaller pool area which is located at the end of the lake with building 4 on the one end and building 5 at the other. It was equally well done but quite a bit smaller and less grandiose. There is a little Pizza Hut express at this pool. SERVICE: A FEW PROBLEMS- the first night we asked for an extra blanket and it took over an hour to get it after several calls. Other than that, there were a few minor glitches but nothing major. All hotel employees appeared friendly and professional. Maid service was good. OTHER: There is a new strip center with a Publix Grocery right across from the entrance to the HGVC which was convenient for getting groceries - also Walgreens in same center. International Drive is just down from the HGVC entrance and there are many restaurants and shopping areas on this road which can get congested at prime times. Unfortunately, most all the restaurants are typical chain restaurants so you're not likely to find any great new dining experiences. There is also a new upscale outlet center (?) which can easily be seen from I4 right behind the HGVC property. OVERALL: GREAT CHOICE - We were very happy with our stay here. Even the one bedroom condo (or whatever they are) was sizable and comfortable for a family. We saw a lot of other properties in the area - none looked as nice as the HGVC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: fligster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Wife and 2.5 year old son from May 18, 2007 through May 23, 2007. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa in building 4. I think it is called Teodora or something similar. (Room 4411). We had a great experience, and would highly recommend this hotel. Accommodations: The room was great. It was 1 bedroom with a full kitchen, 1 bathroom that had a shower stall and double sinks. The bathroom had Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries, and there were plenty of towels. There was a HUGE whirlpool tub in the little room between the bathroom and the bedroom. There was also a large fully screened porch with a table and 4 chairs. It was accessible from the living room and the bedroom. We had a great view of the “lake” and the laguna pool. The living room furniture and bed was comfortable. There is a TV with a DVD player in the living room and a TV in the bedroom. There is a washer/dryer as well as a safe. The kitchen had everything you needed, including a toaster and blender. They provided a couple of dishwasher soap packets, a little sponge and small dish liquid, and a single use TIDE box for the washer. We didn’t use the TIDE until the last day, so I am not sure if they would have replaced it or not. Housekeeping was good, but we didn’t get service on the second day. I think they may have come later than normal and we had the Do Not Disturb on the door. Otherwise they always had the place cleaned by noon. Our sons feet did get really dirty one day, I think it was from the porch. Recreation / Activities: There is a main large pool and a smaller pool. There is a hot tub near the smaller pool, and 2 hot tubs at the larger. The smaller pool was right near our unit, and was great for our son because it was a zero entry pool with a maximum depth of around 4 feet. He loved the pool, and it was never too crowded. There was “swim noodles” around the pool that could be used for free. They had plenty of towels and chairs. There are restrooms and a bar at both pools. At the main pool they have a hut that sells snacks and some sundries. At the main pool, they also have “fountains” for kids to run through and play in. Our Son also loved this. The bar at the main pool is large and also serves food. They have 3 small charcoal grills that can be used. They sell charcoal in the deli/market shop. They have a playground area that was nice and covered by a tent/canopy, which was good to be in the shade. It has slides and things to climb on, but no swings. It sits on a nice “padded” floor for safety, and there are benches for the parents to sit on. There are also planned activities every day. They were mostly for kids older than our Son and some for adults, but there was a “toddler activity” for children 5 and under the one day. We attended and our son had a lot of fun creating a visor with glued on foam animals. There are 2 pool tables in the “active” lounge, and a ping pong table by the main pool. The pool tables are free. For the ping pong table, you had to buy a ball for 25 cents from a vending machine. Dining: There is a Pizza Hutt Express located on the property. We went there once. It was a little pricey but convenient. You can order ahead for pickup. I believe they will deliver to your room, but I am not sure about that. The Bar at the main pool serves food, but we didn’t eat there so I can’t comment on that. The Deli/Market has various items that a small convenience store would have, and they serve Starbucks coffee. They also make some sandwiches and have fresh pastries, cookies etc for sale. The muffins and cookies are VERY good. We had gotten “continental” breakfast as part of a BounceBack vacation special. You get coupons good for 2 bagels or muffins, 2 Coffees, and 2 Orange Juices (Small Tropicana bottles). If you purchased these items it would be about $10, so consider that when comparing the cost of booking a regular room, versus a room that includes the breakfast. Location: You are a short distance to Disney, Universal, Sea World etc. There is a Publix supermarket across the street and restaurants all within short distances. They are also building a 7-11 across the street. You are also about 2.5 miles from I-4. There is a premium outlet right next store. The hotel provides a sheet with driving directions to the major attractions, as well as to a Super Target and some other shopping choices. General: Check-In was quick and smooth. Everyone who worked at the hotel was extremely friendly. We got a call a couple of hours after checking in to verify everything was ok with the room. During the trip we got one call about attending a presentation about a new resort they are building. They were offering a free breakfast, and either $150 or 20,000 Honor Points to attend the 90 minute presentation. We declined because it would be difficult with our 2.5 year old. They understood and that was it, no high pressure or anything. We didn’t have any problems with parking, but people do seem to drive very fast through the lots, and the staff is constantly driving around in little golf carts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for families and children of all ages!”
Reviews.Author: ripass
Reviews.Content: Amazing place to stay! Wonderfully clean accomodations! Friendly staff and always willing to help with a smile. Large rooms, all the upgrades one would have at home. Granite , ceramic showers, stainless appliances, DVD, BOSE Stereo and speakes, LCD TV...what more can I say!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it”
Reviews.Author: se2085
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week from May 13-20, 2007. We loved both pools, the main pool was large so it never had a crowded feeling to it. They have pool towels conveniently there. The resort is kept clean. The whole week I saw employees walking around picking up trash, washing the grills, cleaning up the pool area, washing the walkways...alway someone out working or cleaning something. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was spacious it worked great for the 4 of us. It had a full kitchen, beautiful marble countertops, dish washer, washer and dryer, whirlpool tub, shower and double sinks. 32" tvs with Bose surround sound and DVD player. The alarm clock/cd radio was not working properly so we just turned it off. The bedroom has access to the balcony as well as from the living room. The balcony is a full length net so no bugs can get in. It has a wonderful view of the lake. We stayed on building 6 which is next to the construction of building 7, but we couldnt hear ANY construction noise. We liked that it had a door that led out to the Premier Outlet Mall without requiring us to drive. It worked great for us. We like having the Publix, Walgreens, McDonalds, Outback and Tokyo Sushi just across the road from the Resort. The Outlet Mall has a food court with numerous food choices and a Starbucks. The hotel Deli has a Starbucks too just a short walk away. The resort has a Pizza Hut by the small pool. Overall the resort is a great vacation place for both adults and children. My only complaint is that the carpet was not quite clean. My 11 month all loves to crawl but he ended up nasty with black knees and hands just from the carpet. We had to restrain him from crawling to keep him from getting soo dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: McKRy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at this hotel, it was really nice! The rooms were very spacious and clean. The pool was great, my 3 and 5 year olds loved it since it is only 3ft. in most parts. They have a nice bar down at the pool, had music playing and had activities going on for the kids, so it is a real nice atmosphere. We chose this hotel hoping to feel like we were at a "resort" after doing Disney all day, and that is the way it felt for us, an escape from the Disney scene.Staff at the hotel were very friendly and accomodating as well. It is in a great location, Seaworld is only a couple of minutes away and Disney about 10 minutes. Also across the street is a Publix Grocery Store and a Walgreens, along with a Subway, Outback Restaurant and McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice!”
Reviews.Author: Vacation85
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a good deal in a perfect location for Disney. The room was very spacious and clean. It had a good feel to it. The hotel is safe and in a nice area. The property has two pools. There is a nice cafe on site and they have good coffee and muffins. It is clear that a few people that have reviewed this resort may have alterior motives. I would reccomend this as a place to stay without hesitation. I did notice the rates are climbing, but if you can get in at under $200 a night, it is a no brainer. The staff is friendly, the grounds are well kept, and there is a supermarket across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jamhog
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the Hilton. After reading some of the negative reviews I was not looking forward to staying here...but we had a great time. We had a two bedroom villa in one of the newer buildings and it was very clean, well stocked and had comfortable beds. I am very picky and complain about most places I stay so I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The pools were clean and my kids loved the sundaes and other activities by the pool. We rented a car and the resort is close to the Orlando airport and Disney World. I would recommend the Hilton resort to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Jewelz_7
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was just brilliant. We booked a suite for our theme park holiday because as vegetarians with children who are fussy eaters we needed a full kitchen I also wanted to avoid car hire for at least some of the holiday and so the free shuttles to Seaworld and Universal studios were perfect - though they could have been more frequent (if you missed the 8am bus you had to wait until 10am for the next one) Having said that after a couple of days of full on theme parking 10 am is quite early enough) I thought $12 per person for the shuttle to Disney was a bit steep so we hired a car for those days. I loved the room with insect screened balcony - cleaned every day and really spacious for our family of 4. The 2 pools were both beautifully landscaped and you could hire floats from the pool tower for your children to play with. The pool bar was quite dear for alcohol but I liked the food (whiuch was reasonably priced) and there was even more than 1 veggie option! Having the pizza hut express on site was useful. I was very happy with the location. Very central to the parks and opposite a supermarket, pharmacy and chinese restaurant. We even had our own gate to access the Orlando premium outlet Mall next door. An added bonus was the activities the hotel laid on every day from 11am. My daughter loved the animal encounter hour when she saw an alligater, iguana and sloth to name but a few. All in all our stay was FANTASTIC. I would like to point out that they are building another block of apartments at present and there was no work taking place on that block whilst we were staying there so I do not know how disruptive that would be if work was in progress. Hope this helps you.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Good Bad”
Reviews.Author: eaesparza
Reviews.Content: The security at the entrance didn't allow us to enter because we were not on the list for check in, we called the front desk and they let us in, but they had to call the guard first. The hotel is great, nice room, avarage service. No place to park our Van if you get there at night and the worst we had a leak on the wall from the room upstairs all the kitchen was flooded and also the carpet on the dinning area, we let them know about it but did not do anything till we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: RLCTapmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids, ages 5 and 7, stayed for 5 nights at this resort. We reserved a 2 bedroom suite at a great price for Disney. When we arrived, the front desk staff was very nice, gave info about the hotel and the area, and sent us to our room. We thought the rooms were REALLY nice - granite tops in kitchen and baths, huge living room and the kids' bedroom was a lockout, so attached to the main suite. We were all really impressed. The Publix across the street was great to have, we stocked up on food when we got in. The kitchen appliances were all fairly new. We had an oversized jacuzzi in the master bedroom that fit 2-4 people, it was HUGE! We loved having the washer/dryer and the kitchen (we ate breakfast in the room each morning before heading to the parks). And the screened porches (we had one off the master bedroom/living room and one off the second bedroom) were SO nice to sit out on and read the paper in the mornings. You could even see the Magic Kingdom fireworks from our balcony. We thought the pools and whirlpools were terrific and the activities were great for the kids. On Easter morning, the bunny came to the rooms with baskets for the kids which was really nice. And that day, when we were sitting out at the pool, an exotic animal expert came with 6 or 7 cool animals and did a 45 minute presentation - we all loved it, we got to see a 35 pound sloth up close! I found the ladies at the Fresco Deli/Market to be SO nice and pleasant, not sure what a recent reviewer was talking about. Actually, we found all of the staff we dealt with to be friendly and very helpful. We will definitely return to this hotel - we highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: triptaker07
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 30th,and just got back from this Hilton Grand Resort. There is nothing GRAND about this place! The Good: Bathtub The Bad: Unorganized check=in. Broken Bathroom door, Broken Alarm clock, cheap furniture, the mattress looks like it came from thrift shop, Missing kitchen items, lack of service in the deli, no restaurant, no snack machines, slow slow internet, AC does not cool, far away from attractions, terrible intersection, poor directions(staff sent us 25 miles out of the way with bad directions)harassing phone calls to sell us the units, had to call to have our room cleaned, they did not clean it(slack), shabby fitness center, carpet looks 10 yrs old, very worn. We would never stay here again, even if it was free. This place is the biggest NOTHING we have stayed at, and we travel alot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tamara2298
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two year old daughter and both of our mothers on a Disney Cruise in March, 2007. We needed a place to stay both before and after the cruise. After a bit of research and checking into prices, I saw the reviews posted for the Hilton International Drive. I was able to book directly through Hilton and even received a AAA discount by calling them instead of booking on the Grand Vacations web site. We found the accomodations to be much more reasonable than the price of the hotel rooms during the same time. We would have also had to have booked two hotel rooms versus one two-bedroom suite at the Hilton. The rooms were what we expected. The furniture was very nice. The beds and bedding were very comfortable. Both units we were in were quiet. Both kitchens were well stocked with everything we needed. It was great having a place to store my daughter's milk and snacks. We picked up a few items at the Publix across the street to keep in the kitchen. The dining area was large and very comfortable. It was nice to be able to sit and have a snack together. The living area and bedrooms were all nice and large. Much larger than just having a regular hotel room. My daughter was able to sit and play. She could take a nap in one of the bedrooms while we relaxed in the living area or out on the screened porch area. The room we had before the cruise was in excellent condition and spotless. The room after the cruise was nice, but the carpet was worn in a spot and, to my surprise, I think the maid had forgotten to dust...probably for a while. There was quite a bit of dust on the tables and lamps. We wiped it up, then moved on. The best feature was the porch off of the living area. It was screened in and had very comfortable outdoor furniture. We were able to sit out there and relax in the mornings and in the evenings. There is a cafe on the property. My husband woke up every morning and headed to the cafe to pick-up coffee for all of us to enjoy on the balcony. The pools were beautiful and immaculate. We never had a problem finding five chairs together. The poolside food service was excellent, too. There was a small covered playground area for the kids. It was a great place for our two year old to have some kid time. The business center looked O.K. I tried to print out some directions using my laptop there. The connection to their machine was bent and I was unable to use my laptop. Then I was told that the printer doesn't always work, so don't rely on using it. We left without the directions. We only received one phone call about attending the timeshare presentation. We declined and were never approached again. One thing I would like to mention, since this is something we had not planned for, is that check-out is at 10am. The outlet mall is right next the the hotel complex. It had many upscale shops. We found quite a few great items there and ended up having to purchase an extra suitcase to get everything home! All in all, I think my husband and I will now always check to see if there is a Hilton or a Hyatt vacation club wherever we are traveling. It is a much better and more comfortable way to travel, especially with children or a group. It would have cost us almost four times the price to accomodate our group into a comprable hotel, and we would not have had the kitchen, dining area, outdoor area, or a big living area. I am pretty sure we would have been fighting for chairs at a hotel pool, too. The resort was nice, easy to get to, and fulfilled all of our needs on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches, Dirty Carpets & Sex Toys, OH MY!!!”
Reviews.Author: FLvacamom
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this was our third attempt at the Hilton on Int'l. Our first trip was this past summer, when we had gotten a deal through RCI. The carpets were filthly, but someone came to clean them the next day. It was our second visit that really had us raising our eyebrows. We went there in November '06 for my birthday. First, we had to wait for two hours to check in because they were "cleaning our room." Yeah right!! I guess it was cleaned by a blind person! Second, (this is the doozy one!) our 2 yr old found a sex toy beside the nightstand and bed!! She walked out into the living room with it to show us. I must have scrubbed her hands for an hour! Third, there were huge roaches in the closet of the master bedroom, YUCK! Well, needless to say, after the sex toy was found they could hardly talk at the front desk. In return, they gave us a two night comp stay for us to use at another time. Well, here we our now for our third visit in March 2007 for our daughter's birthday. Again, the carpets were filthy, countertops dirty, missing dishware in kitchen, but I'll save the best for last. On the first night I woke up around 3 AM to get a drink. I flipped on the lights in the kitchen and TWO HUGE PALMETTO BUG ROACHES crawling across the counters! It took everything I had in me not to scream and wake up our daughter. It took my husband and I 30 min. to kill those damn things. I called the front desk shortly after and was told, "oh, how disgusting. I'll send someone to clean and spray for bugs tommorow around 11 AM." Did anyone show up at 11 AM,..... NO! I called the front desk and was treated like it was no big deal. Someone finally showed up later to clean our place. They also sprayed the entire unit which I asked them to only spray the kitchen and entry. I didn't want our little girl breathing that crap in. But from the response of the front desk, I guess they're accustomed to roaches everywhere. It's a shame. The resort on the outside is gorgeous. I guess we learned a big lesson in "it's what's on the inside that counts." Sadly, from other magazines and whatnot, I've noticed a lot of other people complaining about all sorts of Hilton resorts. Hilton, get your act together!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC hotel and guest rooms!”
Reviews.Author: specialk2077
Reviews.Content: I stayed here March 1-3 for a couple days after a work conference to visit the Disney parks. I got a great room rate of $133 on the Hilton website and I couldn't have been happier with my stay. This hotel is Tuscan styled and just over a year old. There are 7 condo like buildings arranged around a center lake and two swimming pools. All rooms are studios, 1 or 2 bedroom suites and feature king size beds. THERE ARE NO TWO BEDDED ROOMS--ONLY KINGS!!!! All rooms feature the Hilton Suite Dream Serta mattress along with a wet bar, small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, safe, 27'' TV with cable, DVD player and free high speed wireless internet. Parking is plentiful and you can park near your room. Parking is FREE and there is no daily or in-and-out parking fee. The hotel grounds are well maintained and the rooms are very comfortable. The bathroom is nice sized and has a large granite counter top surface for all your stuff. Towels are plentiful, soft and fluffy. All rooms have a screened in balcony or porch with a table and chairs. Rooms also have a ceiling fan and thermostat to control the temperature. There are 2 pools and 2 hot tubs that are great! There is one restaurant on-site (Tuscano Bar & Grill) and is at the main pool. it stops serving food at 10:00 PM so if you arrive later in the evening, get something to eat before you settle into your room for the night. The food is good and is reasonably priced considering it is Orlando. There is also a little shop that sells snacks, beverages, coffee, etc. The prices are a little high. I would suggest going to the Walgreen's or CVS down the street and stocking up on snacks and water to keep in your room fridge. This hotel complex is adjacent to the Orlando Premium Outlet and is accessible to hotel guests via a short walk across the parking lot. There is a security gate separating the hotel from the outlet and you MUST use your hotel key to enter or exit. My only complaint about this hotel is that if you have a parking lot facing room, you have to walk around the buildings to access the interior hotel grounds. Also, there is no free shuttle to Disney parks from this hotel. There is a shuttle service which costs $12 per person and reservations have to be made in advance. The first shuttle leaves after the parks open which doesn't work if you want to beat the morning crowds. You're better off taking a cab directly to the Disney parks which will set you back around $10-15 with tip. You can also take a cab (or drive) to Downtown Disney (just across the highway) which has free parking. You can then take a Disney bus to the park of your choice. Please note that the Disney buses don't pick up at Downtown Disney until 10 AM and it is very difficult to get a cab here before the shops open.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: OSU_Fan1967
Reviews.Content: We just returned from relaxing week at this resort. It is ideally located just outside the Disney World complex and is an easy 10 minute drive to the parks. Our 1 bedroom suite was nicely furnished and in "like new" condition. The bathroom was very large and well appointed w/ both a shower and jacuzzi type tub. Our two year old slept on the fold out sofa bed and enjoyed his own TV complete w/ a DVD player. The pools were very nice and a relaxing way to enjoy time away from the Disney parks. The only negative is the parking situation that has been mentioned by several other reviewers. If you plan to return to the resort much later than 10 PM you need to keep your fingers crossed that you'll be able to find adequate parking. Other than that, we whole heartedly recommend this fine resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashlee7878
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spend 5 days and 4 nights in Orlando for our 1 year anniversary. I have always stayed inside the parks with my family so I was skeptical about staying outside. I couldn't have been happier with our hotel though. After much research, I decided on this place because of the beautiful pictures on the website. I must say our room looked exactly like the pictures. We had a 1 bedroom suite and it was amazing!!! Kitchen was beautiful and fully stocked, including wine glasses and a wine bottle opener. The furniture was beautiful. The living area had a nice size tv, w/ DVD player, and a comfy couch. The bedroom had a nice king size bed with a tv. We loved the jacuzzi that was in our room as well. After walking around the parks all day long, it was a nice perk to come home to. The bathroom was a nice size with double sinks and a decent size shower. We also had a washer/dryer in the suite, but we did not use it. I was surprised maid service came every day to run our dishwasher and make our bed and restock towels. Parking was a little annoying. A few nights we came home around 10pm or later, and had to park quite a ways away from the building we were staying at. The hotel was nicely located right next to upscale outlets (IE Fendi, Burberry, Dior.) It was also located close to Disney World and a quick drive up Rt. 4 took us to Universal. A AAA discount made the price of the room a little more affordable, so definitely check that out if you can. Although I noticed mostly families stayed here, we were far enough away from the main pool, Building 6, that we never felt overwhelmed by children. We both wished we could have stayed longer, but had a puppy to return home to. We're already looking forward to more vacations at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: peakplanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for two days at the end of our trip with our two kids, ages 9 and 7. We decided on this hotel based on user reviews and how right they were! We had planned on taking the kids to Disney for one day before we left for home on the next. However, after arriving around noon on our first day, the kids were having such a good time with the hourly activities around the pool area that we all agreed we would skip Disney and enjoy the hotel amenities as we are coming back in April anyway. The rooms (we had a 1BR suite) were magnificent, with marble counters and a romantic tub in the bedroom. The rooms were very clean, as was the entire resort. As our main objective in hotel stays is to keep the kids occupied and having fun, this resort hit the mark. The kids staff (mostly college students doing internships) were excellent, and on our last night there they had a 4 1/2 hour kids getaway where they went offsite to play lasertag and eat pizza. For the nominal fee, we got some free time to ourselves to enjoy the wine tasting they had set up for guests as well as share some laughs at the outside bar. We would absolutely recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Bubba-7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day, 3 night "mini-vacation" at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on International Drive. We were a little skeptical last year when we originally invested in the Vacation Club concept....We now realize that it is one of the best investments we have ever made! This particular location is more than just beautiful...The friendly and knowledgeable employees went out of their way to make our stay a most memorable experience. We had a beautiful (2 bedroom) 7th Floor view of both the lake and the pool area....We intend to return to this location (as well as taking advantage of all of the other resorts connected with the Hilton Vacation Club!) We highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Alternative in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Historiana
Reviews.Content: We embarked on our trip to Orlando with trepidation. It was President’s Day week and we knew it would be very crowded. This hotel really helped make our trip. The room was extremely clean and very well maintained. My wife and 10 year old daughter loved it. It was much roomier than a normal hotel room and was really a small furnished apartment. While we were not looking to cook our own food, the kitchen was very convenient. The bathroom was large with double sinks and a separate show and tub. The hotel’s location is very close to Disney but still sufficiently removed so you can get a break. Depending on your room’s location you may feel a bit close to the Outlet Mall or Shopping Center but I would not let that be a deterrent. I noticed they had ground floor rooms which I would try to avoid and would recommend requesting a room on the higher floors (goes up to 6). The staff was friendly and they have a very convenient deli open to 11:00 each night where you can get a range of goodies. Pools looked great and they have a nice game room. They did contact us about a timeshare presentation but it was very half hearted and no problem to decline. Overall, a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “We liked it but..!?”
Reviews.Author: Summertown
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 3 night stay in Feb 2007 that included a trip to Saint Augustine's gator farm and Disney. The resort is a gated community with non-intrusive guards, cameras and 24 hour staff. We tried to reserve a 2 bedroom suite for our family of four but, only 1 bedroom suites with a whirlpool bath were available. However, our suite was very spacious with over 800 square feet, a fully equipped kitchen (conventional oven, microwave, glass top stove, double sinks, dish washer, blender, utensils, pots/pans and full size refrigerator), living room with a sofa bed, two televisions, balcony (patio furniture, mosquito screen, ceiling fan), large bathroom with double sinks and shower. It was a pleasure to return to our room after a busy day at the parks. The parking lots was never full which left plenty of room for SUVs and vans. Elevators were never busy and the luggage carts were always available for arriving guests. NEGATIVES: As indicated by other postings, Publix is across the street from the property and the staff is not very knowledgeable for finding another grocery shopping alternative. The onsite restaurant, Tuscany Grill, has limited offerings so please venture down International Drive for dinner options or prepare to cook your own food. Surprisingly, there were several business travelers at the property during our stay but beware of the pedestrians that can dart out into the drive ways without warning.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! What a Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel88
Reviews.Content: Just came back from spending 3 terrific nights at the HGVC on International Drive, Orlando. We had a beautiful one bedroom villa that was nearly brand new, the furnishings were very nice, the villa was extremely comfortable and home-like feeling, we had everything we needed, including free internet access, a large flat panel tv in the living room, a Bose stereo and speakers, as well as really comfortable furniture to lounge on in the living room, a full kitchen completely stocked with pots and pans, dishes, glasses, silverware, etc., , dining area, king bed in the bedroom with sliding doors to the screened patio, a very nice flat panel tv, a large bathroom with a wonderful jacuzzi tub and separate shower!! We loved everything about this hotel/condo! The grounds are landscaped very pretty and the location was great, it's located on the north end of International Dr, so you aren't in the heavy traffic at all and it was aprox 10-15 mins to the disney parks, we never used I-4 and were really glad we didn't need to!! There are two pools, the main pool is very large and has a pretty waterfall, and the other pool is smaller but still very nice, the bar at the main pool was fun and has a menu you can order appetizers and sandwiches from. There is a nice deli/store on the property and they have Starbucks coffee!! They did approach us to attend a timeshare presentation but since we were not interested, we simply told them "no thank you" and that was the end of that, no one pressured us at all!! We will definitely stay here again when we are in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Really really fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Aazadeh
Reviews.Content: I have spent many years of my life traveling... i usually stayed in 5 star hotels since it was for business....so I’ve seen a lot of nice hotels... We went on a family vacation with two kids. I really can't think of anything bad to say about this resort. The pools were clean and warm and beautiful. The rooms, or should i say, Suites were very clean, modern and fresh.... (i love going into a hotel where it smells clean and fresh.. . i wanted to take the bed sheets home) .The location of the resort was great too... right across the road from Publix supermarket (where the locals shop, so you don’t get ripped off for shopping at a 'tourist supermarket').... only a short walk to McD's and right next to an Outlet Mall!!!! Even though there was construction, we really didn't feel inconvenienced. The kids LOVED it.... and so did we.... We've paid more for a freaking crappy Best Western.... Another great thing... you have a full kitchen and washer/dryer... GREAT for longer stays with the family.. Only one thing that was 'not so great' and I’m being picky now, was the front desk staff were a little unfriendly... but they might have just been having a bad day.. the Bell Hops were AWESOME and so helpful.. and so were the reservations people! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “probably the nicest resort i have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: rick00001967
Reviews.Content: i cannot say enough about the accomodations at this resort. we stayed in a one bedroom unit. it was amazing. king bed, huge jacuzzi beside the bed, nice bathroom, beautiful kitchen w/granite counter tops, big screen t.v., balcony that was very private. what more could anyone want??? i have done alot of traveling. i am a timeshare user and traded for this property so i don`t know the rental cost of a unit there but i can say that in the 15 or 20 years i have been traveling, this is probably the nicest resort i have stayed in. of course being brand new it helps. it is located at the south end of international drive. just a couple miles from sea world/discovery cove. it is very close to the disney area as well as to the 192 highway through kissimmi. there is a Publix grocery right across the street for food, wine, and beer. an Outback rest is also across the street. the food was reasonably priced and very good. be sure however to go out to eat early on the weekends as all the restaurants in the area are packed by 6 or 7pm. the Dolly Parton dinner theater is down the road a couple of blocks. it is some kind of western dinner theater. did not go to it though. we did go to the Pirate dinner show as well as the Medievel Times show (again). loved both. pirate show is more interactive. great for the kids. for good ticket prices there is a small outlet in the outlet mall south of the hotel on 535 i believe it was. the outlet was for "fairfield resort" properties i think. they had great specials on every day for tickets without having to go on one of those timeshare tours. there is another good ticket outlet a bit further down 535 on the right side in the gas station (a chevron i think). it is called "the official ticket center". ask for Patrick. the "premium outlet mall" is right beside this resort. it is a great place for shopping. and if you have a car, don`t forget to go to the "florida mall". it is unbelievable. a car is definetely an asset in this area to see all there is to see. i have been to this area many times and still am blown away by all the attractions etc. if you can, do yourself a favour and stay at this resort on your next trip. it is awsome. pls email me if you have any questions at all. i love to talk about travel. anywhere/anytime. gooper@shaw.ca

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, very good service”
Reviews.Author: StreamGrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (thirtysomethings) spent 4 nights at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club on International Drive in Orlando. We were looking for a hotel that we would enjoy spending relaxation time at, between excursions to Universal Studios and other Orlando attractions. I was impressed by the reviews of other TripAdvisor users and the hotel's website, so we gave it a try. We were very impressed. We stayed in a king whirlpool suite. It was basically a really nice furnished apartment, and the place was immaculate. The screened patio was a great spot for breakfast and reading. My husband was impressed by the Bose sound system on the large TV in the living room. The beds were extremely comfortable, and we liked the layout that put the bedroom on the outside wall, so there was no concern about "neighbor noise" (although we never heard any neighbors at any time while in the room). What's more, the whirlpool was actually big enough for tall people...and to share. Outdoors, the pools and whirlpools were again immaculate and big enough so that kids and adults could all enjoy them without getting in each others' way. We took advantage of the poolside bar and dining more than once, and were impressed by the day-long schedule of children's, family, and adult activities available through their Recreation Staff each day. When we checked in, a bellman whisked us and our bags off to our building in a golf cart - a new experience for us, probably unnecessary for us but a very nice convenience for families or those with more luggage. We were not bothered by sales reps trying to get us to come to an ownership presentation - we were invited once, on checking in, and that was it (maybe we didn't appear old or wealthy enough to be their 'target audience'?). All the staff - and there were a LOT of them, were friendly and greeted us whenever we passed. We did not have a car during this trip, but that was no problem. The hotel has a shuttle service that makes a few scheduled trips to Universal Studios (free) and Disney (for a fee) each day. They also have their own driver to take you to other destinations (airport, restaurants, Downtown Disney) for the same price as a cab but with friendlier and more dependable service. Also, the hotel is on the bus and International Drive trolley lines, and within walking distance to a large grocery store and drugstore, so we had no trouble getting where we wanted to go. The only minor complaint we had is one experienced by other TripAdvisor reviewers - most of the people staffing the concierge desk were less than knowledgeable about basic questions regarding Orlando attractions - however, they were willing to investigate and find out, and eventually would find the answer for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: knightmvp
Reviews.Content: The place is beautiful. We have been to Orlando several times before and this is the best location we stayed at.. The rooms were large and we all had our own t.v. The living area had a dvd. We saved money by making use of the fully stocked kitchen,(grocercies not included) we had breakfast and dinner at the resort. A washer and dryer was in the room. We did order dinner twice from the resort, it was reasonably priced not fine cuisine but it worked. This place is close to the parks, shopping and the grocery store. As said in a previous post you will need a car here. It was a little chilly for the pool but it was big. I enjoyed the Tuscan theme of this resort. We will stay here again next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious & luxurious! 5 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: cancunvacationing06
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've ever written a review, but since I picked this property BECAUSE of the reviews on Tripadvisor and because we had such a WONDERFUL experience, I felt I owed it to everyone to post a review. We vacationed at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club on International Drive from 1/1/07 - 1/8/07. We booked a one bedroom unit for $179 directly from the HIlton website. We consider ourselves "hotel snobs" and will only stay at a luxury property. We previously stayed at the Dolphin and Disney's Wilderness lodge. We usually check in to a hotel and have to make several room changes before we find a room we are happy with. This was the first time we opened the door to a hotel room and said, "Wow, this is great!" I had made my room requests when I booked the room asking for a 3rd floor room overlooking the pool and that's exactly what we got. I would have preferred it to be overlooking the main pool, but since I didn't realize there was more than one pool, I just requested "pool" and that's what I got. I couldn't get the main pool because the hotel was sold out. The room was gorgeous! A beautiful kitchen with granite counters, a full size refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher, garbage disposal and all pots, pans, containers, cookware, and utensils you could possibly want. Even an icemaker int he fridge. Right off the kitchen was a washer and dryer which was wonderful.. The bathroom was large and had a glass door shower and double sink with granite counters. There was a main entrance to the bathroom and a sliding (lockable) door to the bedroom. In the bedroom there was a large, beautiful jacuzzi. Also, a king size bed, a TV, a very large closet and sliding doors to a large screened balcony that had a 4 seat patio table and a ceiling fan and light. The dining room was open to the living room and kitchen and had a large glass dining table with 5 chairs, a fancy chandelier and the living room had a pull out sofa (bed was not that comfy though) a TV, a writing desk, a chair and ottoman and a coffee table. There was also a door to the screened porch from the living room. 5 of us stayed in the room (Hilton allows 4 in this room, but never asked me upon check in how many we had). My 3 year old slept with my husband and I and my mom and 6 year old son slept on the pull out couch. We all absolutely LOVED the Hilton. It was just so spacious compared to the rooms at the Dolphin or Wilderness Lodge. Considering the Wilderness lodge is $350 a night and has less than half the space of this one bedroom suite, the Hiltom would be my FIRST choice when we return to Orlando. Everything was so luxurious and decorated so comfy. The bed was soft and had a cozy thick comforter and 5 down pillows. We had daily maid service because we rented, they told me time share owners only get service every 3 days. The house keeping was great, she even washed our dishes. I can't say too much about the hotel amenities because we left in the morning to go to the parks and were back late at night. I can say the main pool was beautiful and I'm sad we didn't get a chance to use it. There arent' many restaurants on site just a deli with sandwiches and only a few hot item choices. The hotel is within walking distance to shopping including a Publix grocery store across the street. The kitchen was wonderful because we bought groceries and had breakfast in the room every day which saved a ton of time and money. We were only called by the time share people once and it was a quick call, no pressure at all. We would definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: tripon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton in November with 2 friends. The resort is conveniently located at the end of International Drive close to a Publix grocery store and several restaurants. The Hilton offers several activites during the day and evening and we participated in Vegas night which was great. The rooms are elegantly appointed with marble countertops in the kitchens and bathrooms. We stayed in a two bedroom suite and there was plenty of room. We found the resort quiet and were never disturbed by other guests. We had lunch at the pool bar once and it was reasonable and flavourful. We went in the hot tub most evenings. We had a fanastic time at the Hilton. One word of caution is to only use a store purchased calling card from the area where you are staying otherwise you will still incur long distance charges. We visited Busch Gardens and Sea World during our stay which we thoroughly enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “I've seen a lot of Hiltons, and this one is just fantastic all around!”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: The HGVC on I-Drive really got the first 2 days of our Orlando vacation off to a fantastic start...the staff bent over backwards to provide excellent service and the amenities were first rate. Our next 5 nights were at Disney's Wilderness Lodge and Polynesian, and we were honestly sad to be leaving the HGVC! Rooms were extremely large, with master bedroom having its own massive whirlpool tub. Separate bath with tiled standup shower. Full kitchen with oven, microwave, fridge, dishwasher, etc. Nice touch is the Bose speaker system for the TV and the screened in porch overlooking the massive pools. I guarantee you will not be disappointed. Close to just about everything you could ever want, with excellent shopping across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort !!!”
Reviews.Author: KellyTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom condo the week before Christmas. The bed and bedding is fabulous. After a long day at the parks, it is so nice to have a comfortable bed to melt into. The kitchen saved us money; we cooked most meals in the room. The bathroom is huge, and it has a whirlpool tub and steam shower. My 2 boys loved the pool and play set ; I loved the large jacuzzi, and the restaurant and bar by the pool is reasonable too. The activities are well planned and we loved having the complimentary wireless internet and the Bose stereo system in our room. This is one of the best I've stayed in near Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tylercarter21
Reviews.Content: My family had a 3 night stay here in December b/c my work offers close to member pricing for this hotel. We stayed in a King Studio which comes with a private balcony, mini-fridge, microvave, toaster, forks, plates, cups, etc. It is basically a small condo. Location is great, as it is right next door to the outlet malls and right across the street from Publix, Subway, and an Outback. Free transportation from/to Seaworld and Universal. Also, there is a I-Ride ($1 rides) bus stop right across the street. These run more often than the free transporation and allows you to be flexible with your time. If you want to go to Disney parks we found a trick. Just drive a couple miles down the road to the Hilton WDW resort and park in their parking lot for free. Then catch the MEARS bus that runs every 30 minutes from the Hilton to the Disney parks. There is no checking of room keys, etc. Depending on the traffic this resort is less than 5 minutes from the Hilton WDW. Front desk and concierage were nothing but helpful and friendly. I will definitley stay here again on upcoming disney trips.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous and fabulous etc.etc.........”
Reviews.Author: britishtraveler
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from my fab stay at HGV Club on International Drive, I wanted to share my thoughts. If coming to Orlando and staying on I-drive you absolutely must stay here!! The only niggle(in my view anyway) was after New Years Eve,until i left on the 4th Jan.07 they were still playing the same Christmas songs.ALL DAY LONG................. Still, a very small niggle at that...... Nothing else could i fault.Spacious apartments spotlessly clean. Surrounded by a beautiful lake.Staff very attentive and pleasant. Two lovely pools one being smaller and quieter.Will definately return,hopefully in the autumn of this year. Can't wait..........................

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Accommdations, Awesome Value”
Reviews.Author: francoisdaman
Reviews.Content: Everything about the place was awesome. Room was simply beautiful. After reading other reviews I had high expectations, and they were exceeded. Staffing was great, location is very good. About the only thing I could find fault with was that the parking spaces are a little tight, but really that's being incredibly nit picky. Great to have the publix close by. Very close to International Drive. Beautiful Pool, has activities for kids. Just something for everyone. A must visit. Timeshare solication was well done...no high pressure tactics and very professional. I hope I get to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Where economy and luxury meet”
Reviews.Author: A1derbean
Reviews.Content: We were contacted, and offered a special rate by phone ($110 for two nights) to come stay at this hotel and sit through a time share presentation. Since we live so close we went ahead and did it. We loved the look of the property and the staff was overwhelmingly friendly. The room they gave us had a kitchenette, so we went to get groceries across the street. It was all very convenient. We did not use the on-site shop or concierge desk. We did not use the pool, but it was all spotless. This hotel is super close to Dixie Stampede and a fabulous outlet mall. They had good security from what we could tell. I think that the regular rates at this hotel are great for something of its caliber in a city like Orlando. We have stayed at lower end properties close to the theme parks and at higher end downtown properties, but this is where price, convenience, and luxury meet. My only complaint was the parking. Both nights we ended up parking near the entrance and our building was three down from the main building which, after walking all day at theme parks, was the last distance we wanted to walk. One night there was a guy in a golf cart passing by and he picked us up and dropped us off at our building. We are staying there again for New Years's weekend 06-07. This time they sent us a schedule of events like ice cream socials and games, and a list of services at the concierge desk. I am looking forward to staying here again. As for the timeshare presentation, it was actually decent. They treated us with respect as human beings and with respect for our time.

Reviews.Title: “Made our vacation Grand”
Reviews.Author: moxieDog1
Reviews.Content: We made a quick trip to Orlando and picked this hotel on-line the night before we arrived. We could not of been happier with the service and beautiful rooms. My son left his gameboy games in the hotel room after we checked out. The housekeeping staff found them and Fed-ex them home to us.....we were very immpressed. Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Will Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: Dueceman
Reviews.Content: HGVC is highly recommended for anyone, but especially families. We booked a 7 day stay (Dec. 13-20, 2006) using AAA rate of $130/night for a one bedroom villa. Full kitchen (there is a large grocery store right across street) and washer/dryer was especially useful. We had requested a crib in advance and it was in our room when we arrived at midnight on our first night. I had read about noise at this property, but we stayed on the top floor of building 3 and heard no noise whatsoever. Very very nice and would have expected to pay $200-$300+ for a room of this caliber. This is a timeshare property, so we did receive a call to sit through the sales pitch, but since we were paying full rental rate we simply declined and HGVC never called or mentioned it again. Bottom line, can't think of ANY complaints about this property (which is a first for me....). Every time our family travels to Orlando for Disney World, we will stay at HGVC.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: pbjandthou
Reviews.Content: How extraordinary to stay in a hotel that is nicer in person than it is in the site photos! The HGVC is truly lovely, from the landscaping, to the pool, to the rooms themselves. We were so busy going to the parks, however, that we didn't have time to enjoy the amazing pool and spas...next time, I'm sure. I had to call the resort a few times before our arrival and did learn that if you are not an owner it is best to contact the resort directly and speak to someone on-site. Everyone that I spoke to over the phone and dealt with once we arrived, was very nice and very helpful. We stayed in the 3rd buiding, on the 4th floor, in a 2 bedroom corner unit. The balcony was screened-in with a table for 4 upon it and was a lovely spot to sit an enjoy the view of the pool, pond and fountain. Our condo was very nice and as I said, the photos that I've seen simply did not do it justice. I am certain that my husband and I will be returning to this resort and have already recommended it to all of our friends. Lora

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Family_two_boys
