Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 4 nights with our two small children. We had a one bedroom jacuzzi suite, with a full kitchen and a stacked washer-and-dryer unit. There was definitely a "Wow!" factor when we first walked into the room, because it was so big and the interior was decorated like something you would see in a magazine - granite counter tops, big tvs, fancy sound system for tv, etc. The jacuzzi tub was open to the bedroom. There was a shower stall in the adjacent bathroom. It was very luxurious and quiet. While the amenities guide in the room indicated that maid service was only every 3 days, they ended up bringing fresh towels and emptying the garbage every day. We were forewarned about the aggressive time share folks by other reviewers on this site. So, we ignored the phone, which would ring like clockwork in the morning and evening - they didn't leave messages. It is conveniently located close to the I-4, Disney properties, and chain restaurants (although you really need a car to get to the restaurants). We also used the hotel as a base for a visit to the Kennedy Space Centre in Cape Canaveral. We would happily return to this hotel, if we could get a good rate again - we ended up paying $129.10 per night (via a travel agent, who got us a better rate than the on-line travel rates quoted by Expedia, etc.), which was a real bargain, considering what the property had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Snapcf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGVC 12/17 thru 12/13. We decided on staying at this hotel after reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor. After staying at the hotel, I can say the reviews have been accurate. The propery is very, very nice and the rooms are updated. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite (2 adults, 2 children: 7 and 3 yrs) and were very happy with our choice of hotel. Pros: 1. extremely close all theme parks and restaurants. I would recommend renting a car since the hotel is located on the quieter side of International Drive. With our rental car, we were able to get to Kennedy Space Center (saw the launch of STI-116!!), Disney (~10 min) very quickly, up and down International Drive for take out, etc. Dining options are limited on the property, so a car came in very handy. 2. As mentioned, the hotel is in a quiet area of International drive. Our suite was very peaceful....no noise, very quiet at night. No issues with construction despite facing construction on the lake side. 3. Upgraded, clean suite* (see below under Cons) 4. Clean pool, quiet no loud music 5. Friendly staff*(see below under Cons) Cons: 1. The conscierge (?sp) was TERRIBLE. We called to ask how to get to Disney and the person did not know. You would expect a conscierge to know this type of information immediately or at least know how to retrieve the info. On a separate occasion, we called to ask for a recommendation for a nice restaurant for breakfast. Conscierge has no idea. Recommended Denny's...even though I asked for a nice sit down place. She made no attempt to even look up my request. Lastly, called for her opinion on a particular aJapanese restaurant and this person (same one each example) had no idea. Extremely unhelpful! I can understand a person who admits they are unaware of a restaurant, but this conscierge was rude and condescending. 2. Despite a clean suite, there were little, tinny tiny ants in our bathroom. We had the bathroom sprayed, but the ants were still present. You can hardly see the ants since they are hidden well against the background of the floor tile. Look closely...we were on the top floor in the building. Tips: 1. Rent a car 2. Housekeeping will change linens, towels, clean up every 3rd day of your stay. You can ask for daily cleaning for $30/day (1 bedroom suite). We noticed that our suite was cleaned every day, despite not asking for this option. Turns out that when you book HGVC through Expedia or Orbitz, the daily cleaning charge is added to the cost of the hotel. We were charged $149/night. I am unaware of how you can opt out of the daily cleaning charge; nevertheless, was very happy to get clean sheets and towels everyday....something so nice about coming home to a clean room after being out all day! But I suppose if you are on a budget, the $30 is a little steep. 3. Hotel does charge for a roll away bed, but no charge for a Pack n' Play 4. pack light! With a stackable washer and dryer at your disposal, you can very easily wash your clothes! In fact, my son had an accident, so I had to wash clothes...called up housekeeping and they sent up 5 boxes of Tide!! 5. eating choices limited on the property, but a mere 5 min away up International drive, there are HUNDREDS of restaurants...so many, it;s overwhelming! Many places also deliver. We will definitely return. The place is very pretty and very convenient. The only downside were the ants and ill-informed, bad attitude conscierge.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay for everyone”
Reviews.Author: travelingFool36
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research before our stay in Orlando.. I was going with my little one (4) my hubby and my inlaws.. we got a 2 room villa.. and boy was it the best place I have ever stayed at. the rooms were great.. we had the one with the jet tub.. boy was that nice after a day at the parks.. the rooms were nice and clean.. in fact we had cleaning service everyday..my mother inlaw said look at the bottom of my slippers they arent even dirty from the carpet. the rate was great.. I got the room for 205 a night would stay there every time I am in orlando. they even had a great activity center for the kids and a movie by the pool twice a week.. my little one loved it there and said she didnt want to leave

Reviews.Title: “Wonder Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Mavis.789
Reviews.Content: I had wonderful stay. The resort is jut beauitful. We had no problems with the front desk during my stay. I did not attend the sales meeting, but if I were looking to buy a timeshare in Orlando this would be it. We stayed in an 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen, washer and dryer and jacuzzi. The suite was spacious, the balcony was enclosed so no bugs. The resort has a very large pool that has side food and drinks available right there. I most enjoyed the poolside movie at night. My husband and I enjoyed our stay here very much. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property - Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Billyz11
Reviews.Content: Luxurious and spotless accommodation, stayed in a spacious 1 bed suite. Nice touches like free wired & wireless internet, washer dryer, Bose sound system to main TV. Balcony a good size and pool area very pleasant. Now the bad....I'm a Gold VIP Hilton Honours Member yet still took 20 minutes to check-in then a further 5 minutes to 'find my reservation' Specifically requested a top floor (2 months ahead) was given a 1st floor with no option to change. No additional benefits offered for Gold Membership. Constantly harrased by the sales team to attend their presentation (even woken at 8am one morning) ended up un-plugging the phones for peace and quiett. Had to pay half rack rate for a 3pm check-out and then front desk refused to deliver fresh keys to the room. I give the property 5 stars but the staff 1 star. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: abc31
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through an RCI exchange. I was so excited to be able to get this property after reading all of the wonderful reviews. I was not one bit disappointed. The resort was as beautiful as all of the pictures I had seen on their website & on this website. Unfortunately, the weather kept us from enjoying the ammenities to the fullest. It was quite cold during our stay. Our room in building one overlooked the main pool which was just beautiful . There are 2 hot tubs on the pool deck as well. Our two bedroom lockoff unit had not one, but 2 screened in terraces. Again, it was too cold to sit out & enjoy it. There is a children's playground that is actually covered, so that if it was a little rainy, the equiptment would stay dry. There is a basketball court also. There are many activities run by the resort for children & for adults. They did charge a fee for some, but not all of the activities . One night they had a complimentary "wild animal encounter". It was very informative and interesting. There was an alligator, a lemor, a baby owl, a snake & and an iguana. You got to see them all up close & even touch some them if you wanted to. Other complimentary activies included a "Dive-In Movie". They showed a movie on a screen at the pool at night & you could float on a raft & watch. Unfortunately, it was too cold & was moved to the "active lounge" while we were there. There are three lounges for the guests. There is a "quiet lounge" for you to sit & read if you wanted to. There was an "active lounge" with pool tables and a big T.V. There was also a children's lounge where 5-12 year olds could go to do crafts & play games at scheduled times. You could drop them off or stay if you wanted to. Some of the crafts had fees of about $3-$4. There is a video game room adjacent to the children's lounge. That was a bit disappointing for my boys. There were only about 5 games in there. But, they had plenty of other things to do. Dining at the resort was somewhat limited. There is a pizza hut that delivers to your room. There is also room service available from the poolside bar menu for lunch or dinner. There were things such as salads & burgers on the menu. There was a pretty well stocked market that had starbuck's coffee. They had really good muffins as well. The only thing I would have liked is somewhere to have a hot breakfast on site. However, there is everything you need to cook it yourself in the unit's kitchen if you are so inclined. That brings me to the room. We had 2 adults & 4 children in a two bedroom lockoff unit. We were all very comfortable. For those of you who don't know, a lockoff means that there are actually 2 rooms with seperate entrances with a connecting door that can be locked. One side was a one bedroom with a livingroom & a full kitchen. The other side was a studio with a partial ktchen. Both units had extremely comfortable kingsize beds & there was a pull out couch in the livingroom. The master bedroom had a huge jacuzzi just outside the entrance to a bathroom with a stall shower & double sinks. The other room had it's own full bath with a regular tub. The units are spotlessly clean & nicely decorated. Everything is top notch. The kitchen & baths have granite counter tops. There is every comfort of home & then some. The room had cordless phones & dvd players. Everything you could possibly need was in the kitchen, even a blender. There is a small washer & dryer in a closet. They give you starter packets of dishwashing detergent &, laundry detergent. They even give you a small packet of condiments & coffee for the coffee maker. Housekeeping comes in once a week, on the third day of your stay. In between, they will exchange your towels & give you extra supplies if you need them. You will see them with their carts each morning. There is a carpet sweeper, and a broom with a dustpan in the closet, as well as spunges & paper towels if you need to tidy up after meals. Most of the staff were very helpful & courteous. Everything is so well thought out though, that I hardly needed to contact them. They even give you a card when you check in with directions to & from all of the area attractions & major shopping. I had to call about a problem with the dishwasher & they came immediately. The maintenance man even fixed a broken toy for my son while he was there. The front desk followed up with a call to make sure that the problem had been taken care of. I did have one major problem while I was there and I hate to even mention it, because everything else was so perfect. My wallet was stolen while I was sitting by the pool. I think that the staff could have showed a little more concern. It took several calls to even get security to write up a report. You might take this as a sign that there aren't many security issues there. They told me that this has never happened before and that if something is missing, it always turns up. I would not let this stop me from staying at this truly wonderful resort in the future. It is a great choice for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “For a truely relaxing vacation in Orlando this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: ukbar
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the end of July 06 with my teenage daughter and 8 year old son. We had stayed on Disney property for the previous week and I decided after reading the reviews to stay two more nights in Orlando at the HGVC to regroup and check out the whirlpool tub. The HGVC is awesome! It is an incredible bargain. Beautiful spacious accomodations (we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite). Our suite was very clean, nicely appointed, and had so many amenities. We did our laundry so that we were able to leave Orlando with clean clothes, watched TV (we had two so no fights over the choice of channels), and swam in the wonderful main pool. They showed Shrek poolside so we were able to swim and watch a fun family movie. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Orlando and elsewhere(including several Disney properties - Pop Century, Port Orleans, and Beach Club Villas) and I have never found anything like the level of amenities offered by this hotel at such an incredibly low price. A comparable Disney property would have cost about 4 times more. We stayed on a Friday and Saturday night so we didn't experience any construction noise. We departed with our clean clothes, feeling refreshed (staying at Disney can really wear you out!), and relaxed for our trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Coming to our room every night was like coming back home.”
Reviews.Author: Mickbee
Reviews.Content: We booked the studio which is their smallest offering, but it was extremely roomy for two people. There is a small kitchenette with all the supplies you need. Although there is no stove, we sufficed with the microwave oven and toaster. There is a mini refrigerator with top shelf freezer section and a small sink. We always ate out, but if you want to get some groceries I recommend the grocery store in the nearby WalMart. Walgreens and another grocery is across the street if you don't want to drive. The biggest plus is the outlet store right next door. You can actually go through a guest only access gate from the resort to the outlet though I'm not sure if it's available yet since that part of the resort is still under construction. I have to say this resort is one of the best I've stayed at. I felt so comfortable in my room and cleanliness is very important to me. I was so comfortable that I was able to walk around in my bare feet which I rarely do. The staff are so accommodating and friendly. They really go out of their way to make you feel at home. The guarded entry into the resort makes me feel safe too. Parking can be a pain during the busy season, but there is parking even if it means not being able to park next to your building. The location is perfect. We didn't have to travel far from the airport. The gas stations on International Drive aren't as overpriced as those across the free way. Like I said, there's the outlet next door just in case the airline loses your luggage, restaurants are abundant, Walgreens is walking distance, and all the theme parks are close. Walt Disney World is very close especially when you don't even need to get on the freeway. I stayed at the Disney All Star resort for one day, and the commute to me seemed just the same. I would definitely come back for our next Walt Disney World vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - so so location”
Reviews.Author: Narnia_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 14 nights recently in the HGVC in a 1 bedroom suite. The suite was lovely, we really enjoyed the double size whirlpool bath. The kitchen has all mod cons and there is a washer/dryer in one of the cupboards. It has everything that you would need. The pool area is beautiful and the dive in movie is great for kids. The food at the poolside bar was good and the deli was handy. There is a supermarket across the road from the hotel. It is about 10 mins drive to Disney and 15/20 mins to Universal. There was only two downsides to this hotel. 1. The timeshare sales people came down a bit heavy. Be careful when checking in, if you are stopped for a few gift in reception at a separate desk just say no thanks and keep walking, they end up inviting you to there sales pitch and offer money for attending. We had to say no to three different people before they took no for an answer. 2. The Location If you want to eat out at night this area is not for you. The only restaurant close by is an Outback. There is nothing else around so you either have to drive or get a taxi 10/15 mins up International Drive. I would definately stay here again and I would not let either of the two downsides put me off staying in a HGVC again. It really was lovely. A note nothing to do with the hotel: Do not get into any taxi unless it has a plate on the roof. It is a long story but there are some scam merchants who pretend to be taxi driver and try to charge you a fortune for the journey.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort -- Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TravelBrats
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand vacations Club is an excellent hotel and a great option for those wishing to enjoy Orlando. My wife and I visited for a 4 night trip in November, 2006. It is 20 minutes from the airport, 5-10 minutes to both Disney and Sea World and 45 - 60 minutes to the beach. The staff were among the friendliest of any hotel staff I have ever interacted with and the resort is beautiful. I would definitely stay here again. Some specifics: Rooms: suite, 1 Br., 2 Br., 3Br. All are very clean, newly furnished have free wireless internet, have kitchens with stoves, refrigerators, microwaves, coffee makers and silverware / dishware. We had a problem with our phone when we arrived and it was fixed he next morning after one phone call (it would have been fixed earlier, but we got in late). Bathroom is spacious and very clean with plenty of towles. Facilities: Outstanding! This is a new complex that is still under construction, but the construction is on the other side of the lake (there's a lake in the middle of the complex -- no swimming) and we didn't hear it al all, not even during the day when we were out at the pool. The hotel is built on a Tuscan theme and the artitecture is very cool. The pool is expansive, beautiful and very child friendly...4 feet at its deepest. There's a big waterfall and several fountains that add to the character. There are also two hot tubs, a bar and pool-side waiter/waitress service. Lots of loungers, tables and chairs and all the towels you want. In addition there is a second pool that is smaller with a hot tub on the other side of the complex. There is also a coffee shop/deli that serves breakfast sandwiches, coffee, lunch sandwiches and stocks some groceries / wine as well. Workout facilities looked great. Children's activities: Great place for kids! Two nights a week they have free "drive-in" movies at the pool (outdoors). On a big screen they show a G or PG movie. Lots of kids watching on loungers or on floats in the water. They also have pool activities during the day such as make-your-own icecream sundaes and bingo. The sales pitch: This is a "vacation club" -- sort of like a timeshare, but different. In any case, those who do not own a stake in Hilton's Vacation Club will be asked to attend a sales pitch where they will try and get you to sign up. Of course, you may decline the invitation. We signed up and were compensated $80.00 in cash for our time (1.5 - 2 hrs, including breakfast). There was little sales pressure to sign up or buy in and the sales staff was very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: patior
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting our daughter in Florida. This is a beautiful resort. The rooms are very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. They have two great pools and a bar where you can get food as well. The people working there too were very helpful with any questions or problems you might have. We will be back here again for sure next year.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL resort/rooms, EXCELLENT value, even better AAA deal!”
Reviews.Author: AmusingSue
Reviews.Content: Every nightmare story you hear about timeshare resorts are squashed here. First, a little about the resot. In a word, GORGEOUS. The rooms are very nicely appointed with modern appliances (black kitchen appliances, Bose surround sound system for the living room TV, etc.) and furnishings, WONDERFUL down bedding, and the place is well laid out. If you think you might need to do laundry, spend the little extra if you can to get the 1 bedroom suite. It has a stack washer & dryer nicely tucked into a closet (as well as a full size kitchen rather than a kitchenette) and the convenience of it proved to be priceless at the end of the trip. We never felt as though we were at a resort, but instead felt right at home. Sitting out on the balcony in 72 degree weather, over the beautiful pool at 9pm was pure heaven. Of course, there's also the jacuzzi tub which was perfectly suited for 2 persons. It was cheesey or sleezy like some in-room jacuzzis are, it was nice and tasteful. I didn't take any pictures of the room, but I can guarantee you that what you see on teh Hilton website is EXACTLY what you get. In the room you'll find coupons for some nice freebies, including a very nice 5x7 vacation portrait, taken by the on-site photographer. We also were given at check-in coupons for free newspapers every day of our stay and 2 bottles of water. We did have a small glitch at check-in, but why complain about it, it's not like it ruined our trip. Other than that, the resort staff were excellent. Everyone was kind, helpful, and courteous. In fact, the one thing that did go wrong was the cab we called for didn't show when it was supposed to and we had a wedding to get to at the Grand Floridian. Instead of calling another cab, the Hilton staff sent one of their 2 private limo cars to drive us, at no additional charge and without us asking. Above and beyond service for sure. The location was excellent! We left home in a rush so things were forgotten but directly across the street was a full-fledged outlet mall to get in trouble with as well as a strip mall with, amongst other things, a large Publix grocery store and a Walgreens drugstore. There is an Outback Steakhouse there to I believe. About the resort sales - I had one phone call on day 2 of our stay offering us $100 or 20K Hilton Honors points in exchange for a 90 minute breakfast or brunch presentation. We were interested in exploring a timeshare option at this resort so I clearly said I'm not into high pressured sales and that if I encounter this I am walking out. As promised, when we returned to the room later in the day I found a written guarantee with the invitation stating that there would not be any high pressured sales tactics. Guess what? It was true! One last word of advice... if you have AAA, use it when you book the room. When I first looked at the rooms the rate was $175 for the full suite/apartment with large tub, kitchen & washer/dryer, and $145 for the smaller hotel-like room with kitchenette. Using AAA got rates of $130 and $103! I have seen the $103 drop to just under $100 as well, depending of course on when you go and availability. We've stayed many places and have decided that this is our homebase of choice when in the Orlando/Lake Buena Vista area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laaj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hilton September 6-12. This is an absolutely beautfiul hotel. We had a king sized bed which was extremely comfortable. These rooms are suites that can accommodate up to 4 people (sofa pullout), washer and dryer. They are very well maintained. The staff was very accommodating and friendly, although, I didn't have any contact with them except during our arrival. The safe in the room did not work and I didn't bother to use it because of my short stay. Rooms are cleaned every other day which I thought was fine. The location is great, its close to the Premier malls, all the restaurants and the Publix supermarket which is very convenient and parking was free. The only downsize was the phone call to attend one of their timeshare presentations . They offered us $100 rebate on our room, a free hot breakfast, or Disney or Seaworld tickets if we attended a 90 minute presentation. We opted out because of our tight schedule. There is a Pizza Hut on the premises that will deliver to the rooms. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Nearby Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: tempdragon
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the HGVC Orlando on International Drive. The grounds at the resort are very pretty. There is a ‘lake’ next to the property. The pool is great. There is even a small water play area for the kids. My young son also enjoyed playing in the kid’s play ground area. Several nights during the week, they even played outdoor movies at the pool. One night it was the movie, Curious George playing. The staff at the resort are all very nice. The front desk people were great. I checked in on Sunday and checked out Sunday. When I checked in at 5:00 PM there was only one other person in front of me. They initially placed me on the first floor next to the parking lot and I asked to be moved to a higher floor and they accommodated me. We were on the fourth floor in a corner facing the parking lot. It had a partial view of the lake if you look out the balcony. When we checked out at 9:45 AM there was no one in the lobby. It was the easiest check out I ever had. We had a two bedroom suite and it was of decent size. In the master bedroom there was a jet tub, but we didn’t use it. In the master bathroom, we had tiny ants roaming around the edges of the counter. We called the front desk and they sent a maintenance person within 15 minutes to spray the counter. The natural “non-toxic” spray worked for about 2 days and the ants found another opening and came out again. This time when I made the call, it took maintenance 45 minutes to show up. These ants are kind of hard to see initially because of their small size, but once you see them, you notice them right away. The master bedroom had a king size bed and the second bedroom had 2 full size beds. Each room had its own television with many cable channels to watch. The beds were very comfortable to sleep in and the A/C worked great. The resort is also pretty quiet during the day and night. I never saw the maid, but they cleaned the unit once during our 7 day stay. The suite was clean and well maintained. There are plenty of pots and pans in the granite kitchen as well as dishes and utensils. Dishwashing detergent was provided as well as detergent for the washer and dryer combo. The washer and dryer was a plus during our 7 day trip as we did many loads of laundry. We were so busy visiting Disneyworld that we never really got to enjoy the resort. We had a rental car and drove to Disneyworld visiting the various theme parks as well as the two water parks. Downtown Disney is about a 5 to 10 minute drive depending on traffic. There is a market across the street from the resort as well as a McDonalds. There is also an outdoor outlet mall nearby, however it would be kind of far to walk if you have to carry things. To stay at this resort, I would definitely recommend a rental car to get around. Overall it was a great stay. The resort is nice and the staff is friendly. Just try not to visit in late September like I did or else you’ll get to know the “Love Bugs.” This was my first experience with them and it was quite annoying. I was told that it was a Florida kind of thing. For those you familiar with them, you know what I’m talking about

Reviews.Title: “Kingsize bed”
Reviews.Author: apeman
Reviews.Content: I have only one regret about booking the HGVC and that is that we didn't stay longer. Usually on a two-week holiday my wife starts looking forward to "sleeping in her own bed" about halfway through the second week. Not this time though, we really did not want to go home. We arrived late afternoon and were dealt with at reception and in to our room immediately. All of the rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious. I hadn't told the wife about the double Jacuzzi tub and so that was a nice surprise for her and we used it every day. The kitchenette had everything including cooker, microwave and fridge/freezer, although we only used the coffee maker (complimentary coffee) and the icemaker. There were two large TVs, one in the bedroom and one in the living room. The living room TV was connected through a bose sound system so I was glad to have taken some CDs to listen to. The living room also opened on to a patio protected by mozzy nets (though we didn't see any mozzies) with a great view of the pool (see pics) The bedroom was spacious enough and the king-size bed was extremely comfortable. This led to the Jacuzzi tub and through to the bathroom with double sink and shower cubicle. Other features were a wash tub and dryer, iron and ironing board and digital safe. The maid service was efficient and unobtrusive. The amenities at the hotel are great. The reason I picked this hotel is because I wanted to be on i-drive and I wanted a place with a good pool and good poolside bar. Spot on. The pool was great, the bar was great (especially the mango daiquiri and the watermelon snow cones), the food at the bar was great, and the staff were the best. There was an endless supply of sunbeds and towels and the two heated Jacuzzi pools were a treat. They also have "swim-by" movies, giant jenga and ice-cream specials. Amazingly, we did use the gym (okay it was only once) and again it was well kept and we enjoyed the games room too. The on-site shop wasn't very well stocked but there is a foodmarket across the road although it was at no odds to us, as we didn't cook. Next to the Hilton is the Premium Outlet Mall which is good news if you are bargain hunting but bad news if you have a wife with a fondness for shoes. Right outside is the stop for the i-trolley. You'll need this, as this is a remote and quite part of i-drive. But for a dollar you can use the trolley to go anywhere on i-drive and this it what we did (we would recommend Bahama Breeze). You can also use the trolley to get to and from Sea World if you choose. The trolley claims to come every 20 minutes but we never waited more than 5. However at the busiest times when it is stopping more regularly it can take 45 minutes to get to the busiest part of i-drive, but this didn't bother us. And it only runs until 10.30pm so you'll have to do as we did and taxi back (about $20-25, reasonable by UK standards). Getting to the parks is easier as the Hilton puts on complimentary shuttles to Sea World and Universal and $10 shuttles to Disney. There were three pick up times through the morning and three return times in the afternoon/evening. We used the shuttle all the time without problem. This was our first trip to Orlando and we loved it. We can't wait to go back and we know where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Clean, friendly, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: KitKatluvr2
Reviews.Content: Our travel party consisting of two families shared a large 3 bedroom suite in this hotel in July. Our suite was actually a 1BR with access to their 2 BR. We had our own kitchenette, bath and patio. The 2 BR unit had a full kitchen, dining area, livingroom, 2 full baths (1 with a huge whirlpool tub), and ofcourse the 2 bedrooms. The 2 BR unit included a stacked washer & dryer (priceless). The resort is HUGE, meticulously clean and well groomed. The hotel rooms were very clean and comfortable. Great bedding, no cheap mattresses....very plush. The main pool is absolutely HUGE. The children & adults all loved it. The complimentary shuttle service is excellent....but be prepared, the shuttle services 3-4 of their other properties as well. This means you will be making multiple stops on the way to or on the way back from your destination. The pool staff was fantastic. They keep a big supply of towels at the pool at all times. There are planned activities for the kids daily, and "dive-in" movies that you view poolside. We loved this hotel. If we visit Orlando again (which is not a likely probability because we don't like it, in our view it as a very high crime, rude, overpriced city). Downside to hotel - they have a Pizza Hut delivery service on site that and it is a rip off. We used it the first night we arrived because we arrived late and were too hungry to leave (just wanted to rest & unpack). The pizza took an hour and 30 minutes to deliver, was lukewarm, and cost twice the normal cost of their pizza. Don't bother. I do recommend eating at their poolside dining area. This food was delicious, hot, and competitively priced. Overall, I advise this as a better than average place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place..”
Reviews.Author: fonyaf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the HGVC from August 29th through September 5th. The check in was smooth and we stayed in Building 5, Suite 5210. It was a 1 Bedroom Whirlpool Suite and was layed out perfectly. Our suite was equipped with a stove, full refrigerator, microwave, garbage disposal, washer, and dryer. They also have several kitchen utensils for cooking and eating. It was almost like being at home, but BETTER. The appliances are very modern. The countertops in both the kitchen and bathroom are done in Marble. The living room has a Bose system and TV where there is a DVD player as well. The screened in porch is NICE and the bedroom has a TV as well. The Beds are very comfortable and the seperate walk in shower was very nic. The bathroom has two sinks and lots of counter top space. The housekeeping staff is friendly and brought up anything you needed immediately after your call. They provide you with Tide laundry detergent as well to wash any of your clothing. Housekeeping kept our room full of clean fresh towels that were neatly placed. Housekeeping does come in daily to replace towels and make up the bed free of charge. Please NOTE: If you want your bathroom/kitchen cleaned etc... beyond bed making and towel chaning, this is seperately billed! It is called Tidy Clean service and begins at around 25.00 for Studio room and 35.00 for the 1 Bedroom. The staff was very nice and they bring the luggage to your room at check-in with no problem. Do not let any negative reviews scare you away from this place. The property is beautiful and you receive a complimentary photo from the resort photography of you and your family. There is a pizza hut on site and a deli as well. However, there is a 3 dollar delivery charge and 22% gratuity added to anything delivered to your room as well as sales tax. You may want to stay away from this. We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. I never experienced any problems with the elevator breaking as a previous review states from the same week. We payed 112.50 a night with the AAA rate, which I think was great because we had several amenities and was close to eveything on I-Drive. My husband and I will be returning next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinQueen73
Reviews.Content: One of the greatest places we have stayed at! We stayed at the All Star Movie resort in Disney for 7 nights and then we came here for three nights and after being in the tiniest room I have ever stayed in this seemed like heaven! We stayed in a one bedroom whirlpool suite with a screened in porch in building #2. When we opened the door to the suite we were so happy with our choice! It was big and clean and just what we hoped for and more. This apartment had it all! The kitchen had a full size fridge, oven, dishwasher, microwave and garbage disposal. There is a stack washer dryer in the suite also which we put to use, that was a big plus for us. The first day there we had a problem with ants, they were coming from the porch and made a line across the wall to the kitchen, they sent someone right away to spray and the problem was fixed. We were offered another room, but I already unpacked and was happy with this one. The whirlpool bath was big enough for two and very relaxing. We were 2 adults and 3 children, my oldest son slept on the sofa bed which was pretty comfortable for a sofabed! And we have twins who slept in cribs and even with the sofabed open there was still enough room in the livingroom area for the cribs. The kingsize bed was beyond comfortable! There's two closets, one is really big, but there is not much drawer space for clothes, not a big deal though. We were happy that there were 2 TV"S one in the living room and one in the bedroom, and there is a dvd player in the livingroom. Housecleaning does a great . The pool is big and clean and the kids loved it. Not over crowded at all and there are plenty of lounge chairs and towels. They have pool toys to rent for the kids and a childrens play water fountain. There is also a bar and grill poolside and a deli. Across the street there is a Publix for food shopping and a Walgreens and also a McDonalds. We did get the timeshare phone call and it was very low pressure. And after being here we actually talked about buying a timeshare, we enjoyed it that much. We were not bothered by the construction noise at all, we heard a tiny bit of noise after 8am but it wasn't bothersome. We drove to the disney parks and it is a 10 minute drive to Magic Kingdom from the hotel. The hotel is listed as being on International Drive but it is away from all the hustle and bustle and close enough to all the restaurants with a quick drive. Will definately go back! We left as Hurricane Ernesto was about to hit Orlando or else we may have stayed another day!

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than some properties but not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kakelly03
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews here I booked a 2 bedroom for 2 nights. The layout was perfect for my husband and I travelling with a 5 year old and 3 year old. I agree with all the comments about the pools and kitchen/bathroom in the suites- they are very nice. My disappointments were mostly service related. We knew that we probably couldn't check in early but tried- ended up waiting at the pool but they never called us to say our room was ready. Went back to the front desk and after long delays finally went to our room around 4:30. You could immediately smell cigarette smoke in the 2nd bedroom. We booked a non-smoking room and our kids both have allergy/asthma issues. The front desk was very rude and said that all of their rooms were non-smoking and that room was our only choice. The carpet had stains and burn marks anyway and the smell kept us out so we only used the large room with the living room/kitchen. The elevator in our building was not always operational and none of the vending machines in any building worked. Parking was very difficult in the evening. This hotel is much better than some and really has a lot of potential but is not a 5 star hotel in my opinion. Will go back to the JW Marriott next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotelnice rooms best place in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: geneva
Reviews.Content: THis hotel has large suites, great pools and is located near all the attractions. Also it has a screened in porch which is great in Florida. Awesome place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulosity at Its' best-- Who needs to see the mouse???!!!!???”
Reviews.Author: FoxiBrown
Reviews.Content: My family had the pleasure of staying at this resort from August 6th -12th, 2006. If you believe in the Hilton brand, this resort will solidify that belief. Check in went smoothly, everyone was friendly from the secnd we pulled up to check in. We checked in a smidgen early, and they accomodated us graciously. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa in building 4. (It was five of us - 2 adults and three kids) We had a perfect view of the 2nd swimming pool, as well as the lake. The villas are very well appointed, with everything prisitne and new. If you are the type that likes to fix meals, the kitchen had everyhting you needed to put together a good meal. Once getting in to our villa, the only small problem was the master bathroom toilet was stopped up. But no problems there, a maintenance guy arrived quickly with plunger in tow. My kids were so excited to go swimming, but first we popped across the street to the Publix to stock up on snacks, breakfast items, and drinks for the week. We fixed a nice breakfast in the villa daily, before we headed out to the parks, and that usually carried us until late afternoon, so that was very cost-effective. (Note: In my opinion that Publix prices were not that great. I would suggest going to the Super-Walmart 5 minute away. You will probably end up spendfing a lot less, and they too are one-stop shop for liquor, food, and they also have a gas station attached, which had the cheapest gas in the area.) There are two pools on property, with the largest being the most popular. There is a nice bar, and they have a menu that you can order from, and eat poolside if you like. The Pina Coladas were great, and the service terrific. My kids loved the pool, and seemed to be more interested in swimming than, going to theme parks. In fact we cut one park out of the schedule, and jkust let the kids hang out at the pool all day. The pools stay open until 11:00 pm, and we stayed until closing on more than one night. The property is extremely beautiful, well-kept, the landscaping perfect, and the property has an overall luxurious feel to it. You will forget you are in busy tourist-trap Orlando, and imagine you are in the middle of a lush, tropical Italian resort. If you love shopping, there are great designer outlets within walking distance, and all of the theme Parks are very close, within 10-15 minutes... I have become a bit of a hotel snob, because of the amount of travel I do for business. This resort met my expectations and then some. I remember one evening my husband I were sitting on the screened-in balcony, with the ceiling fan blowing a nice tropical breeze, looking out over the pool and the lake, and he with a beer and me with a wine cooler. We looked at each other, sighed, and smiled. We both could not think of a better way to spend a family vacation. There was truly enough to do on the resort property, that you did not have to venture out, if you did not want to. The have planned kids activities daily. There is a small fee attached, but they appeared to be very interesting. Things such as tee-shirt dying, treasure hunts, arts and crafts. They also do a movie at the pool one night a week. They had bingo, kids-night-out, etc. We, however, did not get a chance to take advantage of much of this because we were hitting the theme parks, and got inlate most evenings. Some previous posters mentioned construction noise early in the morning. We were in building 4, and could see the last building that is under construction, from our villa. I did not hear a thing, and I am a pretty light sleeper. So, peace and quiet were maintained. (maybe we missed the noisy phase of construction. There were workers on the building, but they were not doing any thing noisy.) We loved this place so much, we did purchase the time-share, and cannot wait to go back next year!! Do yourself and your famil a favor. Skip the other joints in Orlando, and indulge yourself at HGVC on International drive!! See you there next year!

Reviews.Title: “One of Orlando's best”
Reviews.Author: Iain_Barbara
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Orlando, having stayed at HGVC. We only had 2 nights here, the last couple of days in our 2 week trip around Florida. What a fantastic way to end our vacation ! The hotel is superb. We booked a 2 bed suite (2 adults plus 2 teenagers) for $230 per night. The room had everything - 2 large bedrooms, jacuzzi/spa pool, 2 en suite bathrooms, large kitchen, fabulaous lounge area with large TV and BOSE sound system, enclosed balcony overlooking the pool - just perfect. We saw the construction work when we arrived, but never heard it. There is Publix supermarket across the road, and the Outlet Mall just a few 100 yards away for last minute shopping. The pool area is fantastic, and not at all busy, with plenty of lounge chairs and free towels. The only down side is that the property is a little out of the way, although a 10 minute drive sees you in the busy part of I-Drive, and 15 mins you are at Universal, Disney, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: Michael710
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two of my children from Aug. 5 to Aug. 10. We stayed in a one bedroom in building 5. Everything was terrific. We arrived several hours before check in time but the reception staff was very friendly and called me on my cell phone as soon as my room was ready. We had a great view of the pond fountain and second swimming pool, wonderful screened in terrace with ceiling fan. The room was perfectly clean, very well appointed, free broadband internet, housekeeping was very diligent (to the point of washing our dishes by hand or in the in-room dishwasher if we left them in the sink). The pools were very nice and a nice way to end the day after a day at the theme parks. The ONLY thing that was even slightly off was the fact that the sofa bed and a separate cot we had brought in were somewhat uncomfortable (so say my kids but I had a very comfortable king bed!). Also, the hotel is very convenient to all the theme parks and Downtown Disney. For those who are interested, there is a mammoth premium outlet mall just next door. I very much recommend this hotel as a great value and I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be nicer for the price”
Reviews.Author: jsd2643
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights in August and it was fantatstic. We payed $112 per night. I know rooms in orlando could be had for 1/2 of that but this was well worth it. We had the 1 bedroom suite with full kithen, separate living room and bedroom. The hotel is brand new and the room has high end tile, granite counters, jacuzzi tub. Check out the traveler photos from others, the rooms look exactly like that. There are 2 huge pools which were not over crowded. They do call 1 time for the time share presesntation which you could decline. We did it...it took 2 hours and they gave us $115. We went to Disney on the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful experience”
Reviews.Author: BigMouseHouseFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for exactly one night. We arrived late at night (11:30 PM) and the check in to our room went smoothly. We had called ahead of time to ensure that the room was non-smoking, as I have asthma and a smoky room makes it hard for me to breathe. I didn't want to start my vacation in an ER. I was assured that all of the hotel's rooms were non-smoking so there wouldn't be a problem. When we went to our room it reeked of smoke - a smell so strong no one, especially the housekeeping staff, could have missed it. I went immediately back to the desk to get a new room. Apparently at midnight all of the front desk people except for one employee leaves. The girl behind the desk was completely overwhelmed with multiple phone calls from rooms with no towels, sheets, pillows, etc. She told us that there were no more rooms and we would have to keep this room. We told her that this was completely unacceptable. She kept clicking on her computer and telling us that she didn't know how to check for more rooms, change rooms, get more keys, etc. She had no one to call for help, and when she got too confused she just walked away and talked to someone on the phone about sheets and other items she could handle, leaving us standing there. 30 minutes into this process another guest arrived and she was completely ignored while this poor girl tried again and again to figure out what rooms were available. After over 90 minutes she finally found a room but still didn't know how to make keys, so she told us that we could have the room but we could never leave all at the same time until the next day when someone came in that knew how to produce keys. She called a maintenance person who was supposed to drive us to this room, but he didn't have a key either and we ended driving around the complex in a golf cart looking for other employees. After 2 hours we finally were in the replacement room (well after 2AM) which was not very nice. The carpet in one bedroom was soaked and smelled like cleaner (apparently someone had been smoking in this room too but they had tried to clean it). The pull out couch was FILTHY to put it mildly - it looked like someone had used the mattress in the yard - and it had footprints on it. The Master Bedroom was OK. In the middle of the night someone appeared with the key. By that point we didn't care - we just wanted to sleep! The next morning we went to the front desk and spoke to the supervisor of the front desk personnel. We told her of our problems and she was very helpful. She directed us to the proper people who gave us a full refund and we immediately checked out. It was a pain to find a hotel in Orlando in June but we were happy to be out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept, fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: waterfreak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to be in Orlando for a convention so he booked this resort for us. We stayed in a studio, #1314. I was most pleasantly surprised at the entire resort upon arrival......then we got to our room. It was even nicer. I especially appreciated the small kitchenette with mini fridge, microwave, sink, utensils, etc. Although the kitchenette had a blender in the cabinet and other small appliances, we weren't there long enough to use any of them. If we ever come back and spend more time there, we would definitely take advanatage of the kitchen for small meals, etc. The small fridge worked great. Too great in fact- I had turned the temperature knob all the way down so it would cool faster and it ended up freezing all the things in the fridge, no problem though. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. The room is nicely equipped with a ceiling fan, TV and DVD player and CD alarm clock. The bathroom was a good size and had real drawers in the bathroom. It was very nice to have a drawer there to put small items in. The closet was also pretty spacious. The only drawbacks in my opinion would be that the A/C in our room seemed to be sluggish. I noticed that no matter what setting I put it on, it never dipped below 75 degrees. And it felt more like 80 even when it would go down to 75. I believe that they have master programmed it not to go below that temp, as it would cool to a certain point and shut off. We used the ceiling fan at night. We did not end up calling maintenance because we were getting back to the room late at night and we had left the A/C on all day to see if it would cool off, but it never did in the 2.5 days we were there. When housekeeping is cleaning rooms, they leave bags of dirty towels in the halls outside the rooms. Kind of unsightly. Also if you take the elevators be warned that they are "hotter than a bucket of hell" inside. The work-out room is great. It has everything you need for a complete workout. Overall, the resort is a great concept. We were not asked once about the timeshare deal. The resort has so much to offer travelers as well as their families. If we find that we have to be in Orlando again, this location is my number 1 choice. For the price and the location and amenities, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LaBoricuaCubana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for ten days in mid-July and absolutely loved it! We let them know ahead of time that it was our wedding anniversary and when we arrived they had champagne, chocolates, and roses on the counter and bed. It was a beautiful touch to an already beautiful room. The bed was so comfortable and everything in the room is new. We stayed in the studio which was more then fine for two adults. (I would get the one bedroom if there were more then two people.) The housekeeping staff were great and even arranged our toiletries neatly!!! We were also only asked once if we were interested in the time-share and there was no pressure when we said no. The hotel is beautiful in every aspect and I think it will be even better when they finish constructing the final building. We stayed in Villa 2 and had a nice view of the pond but we could also see the unfinished building (we didn't care), we could hear some noise (not at all bothersome) while they were working but only while we were on the balcony. However, if you were staying in Villa 5, I think the noise may be an issue. I don't know if they are allowing people to stay there but I'm almost positive if you request the room ahead of time in another building they could accomodate you. Also, the pools were excellent, the pool side restaurant was also good, and the staff were extremely helpful. Although this is a family hotel, it was perfect for my husband and I and I would recommend it to couples or families. We will definetly stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “would go back”
Reviews.Author: trakme7
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in mid July for 5 nights. Great hotel. Had the whirlpool suite, is nice size for family of 5. Kitchen very useful with small kids. Staff helpful. The only drawbacks were: Except for one of the days we were there, all the other days, housekeeping did not get to our room while we were out which meant we came back to a room without clean towels, etc, after spending time either outside or at the pool. In all cases, kids were in need of baths, lunch and naps and we had to wait until someone came to clean , which was only done after a few phone calls to the front desk and this was after I had purposely phoned before leaving the room to ensure that it would be done. Also,one extremely unpleasant occurrence when I phoned the last day of our stay to ask the room be cleaned, it was after 3 p.m. already and I called the front desk only to get an extremely rude person who told me that they had until 6 p.m. to clean the rooms!!! and that there were some "important" people coming and the staff were busy preparing their rooms. I did not believe my ears and said, "are you saying that I am not important?!!" To which she stuttered , yes of course, everyone is, but they have till 6 o'clock to which I said let me speak to the manager, please, b/c this is ridiculous! To which she got back on the line and apologized and said they were sending someone immediatetly to clean the room. They did come and that was that, but certainly not all the personnel are well trained. The pool is great and huge, the main pool , that is. We did not swim in the other pool. would definitley go back,

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLANT! Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: RandW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a 4 day 3 night get away to just relax and forget about all the daily pressures of work. A friend had just recently purchased into the Club and was able to get us a deal on the stay. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa and it had all the accomadations of home. We were very impressed with both the size of the villa and how everything we needed was available. The Publix grocery store across the street was great because we both like to eat in and having the full kitchen really made it easy to prepare our meals. If you want to hit the outlet malls that was very easy as well beings it is right next door so you can just walk to it. With getting the deal on the villa we had to sit through there sales pitch which we did early in the morning. The agent that we had was very nice and pleasant to deal with. He did not presure us into anything and was very helpful with all of our questions. We enjoyed our stay so much and was so impressed with the Club program with all the flexibilty and locations we decided to buy into it as well. We are both looking forward to years of memorable vacations all around the world. I would highly recommend this Resort and I must say Hilton has a really good thing going here.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel on Earth (near Disney)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after originally booking a disney resort only to find out that the disney hotel, a moderate value, was not going to have some amenities that my family and I enjoy. I read the reviews here, called the hotel directly and spoke with several employees, and decided that this resort would be a good fit for our stay. I am so glad I changed our hotel to this one! We stayed for 7 days in a 1 bedroom suite in Villa 1. The grounds were beautiful, lush and peaceful - a welcomed change for the end of a day at disney theme parks. It was nice to escape to the quiet, yet playful resort. I told my husband that if I didn't know better, I would have thought we had left the country for an island vacation. The atmosphere was very complete...and it felt like I had traveled to an island paradise without having a passport. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. For the first 10 minutes upon entering the room, my husband, son and I went around and just called out to each other the "neat" things we found in the room, like the full refrigerator, dishwasher, stove and microwave in the kitchen. (Nice to have access to, but we didn't do much cooking.) My son, 5, loved the patio, it was screened in and he loved to go out and play and we could keep the doors open without tons of FL bugs finding their way in. (I love FL, but ya gotta admit, FL does corner the market on the bugs. We didn't see any in our room during our stay) My husband and I loved the 2-person jacuzzi, especially after a long day on our feet at disney. The bathroom had gorgeous granite countertops, a beautiful shower...and did I mention the jacuzzi tub? The king sized bed was comfortable, might be a little soft for some, but it was those pillows...wow. I just love big, plush down feather pillows. (for those of you with allergies...sorry, the pillows totally rock!) We ate breakfast on the patio, and enjoyed the view overlooking the palms, and the main pool. As for some of the reviews that spoke of noise, to that I will say that I noticed some noise, but I didn't find it disturbing. It was mostly just the activity of a busy summer resort in my opinion. Our room was directly above one of the hot tubs by the main pool, and on the second floor, so we were close enough to hear activity, but at no time, did I find there to be a noisy environment. I'm pretty noise-sensitive and while I did find the music at disney dizzying, I thought the hotel was quiet. (as for the construction, I know I saw an entrance for construction, but I never saw or heard any sign of it. Might have been somewhere, but I never crossed paths with it.) As for the timeshare deal, we were asked once during check-in if we'd be interested, and someone called our room once during the week to check if we were interested, but we were not pressured in any way. I was a little leery of staying at a hotel that was involved with timeshares because we're not into that at this point in our lives. We didn't want to sit in on anything, we didn't want discounted tickets, etc. We just wanted to stay at the hotel, and that was not a problem. We were asked, politely, and when we said no thanks, that was it. No pressure. I appreciated the reviews from this site a lot. Everyone's comments helped me make a great decision and I hope I can do the same for someone. I just wished we had had more time to just spend at the hotel, and enjoy the pool and the activities. The day we did spend at the poolside was tons of fun. My son got to try scuba diving, and he is sure that is the best thing he got to do on his trip. We really felt at home here and plan to stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel- wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely beautiful. The views were great, the location ideal, and the staff members were wonderful. Housekeeping kept the rooms looking excellent at all times. It was very enjoyable and I would not hesitate to stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort, it does not get much better than this!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beulah Beach
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other Orlando Vacation Club Resorts and rate them as a family, we rated this a 9 out of 10. One-bedroom suite overlooking the smaller pool area and we swam here even though the main pool was the reason for the 4 night booking. 5 from Cleveland would have preferred staying more at the resort versus the parks (next time God-willing and just a little less rain). 4th of July we even saw late night fireworks from our balcony. The dive in concept and other activities were very good. We felt sorry for those that stay and pay comparable rates for a standard hotel room when we had all the beautiful comforts of home and then some. Would recommend this vacation oasis to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: nlkee1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from June 30 until July 3. We stayed in Villa number 1 and didn't hear any construction noise. We did have to wait for check in and actually got into the room at 5:45. Other than that the stay was great. Loved the screened in patio that overlooked the pool and the lake.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was Excellent, we stayed at this hotel 3 nights ( 23rd – 26th) and everything was wonderful. I can honestly say I have never slept in a more comfortable bed (Down Everything). The view of the pool and lake was amazing, everyone who worked there was very pleasant, it was very quiet at night almost like no one was around (very nice!). There is a very convenient grocery store across the street and plenty of restaurants minutes from the hotel. This hotel was only about a 20 min. drive from the Airport. The only complaints I have are: The coffee in the room they give you is really not good at all and the bar there closed at 10:45pm. But, I can honestly say I was very pleased with everything else. Oh and if you are interested in the night life - bars/clubs.... I suggest going to downtown Orlando, we had a blast. If you stay at this hotel, trust me you will be pleased. (Also, they also don’t hound you to take the tour, they asked me once and that’s it.)

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: WhenAreWeThere!
Reviews.Content: Just back after our 3rd visit at this resort and it gets better every time. Cant wait until block 6 is completed hopefully later this year. Yes there was construction noise and some dust this time, which we did not notice so much on previous visits. We were in block 2 - 3rd floor, and it started at 8am every morning, but at this time we were mainly about to wake-up or up & away to the parks. An excellent feature of this resort is the massive pool movie night screen (wednesday and think also saturday). Start between 7.30 to 8.30 and is a great night for kids and adults to sit back relax in the pool/spa and unwind! We will be back again and again......but will try to keep it a secret as pure luxury in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: gigatt
Reviews.Content: Our extended family stayed here last week for 8 days/7 nites. There were 9 of us. We had 2 -2bdrm. units in Building 1. What a splendid place! The 2 pools were large although we only spent time in the main pool. All loved the pools. Ordered food the first evening from the poolside bar & ate by the pool. Great food. Drinks a bit pricey, but then it IS a vacation resort. Lots of activities all week; some we participated in. Two activity lounges were a great touch - one an "active" lounge with pool tables and games, the other a "quiet" lounge with chairs, books & a fireplace. The view with the lake, fountains and the screened-in balconies were great, too. The rooms were very clean & very spacious, 2 baths, 3 TV's, DVD player, full kitchen. The full kitchens & BBQ grills allowed us to cook most meals & save a lot of money. Figure we spent $400 or so for the week on groceries for all of us. What a deal. We also stayed a few years ago at the HGVC at Sea World, and both are extremely nice, this one newer. We went to Disney a few days (only 10 - 15 minutes away), but enjoyed our time relaxing at the resort much of the time. Staff very friendly. When we checked into one of the units, a closet door was off the track, but maintenance was there to fix it even before we got our luggage opened. We would stay at either property again in a heartbeat!! (And we are particular about where we stay.)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!! If you are staying here, read recommendations below!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi! We stayed here from June 4 to June 8. The resort itself is beautiful. HOWEVER - as another user had posted, make sure you request a room away from the elevator (which I did) so while I got away from the elevator, I had a up close and personal view of the constuction site, which is pretty bad. The noise from the construction isn't so bad, but what they fail to mention is that right next store is the I-Trolley busses that go up and down International Drive. These busses were coming and going, and backing up (and when they back up they make that loud beeping noise at 10 decibels that we could hear loud and clear up on the fifth floor) until TEN THIRTY at night. My 3 year old daughter who is a light sleeper had trouble sleeping. So, if you are traveling with children, make sure you request to be A. As far away from the construction as possible and B. As far away from the I-Trolley busses! Overall it wasn't a huge deal but just a friendly recomendation to make your stay more pleasant! But, the resort was BEAUTIFUL! We couldn't have been happier. The housekeeping staff was SUPERB. They even took the time to neaten up my make up!? They did a great job - the accomodations were wonderful - the bed was nice and comfortable - we loved the glass shower / jacuzzi tub and having dishes / a microwave on hand came in handy! The staff was very friendly - for example - I usually get up early andrun but the fitness center there opened at 7am - so they opened it early for me at 5am so i had the whole place to myself, which was nice! We did get a deal on this so we had to attend the timeshare presentation. That was mildly painful. But we got the hotel for 5 days and 4 nights for $299 and they threw in our Seaworld & Disney tickets & a $50 dinner voucher for Planet Hollywood. So for all that, I can't complain! The sales pitch is pretty heavy though. The guy told me "if you don't want it, just tell me and that's fine. I get some clients who say that they have to check w/ their CPA, etc." So I told him, " I don't want it," (after all, I had not even been at the resort for 24 hours and this was my first trip to Orlando in 10 years - not ready to drop 20K just yet) and he spent the next 30 minutes trying to convince me otherwise. Then, when you think you are done, they grab a manager to rehash the thing with you. Then, when you think you are FINALY done, they swing you over to someone from "corporate", who was very rude by the way, but all in all, it's well worth the money for what we got ! There is also a playground for the kids that is shaded , which we liked - considering it was 95 degrees in the shade! The pools are BEAUTIFUL!! Highly recomend!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MzBoop
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this resort last week during our visit to Orlando. Every evening when we retired to our room I felt like we were at home! The DVD/CD player with sound system was great. And the fully equipped kitchen allowed us to save some money by eating in. I can't forget the jacuzzi tub - very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Littlekitty19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from May 24th to June 1st. We are very particular about where we stay. We were very impressed from the moment we got there. The grounds, pools (2)and rooms are beautiful. We were in Building 3 which is directly across the lake from the one under construction. It did not bother us one bit and we did not hear any noise from the construction. I think that people that complain about that are just looking for something to complain about. Any one who reads the reviews knows before going that the hotel is still under construction. (this is the last building) We spent two days at the pool with our boys and enjoyed it very much. We ate lunch at the pool both days and found it good and a fair value. It was about $35 for two adults and two kids...drinks included. The bricks around the pool get extremely hot so make sure you wear sandals to the pool. The kids had sores on the bottom of their big toes from walking on the hot bricks. The hotel has a lot of great activities at the pool and in their activities room. We enjoyed two pool side movies, made ice cream sundae's and enjoyed the animal encounter on Sunday evening. Our kids participated in an outing with the kids program and my husband and I were able to enjoy dinner together. We spent 8 days at this hotel and then went to Cocoa Beach. When we got to our hotel at Cocoa Beach (which is suppose to be one of the nicest ones) we knew we weren't at the Hilton any more. We called the Hilton to see if we could come back for a couple nights and cut our trip to Cocoa Beach short but the hotel was booked. We ended up staying two nights at Cocoa Beach and then booked a room for two nights at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club at Sea World. It is also very nice but is older. It has the same great pool side activities as the one on International Drive. The International Drive location is a little more convenient to the Disney parks. If we had to do it over, we would have booked our whole trip at the Hilton on International Drive and made one or two day trips (a good hour drive) to Cocoa Beach. We will definitely stay here again if we come back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went there with my sister, bro in law, 3yr old nephew and mom and the room was very accommodating. We had a king sized bed, pull out sofa bed, 2 tvs, dvd player, balcony with a view of the beautiful pool, full kitchen (toaster, oven, microwave, fridge, dish washer, plates, utensils, etc), washer/dryer, large dining table, large bathroom and jacuzzi. I couldn't believe it! It was the perfect size for a family like us. Security was good. We had to swipe our card when entering the resort so we felt safe. I had an issue with the door (it wouldn't lock after we closed it) on our first day, and somebody came up within 10 min like they said. They fixed it right away. The pools were great. My nephew had a blast. There were a lot of dead bugs in the water towards the end of the day though. The location was great. There was a supermarket Publix across the resort, Outlet shopping across the street, and it was 15-20min away from Disney. There were also a lot of eateries around the area. Our hotel was also next to the construction but it did not bother us at all! No noise whatsoever. Everything was fabulous and we did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand!!!”
Reviews.Author: sabi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a fabulous 17th Wedding Anniversary Getaway at the Hilton Grand Vacation Resort on International Drive. The accomadations surpassed our expectations. Our suite was located in the Villa Di Cale building next to the new construction site, anywhere at the resort is perfect. However, the pool the serves our building was much more quite and calm then the main pool with the water fall. There are couple of pizza hut's at the resort, as well as, bars, deli, market and massage services. This time we did not try out the massage service, but i am sure if it is anything like the resort - you would be overly satisfied. The front desk staff was friendly and very attentive. The suite was like a one bedroom townhouse in a really nice area and very, very nice decor. We were only there for 4 days/3 nights, having never visited Florida - you need a good week to three weeks to do everything!!! However, we were very satisfied with what we were able to see and do. We visited Epcot center which had plenty to see and do. I would say if you go for a few days and want to capture the Disney experience Disney do Epcot. We were told by locals that Sea World, Epcot, and Universal are the best. But for the dollar Busch Gardens and Sea World are tops. The weather was perfect not too hot or humid(85-95), coming from California we soaked in the nice warm weather - its been cold and rainy here. We were ready for some good warm sun. The nights were great 80's at mid-night. Cons: The pool closes at 11pm, but you are ok if you are in there before 11pm they will not ask you to leave. Pros: to many!!! For the ladies that enjoy shopping - there is an outlet mall directly behind the resort. There is a Walgreens and Publix market across the street. Places to chow: The best place was Texas Brazilan steak restaurant. This place is not idea for kids because of the prices $42.00pp but the meat is top quality and its all you can eat. Truly an upscale experience, reservations are recommended but not required. The next best place was The Boston Lobster Feast - another all you can eat seafood restaurant. Beware of this place because there are lots of imitations. The one we went to is located on International Drive next to the pirates attraction. The price is about $32.95 pp but it was well worth it especially if you like seafood. Having read all of the reviews of the resort and location of the restaurants i was disappointed because when we exited the freeway on international drive i did not see all these restaurants and attractions that i was told about. Well just take international drive allllllllll the way down and around and you will have a time choosing where to eat. Staying at this resort you will need a car, there is so much to see in Orlando. We enjoy just getting out and seeing as much as we can from all directions. Finally this experience was very memorable we will be back in April 2007. If i can be of any help to anyone pls email me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, and great for some, but I have a couple of warnings...”
Reviews.Author: HotelHo
Reviews.Content: Our check-in was very late, thanks to housekeeping problems -- didn't get our room until 5 p.m., and our groceries - which would have been okay at 4 (posted check-in time)-- were a mess. Most of the staff was friendly and pleasant, so that was nice. They were pretty good about keeping in touch with us about the status of our room. The room itself is gorgeous, and the kitchen is nicely appointed with Cuisinart cookware and coffee maker. The location is directly across from Publix, which is also handy. BUT: If you're in buildings 1, 2, 3, or 4, your view is of an exceptionally ugly construction site. Seriously ugly grey cinderblock construction. If you're in building five, you're next to the construction, so you won't necessarily see it...but you'll hear it at 7 a.m. Here's the reason I won't come back, though: the music by the pool is so loud you can't even hear a caller on your cell phone. I found it impossible to read as well, since the "music" is a mixture of pop, country, and - I hated this - rap. I find it impossible to concentrate with words being shouted at me that way (Disney does this right - they have generic ambient music playing at just the right volume - way better). I also didn't like waking up to Hootie and the Blowfish on my vacation, but the pool music starts early and ends late, and you can't help but hear it. Had it been tropical music, I wouldn't have minded so much. Or even something beachy like Jimmy Buffett or Jack Johnson (I'm not a fan but the mood would at least have been right). Calls to the front desk didn't help - they say that they'll ask to have it turned down, but it didn't make a difference. Apparently it's Hilton's policy to play it, so it's not going to change. And therefore, I won't be back. (incidentally, there were several other people by the pool talking about it as well, so it's not just our sensitive ears).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and pools!”
Reviews.Author: travelismyhigh
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to the bad reviews of this beautiful hotel. I was so sceptical - I modified my vacation and only stayed here two nights after staying at a Disney hotel 3 nights. I now wished I stayed here all 5 nights. Booked a one bedroom. We were right next to the building in construction and barely heard the noise. Beautiful suite with a HUGE bathroom. Pool areas were stunning. The main pool was so much fun for the kids. Our kids wore themselves out in the water features. They loved it probably more than Disney! Lots of activities - Drive in theatre the night we were there. Very accomidating staff. Let us check in early. We stayed at Wilderness Lodge at the beginning of our trip and while that hotel was beautiful, we would definately come back to the Hilton (HGVC)! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet as a Tomb”
Reviews.Author: Emmarubybegonia
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 3 day/long-week-end stay here. Check in and staff: lovely, very accommodating and nice; Room: superb, spotless, never saw even one bug, ant or critter - not one. Best part: in the 1br unit, you can poach in a luxurious, huge, jacuzzi tub AND watch TV at the same time. Lovely! Noise: took a 3 hour nap in the middle of the day on a Friday - never heard any constsruction noise and I was in the new unit right next to the const. site. Pools: So great. Even the smaller pool right next to my unit - fantastic. Has its own fully stocked bar and bartender. Also, pool area houses an on-site Pizza Hut Express. I don't do Pizza, but I ordered one for my granddaughter - it looked so good I had a slice and ate two more. It was delicious. Location/Access to Theme Parks, etc.: easy to get around and really close to everything/ I highly recommend renting a car - forget shuttles - you won't regret this. I got a Payless rental for $15/day - very plain wrap compact (crank window handles, manual door locks!), but ran fine and got me where I wanted to go and back - $50 bucks for the 3 days!. What I would I do differently: Stay here for a week and just lounge around - forget those theme parks. I'd do a solid week of unapologetic sloth and never leave the place. Shopping: Hee hee hee. I could actually have stepped over a 3 ft high fence right into the parking lot of the Premium Outlet Mall directly behind my unit. Publix Market directly across street from entrance - superb - stop here to stock up on prepared entrees, drinks, sandwich fixings, etc. Their prepared fresh fruit bowls and salads are superb - ready to eat. Security: tight, and I felt totally safe here. 24 hour, gated security - nobody gets in unless you are a registered guest or your name is called into the guard gate.
