Conclusion: I have never been a fan of Florida - hated the place. I was on Captiva Island once and nearly died of the heat/humidity and hated the creepy 98 degree water in the ocean - yech! I went to a playoff game in the Orange Bowl once and the Miami fans were (--). I reluctantly went to Orlando - only so I could be near my daughter and her family who were staying at one of the Disney resorts (overpriced and overrated). Well, I'm impressed, and I have to say I would go back there as long as I could stay at this resort. The Orlando area is lush, relaxing and fun. Orlando airport is excellent. I'm an Orlando fan. There's something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “First class resort”
Reviews.Author: debbiw
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful! We were concerned after reading reviews about construction however we requested bldg.2 and have had no problems! Very close to Disney Parks. Close to everything. Rooms very nice and clean and lots of room. Service has been wonderful! They keep this place very nice. The beds are so comfty! Pizza Hut is great for the kids by the pool. Both pools are nice and clean. We also felt very safe here!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts you'll stay at!”
Reviews.Author: VR731
Reviews.Content: It actually surprises me that this resort is not ranked higher on the tripadvisor rank list. This resort is really pretty amazing. It's one of those that when you're driving through Orlando and you see all the different resorts, you see this one and say to yourself, "Awe man, I wish we were staying there instead." The rooms are better than many homes, with granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, cherry wood work throughout, Bose sound system with DVD player. Once in the room, my brother-in-law and I said to each other that we couldn't think of one thing that we would add or change about the room. The rooms are extremely spacious. 3 bedrooms have 2 queens, and 2 Kings, a pull out couch, and a lot of floor space, as well as 2 balconies. The pool area is great. We had so much fun hanging out by the pool nearly every day. They say it's the largest outdoor heated pool in the country, and I believe it. It's huge, and a lot of fun, with a huge water fall and multiple smaller water features. There is a pool bar and grill just steps from the edge of the pool, which was very convenient. There are several lounges adjacent to the pools with couches, tvs, pool tables. We didn't take advantage of the activities much, but we did see a movie projected on a huge outdoor screen one night by the pool. The list of activities going on is pretty long. If you want things to do here, you won't have any trouble. Very conveniently located next to Disney World and Sea World. Universal is pretty close, as well. Any park you want to go to will take you about 10 minutes by car, and it is very easy and everything is well-marked. You could know nothing about the city and as long as you can get onto Interstate 4, you'll have no problem getting where you need to go. As for the construction, I'm not sure what the other reviewer was complaining about. If you paid attention, you would notice, but we were never bothered. In fact, I don't think anyone in our party of 11 even mentioned it. They're just building another villa to make the place even more available: not a bad thing in my book. They do have sales pitches for times shares, but there's no pressure to attend or buy. Ours only took 70 minutes, and when I told them we weren't interested at this time, the salesman simply said, "OK, well thankyou for you time and I hope you enjoy the rest of your stay." Very Non-pushy. Overall, one of the best vacations I've ever had at one of the best resorts I could ever have hoped to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “hated! this hotel ruined our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: idrkara
Reviews.Content: What no one talks about is the ongoing constuction at this hotel which takes place every morning at 7 am till 5 pm. I mean dump trucks loading/unloading, hammers, power tools, welding - right across the tiny 'lake'. Forget about sleeping late at this hotel... when I complained to managment, they told me I was the first to ever complain - what a joke! They did nothing for us but try to change our room and say sorry, there is nothing we can do. ... We would have never stayed here if we would have known the truth. Now YOU do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton Vacations Club on International Drive”
Reviews.Author: Lisa500
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from April 7 to April 12 and we can't say enough about the service that we received. The resort is beautiful and very clean. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and always had a smile on their faces. We have stayed at several resorts in the Orlando area and this one tops them all. We would not hesitate to stay here again and are already planning on it in 2007. We didn't take the time for the timeshare presentation due to me being on a business trip and time didn't allow. We were never hounded by any of the staff regarding purchasing a timeshare or going to a presentation. We stayed in building 2 facing the lake and the construction noise wasn't too bad so we had no complaints about the noise. I would highly recommend staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a find”
Reviews.Author: Fishol
Reviews.Content: What a great place. We stayed 2 nights and wished it had been longer. We booked a 1 bedroom apartment and it was so well appointed. I didn't get chance to use the Jacuzzi in the room but the whole place was top notch. Only two criticisms, one was there are not enough beds round the main pool and second watch your bar tab, as I checked out I reviewed my bill and saw eroneous drinks added. I asked to see the receipts and the drinks had been added without my signature, they of course cancelled the charges but still check.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Princess35
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for only 1 day, but I wished I could have stayed longer. We will definitely go back to the hotel whenever we are in Orlando again. Hotel staff was very friendly. Accommodations were fabulous. We stayed in a new section of the hotel overlooking the new pool. They had activities for the kids the whole week. Only thing I could see improvement would be expanding the hotel menu. Hotel was within minutes of Sea World making it very easy to get to the park. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at HGVC on I-Drive. We will be staying there again. The one bedroom unit worked well for two adults and two kids. Having laundry and kitchen available makes this a practical stay for families. My wife and kids were all very pleased with this facility. The pools, grounds, and common areas are well maintained. There are tons of activities for kids. We did not book through Hilton and were not pressured into attending a sales pitch. While I did see lots of people getting the tour from salespeople each morning, we said "No" when we checked in and were never asked again. We are planning to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property; very well maintained. Great selection of pools (including an adult pool) and lots of activities. Across the street from Seaworld and close to Disney and Universal- ideal location for a family. A gated property gives much greater sense of security, and the property was quiet and peaceful during our stay despite being full. We stayed in a Studio--small but functional for our agenda. We were guests on this visit, so we had daily cleaning service. The screened balcony was perfect for evenings. Great water pressure in the shower--but the water is Hard. Large refrigerator for a compact. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gladouche
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando from feb 10-15. Hotel was great! Very clean and worth every penny. We stayed in a one bedroom condo with our two-year old son. Excellent staff! We liked it so much we're going back in April!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for children”
Reviews.Author: Kitty-2004
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from our trip and had a one night stay at this hotel. We had a 2 bedroom for 4 adults, 2 year old and a 9 month old. And mom and dad had a studio on the floor below. We were in Pembroke unit. Our front door needed different help. Could hardly open or shout it. Decor is Florida like yellow and green and new carpet which I liked a lot. The units are very clean and other wise well kept. I must comment that I agree about the cribs are horriable. The water and play areas are all geared to the young which is wonderful when traveling with small children. Didn't find the food prices out of line either. There were in the process in painting the upper 2 floors of our unit. I'm sure there are many place to stay I probably will look around a little more when family travels again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: lkirk4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights here with our 3 kids, ranging in age from 1 to 10. Similar comments as other posts - pretty grounds, new, beautiful pool, nice rooms. We had a 1 bedroom suite in building #2 (Giovanni). I requested a suite away from the construction after reading the posts here. Glad I did for the view and decrease in noise. Parking is very, very tight at night. If returning to your room after 7pm, expect to park a distance away. Spent a day at the pool. Chaise lounges were nice. Ordered poolside service - food was surprisingly good. One problem: our waiter closed out our bill at the end of his shift, charged it to our room and gave himself a 40% tip!!! Didn't know that until check-out when I was told it was too late to change it. Towels and sheets were very nice. Comfy bed. Kids said sofa bed wasn't too bad. Crib provided was scary - looked like they got it from an old Russian orphanage. Only had service for 4 in kitchen - needed more! Washer/dryer were great and we appreciated the complimentary Tide provided.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: need2travel33
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that this is a beautiful resort. The pool area is wonderful, as is the lobby area. The rooms are very tastefully decorated and the screened balconies are ample in size. A great find thanks to TripAdvisor! And I found an unbelievable rate by booking through Hilton. My reason for writing this review is to show my appreciation for the staff at this resort. I managed to leave a necklace behind after my one night stay. I called the hotel (never thinking anything would come from it, but I had to try) and was put in contact with housekeeping. Wonders of wonders, they located my necklace! It was shipped to me via FedEx and I couldn't be happier. Those that I dealt with on this issue could not have been more helpful and efficient. I would recommend this resort for the reasons above, but I thought this story would be appreciated by those that travel frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Noise and more Noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am an owner. I bought three years ago and this was my first stay. I was told all units would have view of the water. Well that is not true. Mine had a view of a pool under construction. The noise from 7 am to 3 pm makes is hard to have a conversation on the balcony. If you are an early riser, you will like it. Expect to wake at 7 am sharp every morning. The management can care less. Not their problem, since they already have your money. This construction is expected to last into 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Bklynmom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from HGVC Int. Drive, Orlando which I booked on the advise of tripadvisor reviews. As others have said it is a beautiful property, minutes from all attractions (if you have a rental car). Pool area is huge and beautiful with two jacuzzis, kitchens are fully equipped with great quality appliances and utensils, beds very comfortable, and service excellent. Try to request buildings one or two, others are further from the pool, and four is a bit close to the construction area across the lake. If you have never toured a Hilton timeshare, you can save a considerable amount of $ by taking the two hour presentation. When you are calling to book your stay, say that you may be interested in purchasing a timeshare. You can schedule the tour as early as 8:30 am so that you can still have a full day free. Of course it is a bit high pressure, but you can just say no. Also be aware that although they clean the bathroom and change the sheets daily, they do not really clean the kitchen. This differs from when we stayed in a Disney property with a kitchen, they put the dishes in the dishwasher and cleaned thoroughly. Since I didn't really cook there, it was not a big deal, and I think the property and rooms at HGVC are just as nice as Disney villas, and also newer, at about half to one third the price. Also check out the kids activities they have - good to break up a day that you are just relaxing by the pool. Food is decent poolside and comparably inexpensive. Great place, we were really sorry to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Worst HGVC we've stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: lv92900
Reviews.Content: Heard noise all night from the Disney buses running on a neighboring street. The resort is still under construction, and rooms facing the big brown hole in the ground likely also had the same problem. If you stay in a studio, you do not get to operate your own a/c and heat; the occupants of the adjoining one-bedroom unit control it! Bottom line - if you get a one or more bedroom unit in the building closest to the front desk (away from the construction), you may be OK. We weren't one of those few lucky ones. The resort is new, which may be the only thing going for it right now. P.S. Our favorite HCVC club is at the Flamingo in Las Vegas, where all rooms face the lovely pool area.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it not the salespeople !”
Reviews.Author: Lizcro326
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGVC Tuscany Place and were very happy with our stay. I usually find something to complain about, but this place was top notch. We stayed in a one bedroom king unit with 2 adults and one 5 year old. The accomodations were top notch. We had a problem with the jacuzzi tub shooting out soap scum the first time we used it, but housekeeping was on the ball and came up with some bleach at my request to sanitize the system. Later I figured out that the reason the tub accumulated soap scum was because the soap provided contained shea butter. After long days at the parks, the jacuzzi was wonderful. We stayed as an owner referral promo and got a great deal. I went to the presentation which was not high pressure. We were really interested in buying and eventhough we decided not to purchase at that time, we were offered a decent deal on future accomodations within 15 months. The reason we didn't buy or take them up on the offer is that the salesperson outright lied to me. He told me that the only way we could EVER stay at this resort was to buy or have an owner referral. This was pure bull pucky. I went right up to our room, got online and pulled up the same accomodations on several internet booking sites. When I mentioned a resale I had seen on the net, I was told that the owner would never be able to sell to me because Hilton has "first right of refusal". Which meant if I tried to buy from the owner, Hilton would refuse to sell to me and snatch it up themselves to resell at closer to their retail price. I don't know if this is true or not but it was a definite turn off to buying. We had a corner unit, which was laid out better than the unit I toured. The kitchen was fully equipped with refrigerator/freezer/icemaker, double sinks, microwave. stove oven, dishwasher, cookware, untensils, dishes, glasses. The bathroom was well appointed also with double sinks, toiletries, a one person jacuzzi and a walk in shower for two. Reasonably priced room service was available. Publix, Walgreens and several restaurants were just across the street. We watched the Seaworld fireworks from our balcony. The bed and even the sofa bed was comfortable. The pool was huge and heated. The only draw back was that there was no deep end, but in a way that was ok too. We could relax and let our son explore without worrying about him falling into the deep end. Lots of free activities on the pool deck. They had an upclose animal encounter where a person brought several animals from birds to a lemur. We had a special encounter on the way to the poolside bathroom (also well appointed with showers, lockers and hair dryers). While the animal handler was setting up, my son and I got to touch and interact with the lemur. It climbed up my arm, licked me and sniffed my sons' nose which he took as a kiss. He was delighted. Actually, so was I !! As far as staying there in the future, I would definitely book again. If in the future I decide to buy, I'll try a resale (always love a bargain) and see if the salesperson told another fib. This is fabulous property. I wish were as happy with our experience at Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “NiceNew Resort”
Reviews.Author: JsyCream
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed my stay at the HGVC on ID. As everyone else has said the rooms are nicely appointed and the pool area is great. A couple of tips for for those that might want to stay here - The resort is still partially under construction and as such you can hear and see the building work from some rooms. Also, at least for the one and two bed apartments the rooms vary in size. Some of the units have a large jacuzzi in the master bedroom whilst others have a smaller one in the bathroom. Those units with baths in the bedroom have access from the master bedroom and lounge whilst the others have access from the lounge alone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the HGVC on International Drive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time place was great,returning in December.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we spent a night here while waiting for the rest of the family to come for a wedding. we had a great deal on two studio rooms. however, we were upgraded to a one bedroom suites on arrival. we asked for adjoining room since we had three other members also and got it. we asked for a late check-out and got it. we were able to check-in early too. the room were very new and clean. we were not bothered by timeshare sales pitch at all. wondering if it were because of my hilton honor membership that we got what we asked. the only draw back were that the complimentary water and newspaper were not in the rooms and that we had to go the little cafe to get them. overall, it was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This property is by far the nicest time share that I've ever stayed at. Location is prime - on I-Drive, close to every restaurant imaginable and of course, Disney World. A rental car is a must since all attractions / restaurants are spread out. Once we arrived, we checked our bags with the concierge. We hit the Publix (grocery store) across the street and stocked up with food and booze for the week. We were given a two-bedroom suite...WOW! Words cannot do this place justice. The kitchen was marble with beautiful wood and had every utensil that you'll need for cooking. The only thing that the kitchen didn't include was spices. Thus, pack salt and pepper and anything else that you may need during your stay. The living room had a nice dining room table (seating for 6) which overlooked a lake. The master bedroom was most impressive with a view and a jacuzzi tub that comfortably fit two. The second bedroom was equally nice minus the jacuzzi tub. A washer and dryer is located in a closet and housekeeping will provide you with laundry detergent. Outside of our room, the resort had nice amenities. There are lounges for reading (quiet) and for playing pool and other games. There's an on-site convenience store if you want to get coffee or anything else that you may have forgotten to buy at Publix. And then there's the pool...one that rivals a fancy Las Vegas resort. To my untrained eye, I figured the pool to be the length of a football field accented with a towering fountain in the middle. An outdoor bar that makes great cocktails abuts the pool. The staff was extremely friendly and professional. On the first night, the lights wouldn't turn on. Within 5 minutes of reporting the problem, two maintenance workers were there to fix it (Circuit breaker). On another occasion, I had to send an urgent fax and the front desk was quick to accomodate and didn't charge me a dime. Since this is a time share, I did receive the expected call asking if I wanted to attend a sales presentation. I politely declined and I was never asked again. Hilton has gotten it right. In my opinion, the precedent has been set for timeshares / vacation clubs with this resort. If you're headed to Orlando, this is the place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on International Drive
HotelInfo.Address: 8122 Arrezzo Way, Orlando, FL 32821
